jobDescription: THE COMPANY  Exciting opportunity to join one of the leading health care insurance providers in their widely established Data & Tech team focusing on everything BI related and working with exciting teams within Data Engineers and Data Science & AI. THE ROLE  In this role you will be:  Design and apply data cleansing and data standardisation rulesIntegrate dat...
fullDescription:
THE COMPANY

Exciting opportunity to join one of the leading health care insurance providers in their widely established Data & Tech team focusing on everything BI related and working with exciting teams within Data Engineers and Data Science & AI.

THE ROLE

In this role you will be:

  • Design and apply data cleansing and data standardisation rules
  • Integrate data from multiple sources into a central data warehouse with a logical data model
  • Contribute to the design, development, testing and performance in production of the data-centric software
  • Liaise with the Data Scientists, Architects, software developers, and business experts to understand how data needs to be converted, loaded, processed and presented

SKILLS & EXPERIENCE

  • Technical: Strong development skills - experience using SQL, Big Data experience (Spark, Hadoop Suite)
  • Awareness of Data Management best practice, including Data Lifecycle Management
  • Passion for learning new tools, languages and frameworks

BENEFITS

  • Competitive Salary
  • Competitive Bonus
  • Remote working

HOW TO APPLY

Please register your interest by sending your CV to Daniel Moss via the Apply link on this page

jobDescription: The Role LiveScore is establishing an advanced data engineering and data science lab, LiveScore Labs, and is looking to hire a highly skilled, motivated and supportive team. We are hiring multiple positions at various levels of experience across the following roles:  data architecturedata engineeringsoftware engineeringdata science Key Responsibilities</stron...
fullDescription:
The Role

LiveScore is establishing an advanced data engineering and data science lab, LiveScore Labs, and is looking to hire a highly skilled, motivated and supportive team. We are hiring multiple positions at various levels of experience across the following roles:

  • data architecture
  • data engineering
  • software engineering
  • data science

Key Responsibilities

  • You will work in small team sizes of 4-7 people.
  • You will be immersed in a startup atmosphere (fast pace, low bureaucracy) but with the backing of a very successful company.
  • You will work on laying the foundations of a modern data infrastructure combining transactional data from multiple sources and creating a single source of truth.
  • You will use the latest tools and technologies on Google Cloud Platform.
  • You will design efficient data pipelines to share data across multiple systems.
  • Speed and latency are critical factors in sports, you will continuously strive to refine the definition of "real-time".

Key Skills/Experience

  • A degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Physics or equivalent
  • 3+ years’ experience in data analysis or data engineering with large-scale complex datasets
  • Knowledge of ETL and data warehousing concepts
  • Knowledge of SQL Server and comfortable writing SQL queries
  • Experience with agile scrum or kanban and modern CI/CD development practices
  • Logical mindset - problem solving through methodical techniques

Desirable

  • Experience with Google Cloud Platform, BigQuery, Kubernetes, Tableau
  • Experience dealing with high volume transactional data
  • Knowledge of 'martech’ platforms
  • Previous experience in sports or sports-betting industries

The Person

We are looking for motivated individuals to form a fast-paced, committed team which will tackle some of the most technical challenges in the data-driven world of sports betting.

What can we offer?

  • Performance bonus
  • Private Healthcare scheme
  • Subsidised gym membership
  • Ride to Work Scheme
  • Virgin Tribe - access to exclusive Virgin offers and experiences
  • Life Assurance (x3 salary)
  • Contributory Pension Plan
  • Friday drinks in the office
  • Daily fruit, quality coffee and soft drinks
  • Festival summer and cracking Christmas parties

About Us:

LiveScore Group is home to the world’s largest scores and stats provider, boasting more than 56 million dedicated monthly users, and a sportsbook that truly packs a punch. Delivering live scores, results, tables, news and facts via native apps and an unbeatable website, LiveScore throws the spotlight on football, cricket, tennis, basketball and hockey.

Launched in May 2019, Virgin Bet offers daily price boosts and a huge range of markets across all major sports. Delivering unsurpassable user experience, quality customer service and betting choices galore, we have the perfect line-up to disrupt the sportsbook market.

From now on, sport is at the forefront of our agenda. Whether it be first-in-class designers, leading industry marketeers or technology, we’ll continue to make an impact by growing our talent pool across the globe. Taking our products to the fingertips of users internationally, we intend to combine our skills to create the best odds for a bright and lucrative future — and win.

jobDescription: MFK Recruitment has an exciting opportunity for a Senior Machine Learning Engineer to join our global AdTech client, based in Shoreditch, London. My client has been recognised as one of the fastest growing companies in the US and Europe and they have also won several 'Best Places to Work’ awards. Many of their team hail from tech giants such as Google, Amazon & Facebook. We are looking for a Senior Machine Learning Engineer...
fullDescription:
MFK Recruitment has an exciting opportunity for a Senior Machine Learning Engineer to join our global AdTech client, based in Shoreditch, London.

My client has been recognised as one of the fastest growing companies in the US and Europe and they have also won several 'Best Places to Work’ awards. Many of their team hail from tech giants such as Google, Amazon & Facebook.

We are looking for a Senior Machine Learning Engineer with an in-depth working knowledge of the latest in Machine Learning/Data Science technologies and cloud platforms to join their team.

In this role you’ll work on a wide range of computational challenges such as: CTR prediction, forecasting, bidding models, and delivery optimization. We practice an effective data science process that recognizes the uncertainty in explorations for ML solutions but also emphasizes an agile software engineering workflow. My client uses the most popular tools in the Python data science ecosystem and embrace innovation.

My client’s tech stack is always evolving to meet the challenges of the massive scale of transactions on which they operate. To manage the firehose of data coming in, they explore complex trade-offs and carefully architect high performance distributed systems. Those in turn require elegant and thoughtfully designed interfaces to make the systems accessible to both their team and their customers.

Senior Machine Learning Engineer - What You'll Be Doing:

  • Lead data science projects and ensure they deliver business value
  • Work with the Product and Engineering team to build data model pipelines to power customer-driven products
  • Guide major architectural changes as we scale to improve our engineering velocity
  • Implement and test the latest research works
  • Mentor other engineers on architecture and process

Senior Machine Learning Engineer - What You Should Have:

  • MSc or above in a STEM (science, technology, engineering, mathematics) subject
  • 5+ years of an excellent track record with Machine Learning/Data Science in industry
  • Strong understanding and experience in distributed computing frameworks, especially in Apache Spark
  • Expert-level proficiency in Python and SQL
  • Practical experience with Data Warehousing (especially Snowflake), Deep Reinforcement Learning and out-of-core algorithms
  • Good understanding of engineering best practices, agile (as it applies to Data Science), and version control
  • Effective collaboration with Product, Customer, and Engineering teams

jobDescription: Machine Learning Engineer - Contract - London Data Idols are working with a rapidly growing global e-commerce company who are looking for a contract Machine Learning Engineer to join the existing Data team in London on a contract basis. We are working to a rapid timescale with successful candidates starting in January. THE ROLE  Within this role as a contract Machine Learning Engi...
fullDescription:
Machine Learning Engineer - Contract - London

Data Idols are working with a rapidly growing global e-commerce company who are looking for a contract Machine Learning Engineer to join the existing Data team in London on a contract basis.

We are working to a rapid timescale with successful candidates starting in January.

THE ROLE

Within this role as a contract Machine Learning Engineer you will be working with the data teams to train Machine Learning algorithms using pre trained models. You will also be analysing large data sets and working to deploy fully functional models using Machine Learning.

As a Machine Learning engineer, you'll play a vital role in the continual development of the analytic techniques. You will work closely with researchers, the software development group and the data scientists in the teams to implement machine learning and deep learning solutions. You will be working with the wider business to validate the potential opportunities for machine learning techniques, prepare data for training and testing, designing the model, training the model and deploying in production. As an integral member of the team, they highly encourage the contribution of ideas and drive in the generation of new concepts.

YOUR SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE

  • Experience leading projects
  • Expert using Machine Learning
  • Experience developing models that are fully functional
  • Experience using Python
  • Experience using AWS and/or GCP cloud infrastructure
  • Familiarity with Docker and orchestration services like Kubernetes

This is a great opportunity for a contract Machine Learning Engineer to join a very exciting company on a contract basis. Please submit your CV for consideration and further details.

Machine Learning Engineer - Contract - London

jobDescription: Are you a Manchester-based, Machine Learning Engineer with strong experience with cloud technologies and equally enjoy and have a track record of coding and building ML focused tool-sets from scratch? I've partnered with a forward-thinking and highly successful FinTech disruptor based in Manchester as we seek a Machine Learning Engineer to join an established Analytics function as they plan for further expansion and success in 2021......
fullDescription:
Are you a Manchester-based, Machine Learning Engineer with strong experience with cloud technologies and equally enjoy and have a track record of coding and building ML focused tool-sets from scratch?

I've partnered with a forward-thinking and highly successful FinTech disruptor based in Manchester as we seek a Machine Learning Engineer to join an established Analytics function as they plan for further expansion and success in 2021...

My Client have identified at board-level that a key part of their strategy to build on 2020's success is to heavily invest in Data Science and Big Data, this is where you come in… This is an exciting VC-backed FinTech organisation that competes with some of the world's largest and established banking institutions, and wins.

The successful candidate will be well-versed with Data Science techniques, but equally as skilled in the ability to code and build tool-sets from scratch to support product development. This candidate will act as an SME and point of call for support to the wider business, and will ensure optimal data delivery is consistent throughout ongoing projects.

Responsibilities & Requirements:

- Designing, building and maintaining data toolsets and models to be used in pricing, acquisition and reevaulation of future investments.
- Collaborating with Data Engineers, Data scientists, Analysts and the Finance/Commercial teams as an SME on a range of ongoing workstreams.


-Minimum MSc in a Quantitative subject (STEM; Maths; Physics; Computer Science etc)
-Minimum 3 years practical experience in a Data Science/ Data Engineer (ML focused) role.

- Practical application of data science techniques such as: Regression Models, Monte Carlo Simulation, Markov Chain, Random Forest etc.
-Practical experience working with: SQL and R/SAS/Python/Scala and their related frameworks and accompanying tools (PySpark etc)
-Practical experience working with cloud platforms: Azure (preferred) or AWS, GCP
-Experience as an SME, able to technically support the wider business with problems relating to Data with appropriate solutions.

If you're a Machine Learning Engineer based in Manchester looking for an exciting new role within a successful FinTech organisation, get in touch today!

jobDescription: Machine Learning EngineerLondon - Paddington£80,000 + benefits Harnham are working exclusively with the R&D unit of a leading telco's Big Data & AI Lab in Europe to build out their machine learning team in London (Paddington). They have 300+ people across analytics, with a number of Data Scientists, Data Engineers and Machine Learning Engineers. Everything this team does involve...
fullDescription:
Machine Learning Engineer
London - Paddington
£80,000 + benefits

Harnham are working exclusively with the R&D unit of a leading telco's Big Data & AI Lab in Europe to build out their machine learning team in London (Paddington).

They have 300+ people across analytics, with a number of Data Scientists, Data Engineers and Machine Learning Engineers. Everything this team does involves how the use of machine learning and sophisticated algorithms can be used to benefit the business.

Vital for this role is to be able apply complex machine learning knowledge to real-world challenges faced by the business.

This is the perfect opportunity for someone who iskeen to work at the intersection between cutting-edge data science and scalable machine learning production.


The Role - Machine Learning Engineer

You will be:

  • Building end-to-end machine learning systems for the business
  • Experimenting with deep learning algorithms
  • Translating business challenges and converting them into clear and concise projects
  • Deploying models to production and working closely with Data Scientists to build state of the art systems


Experience - Machine Learning Engineer

You will have:

  • M.Sc. or Ph.D. in: Statistics, Applied Mathematics, Computer Science, Engineering, etc.
  • Experience using Python is a must (tools like AWS and Spark are beneficial)
  • A strong knowledge of statistical/machine learning models applied to real-world problems
  • A keen interest in problem solving and using scalable machine learning to solve the biggest data-related problems
  • Experience in core software engineering principles


BENEFITS

£80,000
Competitive bonus and pension
Budgets for training and conferences
The ability to attend and present at conferences
Working from home / flexible working
The opportunity to join a world-class and growing team


HOW TO APPLY

Please register your interest by sending your CV via the Apply link on this page. For further details or to enquire about other roles, please contact Nick Mandella at Harnham.


KEYWORDS

Python, SQL, Tensorflow, Spark, AWS, Kafka, machine learning, deep learning, analytics, insight, Data Science, Data Scientist, telco, Big Data, Artificial Intelligence.

fullDescription:
A London based Consultancy firm are on the lookout for a number of Data Engineers to join their team.

The Company

This is an exciting opportunity for a Mid-Level Data Engineer to join one of the leading Advanced Analytics service consultancy firms.

The Role

In your role as a Data Engineer, you will be focused on the delivery of a variety of projects helping customers. These could include but are not limited to; building Big Data pipelines and reliable Data Platforms.

Data Engineer Requirements

The required skills for the role are:

  • Python programming experience
  • Apache Spark - Databricks
  • Azure Modern Data Warehouse including Azure Data Factory, Azure Data Lake, Azure Data Bricks.
  • SQL
  • Consultancy experience is desirable but not essential.

In return, you will receive a salary of between £45,000 and £65,000 D.O.E. + a competitive bonus scheme.

To ensure candidate and employee safety, the interview process and the role will be conducted remotely for the foreseeable. On occasion travel may be expected.

Interviews for the role are already underway, so if you this sounds like the role for you then please apply now.

jobDescription: TECH LEAD - DATA ENGINEER (JAVA) £75,000 - £85,000 + BONUS  WEST LONDON A hands on role for a senior data engineer/tech lead in a growing tech company based in London. You will guide a small team of data engineers in an exciting new project. THE COMPANY: This role is with an online tech disrupter who use large amounts of data ...
fullDescription:
TECH LEAD - DATA ENGINEER (JAVA)

£75,000 - £85,000 + BONUS

WEST LONDON

A hands on role for a senior data engineer/tech lead in a growing tech company based in London. You will guide a small team of data engineers in an exciting new project.

THE COMPANY:

This role is with an online tech disrupter who use large amounts of data in everything they do. They have recently opened out a modern new office in London and are looking to build out their data team. They are currently growing out their Data Science team and they are looking to accompany this team with some keen data engineers who can build streaming data pipelines.

THE ROLE:

The successful candidate will lead a small team of Data Engineers whilst getting hands on working in a real time streaming infrastructure using technologies such as Spark & Kafka.

In particular, this role will involve:

  • Leading data engineers in a new project migrating from the existing data warehouse to Snowflake.
  • Building data micro services using Java.
  • Ingesting data into the Snowflake Warehouse.
  • Working with the data science team to build models.
  • Building out streaming pipelines using Kafka, Spark etc.

YOUR SKILLS & EXPERIENCE:

  • Commercial experience with strong technical expertise in Data engineering.
  • Strong commercial Java experience.
  • Commercial experience with AWS data tools (Snowflake).
  • Experience using streaming technologies (Kafka & Spark).

THE BENEFITS:

The selected candidate will receive a salary between £75,000 - £84,000 depending on their experience and requirements as well as a bonus.

HOW TO APPLY:

Please register your interest by sending your CV to Holly Neeves via the Apply link on this page.

THE COMPANY This well-established Insurance company have their HeadQuarters in Surrey and they are building an entire Data Science f...
fullDescription:
Machine Learning Engineer
Surrey
£60,000 - £75,000

This is an exciting new opportunity for a Machine Learning Engineer to join a growing team of Data Science experts for an established Insurance company.

THE COMPANY

This well-established Insurance company have their HeadQuarters in Surrey and they are building an entire Data Science function having heavily invested in this area. You'll be working in the Pricing team for the business, working with cutting edge technology and driving the new approach for Machine Learning there. It's a great opportunity to join a stable business but have an immediate impact in a new team.

THE ROLE

As a Data Scientist for the business you will:

  • Use your analytics experience to increase the sophistication for pricing including data acquisition from both internal and external data
  • Working with the other Data Scientists in the team to drive the new Machine Learning approach across various areas of the business from building the ML models to productionisation of the models
  • Be involved in deploying automation across the business

SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE

  • Bachelors/Masters in a numerical or relevant field is essential
  • An excellent understanding of Data Science techniques including modelling and machine learning - end to end ML including productionisation
  • Proven commercial experience of deploying automation
  • Tech: Python, Pyspark, Spark, Git, Databricks, Jenkins

SALARY AND BENEFITS

  • Basic salary £60,000 - £75,000
  • Benefits
  • Flexible working

HOW TO APPLY

Please register your interest for this role by sending your CV to Rosie O'Callaghan via the apply link on this page

Please note that our client is currently running a fully remote interview process and able to on-board and hire remotely as well. This role is intended to be home working for the duration of the pandemic.

jobTitle: Machine Learning Engineer - VC Backed Business
jobDescription: Title: Machine Learning Engineer - VC Backed Business Location: Manchester Salary: £68,000k to £75,000k + Significant Bonus + Benefits As a result of a surge of new investment opportunities, this VC backed business is looking for a commercially savvy Machine learning Engineer to join their award winning team of Analytics experts to support the investment team and Data Scientists on package deve...
fullDescription:
Title: Machine Learning Engineer - VC Backed Business
Location: Manchester
Salary: £68,000k to £75,000k + Significant Bonus + Benefits

As a result of a surge of new investment opportunities, this VC backed business is looking for a commercially savvy Machine learning Engineer to join their award winning team of Analytics experts to
support the investment team and Data Scientists on package development ensuring optimal data delivery architecture is consistent through ongoing projects.

Reporting into Specific responsibilities will cover:

- Increasing the efficient of investment analysis via Build, develop and productionise toolsets and models to be used in pricing, acquisition and revaluation
- Creation of ad hoc models for valuation of varying asset types
- Development and implementation of the pricing and framework
- Technical input into and knowledge sharing during all Decision Science projects;
- Collaborating with data scientists and architects on several projects

The ideal candidate will be an experienced data package builder and data wrangler who is excited by the prospect of solving business problems using their technical skills (be it from optimising models or building from scratch)

Applicants should possess;

- Strong coding ability (Sql, Python, Pyspark or some other programming language) with a passion to solve business problems through coding
- Experience of cloud based analytics packages (Scala, Databricks)
- Understanding of Machine Learning methodologies (Markov chain Monte Carlo, Decision Tree, Random Forest etc)
- Technical expertise with data models, python package development, deployment of predictive models to cloud solutions, data mining, and segmentation techniques.
- Highly educated in a quantitative subject (Mathematics, Physics, Economics, Computer Science etc)

This represents a unique encompassing both data Analytics and Engineering in one of the most desirable companies and ambitious companies in the North of England.

You will be someone who is excited about the prospect of improving and potentially even helping to re-design the company's data architecture as they look to introduce new initiatives and become even more data-driven.

Requirements:

  • Strong SQL and T-SQL development skills
  • Experience building and optimising ETL processes and data pipelines using SSIS
  • Analytical and data manipulation skills
  • Experience working with complex, unstructured data sets

Benefits:

  • Salary of up to £40,000 depending upon experience
  • 25 days' holiday
  • Some flexibility for home-working

Interviews are taking place shortly, so please apply ASAP to be considered.

jobTitle: Data Scientist / Machine Learning Engineer - Martech Start Up
jobDescription: Data Scientist / Machine Learning Engineer ** Martech Start Up ** SALARY -            £50k - £65k & equity LOCATION -        Remote to begin with, then Central London Following steady growth over the last 5 years, this martech start up...
fullDescription:
Data Scientist / Machine Learning Engineer

** Martech Start Up **

SALARY -            £50k - £65k & equity

LOCATION -        Remote to begin with, then Central London

Following steady growth over the last 5 years, this martech start up are looking to expand their growing Tech Team.

Their digital advertising optimisation product, sees them partnering with large organisations, tech providers and other agencies to deliver AI and machine learning optimised advertising performance and engagement; looking in detail at customer behaviour, engagement and conversion.

We are looking for a bit of a hybrid, someone who can easily go between the data science and software engineering team, with skills in both camps. This is essentially an R&D role, where you can flex your creative side in solving real world product problems and adding value through actionable insights and recommendations. You will take the lead on greenfield research projects employing a range of techniques including NLP (Natural language Processing) and Computer Vision (especially video analysis), as well as deploying production ready machine learning pipelines.

You will be joining a cross functional tech team of Data Scientists, Engineers and Software Developers, which they plan to expand over next year, so there is plenty of room for growth and development.

Working closely with the CTO, you will deliver data science solutions and services for their digital advertising optimisation product. They use every bit of available relevant data from their clients to help predict which ads will or won’t do well to enable commercially valuable forecasting and audience insight.

Experience across specialisms such as NLP, sentiment analysis, text mining and AI is required as well as very strong coding and programming skills in machine learning (using Python). Their USP is their creative use of AI to improve each advert for their clients so the variety of projects and work you will gain exposure to is broad, meaning your learning curve could be steep – and joining at middleweight level, you could soon be operating at senior level within a year or two.

Culture is something that is the lifeblood of this agency and something their CEO takes very seriously. They love people from non-traditional backgrounds, and are a very diverse bunch, working hard to ensure they embrace all ethnicities, genders, age groups and disabilities.

Skills and experience required:

  • Educated to at least degree level in a numerate subject; Mathematics, Statistics, Engineering, Physics, Chemistry, Economics, Machine Learning, Computer Science etc.
  • A strong background in data science techniques as well as coding using Python
  • Experience using a wide range of machine learning techniques, but definitely including NLP and Computer Vision.
  • Ideally industry experience in marketing or advertising
  • A problem solving approach, ability to apply AI and ML techniques to real world business challenges
  • A curious nature, and inquisitive nature plus an ability to build strong relationships with co-workers, peers and senior level stakeholders

jobTitle: Senior Data Engineer - Python & Airflow - £600 PD - 6 Months
jobDescription: Senior Data Engineer - Machine Learning & AI - Python & Airflow Development An excellent opportunity has arisen with a global financial for an experienced data engineer to help re-architect one of their flagship data products. This is a platform that aggregates many different data sources, applies machine learning to generate predictions  and presents everything in a web application. Initially...
fullDescription:
Senior Data Engineer - Machine Learning & AI - Python & Airflow Development

An excellent opportunity has arisen with a global financial for an experienced data engineer to help re-architect one of their flagship data products. This is a platform that aggregates many different data sources, applies machine learning to generate predictions and presents everything in a web application.

Initially working remotely then onsite from their London office (likely from June), this is an exceptional opportunity for those who want to enjoy state-of-the-art R&D and be challenged !!

Responsibilities:
·Architect and build distributed, scalable, and reliable data pipelines to ingest and process data
·Collaborate closely with stakeholders and researchers to support machine learning, analytical and product use cases
·On-board, document and curate external datasets for internal usage
·Engage in data interpretation and forensic data analysis and troubleshooting

Requirements
·Self-motivated and creative. They are building from ground up, not tweaking legacy
·Good communicator and team player
·Solid understanding of algorithms and data structures
·Proficiency in scripting languages (especially Python)
·Experience of cloud platforms (e.g. Amazon Web Services)
·Commercial experience of writing and optimizing SQL queries
·Experience of data orchestration platforms (e.g. Airflow)

An ideal candidate (is not required to, but) will also have:
·Experience in feature engineering for Machine Learning applications
·Knowledge of data versioning libraries/ methods (e.g. DVC)
·Familiarity with data lakes
·Experience of cloud data warehouses (e.g. Snowflake)
·Familiarity with migrations frameworks for change management (e.g. Flyway, Alembic)
·Experience of dynamic schemas/schemas evolution
·Experience building streaming pipelines (e.g. Kafka, Kinesis)
·Familiarity with continuous deployment
·Experience ingesting data from web (e.g. HTTP requests, HTML/ XML parsing)
·Familiarity with Big Data ecosystem (e.g. Spark/ MapReduce)
·Experience of load testing data pipelines
·Experience of geo-indexing technologies (e.g. PostGIS)
·Knowledge of columnar data storage formats (e.g. Parquet, ORC)
·Experience working within an agile team

They are looking for a senior data engineer to help build out their data platform. THE COMPANY The company are a progressive start-up looking at expanding their d...
fullDescription:
SENIOR DATA ENGINEER

LONDON (REMOTE WORKING)

UP TO £83,000

Harnham are partnered with a start-up health-tech company that partner with the NHS to help patients with diabetes. They are looking for a senior data engineer to help build out their data platform.

THE COMPANY

The company are a progressive start-up looking at expanding their data platform after creating a groundbreaking digital weight-loss app. They are partnered closely with the NHS where those diagnosed with diabetes are routinely referred to this company. They require a senior data engineer to build out an AWS platform from end to end to ingest and distribute this data.

THE ROLE

  • You will have control to ensure quality code in Python
  • You will be building out their AWS platform
  • You will be introducing machine learning to make their data platform more advanced
  • You will be using Airflow for orchestration

YOUR SKILLS AND EXPERIENCES

  • An expert Python programmer
  • Written ETL pipelines from end to end
  • Experience Apache Airflow
  • Highly experienced in AWS

HOW TO APPLY

Please register your interest by sending you CV to Callum Castling via the apply link on this page.

jobDescription: Data Engineer, Contract Job, Remote (Glasgow), Outside IR35 Your new companyA Glasgow based public sector client have again engaged with ourselves to recruit a Data Engineer to join one of their project teams. They have initially released the role on a 3 month basis, outside of IR35, with a competitive day rate.Your new roleThis will include using Data Extraction Transform...
fullDescription:
Data Engineer, Contract Job, Remote (Glasgow), Outside IR35

Your new company
A Glasgow based public sector client have again engaged with ourselves to recruit a Data Engineer to join one of their project teams. They have initially released the role on a 3 month basis, outside of IR35, with a competitive day rate.

Your new role
This will include using Data Extraction Transformation and Loading (ETL) systems and routines to facilitate reporting from customer management systems (Dynamics, Agresso, others as required) using a range of appropriate data handling and manipulation tools.The purpose of this role is to design, develop, implement and maintain data management solutions (e.g. Data Pipelines) that extract and transform data into formats that can be used by performance and BI analysts.

What you'll need to succeed
You should have substantial experience designing and building efficient data pipelines (ideally in Azure Data Factory) and relational databases (ideally in Azure). Good knowledge of MS Dynamics CRM 365, using Power BI and also other coding languages like Python. Working knowledge of Microsoft Logic Apps and/or Power Automate (previously Flow), SSRS and preferably experience of DevOps good practice.

What you'll get in return
An opportunity to work with with an agency with a robust out-of-scope contractor engagement process, who also have a long running successful partnership with the public sector client. You will also receive a competitive remuneration package and access to our highly effective and easy to use time sheet portal.

What you need to do now
If you're interested in this role, click 'apply now' to forward an up-to-date copy of your CV, or call us now. If this job isn't quite right for you but you are looking for a new position, please contact us for a confidential discussion on your career.

Hays Specialist Recruitment Limited acts as an employment agency for permanent recruitment and employment business for the supply of temporary workers. By applying for this job you accept the T&C's, Privacy Policy and Disclaimers which can be found at hays.co.uk

fullDescription:
DATA ENGINEER

LONDON (REMOTE WORKING)

UP TO £85,000

Harnham are partnered with a marketing agency. They are looking for a senior data engineer to join their team to lead their data engineering capabilities and pioneer a new academy for graduates.

THE COMPANY

The company are a large marketing agency, focused on predicting buying habits of customers using data science. They have very advanced analytics and their marketing campaigns use behavioural science to ensure their success. They are also starting up a data academy to teach graduates and tackle diversity in the industry. They require a senior data engineer to establish a curriculum and build out a data platform.

THE ROLE

  • You will be involved in project-based work, coding ETL pipelines in Python.
  • You will be mapping out the architecture of their new platform
  • You will be involved in client sales pitches and managing stake-holders expectations.
  • You will be a key figure in the data academy, outlining a curriculum and teaching.

YOUR SKILLS AND EXPERIENCES

  • An expert Python programmer
  • Written ETL pipelines from end to end
  • Experience in SQL and noSQL
  • Experience using cloud systems such as AWS, Azure or GCP

HOW TO APPLY

fullDescription:
Big Data Engineer - Google Cloud

GCP, GCP datastores, GCP Dataproc, Hadoop, NoSQL

Permanent

London

Summary:

A new opportunity has arisen with an amazing company in London for and experienced Big Data Engineer with GCP expertise. My client is a young logistics firm and one of the fastest growing in the UK. They are looking for self-driven, curious and creative BigData engineers to join their data engineering team and architect an automated, scalable and reliable BigData platform. You will be working very closely with their Data Scientists and analysts and be working on some of the very latest technologies.

Responsibilities:

  • Develop reliable and scalable production components
  • Use Kafka to build data stream pipelines
  • Troubleshoot data clusters
  • Build and integrate machine learning algorithms
  • Have a cloud native approach
  • Participate in technical design meetings within the product engineering team to solve some real operational issues

Skills and experience:

  • Excellent knowledge of GCP infrastructure and services
  • GCP datastores, GCP Dataproc, GCP Pub/Sub
  • Hadoop
  • Good experience of streaming frameworks, e.g. Spark, Flink
  • Experience with (Cloud-based) NoSQL databases
  • Linux and Terraform scripting experience
  • Experience building CI/CD pipelines using Jenkins
  • Experience of deployment of a containerised environment
  • Kubernetes
  • Python or Go languages

This role offers a competitive salary, pension, flexible working, and huge potential for growth!

***Please apply with your latest CV for immediate consideration***

jobTitle: Data Engineer - Tech start-up Azure, C# FULLY REMOTE, £60K
jobDescription: Are you a Data enthusiast looking to take ownership of a truly cutting edge.. highly sophisticated data driven simulation project? Do you have a really good handle on data engineering, and tiered storage in Azure, maybe a tad of data science and ML exposure  and have the ability to lead projects, with a hands-on approach? Modis are working with a truly world-class business on their search for a Data Lead to take ownership of the devel...
fullDescription:
Are you a Data enthusiast looking to take ownership of a truly cutting edge.. highly sophisticated data driven simulation project? Do you have a really good handle on data engineering, and tiered storage in Azure, maybe a tad of data science and ML exposure and have the ability to lead projects, with a hands-on approach?

Modis are working with a truly world-class business on their search for a Data Lead to take ownership of the development of a highly data driven product that is absolutely one of its kind within its industry. This is a perfect opportunity for a hands-on techie looking to lead a project and oversee a small team of incredibly talented Developers. Technology is absolutely at the heart of what these guys do - They need software that will grow with them as a business and allow them to reach their full potential.. and this is where you come in.

The work here is technically complex, highly intricate and challenging so it's important that you will work hard and run fast in order to be a success within this environment. We're looking for Lead who's absolutely at the top of their game technically - who can take full ownership of the product,

Technically you'll have a proven track record in cloud based data engineering and/or data science experience and you'll be an Azure expert. You also won't be afraid to code in C# or Python and you'll ideally have a good grasp of ML/AI tools and techniques.

A real-time programming language would be hugely beneficial to this role due to the nature of their product and what they're all about. You'll have a proven track record in designing and implementing well-engineered, reliable, and bug-free data architecture and you'll know exactly what to do in order to really drive this product forward and take it to the next level, In return you'll join a fun and informal environment and work with a very intelligent bunch of guys who all share a passion for the product and the companies ethos. This is a great chance to really shape a leading product that's already leading the way within its industry.

This role is available on a fully remote basis - their brand new offices in the heart of Newcastle. In return you'll receive up to £60k plus an array of benefits.

Call Laura at Modis today for immediate consideration

Modis International Ltd acts as an employment agency for permanent recruitment and an employment business for the supply of temporary workers in the UK. Modis Europe Ltd provide a variety of international solutions that connect clients to the best talent in the world. For all positions based in Switzerland, Modis Europe Ltd works with its licensed Swiss partner Accurity GmbH to ensure that candidate applications are handled in accordance with Swiss law.

Both Modis International Ltd and Modis Europe Ltd are Equal Opportunities Employers.

By applying for this role your details will be submitted to Modis International Ltd and/ or Modis Europe Ltd. Our Candidate Privacy Information Statement explains how we will use your information - please copy and paste the following link in to your browser: http://en-gb/candidate-privacy

DATA ENGINEER (PYTHON, AWS, TDD)

£45,000 - £55,000

LONDON

This is an exciting opportunity for a mid- level Data Engineer with Python and SQL skills to work within a trendy, music company.

THE COMPANY:

This role is with a relatively small sized company based in the Capital. They are a global music company who create music for TV, Film and advertising with their own in-house database and data tool. There is an excellent culture within this business with a young, flexible workforce.

THE ROLE:

  • Building, testing, and deploying pipelines using Python.
  • Dealing with end to end ETL processes.
  • Data modelling and governance.

YOUR SKILLS & EXPERIENCE:

  • Experience writing code in Python
  • Knowledge of AWS technologies (Lambda, Redshift, S3)
  • Commercial experience with TDD
  • A software engineering mindset.
  • A relevant university degree (computer science/engineering/maths/stats) or relevant professional experience.

THE BENEFITS

This opportunity offers a salary of £45,000 - £55,000 plus a bonus and added benefits.

HOW TO APPLY

This is a brand new requirement for a graduate with aspirations of working in Data Engineering / Data Analysis.  Data Engineering Our client analyse businesses via public data, such as geography, trade and customer reviews  <...
fullDescription:
Graduate / Junior Data Engineer - Brighton, East Sussex

£DOE

Junior Data Engineer required by exciting business that are in the early throes of their evolution. This is a brand new requirement for a graduate with aspirations of working in Data Engineering / Data Analysis.

Data Engineering

Our client analyse businesses via public data, such as geography, trade and customer reviews

  • Your role is to identify and collate sources of data
  • The next stage is to check and cross-reference the data for accuracy
  • And then make them ready for loading into our underwriting and CRM system
  • There is an ongoing cycle of data refresh and improvement

Data Analysis

  • Your role is to bring together external and internal data to produce insights
  • For marketing, these insights help us to understand what potential customers want
  • For underwriting, the insights are key to our future profitability

This is an exciting opportunity to get involved in a rapidly rising start up. Please send your cv or simply call Marcus and the team at ARC IT Recruitment.

Brighton, East Sussex

£d.o.e

jobTitle: Data Engineer (SC, DV or BPSS Cleared)
jobDescription: Data Engineers needed for a Consultancy specialising in Data Engineering, Data Science and Cloud infrastructure. As a Partner driven organisation they focus on customer success and fostering an excellent internal culture for the team. By doing so it enables  them to implement rapid agile digital transformations across a variety of industry which is further augmented by their accelerators and automation toolsets They believe that their...
fullDescription:
Data Engineers needed for a Consultancy specialising in Data Engineering, Data Science and Cloud infrastructure. As a Partner driven organisation they focus on customer success and fostering an excellent internal culture for the team. By doing so it enables them to implement rapid agile digital transformations across a variety of industry which is further augmented by their accelerators and automation toolsets

They believe that their people are what has made them the company they are today. They have chosen to adopt a partnership model, ensuring that they all share in the success. With only 4 levels in their hierarchy between consultant and partner, everyone is empowered to have a positive influence in the way we do things.

Please note that a lot of their work is in government, so will require DV or SC clearance or the ability to acquire.

Role & Responsibilities:

  • Working within their data engineering practice, a team who provide expertise and specialist data transformation services, enabling clients to gain insight from their data.
  • Direct involvement in the Data Engineering lifecycle, from requirements gathering and development activities through to production deployments.
  • Working directly with clients to understand their business problems and translate these into data pipelines from prototype to production-ready code.
  • Implement data pipelines to connect operational systems and data for analytics and BI systems
  • Promote the adoption and integration of data engineering into the client organisation. Helping to drive innovation both internally and with clients.
  • Build source to target mappings and similarly interpret these mapping specifications in order to build efficient data pipelines.
  • Able to utilise services from cloud platforms such as AWS or Azure, as well as metadata driven platforms like Informatica or Talend.
  • Define and participate in Proof of Concepts for the client and internally provided use cases. Helping to assess and propose innovative solutions based on business requirements.

Essential Requirements

  • 3+ years proven experience in working on relevant data engineering projects
  • Strong SQL skills with a solid understanding of dimensional modelling
  • Knowledge of programming languages (esp. Java)
  • 1+ years of hands-on experience using cloud platforms
  • Strong communicator and stakeholder management experience is essential, with the ability to articulate and present findings and insights at the right level for a wide audience.
  • Experience of working within large, complex and geographically dispersed Programmes
  • Knowledge of data management best practices, such as DAMA.
  • Experienced working with stakeholders to gather requirements and deliver findings.
  • Experienced conducting data quality assurance, validation and linkage.
  • Able to utilise tools and techniques for data analysis and data visualisation such as SQL, PowerBI or Qlik.

jobDescription: DATA ENGINEER - REMOTE WORKING  £35,000 - £45,000  REMOTE (OFFICE IN LONDON)  THE COMPANY:  The company are a private equity firm with investments in the fintech, online marketing, insurance and online gaming spaces. They are looking for an experienced ETL developer with SSIS and ideally Azure Data Factory experience to come in and focus...
fullDescription:
DATA ENGINEER - REMOTE WORKING

£35,000 - £45,000

REMOTE (OFFICE IN LONDON)

THE COMPANY:

The company are a private equity firm with investments in the fintech, online marketing, insurance and online gaming spaces. They are looking for an experienced ETL developer with SSIS and ideally Azure Data Factory experience to come in and focus on data ingestion as well as building data pipelines.

THE ROLE:

As a Data Engineer, your responsibilities will include:

  • Leading data integration projects on Azure Cloud Platform
  • Building real time streaming data pipelines
  • Data ingestion and ETL work
  • Building schemas and designing data warehouses

YOUR SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE:

The successful Data Engineer will have the following skills and experience:

  • Excellent ETL experience
  • SSIS and T-SQL
  • Azure Data Factory/Azure exposure
  • Ability to code in Python, Scala or C#

HOW TO APPLY:

Please register your interest by sending your CV to Ria Verma via the Apply link on this page.

If so, there is an opportunity available with one  of the UK's leading Digital Cyber-Security organisations which you should consider. As a Senior Data Engineer for this forward thinking o...
fullDescription:
Senior Data Engineer

Are you a Senior Data Engineer with current SC Clearance? Do you like the sound of working to help protect some of the UK's most critical infrastructures and national assets from cyber-crime and threats? If so, there is an opportunity available with one of the UK's leading Digital Cyber-Security organisations which you should consider.

As a Senior Data Engineer for this forward thinking organisation you can expect to work across either the public or private sector, as a key figure in an industry leading team of data experts consisting of data architects, and scientists. It is fast paced, and at times a challenging environment, but with a highly rewarding and tangible benefits.

The Senior Data Engineer can expect a great platform to enhance their profile, with exposure to the latest technology sets, and trends such as Big Data/Machine Learning. Additionally you will receive reviews on a 6 month basis, so there is plenty of opportunity for promotions!

*Must hold current Security Clearance to attain this position*

Requirements:

Must have some but not all:

  • 5+ years' experience in a data related position/must have leadership experience
  • MUST hold current SC Clearance
  • Experience with Python, R, or SQL
  • Experience of the analysis, design and development of Data warehouse, Big Data or complex Data migration solutions
  • Expertise in at least one or two data stores such as SQL Server, Hadoop, netezza etc.
  • Knowledge of the Agile development approaches

If this role sounds interesting or you're curious to find out more, please get in touch with Adam below for consideration!

Location: Guilford

Agency: Anson McCade

Duration: Permanent

Salary: £55,000 - £70,000 + 5,900 car allowance + 11% bonus

fullDescription:
THE COMPANY

Leading Fintech who are looking to improve their Data Engineering function. My client is looking for a data engineer to join their team of world class engineers and Data Scientists to build end-to-end applications that make use of large volumes of source data from the operational systems.

THE ROLE

On a daily basis you will be:

  • Utilise the appropriate development, data engineering (ETL & ELT, stream processing), test and release model(s) and be flexible with your approach
  • Apply the appropriate standards and principles when delivering data ingestion and data transformation into target data models
  • Convert algorithms, models and features created by data scientists, analysts and designers from prototypes/designs into production solutions
  • Deliver, cost effective, appropriate capabilities for the business.
  • Create Data Lakes & Data Pipelines

SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE

  • Strong knowledge of Spark, Scala and AWS
  • Someone who likes to roll up their sleeves and enjoys learning
  • An understanding of data modelling, access an storage
  • Self-driven and constantly striving to improve your skills
  • Advocate of agile/lean delivery methodologies

THE BENEFITS

  • Competitive pension scheme
  • Up to £75,000

HOW TO APPLY

Please register your interest by sending your CV to Daniel Moss via the Apply link on this page

jobDescription: DATA ENGINEER  £70,000 - £80,000 + BENEFITS  LONDON  Are you a hands-on Data Engineer with strong Scala and Spark experience looking for a stimulating new challenge? If so, apply to be considered this opportunity. THE COMPANY: This role is with a global media company that sits in the television space. They are a very successfu...
fullDescription:
DATA ENGINEER

£70,000 - £80,000 + BENEFITS

LONDON

Are you a hands-on Data Engineer with strong Scala and Spark experience looking for a stimulating new challenge? If so, apply to be considered this opportunity.

THE COMPANY:

This role is with a global media company that sits in the television space. They are a very successful business having experienced over a 10 billion turnover this year. Because of this, they are going through a business model transformation to become more digitalised and thus more data centric.

THE ROLE:

We are recruiting for an experienced Data Engineer to join this growing team where they will be using Scala and Spark heavily in an AWS platform.

In particular, this role will involve:

  • Being a fully hands-on, technical contributor using cutting edge technologies. (Spark, Scala, AWS, Airflow, Python)
  • Building cloud based distributed data processing systems.
  • Collecting and visualising large data sets.
  • Designing and building pipelines using big data tech.
  • Developing and maintaining infrastructure in Scala, AWS Athena, Spark etc.

YOUR SKILLS & EXPERIENCE:

  • Educated to a degree level with computer science or similar background.
  • Commercial experience with strong technical expertise in Big Data technology.
  • Strong commercial Scala and Spark coding experience.
  • Commercial experience with AWS data tools (Kenesis, Redshift, Athena etc), must have
  • Experience in Python and SQL.

THE BENEFITS:

The selected candidate will receive a salary between £70,000 - £80,000 depending on their experience and requirements. On top of this salary, there are some excellent benefits on offer.

HOW TO APPLY:

Please register your interest by sending your CV to Holly Neeves via the Apply link on this page.

jobDescription: Senior Data Engineer with experience managing and architecting complex data streams is sought on a fully remote basis by a multi award winning SaaS platform house based in the Midlands. The organisation works to automate and improve key business processes within financial services and as such are looking for a Senior Data Engineer who can bring 5 years' data modelling experience to champion data driven decision making across the compan...
fullDescription:
Senior Data Engineer with experience managing and architecting complex data streams is sought on a fully remote basis by a multi award winning SaaS platform house based in the Midlands.
The organisation works to automate and improve key business processes within financial services and as such are looking for a Senior Data Engineer who can bring 5 years' data modelling experience to champion data driven decision making across the company.

This Senior Data Engineer can expect full time remote working and a complete commitment to personal development and growth with extensive progression opportunities as the department grows over the next 12 months.

This Senior Data Engineer should have most of the following key skills:

- Solid SQL experience
- Experience working in an AWS cloud environment
- Demonstrable experience managing and architecting complex data streams (ideally using Kafka)
- Financial services sector experience would be useful by not essential
- Any JSON exposure would be really useful
- Ability to communicate clearly with external stakeholders

This Senior Data Engineer will receive:

- Starting salary of £70,000 - £80,000 DoE
- Bonus
- Share options
- Bi-Annual salary reviews
- Full remote working
- Private pension scheme
- 3rd party healthcare scheme
- 26 days holiday plus bank holiday
- Choice of technology
- Weekly personal development time and budget

So if you are a Data Engineer with a real passion for the latest data management technology and like the idea of joining a company that can offer fast track progression within a technologically astute business then please apply now to be considered.

Senior Data Engineer

£70, 000 - £80,000 plus full remote working

SQL, AWS, Data modelling, Data Pipelines, Kafka

jobDescription: DATA ENGINEER LONDON (REMOTE WORKING) UP TO £85,000 Harnham are partnered with an international television network that produces its own unique content. They are looking for a data engineer to join their subscription service and work in tandem with BI and Data Science teams. THE COMPANY The company are a huge television network that tu...
fullDescription:
DATA ENGINEER

LONDON (REMOTE WORKING)

UP TO £85,000

Harnham are partnered with an international television network that produces its own unique content. They are looking for a data engineer to join their subscription service and work in tandem with BI and Data Science teams.

THE COMPANY

The company are a huge television network that turnover around £8bn per year. They are undergoing a transformation of their business model that has moved from selling their content to network providers, to a subscription service. It is a business with important assets and a big market share. They require a team of data engineers to build pipelines to ingest and transform their new forms of data.

THE ROLE

  • You will be involved in building an AWS platform using Scala
  • You will be pulling data from API's and providing this information for BI and Data Scientists
  • You will use Big Data technologies such as Spark
  • You will be part of a team building ETL pipelines to ingest, transform and distribute data.

YOUR SKILLS AND EXPERIENCES

  • An expert Scala programmer
  • Extensive experience using AWS
  • Have previously used Apache Airflow
  • Highly important to have experience using Spark

HOW TO APPLY

Please register your interest by sending you CV to Callum Castling via the apply link on this page.

fullDescription:
Senior Data Engineer - 12 months - £650 p/d

This is a great chance for an Azure focused senior data engineer to join an award winning consultancy on a new project with a large private sector client. You will play a key role as a senior member of the team on a brand new project analyse and processing large amounts of data to enable the business to focus their attention where needed.

We are looking for self sufficient Azure Data Engineers from an Agile background and with good stakeholder engagement experience.

Skills:

  • Microsoft Azure
  • Databricks
  • Python
  • Spark
  • Azure DevOps
  • Data Lake

This is an outside of IR35 opportunity for an initial 12 months.

We are looking to get the new team started in early January so this can turn around before Christmas. For further information please apply.

jobDescription: SCALA DATA ENGINEERWEST LONDON, CURRENTLY FLEXIBLE / REMOTE / HOME WORKINGUP TO £75,000 + BENEFITS + BONUS Harnham are partnered with a TV network who own several channels that are looking to introduce a subscription service. They have a strong Data Engineering team which they are having to expand due to the changes to their current platform. TH...
fullDescription:
SCALA DATA ENGINEER
WEST LONDON, CURRENTLY FLEXIBLE / REMOTE / HOME WORKING
UP TO £75,000 + BENEFITS + BONUS

Harnham are partnered with a TV network who own several channels that are looking to introduce a subscription service. They have a strong Data Engineering team which they are having to expand due to the changes to their current platform.

THE COMPANY:

This role is with a global company who turnover £8bn in revenue each year. Due to the demand of their channels, they are looking to create a subscription service so that their viewers can easily catch-up on programmes they have missed, on demand. This has meant that they have had to re-platform their analytics capability to ensure it can cope with the increased demand.

THE ROLE:

  • Building pipelines for their new product, to ingest data coming from different sources
  • Writing quality, production-level Scala code to make data accessible for the BI, Data Science and Marketing teams
  • You will be streaming data using Spark to channel high volumes of data
  • Enhancing their AWS platform, adding new features to improve the infrastructure and scheduling of the current ETL pipelines

YOUR SKILLS & EXPERIENCES:

  • Expert programmer in Scala
  • Have a good understanding of the AWS platform
  • Have streamed/processes data using Spark
  • Work in an agile way, hitting deadlines on coding tasks

HOW TO APPLY:

Please register your interest by sending you CV to Henry Rodrigues via the apply link on this page. (The Company have outlined a fully remote interview process and have a remote on-boarding policy in place).

Given the excitement around this new tech company, it will be fast paced and challenging!  Location: London (50/50 remote)  The Role: This role will mainly involve back-end work, but a commercially-aware mind and good communication skills will go a long way. Withi...
fullDescription:
An exciting, high-growth start up, which has just received PE funding is looking for a Data Engineer to join their data team. Given the excitement around this new tech company, it will be fast paced and challenging!

Location: London (50/50 remote)

The Role:

This role will mainly involve back-end work, but a commercially-aware mind and good communication skills will go a long way. Within the data team you will be required to:

  • Build out the data models predicting the company’s growth
  • Help with cloud based projects (using AWS)
  • Work with detailed datasets to see how consumers are using the start-ups product
  • Build the data warehouse from scratch and maintain it
  • Decide on the database management tools the business uses

Skills required:

  • Software and languages: Azure, Python, AWS.
  • 3+ years experience in Data Engineering.
  • Experience with building out the architecture.
  • Strong problem solving skills.
  • ETL process exposure.

THE COMPANY: The client is a leading European Home-wares Retailer who is one of the largest adopters of AWS Serverless. Th...
fullDescription:
Data Engineer

Copenhagen, Denmark

6 Month Contract

900 DKK Per Hour

As a Data Engineer you will be creating and maintaining data pipeline architecture for a leading European home-wares retailer.

THE COMPANY:

The client is a leading European Home-wares Retailer who is one of the largest adopters of AWS Serverless. The client has recently transformed their digital platform using the latest technology and require a Data Engineer to build and maintain highly scalable cloud-based data infrastructure.

THE ROLE:

As a Data Engineer you will be expected to define AWS cloud-based infrastructure as code using CI/CD practices, developing high quality code in python, and designing data solutions that align with the goals of the business. You will be able to adapt to regularly changing business requirements. You should also be comfortable challenging and leading on best practice.

YOUR SKILLS & EXPERIENCE:

The ideal Data Engineer will have:

  • Commercial experience building and optimising ETL data pipelines
  • Advanced working knowledge of SQL
  • Commercial experience in one or more cloud-based warehouse such as Snowflake, Redshift or BigQuery
  • Commercial experience working with AWS cloud services in production

HOW TO APPLY:

Please submit your CV to Lily Desmond at Harnham via the Apply Now button.

fullDescription:
Data Engineer

Our client is a well-established international insurance company, and they are looking for 2 Data Engineers to support the Data & MI team. This is a business facing role within Actuarial & Analytics so excellent communication skills are required. This is ideally suited to candidates with an interest in insurance and programming to develop their skills.

Responsibilities

  • Developing or redeveloping new or existing solutions that support analytics capabilities, database usage and dashboards using new or existing technologies
  • Developing and maintaining new and existing data warehouses, structures, and loads
  • Understanding and analysing new datasets/warehouses as and when required.
  • Being involved in key data projects to help the company meet its strategic objectives.
  • Automating business processes using SQL, Python, SSIS or other relevant technologies.
  • Developing and maintaining C# applications used to automate business processes
  • Extracting, transforming, and loading data to the right places in the right format
  • Liaising with other business units to help them identify and build the right solutions they require.

Requirements

  • Knowledge of at least one object orientated programming language e.g. C#, Python, R, MATLAB
  • Scripting skills e.g. VBA (use with Excel)
  • Advanced knowledge of Microsoft Excel
  • Highly numerate - expecting a good (2.1 or above) degree in mathematics/computer science or related disciplines
  • Good written, verbal and presentation communication skills
  • Organised self-starter, with drive and commitment
  • Excellent interpersonal skills and the ability to maintain effective working relationships

Desirable skills and experience

  • Knowledge of ETL techniques to support the transformation of data from a variety of sources, especially SSIS
  • Good knowledge of SQL
  • Experience supporting data scientists and analysts in a commercial setting
  • A keen interest in keeping up to date with new technologies

This is a great opportunity for someone who wants to join a growing area of this business. Please apply only if you have the required experience along with excellent communication skills.

fullDescription:
Data Engineer Lead

Artificial Intelligence | Machine Learning | GCP | Big Data | Cloud | SQL | Data Modelling

Are you a talented Data Engineer?

Do you have experience with SQL, NoSQL and Cloud Implementation?

Can you see yourself working for a company rated as a 'great place to work' by the Economic Times?

  • £80,000-90,000
  • 15% Bonus paid annually
  • Central London office (and other offices across the globe)
  • Fully remote until further notice
  • Some Travelling Involved

The Company

I am excited to be exclusively partnered with a leading artificial intelligence company that provide services in consumer packages goods, healthcare, life sciences, insurance, retail and technology and the financial sector.

The Data Engineer Lead Role

  • Drive deployment / increase consumption of solutions (cloud data and analytics services - SQL Database, NoSQL databases, SQL Data Warehouse, Big Data processing, Machine Learning, and Stream Analytics)
  • Establish relationships with decision makers to resolve business problems within their companies
  • Lead mapping of business solutions to cloud based architecture & data technology solutions (take systems-wide view of customer solution data landscape)
  • Architect scalable data processing / analytics solutions. Including technical feasibility and development for Big Data storage, processing and consumption - (development of enterprise Data Lake strategy / heterogeneous data management / Polyglot Persistence / decision support / BI over Data Lake)
  • Design, coordinate and execute pilots, prototypes or proof of concepts, provide validation on specific scenarios
  • Provide subject matter expertise around technical infrastructure and applications
  • Define the case for solutions, design the solution to help prototype and develop the customer's new environment, and guide the solution through launch to market
  • Demonstrate leadership in cloud computing across multiple channels and become a trusted advisor to decision makers

Required Experience

  • SQL/ noSQL
  • Data Modelling and Data Design
  • Must be able to write PL/SQL stored procedures
  • Experience designing Star, Snowflake Schemes, Dimensional Data Modelling, SCD and CDC
  • 7+ years of experience in technology consulting and cloud implementation experience, preferably in Google Cloud Platform (GCP) stack

Desirable

  • Media-Network Industry experience
  • Preferably an MBA or MS/M.Tech. degree in Computer Science or related field.

If you are the talented individual they are looking for, do not hesitate to apply! Interviews will be commencing as early as the 15th December. Contact charlotte.dacre@oscar-tech for more info ??

Artificial Intelligence | Machine Learning | GCP | Big Data | Cloud | SQL | Data Modelling

fullDescription:
Data Engineer

Ast.Start: ASAP (Q1 2021)
Location: Remote / Amsterdam - 4 Days on site when COVID restrictions are lifted
Duration: 12 months (with option to extend)

You are a senior software engineer with at least three years of experience and a passion for data. You are able to engineer a complete data-centric solution from scratch, collecting functional and non-functional requirements, taking into account technical environments, business constraints and enterprise organizations.
You like working with data scientists and you speak their language. You are a team player and a self-driven professional. You keep learning new technologies, architecture patterns, programming languages and machine learning algorithms.
You are enthusiastic about innovation in software engineering and not afraid to contribute to open-source projects. You like attending, and even better presenting, at technical meetups from time to time. You are curious about the big picture and passionate about bringing data to life.
We expect a data engineer to bring a broad software engineering experience:

  • Backend and/or frontend development in any programming language of your choice.
  • Design of web services.
  • Algorithms and complexity analysis.
  • Linux system administration, development and production environments.
  • Cloud, container and micro services infrastructures.
  • Software security.
  • Development workflow automation and a strong focus on data processing:
  • Databases, theory and practice.
  • Distributed data processing.
  • Real-time event processing.
  • Concepts of functional programming.
  • Data privacy and anonymization techniques.
  • Enterprise data warehousing, business intelligence and ETL principles.
  • Statistics and analytics.
  • Machine learning.


Core technology requirements: Scala, Spark, Kubernetes, AWS, Java, Python

fullDescription:
Junior Data Engineer, Uxbridge, £40-50K + 10% bonus + bens. You must be a Graduate with a strong understanding of Data Engineering, Machine Learning and ideally a good knowledge of Java. Either a recent Graduate or someone with commercial experience, both will be considered.

Reporting into the Data Engineering Technical Lead, the role involves creating data solutions to process data at scale, both in batch and real-time pipelines, to support a wide range of data-driven projects and support our transformation into an AI-ready organisation.

The key responsibilities of the Data Engineer are:
*Implement workflows to ingest data into a Snowflake data warehouse for a variety of data sources
*Implement data transformation pipelines in real-time and batch environments
*Support all product teams in adopting our data engineering tech stack to generate new data streams
*Collaborate with Data Science and Business Intelligence teams to identify requirements and develop the necessary data workflows to deliver against those requirements

Key Experience:

*University degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering or related subjects
*Knowledge / experience of Java. Python desirable.
*Relational and non-relational databases. Experience with Snowflake a plus.
*Batch processing frameworks, such as DBT, Flink, Apache Airflow, etc.
*Message brokers / stream processing technologies (Kinesis, Kafka, Storm, Spark Streaming, Flink, etc.)
*Familiarity AWS, Docker, Kubernetes, Amazon EKS
*Continuous Integration with Jenkins
*Test-Driven Development and XP

This role involves close collaboration with data scientists, data analysts and product engineers.

This Junior Data Engineer position is based in Uxbridge but can be remote working and is paying c£40-50K + 10% bonus + Bens, depending on relevant experience.

SENIOR DATA ENGINEER

SALARY £65,000 - £75,000

LONDON

Are you an enduring learner who wants the opportunity to get hands on in an innovative company, whilst being able to influence business decisions and solution delivery?

THE COMPANY:

This role is with a maturing global and diverse company which sits in the ever-evolving media industry and thus functions at a fast pace in order to strive and out do their competitors. They are looking to develop their data implementation in order to enable deeper analysis, reporting and business decisions.

THE ROLE:

The Senior Data Engineer will sit within the Technology department and report into the Head of Data Insights & Engineering.

In particular, this role will involve:

  • Design, develop and maintain data pipelines, the data lake and data warehouse using Python.
  • Outline best practice for data storage, access and security.

  • Educated to a degree level with computer science, Math or an analytical and web analytics tools (Adobe Analytics). background.

  • Exposure to workflow management tools (Airflow, Luigi, Pinball etc).

  • Capable of writing SQL queries.

fullDescription:
Senior Data Engineer (DevOps Data Terraform AWS SQL Python) *Remote Interview WFH*. Are you a data savvy Data Engineer seeking a role where you can take ownership and progress your career working on complex and interesting systems?

You could be joining a FinTech Unicorn that is helping to revolutionise payments industry Globally via their suite of cloud based SaaS Products.

As a Data Engineer you will focus on building the tools and platforms are at the core of the businesses product offering - ensuring that the core data platform is highly available and performant. You'll take ownership of the data storage infrastructure roadmap and lead the requirements for implementing improvements, optimisations and technology changes via monitoring of availability, performance, capacity and usage patterns of the event systems and databases to assess the need for tactical or strategic changes.

In this Data Engineer you will collaborate to solve problems in large scale distributed systems and have a great deal of influence on best practice.

Requirements:

  • Strong Engineering Background with an interest in Data and Machine Learning
  • Good understanding of Python and have the ability to write production ready code
  • Experience working with stream processing with Kinesis, Kafka
  • Familiarity with Spark Dask and Hadoop.
  • Extensive Experience with SQL Databases
  • Experience designing and implementing CI/CD pipelines.
  • Good knowledge of AWS


Collaborative with good communication skills, keen to learn and share knowledge

As a Data Infrastructure Engineer you will earn a competitive salary (to £95k) plus benefits.

Apply now or call to find out more about this Data Engineer opportunity.

fullDescription:
We are looking for Senior Data Engineer to help us get started on our journey to implementing a new platform. The role will work in a data rich environment together with data analysts and data scientists. Data engineers will configure platform, performing initial data integrations, and implement workflows and models for key use cases. You will be working with the data engineers and working closely with several stakeholders. The role will be responsible to ensure compounding value is created through shared data, common ontologies, and cross-organisation projects.

As Senior Data Engineer, the post holder will work with the data engineers to deliver robust data services. The day to day roles involves working with the data engineering team and the corporate data assets. The role will involve driving forward improvements in data services including the development and implementation of a new data platform and roll out of platform for analytics and reporting. The role will also involve supporting the organisation with ongoing projects from a data perspective.

We are looking for a highly motivated professional with demonstratable experience and expertise over a significant period is essential. You will need to work on your own initiative and hit the ground running in order to build data pipelines in new data integration platform. You will be ambitious and excited by the prospect of joining a rapid growing team, and with the right qualities to thrive in an unstructured fast growth environment.

This role would suit an ambitious Data Engineer with significant experience coming from a background of either working in a fast growth scale up company, or someone who has worked within a large organisation who has an appetite for taking on more responsibility and autonomy and leading the team.

The Senior Data Engineer will require the following experience:

  • Educated to Degree Level (or equivalent relevant experience)
  • Proficiency in in Python/ PySpark/ Spark SQL
  • Advanced level of SQL coding and experience in the Microsoft BI Stack
  • Experience with Microsoft Azure and/or AWS
  • Experience of Big Data technologies
  • Experience in development best practices (e.g. Git workflows )
  • Experience with Agile methodology and problem-centric solution design
  • Tracking pipeline dependencies

Most staff are currently working from home due to the impact of COVID-19. This role is nominally based at our London or Leeds office and will require travel across the country as we work very collaboratively with partners, so the post-holder will need to be happy to work in a mobile capacity as well as from home. We have flexible working policy and encourage the use of digital technology such as MS teams. The base for this post can be flexible depending on the successful candidate.

Short-listed candidates will be invited to an interview via MS Teams to assess their knowledge, skills and potential.

Who we are

The Data and Analytics function is responsible for providing a service for all of NHS England and NHS Improvement users. As part of the Chief Operating Officer Directorate the service is also required to provide data and analytics services to the wider NHS, and support Regions to work in a more integrated way with local systems. This programme is the delivery mechanism for one of our core corporate objectives - to align all parts of the NHS to have access to consistent data for performance, planning and transformation programmes and to support the delivery of the Long-Term Plan.

We have a new exciting opportunity for a range of roles to support us with the implementation of a new data and analytics integration platform. The roles are fixed term 2 years with potential for permanent role and include: Senior Data Scientists, Data Scientists, Senior Data Engineers, Data Engineers, Visualisation Developers, Data Developers, Deployment Managers, Business Analysts and Programme Management roles.

The roles will be part of a highly skilled and valued team that supports the work across NHS England and NHS Improvement to improve health and care. Our vision is to connect and empower the use of data and analytics across the NHS by:

  • Harnessing data
  • Improving integration
  • Driving data insights
  • Growing capability

What are the benefits to patients and to the wider NHS?

  • Improved health outcomes derived from better-informed decision-making ability from more accurate and timely data insights, as well as increased capability as a result of the functionality provided by the platform.
  • Time savings for users, as reduced effort needed in inputting, cleansing, disseminating and interpreting data.

Please note that the reason for the fixed term of your contract is short term vacancy due to time limited project

For further details / informal visits contact:

Name - Jennifer Sturdy

Job title - Senior Business Assistant

Email address -
