As Data Engineer, the post holder will work with the data engineers to deliver robust data services. The day to day roles involves working with the data engineering team and the corporate data assets. The role will involve driving forward improvements in data services including the development and implementation of a new data platform and roll out of platform for analytics and reporting. The role will also involve supporting the organisation with ongoing projects from a data perspective.

We are looking for a highly motivated professional with demonstratable experience and expertise is essential. You will need to work hit the ground running in order to build data pipelines in new data integration platform. You will be ambitious and excited by the prospect of joining a rapid growing team, and with the right qualities to thrive in an unstructured fast growth environment.

This role would suit an ambitious Data Engineer coming from a background of either working in a fast growth scale up company, or someone who has worked within a large organisation who has an appetite for taking on more responsibility and autonomy and leading the team.

The Data Engineer will require the following experience:

  • Educated to Degree Level (or equivalent relevant experience)
  • Experience in in Python/ PySpark/ Spark SQL
  • Advanced level of SQL coding and experience in the Microsoft BI Stack
  • Experience with Microsoft Azure and/or AWS
  • An understanding of of Big Data technologies
  • Proficiency in development best practices (e.g. Git workflows )
  • Experience with Agile methodology and problem-centric solution design
  • Tracking pipeline dependencies

Most staff are currently working from home due to the impact of COVID-19. This role is nominally based at our London or Leeds office and will require travel across the country as we work very collaboratively with partners, so the post-holder will need to be happy to work in a mobile capacity as well as from home. We have flexible working policy and encourage the use of digital technology such as MS teams. The base for this post can be flexible depending on the successful candidate.

Short-listed candidates will be invited to an interview via MS Teams to assess their knowledge, skills and potential.

Who we are

The Data and Analytics function is responsible for providing a service for all of NHS England and NHS Improvement users. As part of the Chief Operating Officer Directorate the service is also required to provide data and analytics services to the wider NHS, and support Regions to work in a more integrated way with local systems. This programme is the delivery mechanism for one of our core corporate objectives - to align all parts of the NHS to have access to consistent data for performance, planning and transformation programmes and to support the delivery of the Long-Term Plan.

We have a new exciting opportunity for a range of roles to support us with the implementation of a new data and analytics integration platform. The roles are fixed term 2 years with potential for permanent role and include: Senior Data Scientists, Data Scientists, Senior Data Engineers, Data Engineers, Visualisation Developers, Data Developers, Deployment Managers, Business Analysts and Programme Management roles.

The roles will be part of a highly skilled and valued team that supports the work across NHS England and NHS Improvement to improve health and care. Our vision is to connect and empower the use of data and analytics across the NHS by:

  • Harnessing data
  • Improving integration
  • Driving data insights
  • Growing capability

What are the benefits to patients and to the wider NHS?

  • Improved health outcomes derived from better-informed decision-making ability from more accurate and timely data insights, as well as increased capability as a result of the functionality provided by the platform.
  • Time savings for users, as reduced effort needed in inputting, cleansing, disseminating and interpreting data.

Please note that the reason for the fixed term of your contract is short term vacancy due to time limited project

For further details and informal visits contact:

Name: Jennifer Sturdy

Job Title: Senior Business Assistant

Email Address:

jobDescription: An exciting opportunity exists for an enthusiastic, suitably qualified, experienced, and self-motivated Voice and Data Engineer to be based at either of the following BCUHB sites: Bangor/Abergele/Wrexham. Working as a member of the Voice and Data team within the ICT department, the successful candidate will be responsible the development, installation, and on-going operational management and support of the Health Board’s voice and dat...
fullDescription:
An exciting opportunity exists for an enthusiastic, suitably qualified, experienced, and self-motivated Voice and Data Engineer to be based at either of the following BCUHB sites: Bangor/Abergele/Wrexham.

Working as a member of the Voice and Data team within the ICT department, the successful candidate will be responsible the development, installation, and on-going operational management and support of the Health Board’s voice and data infrastructure.

Ideally, the post holder should have a relevant Degree/HND and/or demonstrable equivalent experience of:

  • Data Networking Technologies (including LAN and WAN)
  • Network Protocols (TCP/IP and Ethernet)
  • Voice and Video Communication Technologies
  • Network Security Technologies (including Firewall and Intrusion Prevention Systems)
  • Wireless Networking Technologies

Additionally the post holder should have excellent trouble shooting and interpersonal skills as they will be required to provide specialist technical 3rd line support to departmental colleagues and 3rd party providers.

The post holder may be asked to work across all BCUHB sites and locations, therefore the ability to access transport (public and/or private) to travel off site is essential.

The ability to speak Welsh is desirable for this post; Welsh and/or English speakers are equally welcome to apply.

Closing date: 19/01/2021

For further details / informal visits contact:

Dave Slocombe

Data Communications Manager

dave.slocombe@wales.nhs.uk

Dave.bridges@wales.nhs.uk

Monday to Friday 09:00-17:00 hrs

jobDescription: Senior Data EngineerOur client, a global telecommunications firm based in the City of London seeks a senior data engineer to take responsibility for the design, implementation, deployment, and productionizing of their data collection systems, streaming and batch, and (ETL) pipelines  for our data scientists, and customers.You will be responsible for:* The development, maintenance, and deployment of data integr...
fullDescription:
Senior Data Engineer

Our client, a global telecommunications firm based in the City of London seeks a senior data engineer to take responsibility for the design, implementation, deployment, and productionizing of their data collection systems, streaming and batch, and (ETL) pipelines for our data scientists, and customers.

You will be responsible for:

* The development, maintenance, and deployment of data integration and ETL pipelines

* Setting up rules, alerting, and monitoring for data consistency and quality

* Converting and migrating current (legacy) data pipelines * Working together with the data scientists and operations to help them provide the right data at the right time to the business, our partners, value added resellers, and customers

* Automating business and operations reports and alerts

What we need from you:

* Significant experience managing distributed systems and clusters

* A background in Linux administration

* Experience using automation tools such as git, Jenkins, Sonar, RPM

* Programming level experience using python / bash

* Experience building complex ETL pipelines

If this role sounds of interest or more information, please apply and you will be contacted.

jobDescription: CIB Application Engineering and Architecture (AEA) group aims to continuously modernise CIB applications, processes and engineering behaviours to create efficiency and leverage. CIB AEA Engineering Efficiency team is serving the overall AEA mission by  developing a suite of data analytics and insights to enable transparency and support data-driven decisions with the aim of assessing and improving engineering efficiency and application modernisat...
fullDescription:
CIB Application Engineering and Architecture (AEA) group aims to continuously modernise CIB applications, processes and engineering behaviours to create efficiency and leverage. CIB AEA Engineering Efficiency team is serving the overall AEA mission by developing a suite of data analytics and insights to enable transparency and support data-driven decisions with the aim of assessing and improving engineering efficiency and application modernisation. The group is also developing tooling to enable better development experience and efficiency. We are continuously evolving our products to embed advanced data science/analytics to surface innovative, advanced and powerful features.

We are looking for a strong data engineer - passionate about data, analytics and problem solving in general to help us deliver high-quality and scalable products. You are willing to learn new skills if required in response to the business needs. You will dive head-first into creating innovative solutions that advance businesses and careers. You'll join an inspiring and curious team of technologists focused and dedicated on enhancing the firm's capabilities. We are improving the design, analytics, development, coding, testing and application programming that goes into creating high quality software and transforms into visually stimulating and insightful products. Coming in with an understanding of the importance of end-to-end software development practices is imperative.
We maintain data and visualisation software and platforms that deliver actionable analytics to senior technology management.

Skills
Interpersonal skills
- Strong communication skills with ability to interact with all levels of the business
- Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills
- Diligent, methodical and attentive to detail
- Self-starter, self-motivated and adaptable team player
- Fast learning, enjoys solving complex problems and creating simple solutions

Technical skills
- Experience with at least one mainstream programming language such as Java or Python
- Experience with working with Big Data solutions - Hadoop, Impala, Spark-SQL
- Experience of working with traditional relational databases
- Experience of container based deployments - Kubernetes
- Experience of automating processes in a DevOps environment
- Experience or provable passion/knowledge in data analytics space, including infrastructure and scalable data analytics platforms
- Experience using SDLC practices and delivering high quality and robust software products
- Experience with infrastructure components and their integration into application architecture

Desirable:
- Experience with data analytics and/or business intelligence (e.g., Qlik Sense)
- Experience using Agile methodologies

jobDescription: Lead Configuration and Data Engineer Airborne ISR - Broughton The Lead Configuration and Data Engineer role will lead Configuration & Data Management (CM/DM) activities on aircraft modification programmes within Raytheon Airborne ISR, based at Broughton. Applicants should possess a thorough knowledge and experience of performing CM/DM for complex products. The role includes performing CM/DM...
fullDescription:
Lead Configuration and Data Engineer
Airborne ISR - Broughton
The Lead Configuration and Data Engineer role will lead Configuration & Data Management (CM/DM) activities on aircraft modification programmes within Raytheon Airborne ISR, based at Broughton.
Applicants should possess a thorough knowledge and experience of performing CM/DM for complex products. The role includes performing CM/DM, and providing training, guidance and support to programme stakeholders .
The successful candidate will be part of the growing Airborne ISR Team which delivers aviation engineering expertise to both military and civil customers worldwide.

Role Summary
Author, implement and apply CM/DM procedures on programmes as directed by the Configuration & Data Manager.
Expedite CM/DM work including acting as a change specialist, performing CM /DM checks, and document audit prior to release.
Support the configuration, implementation, and use of information systems (e.g. Windchill, Sharepoint) used to manage configuration controlled information.
Provide training, guidance and support to programme stakeholders on the application of CM/DM and use of related information management systems.
Provide CM/DM coaching to more junior members of the team.
Establish CM baselines in accordance with the CM Plan.
Maintain the Configuration Status Account records for legacy and current product data.
Produce CM metrics and status reports.
Identify and coordinate process improvements ensuring the ongoing compliance and effectiveness of CM/DM.
Lead physical and functional configuration audits as directed by the Configuration and Data Manager.
Perform document control and data management including the coordination and release of data, and audit for compliance with customer, security, and programme standards.

Candidate Requirements:
Essential
CMII certification or equivalent industry experience.
Working knowledge of CM Standards.
Experienced in the configuration, implementation, and use of information management systems (e.g. Product Data Management / Product Lifecycle Management).
Experienced in expediting work through CM/DM processes and delivering process and information management system training.
Awareness of aircraft design, test and manufacturing procedures.
Awareness of key disciplines including Engineering, Procurement, Production, and Maintenance.
Able to influence, interface and communicate with multiple levels of management and colleagues throughout the programme.
Pro-active and enthusiastic.
Ability to plan and deliver workload for a small team of CM/DM resources.

Desirable
Experience of the Aircraft Design and Manufacturing industries
Working knowledge of Def Stan 05-57, 05-61, and ISO10007
Experienced with Microsoft office tools.
Strong written and verbal communication skills, including the generation and presentation training, guidance and communications to programme stakeholders and customers.

Eligible for or holder of SC level security clearance (Raytheon will sponsor as required). .

For further details on Raytheon AISR visit - -in-the-uk/airborneisr

About Raytheon UK
With facilities in Broughton, Waddington, Glenrothes, Harlow, Gloucester, Manchester with presence across other customer sites also. Raytheon UK is invested in the British workforce and the development of UK technology. Across the country Raytheon UK employs 1,700 people and supports 8,000 jobs. As a prime contractor and major supplier to the U.K. Ministry of Defence, Raytheon continues to invest in research and development, supporting innovation and technological advances.

Raytheon UK is a landed company, part of the Raytheon Technologies organisation and sits within the Raytheon Intelligence & Space business.

About Raytheon Technologies
Raytheon Technologies Corporation is an aerospace and defence company that provides advanced systems and services for commercial, military and government customers worldwide. It comprises four industry-leading businesses - Collins Aerospace Systems, Pratt & Whitney, Raytheon Intelligence & Space and Raytheon Missiles & Defence. Its 195,000 employees enable the company to operate at the edge of known science as they imagine and deliver solutions that push the boundaries in quantum physics, electric propulsion, directed energy, hypersonics, avionics and cyber security. The company, formed in 2020 through the combination of Raytheon Company and the United Technologies Corporation aerospace businesses, is headquartered in Waltham, Massachusetts.

Raytheon Career Development:

Raytheon has a wealth of resources available to help you develop your career from the moment you join. Activities range from on-line learning modules, to external training and support for taking professional qualifications relevant to your role.

Standard Benefits:

25 days holiday + statutory public holidays

Contributory Pension Scheme (up to 10.5% company contribution)

6 times salary 'Life Assurance'

Flexible Benefits scheme with extensive salary sacrifice scheme's.

Enhanced sick pay scheme

Enhanced Family Friendly Policies, including enhanced Maternity & Shared Parental leave.

37hr working week, with an early finish Friday/9 day fortnight (hours may vary depending on role, job requirement or site specifics arrangements).

Flexible working arrangements can be considered wherever we can (depending on the role) so please enquire or highlight any request to our Recruitment team to explore flexible working possibilities .

Diversity:

Diversity is a core business imperative at Raytheon. We are an equal opportunity employer that promotes inclusiveness and always employs the best professionals for the job. Having a diverse workforce allows Raytheon to draw upon a range of different ideas and experiences which supports growing our business and creates an environment where everyone has an equal opportunity for success. Raytheon UK pro-actively encourages diversity of ideas, thoughts, and networking opportunities and has created Employee Resource Groups (ERGs) including Raytheon Women's Network, YesNet (Young Employees Success Network), Raytheon Reservist Network (RaRe), Raytheon Alliance for Diverse Abilities (RADA) and all work together with our Diversity & Inclusion council, and all Raytheon employees are welcome to participate regardless of their background.

As a proud contributor to the HM Armed Forces, Raytheon UK signed the HM Armed Forces covenant in 2014. Due to the varied activities and support to our Armed Forces & Reservists,

Raytheon UK has since been awarded the pre

jobDescription: Job Title: Data Engineer - Consultant / Senior ConsultantLocation: London, Gloucestershire, Hampshire or ManchesterType: ContractDuration: 6 months initially - option to extend the contractConditions: DV Clearance or SC ClearanceThis position requires the Data Engineers to be DV Cleared...
fullDescription:
Job Title: Data Engineer - Consultant / Senior Consultant

Location: London, Gloucestershire, Hampshire or Manchester

Type: Contract

Duration: 6 months initially - option to extend the contract

Conditions: DV Clearance or SC Clearance

This position requires the Data Engineers to be DV Cleared or SC Cleared prior to working on client site. Please get in touch to discuss in more detail.

The Role

Our client, a specialist partner-driven consultancy primarily focused on implementing digital transformation programmes for their end clients, are experiencing significant growth within the business and have put plans in place to expand their Data Engineering team. They are keen to recruit several talented Data Engineers to join their project teams on a contractual basis and are flexible for you to work in any of their four client sites; London, Gloucestershire, Hampshire or Manchester.

You will be working with the latest technologies in an agile development team focused on continuous improvements to client projects.


  • You will be implementing data flows to connect operational systems, data for analytics and BI systems
  • You will be documenting source-to-target mappings and re-engineer manual data flows to enable scaling and repeatable use.
  • You will be leading and supporting the build of our client's data streaming systems
  • You will be required to write ETL scripts and codes to ensure the ETL process perform at optimum level.
  • You will need to develop BI reports
  • You will need to build accessible data for analysis.


What we look for in you?


  • You will need to have strong SQL skills and be comfortable in analysing and processing data.
  • You will need to have working experience of Java, in building efficient and scalable solutions
  • Proven experience of working in large, complex and geographically dispersed programme.
  • Ability to build strong relationships and network with key project stakeholders
  • Ability to articulate and present solutions to key project stakeholders
  • It is desirable if you have proven working experience with SAS.
  • Good experience with any Cloud technologies; AWS, Microsoft Azure, etc. would be desirable.
  • Good experience with Apache Kafka would be desirable.


Interested?

Please apply with your most recent copy of your CV including a contact number and we will contact you directly to discuss further.

We welcome applications from all suitably qualified people regardless of gender, race, disability, age or sexual orientation. All applications are assessed purely on merit, against the capabilities and competencies required to fulfil the position.

jobDescription: Lead Data Engineer Up to £72,343, up to 27% pension, flexible working and more Are you a strategic leader with a passion for data and modern engineering practices?Can you drive transformational change in a large, diverse data engineering environment?Can you innovate, inspire and promote a modern standards approach, a customer cent...
fullDescription:
Lead Data Engineer Up to £72,343, up to 27% pension, flexible working and more

Are you a strategic leader with a passion for data and modern engineering practices?

Can you drive transformational change in a large, diverse data engineering environment?

Can you innovate, inspire and promote a modern standards approach, a customer centric model and better processes and practice?

And are you ready to be part of an epic digital transformation?

Then click APPLY now, we'd love to hear from you!

DWP Digital With Purpose.

DWP is UK's largest government department. Millions of people use our products and services and we make £billions of payments.

Our DWP Digital teams are transforming these services. We're using the power of technology to make our services more available, more accessible and simpler to use and run. It is a once-in-a-generation digital transformation programme that will change, on an epic scale, how people interact with government.

Data Engineering is a critical part of our digital ambitions. We have an exciting opportunity for a talented and innovative Lead Data Engineer to help us transform data management and data services.

Duties. Work. Projects.

You'll lead our thriving Data & Analytics practice. You'll promote and develop your team, organise events and learning opportunities, and set the direction for our Data community.

You'll drive us to build quality data products and services, in line with industry best practice. You'll provide our strategic vision, championing value creation and modernising data products and service delivery.

You'll have proven experience in a large scale data-driven organisation, leading design, build, test and deployment activities for data services with a focus on self-service and data quality.

You'll be our expert voice on Data Engineering, an ambassador for the power of your practice to shape the best outcomes. You'll provide deep technical expertise to many multi-disciplined teams, building and embedding Data Engineering capability across DWP Digital and wider government.

You'll also join a motivated senior leadership team. Together we'll develop and deliver our data services that work for us and our users.

What skills & experience we are looking for?
  • A strong understanding and application of the most appropriate modern standards and practices for data and software engineering as a service.
  • You have identified opportunities to enhance capability in alignment with business goals through the recognition of new digital technologies.
  • Sound leadership and where they have taken responsibility for coaching and guiding others.
  • Leadership in the delivery of providing technical advice and guidance to suppliers and customers
  • Ideally you will also have experience of larger digital organisation or a digital estate with large scope and breadth

Details. Wages. Perks.

You'll join us in your choice of our easy-to-reach digital hubs in either Blackpool, Sheffield, Leeds or Newcastle Find out more here: https://careers.dwp.gov.uk/our-locations/

Lot of us are working at home at the moment due to Covid-19. We have all the tech and tools we need to work flexibly.

In return for your skills we offer competitive salary up to £77,343 per annum, a brilliant civil service pension, and a generous leave package.

We also have a broad benefits package built around your work-life balance which includes:
  • Flexible working and family friendly policies
  • Volunteering and charitable giving
  • Discounts and savings on shopping, fun days out and more
  • Interest-free loans to buy a bike or a season ticket, so it's even easier for you to get to work and start making a difference
  • Sports and social activities
  • Bring your authentic self to work with 'I can be me in DWP'
  • Learning and progression tailored to your career and ambitions; opportunities to be a coach and mentor

APPLY: For further information and to start an application click apply or contact me / if you'd like chat first.

jobTitle: Data Engineer Team Lead in London  NatWest Group Careers
jobDescription: Join us as a Data Engineer Team Lead  As the Data Engineering Team Lead, you'll have the opportunity to hire and establish a new data engineering function for RBSIYou'll work with the NWG Data and Analytics team and your Data Analysis, Data Science and CRM colleagues to lead the design, build and commission of a new cloud enabled data and analytics platformYou'll apply your proven expertise to lead the desig...
fullDescription:
Join us as a Data Engineer Team Lead

  • As the Data Engineering Team Lead, you'll have the opportunity to hire and establish a new data engineering function for RBSI
  • You'll work with the NWG Data and Analytics team and your Data Analysis, Data Science and CRM colleagues to lead the design, build and commission of a new cloud enabled data and analytics platform
  • You'll apply your proven expertise to lead the design and implementation of a single, central data and analytics platform using an AWS data lake as the backbone, whilst ensuring the design meets the needs of RBSI's local regulators


What you'll do

We'll look to you to lead and inspire a team of data engineers to drive value from data for the customer. You'll be working closely with core technology and architecture teams to deliver strategic data solutions, while driving data engineering strategies to build a scalable data architecture and customer feature rich dataset.

We'll also expect you to be:

  • Driving the automation of data engineering pipelines through the removal of manual stages
  • Developing and sharing your knowledge of the bank's data structures and metrics, advocating change where needed for product development
  • Developing a strategy for streaming data ingestion and transformations
  • Educating and embedding new data techniques into the business through role modelling, training and experiment design oversight
  • Driving Agile and DevOps adoption in the delivery of data engineering


The skills you'll need

To be successful in this role, you'll need to be an expert level programmer and data engineer with a qualification in Computer Science or Software Engineering. You'll also need a strong understanding of data usage and dependencies with wider teams and the end customer, as well as extensive experience in extracting value and features from large scale data.

You'll bring the passion for data engineering, data analysis, data visualisation and data sciences to bring data to life and help RBSI accelerate transformation. It's expected that you'll bring and share your exemplar data engineering and data architecture practices to fast track RBSI's ambition to build trust and confidence in our data and move us towards an agile CI/CD DevOps position.

You'll also demonstrate:

  • Experience of ETL technical design, automated data quality testing, QA and documentation, data warehousing, data modelling and data wrangling
  • Extensive experience using RDMS, ETL pipelines, Python, Hadoop and SQL
  • A good understanding of modern code development practices
  • Good critical thinking and proven problem solving abilities

It would be ideal if you have experience of using Oracle, Unix scripting, Java, cloud, API, NoSQL and Kafka.
If you need any adjustments to support your application, such as information in alternative formats or special requirements to access our buildings, or if you're eligible under the Disability Confident Scheme please contact us and we'll do everything we can to help.

fullDescription:
Lead Configuration and Data Engineer
Airborne ISR - Broughton
The Lead Configuration and Data Engineer role will lead Configuration & Data Management (CM/DM) activities on aircraft modification programmes within Raytheon Airborne ISR, based at Broughton.
Applicants should possess a thorough knowledge and experience of performing CM/DM for complex products. The role includes performing CM/DM, and providing training, guidance and support to programme stakeholders .
The successful candidate will be part of the growing Airborne ISR Team which delivers aviation engineering expertise to both military and civil customers worldwide.

Role Summary
Author, implement and apply CM/DM procedures on programmes as directed by the Configuration & Data Manager.
Expedite CM/DM work including acting as a change specialist, performing CM /DM checks, and document audit prior to release.
Support the configuration, implementation, and use of information systems (e.g. Windchill, Sharepoint) used to manage configuration controlled information.
Provide training, guidance and support to programme stakeholders on the application of CM/DM and use of related information management systems.
Provide CM/DM coaching to more junior members of the team.
Establish CM baselines in accordance with the CM Plan.
Maintain the Configuration Status Account records for legacy and current product data.
Produce CM metrics and status reports.
Identify and coordinate process improvements ensuring the ongoing compliance and effectiveness of CM/DM.
Lead physical and functional configuration audits as directed by the Configuration and Data Manager.
Perform document control and data management including the coordination and release of data, and audit for compliance with customer, security, and programme standards.

Candidate Requirements:
Essential
CMII certification or equivalent industry experience.
Working knowledge of CM Standards.
Experienced in the configuration, implementation, and use of information management systems (e.g. Product Data Management / Product Lifecycle Management).
Experienced in expediting work through CM/DM processes and delivering process and information management system training.
Awareness of aircraft design, test and manufacturing procedures.
Awareness of key disciplines including Engineering, Procurement, Production, and Maintenance.
Able to influence, interface and communicate with multiple levels of management and colleagues throughout the programme.
Pro-active and enthusiastic.
Ability to plan and deliver workload for a small team of CM/DM resources.

Desirable
Experience of the Aircraft Design and Manufacturing industries
Working knowledge of Def Stan 05-57, 05-61, and ISO10007
Experienced with Microsoft office tools.
Strong written and verbal communication skills, including the generation and presentation training, guidance and communications to programme stakeholders and customers.

Eligible for or holder of SC level security clearance (Raytheon will sponsor as required). .

For further details on Raytheon AISR visit - -in-the-uk/airborneisr

About Raytheon UK
With facilities in Broughton, Waddington, Glenrothes, Harlow, Gloucester, Manchester with presence across other customer sites also. Raytheon UK is invested in the British workforce and the development of UK technology. Across the country Raytheon UK employs 1,700 people and supports 8,000 jobs. As a prime contractor and major supplier to the U.K. Ministry of Defence, Raytheon continues to invest in research and development, supporting innovation and technological advances.

Raytheon UK is a landed company, part of the Raytheon Technologies organisation and sits within the Raytheon Intelligence & Space business.

About Raytheon Technologies
Raytheon Technologies Corporation is an aerospace and defence company that provides advanced systems and services for commercial, military and government customers worldwide. It comprises four industry-leading businesses - Collins Aerospace Systems, Pratt & Whitney, Raytheon Intelligence & Space and Raytheon Missiles & Defence. Its 195,000 employees enable the company to operate at the edge of known science as they imagine and deliver solutions that push the boundaries in quantum physics, electric propulsion, directed energy, hypersonics, avionics and cyber security. The company, formed in 2020 through the combination of Raytheon Company and the United Technologies Corporation aerospace businesses, is headquartered in Waltham, Massachusetts.

Raytheon Career Development:

Raytheon has a wealth of resources available to help you develop your career from the moment you join. Activities range from on-line learning modules, to external training and support for taking professional qualifications relevant to your role.

Standard Benefits:

25 days holiday + statutory public holidays

Contributory Pension Scheme (up to 10.5% company contribution)

6 times salary 'Life Assurance'

Flexible Benefits scheme with extensive salary sacrifice scheme's.

Enhanced sick pay scheme

Enhanced Family Friendly Policies, including enhanced Maternity & Shared Parental leave.

37hr working week, with an early finish Friday/9 day fortnight (hours may vary depending on role, job requirement or site specifics arrangements).

Flexible working arrangements can be considered wherever we can (depending on the role) so please enquire or highlight any request to our Recruitment team to explore flexible working possibilities .

Diversity:

Diversity is a core business imperative at Raytheon. We are an equal opportunity employer that promotes inclusiveness and always employs the best professionals for the job. Having a diverse workforce allows Raytheon to draw upon a range of different ideas and experiences which supports growing our business and creates an environment where everyone has an equal opportunity for success. Raytheon UK pro-actively encourages diversity of ideas, thoughts, and networking opportunities and has created Employee Resource Groups (ERGs) including Raytheon Women's Network, YesNet (Young Employees Success Network), Raytheon Reservist Network (RaRe), Raytheon Alliance for Diverse Abilities (RADA) and all work together with our Diversity & Inclusion council, and all Raytheon employees are welcome to participate regardless of their background.

As a proud contributor to the HM Armed Forces, Raytheon UK signed the HM Armed Forces covenant in 2014. Due to the varied activities and support to our Armed Forces & Reservists,

Raytheon UK has since been awarded the pre

jobTitle: Data Engineer - London- Asset Management  Systematic Trading
jobDescription: Summary: A globally leading, systematic, quant trading firm are looking for a Data Engineer to join their technical team in London. The successful Data Engineer will be utilising both analytical and technical skillsets, building data pipelines in the Python and PyData stack, and working closely with analysts and developers in London to process multiple terabytes of data from various structured  and unstructured sou...
fullDescription:
Summary:

A globally leading, systematic, quant trading firm are looking for a Data Engineer to join their technical team in London.

The successful Data Engineer will be utilising both analytical and technical skillsets, building data pipelines in the Python and PyData stack, and working closely with analysts and developers in London to process multiple terabytes of data from various structured and unstructured sources. This is a fast-moving technical team working with the latest data engineering stack, including Kafka, ElasticSearch, Scala/Spark.

Requirements:
  • STEM degree
  • Solid understanding of Computer Science fundamentals, data structures and algorithms
  • Programming skills in any OO language, and data engineering experience with Python and SQL
  • Desire to work in London

Benefits:
  • Fast-moving, central London-based team
  • Cutting-edge technical skillset
  • Highly competitive salary and buy-side bonus structure


Contact
If you're interested in the data engineering role in London, please get in touch:

Rosie Griggs

jobDescription: Senior Data EngineerNottingham PermanentThe Senior Data Engineer will be instrumental in helping the organisation to achieve its Agile Transformational goals. Responsible for embedding an Agile culture, methodology, tools and techniques in order to help teams keep a delivery and learning cadence  that helps to remain focused on delivering value against the organisational outcomes, while remaining crea...
fullDescription:
Senior Data Engineer
Nottingham
Permanent

The Senior Data Engineer will be instrumental in helping the organisation to achieve its Agile Transformational goals. Responsible for embedding an Agile culture, methodology, tools and techniques in order to help teams keep a delivery and learning cadence that helps to remain focused on delivering value against the organisational outcomes, while remaining creative and dynamic.
Responsible for guiding teams through the implementation process, encouraging colleagues and leadership to embrace the Agile mind-set and associated methodologies.

Key Responsibilities:

• Develop React/Node applications to integrate AI and ML models with business processes
• Build scalable application infrastructure within Microsoft Azure using approaches such as containerisation
• Build DevOps pipelines within Azure to deliver applications and infrastructure through CI/CD
• With a deep understanding of data science methodologies, Support Data Scientists in the development and industrialisation of AI and Machine learning products
• Design, build, deliver and analyse SQL and NoSQL databases and pipelines
• Work closely with senior stakeholders to define requirements and build agile product backlogs
• Coach and support colleagues.
A bit about you:

• MSc or PhD level degree in Data Science, Data Engineering, Software Engineering or equivalent.
• A history of delivering React/Node applications within a technical environment. Experience developing and delivering big data applications within Microsoft Azure using languages such as Python, Scala and SQL.
• Skilled in agile management methodologies
• Experience working within a large-scale retail organisation is advantageous
A bit about the team:

The Data Science and Engineering Team, shortlisted for the ‘Best Analytics Team’ DataIQ Award 2019, is an industry leading analytics team within the Walgreens Boots Alliance group. Our team provides globally scalable analytics solutions for complex and diverse business problems and supports data-driven decision making across our global businesses
Work right at the heart of the business and join us on the exciting journey we’re on.

Be involved in a variety of projects – working with great people and brilliant brands. Fast paced and extremely passionate, our teams drive our success and keep our customers coming back for more, through inspiring and innovative communications. Promoting our latest products, delivering great offers that make our customers feel good and inspiring our colleagues.

Boots UK is part of the Retail Pharmacy International Division of Walgreens Boots Alliance and is the UKs leading pharmacy-led health and beauty retailer. With over 2500 stores in the UK our purpose is to help our customers look and feel better than they ever thought possible. You can learn more by visiting boots.jobs.

What we can offer you:
• 25 days annual leave, plus statutory bank holidays & option to buy an additional 5 days annual leave
• Annual discretionary bonus plan
• Market leading staff discount scheme including Boots Opticians - frames and contact lenses
• Competitive company pension scheme
• Flexible benefits scheme available ranging from private medical insurance, cycle to work scheme and many more
• Onsite Staff Shop, Opticians, Gym, Costa, Canteen and Dry Cleaning
• Boots Benevolent Fund - a registered charity that can offer support to eligible current and former colleagues in the UK, as well as their immediate relatives and dependants, at times of financial hardship
Diversity and inclusion is at the centre of everything we do. We are an equal opportunity employer committed to a diverse and inclusive workforce. We offer a number of flexible working options to suit our colleagues’ needs including job share and part time working. Our website shows examples of colleagues enjoying different working patterns. If this interests you, please talk to us about it.

If you would like to become part of our story and make a difference – click apply and our recruitment partners will be in touch!
If you have any questions or queries regarding this vacancy please contact .Please click the link below or copy and paste it into your browser for a peek into our fantastic Support Office:

>>

They are seeking a skilled Data Engineer to join their data platform  team.This role will see the successful applicant build their next-gen data platform for managing their data flow to their systematic trading arm. You will get to work with the latest t...
fullDescription:
A global leading Hedge Fund that have some of the greatest Portfolio Managers, Quantitative Professionals and Technologists are growing due to their consistently strong performances. They are seeking a skilled Data Engineer to join their data platform team.

This role will see the successful applicant build their next-gen data platform for managing their data flow to their systematic trading arm. You will get to work with the latest technologies such as Airflow, Luigi, Oozie and Spark. You must have expertise in Python, SQL, Spark and a good understanding of cloud technologies (AWS).

Due to Covid-19, they expect to complete the full interview process over WebEx and they will on-board candidates virtually for the foreseeable future.

Key Requirements:
  • Expert Python programming knowledge (at least 4 years experience)
  • A computer science degree
  • Strong analytical skills
  • Experience with either Spark/Hive/Hadoop
  • Experience with orchestration pipelines like Airflow/Luigi/Oozie/Nifi
  • AWS experience
  • Experienced with building analytical systems for data scientists

* You must be eligible to work in the UK without requiring sponsorship

Not quite right for you? Refer someone you know and get £250 when they complete a face-to-face or video interview through Referment. Find out more at Referment.com

fullDescription:
Summary:

A sponsor of London's PyData and ML meetups is looking to hire a Python / Data Engineer to join their core team in London. The successful Data Engineer will be building ETL data pipelines in Python and Kafka on Linux platforms, and will be working with a wide range of opensource frameworks and tools (NumPy/SciPy/Pandas). Joining a collaborative and remote team, the successful Data Engineer will be working on the central data platform, bringing together multiple sources of unstructured and structured data for the entire engineering team to access.

Requirements:
  • BSc/MSc STEM subject
  • Commercial experience working in Python, the PyData stack and SQL
  • Interest in open source software

Benefits:
  • Leading London salary structure
  • Remote working for the foreseeable future (and commitments to maintain remote working options post Covid-19)
  • Work in an exciting hedge fund environment, no financial experience needed


Contact
If you're interested in Data or Python engineering roles in London, please get in touch!

jobDescription: Lead Data Engineer Up to £72,343, up to 27% pension, flexible working and more Are you a strategic leader with a passion for data and modern engineering practices?Can you drive transformational change in a large, diverse data engineering environment?Can you innovate, inspire and promote a modern standards approach, a customer cent...
fullDescription:
Lead Data Engineer Up to £72,343, up to 27% pension, flexible working and more

Are you a strategic leader with a passion for data and modern engineering practices?

Can you drive transformational change in a large, diverse data engineering environment?

Can you innovate, inspire and promote a modern standards approach, a customer centric model and better processes and practice?

And are you ready to be part of an epic digital transformation?

Then click APPLY now, we'd love to hear from you!

DWP Digital With Purpose.

DWP is UK's largest government department. Millions of people use our products and services and we make £billions of payments.

Our DWP Digital teams are transforming these services. We're using the power of technology to make our services more available, more accessible and simpler to use and run. It is a once-in-a-generation digital transformation programme that will change, on an epic scale, how people interact with government.

Data Engineering is a critical part of our digital ambitions. We have an exciting opportunity for a talented and innovative Lead Data Engineer to help us transform data management and data services.

Duties. Work. Projects.

You'll lead our thriving Data & Analytics practice. You'll promote and develop your team, organise events and learning opportunities, and set the direction for our Data community.

You'll drive us to build quality data products and services, in line with industry best practice. You'll provide our strategic vision, championing value creation and modernising data products and service delivery.

You'll have proven experience in a large scale data-driven organisation, leading design, build, test and deployment activities for data services with a focus on self-service and data quality.

You'll be our expert voice on Data Engineering, an ambassador for the power of your practice to shape the best outcomes. You'll provide deep technical expertise to many multi-disciplined teams, building and embedding Data Engineering capability across DWP Digital and wider government.

You'll also join a motivated senior leadership team. Together we'll develop and deliver our data services that work for us and our users.

What skills & experience we are looking for?
  • A strong understanding and application of the most appropriate modern standards and practices for data and software engineering as a service.
  • You have identified opportunities to enhance capability in alignment with business goals through the recognition of new digital technologies.
  • Sound leadership and where they have taken responsibility for coaching and guiding others.
  • Leadership in the delivery of providing technical advice and guidance to suppliers and customers
  • Ideally you will also have experience of larger digital organisation or a digital estate with large scope and breadth

Details. Wages. Perks.

You'll join us in your choice of our easy-to-reach digital hubs in either Blackpool, Sheffield, Leeds or Newcastle Find out more here: https://careers.dwp.gov.uk/our-locations/

Lot of us are working at home at the moment due to Covid-19. We have all the tech and tools we need to work flexibly.

In return for your skills we offer competitive salary up to £77,343 per annum, a brilliant civil service pension, and a generous leave package.

We also have a broad benefits package built around your work-life balance which includes:
  • Flexible working and family friendly policies
  • Volunteering and charitable giving
  • Discounts and savings on shopping, fun days out and more
  • Interest-free loans to buy a bike or a season ticket, so it's even easier for you to get to work and start making a difference
  • Sports and social activities
  • Bring your authentic self to work with 'I can be me in DWP'
  • Learning and progression tailored to your career and ambitions; opportunities to be a coach and mentor

APPLY: For further information and to start an application click apply or contact me / if you'd like chat first.

jobDescription: Senior Data Engineer Band 7 Salary  London: £45,780 to £51,393 pa (Inclusive of HCAS) Leeds: £38,890 - £44,503 pa Job Summary NHS Resolution has put Business Intelligence at the heart of its strategy and this has led to a transfo...
fullDescription:
Senior Data Engineer

Band 7

Salary

London: £45,780 to £51,393 pa (Inclusive of HCAS)

Leeds: £38,890 - £44,503 pa

Job Summary

NHS Resolution has put Business Intelligence at the heart of its strategy and this has led to a transformation of the Business Intelligence department over the last year. We currently have a full-time, permanent vacancy for a Senior Data Engineer to help us continue that journey.

We have a number of complex data sets which are key to managing our £2.6bn annual budget and for feeding back learnings into the wider health system. We are currently developing our SQL data warehouse (on prem) but with a planned transition to cloud, are undergoing a major core system review and also exploring a number of AI projects.

The current day to day role involves managing and developing our BI Systems and technologies including SQL, SSIS, SSRS and Power BI. This includes providing expert resourcing to other BI teams, ensuring integrity of the organisation’s data and undertaking development and project work to support our stakeholders.

The post holder will be expected to educated to Masters Level Degree (or equivalent relevant experience) and to have a good A level grade in Maths; advanced level of Microsoft Excel; intermediate level of VBA, SQL coding and SSRS.

Shortlisted candidates will be invited to progress through a telephone interview selection process to assess competencies required by the role. The selection process may be used to further shortlist applicants for2nd and final round ofinterviews.

First shortlisting for telephone interviews - 18th December 2020

Telephone interviews for 2nd round - 22nd/23rd December 2020

Final Interview Date: 11th - 18th January 2021

Closing date: 16/12/2020

Previous applicants need not toapply.

jobDescription: As a Data Engineer in the Data and Analytics team, you will be working on a global initiative to take our data platforms and practice to the next level. Using the latest technologies and techniques, you will be developing analytic reporting solutions as part of an agile team for our trading businesses. The platform is one year old and this is an opportunity to contribute to the evolution of the platform. We are looking fo...
fullDescription:
As a Data Engineer in the Data and Analytics team, you will be working on a global initiative to take our data platforms and practice to the next level.

Using the latest technologies and techniques, you will be developing analytic reporting solutions as part of an agile team for our trading businesses. The platform is one year old and this is an opportunity to contribute to the evolution of the platform.

We are looking for an experienced data engineer. Experience in Spark and building data pipelines is a must. Containerization/Kubernetes experience is highly desirable, as is experience in application monitoring solutions such as Grafana/Prometheus.

This is a rapidly evolving area and we want people who will bring a learning mindset. Your success will be enabled by the ability to communicate effectively with a diverse set of stakeholders. If you can code, love data and want to work on innovative projects, then apply now!

The Corporate Operations Group (COG) brings together specialist support services including workplace, human resources, market operations and technology. COG's purpose is to drive operational excellence through business-aligned services with a focus on quality, cost and risk. COG comprises the following divisions: Business Improvement and Strategy, Business Services, Human Resources, Market Operations, and Technology.

Find out more about Macquarie at

Macquarie understands the importance of diversity and inclusion - our long history of success has come from being different. At Macquarie we value the innovation and creativity that diversity of thought brings. The one thing we all have in common is our focus on high performance. If you're capable, motivated and can deliver, we want you on our team.

Macquarie is an equal opportunities employer and does not discriminate on the grounds of age, disability, sex, sexual orientation, gender reassignment, gender identity, marriage, civil partnership, pregnancy, maternity, race (including colour and ethnic or national origins), religion or belief.

We're the only global recruitment agency dedicated solely to AWS. Since June 2018, we've more than 1,600 AWS professionals across the world wit...
fullDescription:
Role: Senior Data Engineer

Salary: £55,000 - £65,000 per annum

Location: Holborn + remote

Benefits: To be dscussed over the phone (Long list)

Here at Jefferson Frank,we're dedicated to AWS recruitment-it's all we do.

We're the only global recruitment agency dedicated solely to AWS. Since June 2018, we've more than 1,600 AWS professionals across the world with great jobs working with AWS partners, ISVs and end users. No matter where you are in your career, or where you are in the country, we're in your corner making sure you land the right job with the right terms.

At Jefferson Frank we have an amazing opportunity to join one of the UK's leading IT consultancies to help create a brand-new engineering organisation. Perhaps you know what great engineering culture looks like, or you have an entrepreneurial side as well as outstanding coding skills? Whatever your aspirations, my client are striving to create the best engineering consultancy in the UK and are looking for brilliant engineers to be part of the journey.

They've been officially voted a "Great Place to Work" for five years in a row now. A big reason for this is that they have fostered an incredible environment where regular social events, inclusivity and an ego-free culture is embedded within the business.

They're not interested in cutting corners and believe in helping their clients to make the right choice for the long-term. They draw on their reputation for outstanding delivery to allow their engineers to do the right thing for their clients, and not necessarily the easy thing. Innovation is in the company's DNA, and encourage their engineers and consultants to work together to rethink conventional wisdom on how problems should be solved.

Here's what you will do (Not all of it, but some of the important stuff!)

  • Solve the problems others cannot
  • Spend a day a week working on a combination of internal products and your own development
  • Create data platforms based around modern open source products and cloud-native technologies:
    • AWS, Azure and Google Cloud
    • Python
    • Kafka / NiFi / Flume
    • DB technologies: SQL Server / PosteSQL / MySQL
    • Hive/Spark/Impala
    • Dataiku
    • Terraform
    • Kubernetes

Requirements

The essentials?

  • Experiece building data platforms using either cloud native products or commercial data analytics / data warehouse software
  • Working knowledge of data pipelines & data transformation processes
  • Experience creating and/or maintaining production software delivery pipelines using common CI/CD tools (e.g. Jenkins,GoCD,CircleCI)
    • Demonstrable experience in automating operations tasks with one or more scripting languages
    • Experience working with one or more of the main cloud providers (AWS, Azure or Google)
    • Have a drive for self-improvement and learning, including learning new programming languages
    • Approach solving problems pragmatically
    • Experience of Hadoop big data platforms (either Cloudera / Hortonworks or cloud native equivalents)
    • Experience with data reporting and visualisation tools (PowerBI, Tableau, Qlik)
    • Experience productionising machine learning algorithms
    • Experience with Infrastructure as Code (e.g. Terraform, Cloudformation)
    • Experience supporting and operating production systems
    • Familiarity with configuration management tooling (e.g. Ansible)

    It would be great if you had these desirable skills

    • Experience of Hadoop big data platforms (either Cloudera / Hortonworks or cloud native equivalents)
    • Experience with data reporting and visualisation tools (PowerBI, Tableau, Qlik)
    • Experience productionising machine learning algorithms
    • Experience with Infrastructure as Code (e.g. Terraform, Cloudformation)
    • Experience supporting and operating production systems
    • Familiarity with configuration management tooling (e.g. Ansible)

To find out more, don't hesitate and reach out now to Elliott Collins by email - or by phone on . We can run through the role in detail and discuss your ideals further.

If however this is not exactly what you're looking for, feel free to get in touch and we can talk about how we'll find the perfect opportunity for you.

jobDescription: Skipton Building Society has an exciting opportunityfor a Data professional to join its Data and Information Services team who areresponsible for data growth and innovation. We’re a specialised team thatthinks outside the box and help to design, develop, build and support data andanalytics solutions. Our role is to keep the business lean and agile and toensure that data transferred between internal systems and e...
fullDescription:
Skipton Building Society has an exciting opportunity
for a Data professional to join its Data and Information Services team who are
responsible for data growth and innovation. We’re a specialised team that
thinks outside the box and help to design, develop, build and support data and
analytics solutions. Our role is to keep the business lean and agile and to
ensure that data transferred between internal systems and external 3rd parties,
is fit for purpose. The role is currently fully remote and has a competitive
salary for the right candidate.

What You'll Be Doing

We’re committed to our investment in Data Strategy,
having moved from an on-premise platform to new Data Architecture using
cloud-based technologies. Our new Enterprise Data Warehouse utilises the
Microsoft Azure technology stack include Data Lake, Delta Lake, Synapse etc. We
are specifically looking for an individual who can bring their already acquired
skills in this area to our team to support the design and implementation of our
cloud-based platform. You’ll work collaboratively with other Data
Engineers and Analysts, as well as colleagues from across the organisation to
deliver trusted solutions that meet the Society’s information needs. As a data
expert you’ll play a key role in the Society change hubs and play a pro-active
role in identifying process improvements and generating new ideas that will
maximise the val
ue of data for the Society.

What You'll Bring

To be successful, you’ll need SQL development
experience and good knowledge of developing a data warehouse. You’ll be
creative, respond well to challenges on a day-to-day basis and be comfortable
working with ambiguity. We’re looking for someone who has excellent
problem-solving skills, is logical, and has a desire to deliver a great service
to our stakeholders, whilst looking to develop themselves.

Experience will include: - Design
& Architecture of Azure Data solutions - Knowledge
of data modelling principles, including data lakes and warehousing tools - Implementation
of end-to-end DWH and ETL pipeline solutions - Maintenance
and optimisation of Data Warehouse solutions to maximise performance - Data
analysis (any exposure to analytical tools would be advantageous) - Testing
and software release management - Experience
in business process and requirements analysis - Experience
of full life-cycle software development - Understanding
of Agile methodologies - Experience
working with CI/CD pipelines

Technology: - Microsoft
BI Stack (SSIS, SSAS and SSRS) - Microsoft
Azure - Data Lake, Data Factory and Azure Synapse - Analytical
Tooling – Azure ML, DataBricks

Benefits

- Pension Contribution Scheme - Life Assurance Scheme and Private Medical Insurance - Generous holiday entitlement - Flexible working patterns - Health cash plan - Employee Assistance Programme And many more…

About Us

At Skipton Building Society, we’re not just another
Financial Services Company. We’re a mutual organisation, which means we’re
owned by our members and believe in putting them at the heart of everything we
do. The same goes for our people. We can only be
successful as a business if we have great people, and we believe in treating
people as individuals. Our core values are Trust, Ownership and One Team, which

reflect the attitudes and way of working everyone here displays on a daily
basis. If you’re up for the challenge, and you want to
have a real say in how things are being done at Skipton Building Society, we
want to hear from you. Apply today! More information on our benefits can be
found here

jobDescription: Role: Senior Data Engineer  Salary: £55,000 - £85,000 per annum Location: Holborn + remote  Benefits: To be dscussed over the phone (Long list) Here at Jefferson Frank,we're dedicated to AWS recruitment-it's all we do. We're the only global recruitment agency dedicated solely to AWS. Since June 2018, we've more than 1,600 AWS professionals across the world wit...
fullDescription:
Role: Senior Data Engineer

Salary: £55,000 - £85,000 per annum

Location: Holborn + remote

Benefits: To be dscussed over the phone (Long list)

Here at Jefferson Frank,we're dedicated to AWS recruitment-it's all we do.

We're the only global recruitment agency dedicated solely to AWS. Since June 2018, we've more than 1,600 AWS professionals across the world with great jobs working with AWS partners, ISVs and end users. No matter where you are in your career, or where you are in the country, we're in your corner making sure you land the right job with the right terms.

At Jefferson Frank we have an amazing opportunity to join one of the UK's leading IT consultancies to help create a brand-new engineering organisation. Perhaps you know what great engineering culture looks like, or you have an entrepreneurial side as well as outstanding coding skills? Whatever your aspirations, my client are striving to create the best engineering consultancy in the UK and are looking for brilliant engineers to be part of the journey.

They've been officially voted a "Great Place to Work" for five years in a row now. A big reason for this is that they have fostered an incredible environment where regular social events, inclusivity and an ego-free culture is embedded within the business.

They're not interested in cutting corners and believe in helping their clients to make the right choice for the long-term. They draw on their reputation for outstanding delivery to allow their engineers to do the right thing for their clients, and not necessarily the easy thing. Innovation is in the company's DNA, and encourage their engineers and consultants to work together to rethink conventional wisdom on how problems should be solved.

Here's what you will do (Not all of it, but some of the important stuff!)

  • Solve the problems others cannot
  • Spend a day a week working on a combination of internal products and your own development
  • Create data platforms based around modern open source products and cloud-native technologies:
    • AWS, Azure and Google Cloud
    • Python
    • Kafka / NiFi / Flume
    • DB technologies: SQL Server / PosteSQL / MySQL
    • Hive/Spark/Impala
    • Dataiku
    • Terraform
    • Kubernetes

Requirements

The essentials?

  • Experiece building data platforms using either cloud native products or commercial data analytics / data warehouse software
  • Working knowledge of data pipelines & data transformation processes
  • Experience creating and/or maintaining production software delivery pipelines using common CI/CD tools (e.g. Jenkins,GoCD,CircleCI)
    • Demonstrable experience in automating operations tasks with one or more scripting languages
    • Experience working with one or more of the main cloud providers (AWS, Azure or Google)
    • Have a drive for self-improvement and learning, including learning new programming languages
    • Approach solving problems pragmatically
    • Experience of Hadoop big data platforms (either Cloudera / Hortonworks or cloud native equivalents)
    • Experience with data reporting and visualisation tools (PowerBI, Tableau, Qlik)
    • Experience productionising machine learning algorithms
    • Experience with Infrastructure as Code (e.g. Terraform, Cloudformation)
    • Experience supporting and operating production systems
    • Familiarity with configuration management tooling (e.g. Ansible)

    It would be great if you had these desirable skills

    • Experience of Hadoop big data platforms (either Cloudera / Hortonworks or cloud native equivalents)
    • Experience with data reporting and visualisation tools (PowerBI, Tableau, Qlik)
    • Experience productionising machine learning algorithms
    • Experience with Infrastructure as Code (e.g. Terraform, Cloudformation)
    • Experience supporting and operating production systems
    • Familiarity with configuration management tooling (e.g. Ansible)

To find out more, don't hesitate and reach out now to Elliott Collins by email - or by phone on . We can run through the role in detail and discuss your ideals further.

If however this is not exactly what you're looking for, feel free to get in touch and we can talk about how we'll find the perfect opportunity for you.

THE COMPANY

Exciting opportunity to join one of the leading health care insurance providers in their widely established Data & Tech team focusing on everything BI related and working with exciting teams within Data Engineers and Data Science & AI.

THE ROLE

In this role you will be:

  • Design and apply data cleansing and data standardisation rules
  • Integrate data from multiple sources into a central data warehouse with a logical data model
  • Contribute to the design, development, testing and performance in production of the data-centric software
  • Liaise with the Data Scientists, Architects, software developers, and business experts to understand how data needs to be converted, loaded, processed and presented

SKILLS & EXPERIENCE

  • Technical: Strong development skills - experience using SQL, Big Data experience (Spark, Hadoop Suite)
  • Awareness of Data Management best practice, including Data Lifecycle Management
  • Passion for learning new tools, languages and frameworks

BENEFITS

  • Competitive Salary
  • Competitive Bonus
  • Remote working

HOW TO APPLY

Please register your interest by sending your CV to Daniel Moss via the Apply link on this page

fullDescription:
Our Client is a FinTech start up focussed on the non-bank lending sector. They work in partnerships with established non-bank lenders offering them access to capital and technology to scale their businessesThe role will involve working closely with the data science team and the founder in the build out of a new data product. The candidate will build on work that has already been done in the areas of data collection, cleansing and storage, bringing a full time focus to this area as it scales with the new product launch.

Key Requirements:
  • A Computer Sciences degree or Integrated Masters from a leading university.
  • Must have coding experience in Python, Java and Angular.
  • Experience in machine learning a positive but not an absolute requirement.
  • Beyond the technical skills an interest in finance and a desire to learn more about finance is essential for the role.

 The role offers a number of career paths both within the core business and in the subsidiary lending businesses.

My client has an exciting opportunity fora driven, focused and intelligent individual, who is lookin for a steppingstone into the Data Analytics world.

What You Will Be Doing

  • Developing internal metrics and dashboards to provide insights and enable decision-making

What You Will Have

  • Basic statistics knowledge, and the ability to apply it within SQL and Python

  • Strong communication skills with the ability to explain technical and statistical concepts in a simple way that is easy to understand
  • The curiosity to learn and ask questions
  • Passionate about solving problems and helping others
  • Experience in using cloud platforms e.g. AWS, Azure or Google

fullDescription:
Title: Data Engineer

Our client is currently looking for a Data Engineer to play a vital role in the continual development of our digital transformation strategy and earth science analytics. Candidates must have Python, R and SQL. We expect candidates will have a Computer Science, Machine Learning or Data Science degree with industry experience in data analytics.

Main Responsibilities of the Date Engineer:

  • Developing and implementing technologies and efficient workflows
  • Identify, extract, transform, load, manipulate, manage, explore, analyse, report, and visualise data
  • Essential criteria:
    • Python
    • Databases and SQL
    • Data loading and ETL

Person Specification & Key Requirements:

  • Educated to a degree level in either computer science, data science or similar.
  • Experienced at working with data, data processes, software and databases
  • Advanced problem-solving skills, especially focussed on finding new solutions to data identification, ingestion, consistency, loading, and output problems
  • Active interest in the latest technology and open source trends
  • Advanced skills in Python or similar general purpose programming and scripting languages?

ACS are recruiting for a Data Engineer If you feel that you have the skills and experience required in this advertisement to be a Data Engineer please submit your CV including an outline of your experience as a Data Engineer It is always a good idea to include a covering letter outlining your experience as a Data Engineer with your application as this will enhance your chances of selection and improve your prospects of landing the Data Engineer role you desire.

This role provides the opportunity get hands on with a variety of technologies on a greenfield project building out the company's first data solution. THE COMPANY: This role is with an et...
fullDescription:
SENIOR DATA ENGINEER

£70,000 - £80,000

LONDON

An opportunity for a Senior Data Engineer to be the tech expert in an growing, ethical start up. This role provides the opportunity get hands on with a variety of technologies on a greenfield project building out the company's first data solution.

THE COMPANY:

This role is with an ethical company, founded by members of the NHS and is focused on wellness and health. They have an engineering team who are working to build out a data platform from the ground up for data ingestion and data warehousing.

THE ROLE:

The engineering team need a knowledgeable tech expert with experience in Python, AWS, Airflow and BI technologies to lead the project.

In particular, this role will involve:

  • End to end data engineering processing.
  • Defining the team's tech stack.
  • Architecting, building, and developing the data platform.
  • Data pipelining and programming in Python.
  • Analytics data modelling.

YOUR SKILLS & EXPERIENCE:

  • Relevant tech stack including Python, AWS, Airflow, Stitch, Looker & BI tools.
  • Knowledge and experience of Mongo DB for the existing database.
  • Senior data engineer experience.
  • Good business experience.

THE BENEFITS:

The selected candidate will receive a salary between £70,000 - £80,000 depending on their experience and requirements.

HOW TO APPLY:

Please register your interest by sending your CV to Holly Neeves via the Apply link on this page.

jobDescription: Data Engineer | Azure | SQL | Python | Databricks | £55,000-£65,000 Despite the upset to the health and fitness industry over the past year, this client are extremely well backed and have one of the biggest footprints in the industry Europe-wide, having completed a number of successful acquisitions during 2020.  This businesses attention is now on their data function, primarily in the scaling up of th...
fullDescription:
Data Engineer | Azure | SQL | Python | Databricks | £55,000-£65,000

Despite the upset to the health and fitness industry over the past year, this client are extremely well backed and have one of the biggest footprints in the industry Europe-wide, having completed a number of successful acquisitions during 2020.

This businesses attention is now on their data function, primarily in the scaling up of their data engineering team. This role is a fantastic opportunity for a mid-level data engineer who has working on the Azure stack previously, and will have two main objectives as the data team grows.

You will come on board to work closely with their established data science function, to deploy machine learning models, and onboard new data sets to allow for the best business insights to be gained.

You will also get heavily involved in the roll out of their new unified data platform, and will provide fantastic mentoring opportunities whilst working with some of the UK's best data platform architects.

This role is best suited to a mid-level data engineer, with proven commercial experience in:

  • Azure
  • Databricks
  • SQL
  • ADLS
  • Python

Contact Aoibheann Doherty on LinkedIn for more information about this role and the client, and please apply now for interviews beginning in the first week of January.

Data Engineer | Azure | SQL | Python | Databricks

fullDescription:
My client’s Consulting Group is one of the largest independent research advisors in the world, working in partnership with the UK and Europe’s leading developers, investors, asset managers and governments.

They have a fantastic opportunity for a Jnr Data Engineer , you must a Computer Science (or similar ) degree and interest in database development, business intelligence or integration development..

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES INCLUDE:

Developing and maintaining data pipeline infrastructure.

Building bespoke tools and integrations to enhance our internal capabilities.

Contributing to the planned roadmap for system changes and improvements.

Developing and maintaining BI solutions.

This is a unique opportunity to develop your technical skills, analytical techniques and commercial knowledge in a single team. In this role you will be making a meaningful impact, and see your insights regularly contribute to the success of the group.

CORE SKILLS, KNOWLEDGE AND EXPERIENCE

A degree in Computer Science or related field, or experience in database development, business intelligence or integration development.

Solid understanding of SQL data transformation and manipulation techniques. E.g. joins, aggregation, filtering, pivoting.

Solid understanding of core programming concepts. E.g. variables, conditions, loops.

Experience in, or comfortable with, applying knowledge in different programming languages.

Strong Microsoft Excel skills.

jobDescription: Senior Data EngineerCentral London£78,000This is a specialist data engineering role working on a greenfield project for a cutting-edge fintech organisation.This role will allow you to express your knowledge and experience of working on a big data platform and building it from scratch. The role will require engineering expertise as well as giving you e...
fullDescription:
Senior Data Engineer
Central London
£78,000

This is a specialist data engineering role working on a greenfield project for a cutting-edge fintech organisation.

This role will allow you to express your knowledge and experience of working on a big data platform and building it from scratch. The role will require engineering expertise as well as giving you expose to data architecture. You will take ownership of the project and display technical leadership.


THE COMPANY:

The company is a well-established fintech within the credit card industry. They have a range of their own-brand products, but also offer credit cards working to several high-end retailers. They are a very data-driven organisation with a flat structure meaning they are very autonomous.


THE ROLE:

The role is very hands on, allowing you to express your innovative ability. You will work alongside other more junior engineers, helping to guide them to build a more robust data platform. It is a senior position meaning you will be at the forefront of decision-making.

Albeit a hand on role, you will be introducing new technologies as the team are wanting to move towards real-time data analytics. It would also be beneficial if you have worked from POC to implementing a love platform.


YOUR SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE:

  • Practical experience programming in Scala
  • Exposure working with Spark and Kafka (other big data tools would be great too)
  • Experience working with cloud techs (AWS)
  • Previous experience using ETL tools


HOW TO APPLY:

Please register your interest by sending your CV to Henry Rodrigues. Alternatively click on the 'Apply' link on this page.

They require a senior data engineer to help build out their data platform to ingest large amounts of customer data. THE COMPANY This company are ...
fullDescription:
SENIOR DATA ENGINEER

LONDON (REMOTE WORKING)

UP TO £70,000

Harnham are partnered with an international media company that is looking to scale out their data engineering team. They require a senior data engineer to help build out their data platform to ingest large amounts of customer data.

THE COMPANY

This company are a world-leading radio business, owning a number of household stations. They are a dynamic team that is already succeeding. The team consisting of data engineers, BI and data scientists is responsible for generating billions of pounds in revenue. They are looking for a senior data engineer to go in and lead a data engineering team of five, building out a customer data platform.

THE ROLE

- You will be using a DAX platform, ensuring events coming from a programmatic system are optimised.

- You will have control over the data products that are going out to market, by modelling data lakes.

- You will be in control of content recommendations based on the customer data.

- You will be coding an AWS platform in Python.

YOUR SKILLS AND EXPERIENCES

- An expert Python programmer

- Highly experienced using AWS

- Have used Kafka to stream live data into a Snowflake warehouse

- You will be dynamic with a desire to manage a squad of data engineers

HOW TO APPLY

Please register your interest by sending you CV to Callum Castling via the apply link on this page.
