fullDescription:
BI DATA ENGINEER

£70,000 - £85,000 + 10% BONUS

LONDON

THE COMPANY:

This is a world-renowned insurance business with a range of departments. They've recently been through a transformation to use data more in the business and are looking to bring on a Data Engineer to focus on either the predictive modelling or pricing side.

THE ROLE:

As a Data Engineer, your responsibilities will include:

  • Sit alongside the other data engineers in the team and digging into lots of messy databases and building an enterprise wide data warehouse for the rest of the business to access
  • Work with a range of data sources, transforming from a manual to automated system using SQL
  • Working with PySpark
  • Developing tools for the pricing and actuarial teams to use

YOUR SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE:

The successful Senior Data Engineer will have the following skills and experience:

  • A strong background within insurance and experience on projects relating to pricing or modelling
  • Excellent SQL experience for the building of databases and manipulation of data
  • Ideally Python scripting experience for automating processes or building data pipelines
  • Experience with pricing or actuarial data would be useful
  • Excellent communication skills

HOW TO APPLY:

Please register your interest by sending your CV to Ria Verma via the Apply link on this page.

jobDescription: Data Engineer - London  Location: Southbank, London with opportunity for some remote working Basic salary: £50,000 to £60,000 doe Benefits: Private healthcare, pension scheme, annual leave rising rapidly with service, Company bonus scheme up to 10% of salary, additional leave for personal development The company: ...
fullDescription:
Data Engineer - London

Location: Southbank, London with opportunity for some remote working

Basic salary: £50,000 to £60,000 doe

Benefits: Private healthcare, pension scheme, annual leave rising rapidly with service, Company bonus scheme up to 10% of salary, additional leave for personal development

The company:

Newcross Healthcare's journey began in 1996, since then we have grown to over 60 branches, innovated and developed our own tech and evolved with the times whilst never compromising on quality, now, we are one of the UK's most successful healthcare staffing providers, leading the way within our sector!

We're undergoing a fundamental change in the way that we conduct our business, putting User Experience at the heart of our decision making. We firmly believe that great user experience is great for business.

The role:

We're a small, agile team within a profitable, well-established UK business. You'll be an important member of the team taking the company to the next level and help us to build the worlds leading nurse resource Management platform. You'll be reporting to the CTO and working closely with our development team on a range of exciting projects.

The key focus of the role will be to lead the data analysis and reporting across the business, liaising with different departments across the organisation to ensure business requirements are met. You will work to agile methodologies and drive technical direction in projects, ensuring they meet scalability, robustness and security requirements.


You...

To be successful within this role you will need:

  • Strong knowledge and experience with Elastic stack best practices.
  • Experience of creating advanced searches, visualisations and dashboards
  • Able to create advanced queries using Elasticsearch API
  • Experience of data extraction and aggregation from different sources
  • Strong team collaboration and communication skills
  • Experience using AWS Big Data tool and Data processing such as Amazon Kinesis, Quicksight, Redshift

If so, apply to be considered this opportunity. THE COMPANY: This role is with a global media company that sits in the television space. They are a very successfu...
fullDescription:
DATA ENGINEER

£70,000 - £80,000 + BENEFITS

LONDON

Are you a hands-on Data Engineer with strong Scala and Spark experience looking for a stimulating new challenge? If so, apply to be considered this opportunity.

THE COMPANY:

This role is with a global media company that sits in the television space. They are a very successful business having experienced over a 10 billion turnover this year. Because of this, they are going through a business model transformation to become more digitalised and thus more data centric.

THE ROLE:

We are recruiting for an experienced Data Engineer to join this growing team where they will be using Scala and Spark heavily in an AWS platform.

In particular, this role will involve:

  • Being a fully hands-on, technical contributor using cutting edge technologies. (Spark, Scala, AWS, Airflow, Python)
  • Building cloud based distributed data processing systems.
  • Collecting and visualising large data sets.
  • Designing and building pipelines using big data tech.
  • Developing and maintaining infrastructure in Scala, AWS Athena, Spark etc.

YOUR SKILLS & EXPERIENCE:

  • Educated to a degree level with computer science or similar background.
  • Commercial experience with strong technical expertise in Big Data technology.
  • Strong commercial Scala and Spark coding experience.
  • Commercial experience with AWS data tools (Kenesis, Redshift, Athena etc), must have
  • Experience in Python and SQL.

THE BENEFITS:

The selected candidate will receive a salary between £70,000 - £80,000 depending on their experience and requirements. On top of this salary, there are some excellent benefits on offer.

HOW TO APPLY:

Please register your interest by sending your CV to Holly Neeves via the Apply link on this page.

fullDescription:
GCP
£500-£550 PER DAY
REMOTE/LONDON
3 MONTHS

Are you looking for an opportunity to work for a hugely successful media company design the architecture and using technologies such as Big Query, PySpark and Kafka?

THE COMPANY:

This is an exciting opportunity to work for a leading creative media agency who specialise in providing their clients with award winning ad campaigns. Through data driven social media campaigns they help provide their clients with key insights into how best target consumers. The project you will be working on is a for a financial client where you will be situated in a dynamic team of engineers, scientist and analysts.

THE ROLE:

As a GCP Data Engineer you will be helping to set up data pipelines working alongside Data Engineers using PySpark. You must have excellent experience with Python and an understanding of GCP as this is the platform you will be working on. You must have specific experience with Google Big Query as you will be helping to implement data strategies. As a GCP Data Engineer you will be working closely alongside stakeholders and therefore it is essential you have stakeholder management experience as this will be an important aspect of your job. Any expereince with streaming technologies such as Kafka is valuable or GCP services such as Pub/Sub. In specific, you can expect to be involved in the following:

  • Setting up data pipelines in PySpark
  • Working with Google Big Query
  • Using technologies such as Kafka

YOUR SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE:

The successful Data Engineer will have the following skills and experience:

  • Commercial experience using PySpark
  • Previous experience working in GCP using Big Query
  • Experience with Kafka
  • Stakeholder management

THE BENEFITS:

  • The chance to work in a highly dynamic team environment

HOW TO APPLY:
Please register your interest by sending your CV to Anna Greenhill via the Apply link on this page.

jobDescription: THE COMPANY  Leading Fintech who are looking to improve their Data Engineering function. My client is looking for a data engineer to join their team of world class engineers and Data Scientists to build end-to-end applications that make use of large volumes of source  data from the operational systems.THE ROLE On a daily basis you will be:  Utilise the appropriate develo...
fullDescription:
THE COMPANY

Leading Fintech who are looking to improve their Data Engineering function. My client is looking for a data engineer to join their team of world class engineers and Data Scientists to build end-to-end applications that make use of large volumes of source data from the operational systems.

THE ROLE

On a daily basis you will be:

  • Utilise the appropriate development, data engineering (ETL & ELT, stream processing), test and release model(s) and be flexible with your approach
  • Apply the appropriate standards and principles when delivering data ingestion and data transformation into target data models
  • Convert algorithms, models and features created by data scientists, analysts and designers from prototypes/designs into production solutions

If this role isn't what you're looking for then don't worry, at X4 Technology we have excellent relationships with companies ranging from some of the most exciting start-ups to the biggest names in tech, covering a wide range of mid to senior level permanent and contract positions.

Tech Stack?

The company has moved to a virtual hiring and onboarding process for the foreseeable to ensure candidate and employee safety. Interviews for the role are already underway, so if you this sounds like the role for you then please apply now.

Full Stack Data Engineer

Manchester, UK

Are you a a Full Stack Data Engineer wanting to join a diverse and friendly team? Do you have experience building dataflows into a data lake and data warehouse from a wide range of sources?

What we need from you:

  • Knowledge/experience with data warehouse concepts, including Kimball methodology.
  • Experience with SQL Server and Redshift management.
  • Experience with visualisation development using tools like Cognos, SSRS, Power BI or Business Objects.6
  • An enthusiastic problem solving approach to work.
  • Good communicatiom and ability to develop engaging relationships with colleagues.
  • Have a positive, enthusiastic and methodical attitude to development, business intelligence and data science.

Our client is currently looking for a Data Engineer to play a vital role in the continual development of our digital transformation strategy and earth science analytics. Candidates must have Python, R and SQL. We expect candidates will have a Computer Science, Machine Learning or Data Science degree with industry experience in data analytics.

Person Specification & Key Requirements:

  • Educated to a degree level in either computer science, data science or similar.

  • Active interest in the latest technology and open source trends

ACS are recruiting for a Data Engineer If you feel that you have the skills and experience required in this advertisement to be a Data Engineer please submit your CV including an outline of your experience as a Data Engineer It is always a good idea to include a covering letter outlining your experience as a Data Engineer with your application as this will enhance your chances of selection and improve your prospects of landing the Data Engineer role you desire.

fullDescription:
Senior Business Intelligence Engineer - London - £50k-£70k

Our client is a prestigious not for profit organisation, providing support to thousands of members across the UK. They are seeking a talented and ambitious BI Data Engineer who has a strong technical background, however, also possesses excellent communication skills to work across the breadth of the organisation.

This successful candidate will:

  • Collaborate with business stakeholders and product owners to architect, create, design, test, and implement integrated data solutions into the corporate business intelligence platform.
  • Be working with a high degree of autonomy to investigate, understand and propose solutions for complex data models and data architectures.
  • Work closely with BI analyst and developers to turn data into critical information that can be used to make sound business decisions.
  • Build and maintain batch and real-time ETL data pipelines to power our data warehouse and analytical reports and dashboards.
  • Responsible for the maintenance, improvement, cleaning, and manipulation of data in the analytics databases.

Our client is a big user of the Microsoft technology stack, thus we are seeking the following skills:

  • High experience in Microsoft data cloud services ecosystems
  • MS- SQL
  • Data analytical platform/tools
  • Data warehousing solutions
  • ETL processes,
  • API and general data pipelines such as SSIS, Data factory,
  • Azure Services,
  • Azure DB,
  • Azure data lake

In return you will be working with a talented and highly motivated team of Data Engineers supporting a highly progressive organisation looking to build for the future. Finally we have a highly competitive salary and compensation package to offer.

BI/BusinessIntelligence/SQL/Datawarehousing/Analytics/Cloud/Azure/ETL/API/SSIS/Azure/Data Lake/Azure Devops/Azure Cloud Services

fullDescription:
We are looking for a senior data engineer with strong experience building high quality data assets and high-performance data services on Microsoft Azure. We need someone who is also very well versed in the art of web scraping and REST / SOAP API development.

Our data pool is extremely rich already, but we are looking to take it to the next level. So far, we have terabytes of structured and unstructured data. We have web scrapes, operational data, documents (parsed and unparsed).

THE RESPONSIBILITIES

Build and maintain high quality data pipelines and data models.

Design, build and deploy REST / SOAP APIs.

Design, build and maintain web scrapers.

Essential Microsoft Azure services are: Azure functions, Azure Logic App Data Factory, Databricks, Cosmos DB, ADLS Gen2, Azure SQL and Datawarehouse, and HDInsight.

Experience building ELT pipelines that follow a rigorous data quality framework is essential.

Experience building sophisticated web scrapers.

Developing and maintaining data pipeline infrastructure.

Contributing to the planned roadmap for system changes and improvements.

Solid understanding of core programming concepts. E.g. variables, conditions, loops.

Experience in, or comfortable with, applying knowledge in different programming languages.

Strong Microsoft Excel skills.

fullDescription:
A global advertising company are on the lookout for a Data Engineer to join their team in Edinburgh.

The Company

This is an exciting opportunity for a Data Engineer to join a global market leader who works with leading brands.

The Data Engineering Role

The experienced Data Engineer will support the Data Platform team working alongside software engineers and data analysts to innovate, implement and support code, ETL pipelines and systems.

The successful candidate will also work with data scientists to implement and optimise ML algorithms, pipelines, and systems

The Requirements for the Role

The required skills for the role are:

  • A degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics or similar
  • Proficiency in Python and/or Scala programming
  • Experience with distributed processing using Hadoop, Spark etc.
  • Experience with cloud based services including AWS and GCP

In return, you will receive a salary of between £50,000 and £70,000 dependent on experience.

Interviews are commencing this week and throughout the Christmas period, and the client are keen to have the right person start in January. Interviews are being conducted remotely.

If this role sounds like it could be of interest to you then please apply now.

fullDescription:
Senior Data Engineer (snowflake kafkaAWS) *Remote Interview WFH*. Are you an experienced Data Engineer seeking a role where you can take ownership and progress your career working on complex and interesting systems?

You could be joining a FinTech Unicorn that is helping to revolutionise the payments industry Globally via their suite of cloud based SaaS Products.

As a Data Engineer you will focus on building the tools and platforms that ensure that Data is a asset that can benefit to this businesses clients. You'll work in a small but high performing agile team to take ownership of the businesses data infrastructure. Day to day you will work on a variety of business critical projects - where you will have the opportunity to shape what technologies are used. You will work to create CI / CD pipelines - you’ll automate the businesses snowflake environment using infra as code.

Requirements:

  • You’re a team player who helps others when needed but also aren’t afraid to ask for advice on things when they aren’t needed.
  • You’ll have a strong engineering background with an interest in Data and BI.
  • You’ll have experience working in a snowflake environment.
  • You’ll have experience with DBT or Data Build Tool
  • You’ll be experienced using and deploying airflow.
  • You’ll be familiar using stream processing with Kinesis, Kafka
  • Extensive Experience with SQL Databases
  • Experience designing and implementing CI/CD pipelines.
  • Good knowledge of AWS

Don’t worry if you don’t meet all of these requirements please still apply if you cover most bases and think you can pick these missing skills up quickly.

For this role you can expect to earn upto£90,000 with Bonus, Health insurance and many other benefits on top.

Apply now or call to find out more about this Data Engineer opportunity.

fullDescription:
Data Engineer | £45,000-£60,000 | Bristol

Are you an experienced Data Engineer looking to join an expanding Scale-Up? Are you looking to join an organisation that prides itself on using the cutting edge in data manipulation tech?

We are excited to be working alongside our client - an established Cyber Security consultancy, partnering their search for an experienced Data Engineer. With the work flooding in, you will be joining an ambitious and forward-thinking data team. You will be working on a mix of large and small projects and be responsible for translating data into valuable insights..

What you will be doing:

  • Designing intelligent data solutions for internal and external stakeholders
  • Collect, collate, and effectively interpret data to derive meaningful and actionable insights.
  • Developing fit-for-purpose, resilient, scalable, and future-proof data services that effectively meets client needs.
  • Be aware of and keep up to date with advances in digital analytics/ manipulation tools. (The organisation prides itself on using and benefiting from the cutting edge in data tech)
  • Effectively producing data models, understanding the best model to use at each turn.
  • Effectively recognise and minimise any potential deployment risks
  • Communicating technical jargon in an easily condensed manner to a wider non-technical audience.

Your tech skills will include

  • Experience of scripting in Python or Java Script
  • ETL, data modelling, and data storage experience
  • Exposure to big data technologies, Spark, PySpark Hadoop
  • You will be comfortable and have a background in Datawarehouse Building, Data ingestion and Data Migration

What is essential is an inquisitive nature, a constant will to improve and an ambition to help the wider community by delivering effective Data insights. If this sounds like your type of role please apply with an up to date CV, or if you require any more information please contact me

Do you want to learn from & work alongside some of the most talented, supportive Data Engineers in Bristol? Here is your chance… A unique opportunity for an experienced Data Engineer to join an esteemed Tech Consultancy where innovation and cutting...
fullDescription:
Are you a passionate and technically rounded Data Engineer, looking for an organisation that will invest in you and pushes you to be the best you can be?

Do you want to learn from & work alongside some of the most talented, supportive Data Engineers in Bristol?

Here is your chance…

A unique opportunity for an experienced Data Engineer to join an esteemed Tech Consultancy where innovation and cutting-edge tech lies at its core. They hold a very diverse client base, working across Energy, Financial services, and Retail to name a few; in turn your projects will be diverse and varied where no two days are the same, working to deliver production ready data platforms.

The company has a leading aim of technical excellence, bringing together experts from diverse backgrounds and experiences in an inquisitive environment to deliver outstanding outcomes. They want to be recognised as an organisation that nurtures their diverse team of Data Engineers, helping to unlock their professional potential.

About You

In your new role you will be using nothing less than the best technologies, their engineers work in cross-functional teams, you'll be working alongside fellow Data Engineers, BAs & Data Architects. You'll have a strong breadth of technical experience with exposure to several of the following:

  • Python
  • Big data tech - Preferably Data Bricks or Apache Spark
  • Exposure to NoSQL databases
  • KAFKA
  • Hadoop


You will be working remotely until restrictions are lifted, once we return to a new normal you will be back working closely with your colleagues a couple of days from their centrally based office/ client's site.

If this sounds like your jam, please apply, or reach out

jobTitle: AWS Data Engineer - SC Cleared / SC Eligible
jobDescription: Job Description - We are currently looking for an outstanding Data Engineer to join our growing analytics and data science team. The ideal candidate is a Data Engineer with strong SQL and Python skills and previous experience working with APIs as well as  designing and maintaining ETL pipelines that gather and transform data from different sources. This is a team-based role, where the project work is varied and shared amongst other engineers...
fullDescription:
Job Description - We are currently looking for an outstanding Data Engineer to join our growing analytics and data science team. The ideal candidate is a Data Engineer with strong SQL and Python skills and previous experience working with APIs as well as designing and maintaining ETL pipelines that gather and transform data from different sources. This is a team-based role, where the project work is varied and shared amongst other engineers so you will not just be focused on one part of the process, so being able to see the big picture and work collaboratively is critical. The role will have a 100% focused on client projects.


Role & Responsibilities

  • Working with a team of analysts, data scientists and data engineers amongst other stakeholders to identify and implement best solutions for the analytical needs of a project
  • Contributing to architectural designs, engaging in technical discussions and presenting solutions to product challenges
  • Work with our technical partners and suppliers to ensure their technology is implemented for our internal requirements and for our client projects
  • Work with our internal operations team to ensure a robust business intelligence architecture is in place across all sections of the business
  • Heavily involved in the building and development of the architecture and engineering process of projects including building API's as well as other scripts to set up and automate engineering pipelines and solutions
  • Create and maintain optimal data pipeline architecture
  • Assemble large, complex data sets that meet functional / non-functional business requirements
  • Identify, design, and implement internal process improvements: automating manual processes, optimising data delivery, re-designing infrastructure for greater scalability, etc.
  • Work with stakeholders including the Executive, Product, Data and Design teams to assist with data-related technical issues and support their data infrastructure needs
  • Create data tools for analytics and data scientist team members that assist them in building and optimising our products and services into an innovative industry leader.
  • Someone who can complement the commercial and sales teams, supporting client meetings, pitches and add value to client proposals, new business strategy and company case studies.


Skills & Qualifications

  • Advanced SQL knowledge
  • PostgreSQL dialect is most important
  • Advanced Python programming
  • Familiarity with Docker
  • Strong problem-solving skills, willingness to take ownership and risks, and enthusiasm in the face of technical challenges
  • Excellent interpersonal skills and the ability to work in a team environment
  • Strong communication skills, with the ability to support client meetings
  • Valid SC clearance would be very useful.

fullDescription:
SENIOR DATA ENGINEER

LONDON (REMOTE WORKING)

UP TO £70,000

Harnham are partnered with an international radio company that is looking to scale out their data engineering team. They require a senior data engineer to help build out their data platform to ingest large amounts of customer data.

THE COMPANY

This company are a world-leading radio business, owning a number of household stations. They are a young and dynamic team that is already succeeding. The team consisting of data engineers, BI and data scientists is responsible for generating billions of pounds in revenue. They are looking for a senior data engineer to go in and lead a data engineering team of five, building out a customer data platform.

THE ROLE

- You will be using a DAX platform, ensuring events coming from a programmatic system are optimised.

- You will have control over the data products that are going out to market, by modelling data lakes.

- You will be in control of content recommendations based on the customer data.

- You will be coding an AWS platform in Python.

YOUR SKILLS AND EXPERIENCES

- An expert Python programmer

- Highly experienced using AWS

- Have used Kafka to stream live data into a Snowflake warehouse

- You will be dynamic with a desire to manage a squad of data engineers

HOW TO APPLY

Please register your interest by sending you CV to Callum Castling via the apply link on this page.

fullDescription:
PRINCIPAL DATA ENGINEER

LONDON (REMOTE WORKING)

UP TO £110,000

Harnham are partnered with a consultancy that have a great reputation in the industry and have pioneered a data academy. They require a data engineer to help lead their projects and be a leader in their highly successful graduate scheme.

THE COMPANY

This company are a well-established consultancy, having worked with high-end companies. They have great feedback from all the clients that they work with. Also they have paved the way for a data academy which trains up the best graduates in consultancy. This has been highly successful for them and as a Principal Data Engineer you will be heavily involved in this academy as well as leading projects.

THE ROLE

- You will have control to ensure quality code in Python.

- You will be building out their AWS platform.

- You will be leading teaching in the data academy and involved in writing curriculum

- You will be productionising models using machine learning

YOUR SKILLS AND EXPERIENCES

- An expert Python programmer

- Have previously used machine learning

- May have experience in teaching previously or an interest in this.

- Highly experienced in AWS

HOW TO APPLY

Please register your interest by sending you CV to Callum Castling via the apply link on this page.

fullDescription:
Data Engineer - Contract role, 6 months, remote role with base in London, up to £500 p/d within IR35!

For my Client, a finance and leasing non-profit organisation, I am looking for Data Engineerto join their development team on high profile projects.

Role Responsibilities:

* Build and support data warehouses/data marts/data stores to facilitate data analytics and insights

* Build and support data integration and transformation routines from source systems to target data stores using Oracle Data Integrator (ODI)

* Build performant code following good development practices and improve existing code as appropriate

* Work closely with BA's and the Business Analysis team to build data structures that facilitate data driven insights using various BI Tools like OBIEE, Tableau, Oracle DV etc.

* Scope of work includes on premise and cloud platform environments primarily covering relational databases (e.g. Oracle, PostgreSQL) and file/object stores (e.g. AWS S3)

Required Skills/Qualifications:

* Minimum 5 years of experience building, enhancing, supporting data warehouse solutions (primarily using Oracle data warehouse technologies)

* Proven technical ability in developing, enhancing, tuning and supporting ETL/ELT and data integration solutions using tools from Oracle (Oracle Data Integrator)

* Strong experience with a PL/SQL

* Star schema/Dimensional modelling

* An understanding of Google Analytics structures, data collection and storage, GA API calling, extraction and load from GA into a customer warehouse, Configuration and Enhancing GA for specific data requirement such as customer attributes, click journeys and GA reporting.

* Good knowledge of working with JSONs in Oracle database

* Some knowledge of Python/Spark libraries such as numPy and Plotly or other data manipulation libraries to create data pipelines would be advantageous

* Knowledge/experience of Snowflake and JSON manipulation in Snowflake or the aptitude to understand this technology quickly

If you have above experience and expertise - apply ASAP as this opportunity might be perfect for you!

fullDescription:
SENIOR DATA ENGINEER
CENTRAL LONDON, CURRENTLY FLEXIBLE / REMOTE / HOME WORKING
UP TO £75,000 + BENEFITS

Harnham are partnered with one of Europe's largest Media companies who own brands across TV and Radio. Their founders have invested heavily into their Data teams to build a Customer Data Platform (CDP).

THE COMPANY:

This role is with a Media company who generates billions of pounds worth of revenue, has millions of listeners, and therefore need to enhance their data team. They currently have an AWS analytics platform that needs architecting in a way that will allow them to store data in separate data lakes for each brand, as well as being production ready for Data Science models. The data team is split out into BI, Analytics and Data Engineering. They need a Senior Data Engineer to help build out the platform.

THE ROLE:

  • Rearchitecting their pre-existing AWS platform and introducing Snowflake to store the data
  • Building out a customer-centric data platform, using Databricks to process data taken from multiple sources
  • Building ETL pipelines to ingest data from Kafka streams to understand their customers more and tailor advertising based on website traffic
  • Mentoring juniors in the team, upskilling them with Python, Airflow and AWS

YOUR SKILLS & EXPERIENCES:

  • Expert programmer in Python
  • Have a good understanding of the AWS platform
  • Have streamed/processes data using Spark/Databricks
  • Created orchestration pipelines using Airflow

fullDescription:
SENIOR DATA ENGINEER (JAVA)

£75,000-£85,000 + BENEFITS

REMOTE WORKING/LONDON

Are you a data engineer wanting to move into the e-commerce industry? Do you want to work on a dynamic and exciting Java and real time engineering team? This Senior Data Engineer position offers the opportunity to work on an exciting greenfield project using AWS, Spark, and Java, with the opportunity to work remotely 2-3 days a week.

THE COMPANY

An exciting opportunity to work in a growing team within an iconic and market leading tech focused e-commerce business. They have a mission to save their customers money, whilst remaining a completely tech focused company. Culture is a big priority for the organisation, and they give their staff opportunities to work with dynamic teams in a supportive and enjoyable culture. With small collaborative, tech focused teams work closely using exciting technologies such as AWS, Spark, Kafka and Spring. Looking to utilise real time data and implement microservices, it's an exciting opportunity to work on solving complex issues in an environment which facilitates both personal and professional progression.

THE ROLE

As a Data Engineer, you will have theopportunity to work within a close-knit team and put your mark onto a brand-new data platform using cutting edge technologies such as Kafka Streaming and AWS.

In this role you could also expect to:

  • Work in a diverse and exciting team
  • Build data pipelines using Java
  • Apply your knowledge of big data tools such as Spark, Kafka, and Spring on a day to day basis
  • Work on a complex greenfield project using both customer data and business data, using technologies such as Spark and AWS

THE CANDIDATE

The successful Senior Data Engineer will likely have the following skills and experience:

  • Educated to a degree level or above within a numerical discipline
  • Extensive Java programming experience
  • An in-depth knowledgeand commercial experience of Kafka Streaming
  • Experience using cloud technologies AWS
  • A drive to work in an exciting environment with a desire to build a next generation data platform using Java
  • The desire to perform and learn within a dynamic team
  • Experience in Kafka Streaming and Spark is preferred

BENEFITS

Benefits include £75,000-£85,000 PA dependent on experience. You will also receive a range of incredible benefits, including competitive holiday allowance, work from home, and many more.

HOW TO APPLY

Please register your interest by sending your CV to Kyle Fenton via the Apply link on this page.

jobDescription: Role - Data Engineer / Architect Skills - AWS, SQL, ETL, Python - plus others Location - Manchester  Salary - Up to £70,000  The Role The Dining Club Group is a highly successful technology-focused business which offers huge opportunities to learn new skills in a supportive and creative environment, and to make a signi...
fullDescription:
Role - Data Engineer / Architect

Skills - AWS, SQL, ETL, Python - plus others

Location - Manchester

Salary - Up to £70,000

The Role

The Dining Club Group is a highly successful technology-focused business which offers huge opportunities to learn new skills in a supportive and creative environment, and to make a significant contribution to shaping its future. The Dining Club Group is collectively the largest dining club in the world, with over four million members and over 10,000 participating restaurants across their three brands. They are proud to say that their members currently spend in excess of £600M annually in their restaurants; ensuring that their dining co-operative proposition remains strong.

The Data Architect will play a pivotal role in shaping and guiding data capabilities with The Dining Club Group. Driving transformation of our data capability is at the heart of our business strategy, as such we have huge plans to expand and improve our capability in this area. As the Data Architect you will be in key to the success of project, laying the foundations and implementing a data solution that allows the business to achieve its ambitious goals.

We are looking for someone who will be able to work with other parts of the business, particularly the data and insights team not only shaping requirements and designing solutions but also making recommendations based on emerging technology and trends.

This role is very much hands on, working closely with the CTO and Head of Engineering, we are looking for someone to design the successful architecture but then to implement and deliver this solution to the business. Using your knowledge of data engineering you will own the solution design and then build this from the ground up.

This is a role where you will be able to see the full lifecycle and own the entire project, you will really be able to see the system take shape and a be a key factor in the delivery of an industry leading solution.

This role would not need to be full time office based a few days remote per week is certainly a possibility.

The Dining Club Group would welcome all applications from Data Engineers and Architects for this role. We will certainly look at Data Engineers with some experience who are potentially looking to Architect their first solution from scratch but we would of course also welcome experience architects getting in touch.

Responsibilities

You will be responsible for ensuring business value through innovative solutions. We will need you will take ownership and accountability for critical initiatives and deliverables both internally and for our clients. You will build and maintain valuable relationships and will have the ability to influence opinions and decisioning across clients and internal teams.

Skills / Technology Stack

  • AWS
  • Dimensional Modelling
  • ETL Design & Architecture
  • Database Design (SQL/No SQL)
  • Python - good programming knowledge
  • BI Visualization

If you are an experienced Data Engineer or Architect and you are looking to progress with an organisation that has a fantastic approach to work in a supportive and creative environment then look no further - this is the role for you!

Interviews for this role will be held imminently. To be considered, please send your CV to me now to avoid disappointment.

Role - Data Engineer / Architect

Skills - AWS, Python, ETL, SQL

Location - Manchester

Salary - Up to £70,000

Oscar Technology is acting as an Employment Agency in relation to this vacancy.

To understand more about what we do with your data please review our privacy policy in the privacy section of the Oscar website.

fullDescription:
Senior BI / Data Engineer

** Fin-tech / Insurance Start-Up **

THE COMPANY 

This business offers personalised insurance through their App, working to disrupt the insurance market and make it digitally native. Their product will make people start caring more about their insurance. 

Along with their household-name clients in the automotive industry, they have recently partnered with one client to launch an innovative service in pay-as-you-drive insurance and have secured an exclusive agreement with an automotive giant to white label their direct insurance offering. 

The role reports directly into the CTO and is the first of its kind within this rapidly growing fin-tech start-up (currently 30 strong).

A comprehensive background in BI / Data Engineering is required, with solid skills working in the AWS ecosystem and using AWS data services (Redshift, RDS, Lambda, EC2). Significant experience designing and implementing automated data processing systems, ideally using Extract, Load and Transform (ELT) strategies. Experience designing data models for analytical querying, with familiarity with star schemas and other data warehousing techniques. Strong knowledge of and experience with data processing languages and approaches (e.g. TypeScript, Python, SQL, Spark, DBT). Experience with setting up and maintaining reporting packages (e.g. Tableau, Looker).

You will need to be a self-starter, commercially minded, with the ability to spot opportunity for adding value to customers and partners through data products, services, and analysis projects. Ultimately, this is a fantastic opportunity for an intellectually curious, bright, ambitious Data Analyst, keen to be part of this challenger brand and a growing data team.

POSITION -                 BI / Data Engineer – Fintech / Insurance Start-Up

LOCATION -                100% Full Remote

SALARY -                    £60,000 to £75,000 plus benefits

EXPERIENCE REQUIRED/RESPONSIBILITES

  • Educated to at least degree level in a numerate subject
  • Strong knowledge and experience of data processing languages and approaches (Typescript, Python, SQL, Spark, DBT)
  • Experience of working within the AWS (Amazon Web Services) ecosystem, including Redshift, RDS, Lambda, EC2)
  • Excellent communication skills in order to present findings to non-technical audiences
  • Act as the ‘expert in the room’ for all things analysis for this small yet growing firm
  • An ability to develop, implement and maintain data processing systems, data collection systems, data analytics and other elements of data strategy
  • Develop and support ongoing reporting

TO APPLY

For further information or to apply please contact:

Connor Perry

Consultant – Blue Pelican Data & Analytics

For more vacancies which may suit your needs, please visit us at www.bluepelican.com

Their vision is to...
fullDescription:
An award winning legal start up is looking for a Data Engineer to work in a new team building a Greenfield product based on machine learning, especially natural language processing.

About the role

The COVID-19 crisis has hit the legal sector hard, despite this this company has continued to grow, securing its seed funding in April and allowing the business to continue their extraordinary growth plan. Their vision is to build products that revolutionise the way that land and property transactions are accomplished, using technology to pinpoint the legal risks involved.

You will be involved in every stage of the product development lifecycle, developing data pipelines and building a new data warehouse. The role would allow you to have a large influence on the company’s growth and give you the opportunity to work collaboratively with a cross functional team of data scientists, software engineers and product owners to deliver high impact services.

What skills do you need?
  • A Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science/Engineering , equivalent technical field or equivalent technical experience
  • Proven experience with Python and SQL
  • Worked on Apache Airflow based data warehousing and ETL systems
What can they offer you?

fullDescription:
Senior Data Engineer - AWS - Manchester

Senior Data Engineer x 2 with excellent AWS experience in tools such as ETL, Data Lakes, SQL, SSIS, & Python to join a leading organisation based in Manchester. Any experience with AWS-based BI stack, including Lambda, Redshift, Snowflake and Matillion would be very useful indeed!! These roles are due to their commitment to everything data-related and improving data science within the company, so plenty of new projects to get stuck into on day 1!

My client offers an excellent flexible working policy including working from home. As a Data Engineer, you will be building dataflows into a data lake & data warehouse from a wide range of sources as well as helping to steer the development of efficient data structures that will enable sophisticated analysis and data science

Experience required:

  • Work with ETL tools such as SQL, SSIS, AWS, Python etc.
  • Microsoft BI stack, including SSIS, SQL Server and Power BI
  • AWS-based BI stack, including Lambda, Redshift, Snowflake and Matillion
  • Comfortable with data warehouse concepts, including Kimball methodology
  • Experience of building dataflows into a data lake and data warehouse from a wide range of sources
  • Experience with visualisation development using tools like Cognos, SSRS, Power BI or Business Objects
  • Have a passion & enthusiastic attitude towards development, business intelligence and data science

These Data Engineer roles are varied and working with the latest technology. You will collaborate with other people in the large data team on daily basis as well as the wider business. Duties include:

- Connect APIs, flat files, databases and data streams to their data lake (ELT) as well as shaping data from their data lake and form into a Kimball data warehouse

- Build containers for data model endpoints

- Ensure that appropriate data quality, integrity and alerting is built into all solutions while building containers for data model endpoints

- Work with an AWS-based BI stack, including Lambda, Redshift, Snowflake etc as well as the Microsoft BI Stack

- Work in an Agile Kanban environment & assist with managing the DevOps processes for Data, and any tooling that guides the processes

- Contribute to the architecture of the data warehouse and data lake

My client is offering a starting salary of between £55,000 - £75,000 + Benefits including home working.

To apply, press apply now or please send your CV to matthew.leach @ circlerecruitment.com

Alternatively please connect with me in LinkedIn

Alongside building robust Python code as a Data Engineer you will also be using SQL so experience with this programming language is also vital. You will analysing local data sets so a good understanding of Excel is also key. As a Data Engineer you should be familiar with tools such as Airflow for scheduling. As you will be working in a consultancy you must be comfortable working in a fast paced environment. Any experience within the health sector is highly advantageous.

fullDescription:
Senior BI / Data Engineer

** Fin-tech / Insurance Start-Up **

THE COMPANY 

This business offers personalised insurance through their App, working to disrupt the insurance market and make it digitally native. Their product will make people start caring more about their insurance. 

Along with their household-name clients in the automotive industry, they have recently partnered with one client to launch an innovative service in pay-as-you-drive insurance and have secured an exclusive agreement with an automotive giant to white label their direct insurance offering. 

The role reports directly into the CTO and is the first of its kind within this rapidly growing fin-tech start-up (currently 30 strong).

A comprehensive background in BI / Data Engineering is required, with solid skills working in the AWS ecosystem and using AWS data services (Redshift, RDS, Lambda, EC2). Significant experience designing and implementing automated data processing systems, ideally using Extract, Load and Transform (ELT) strategies. Experience designing data models for analytical querying, with familiarity with star schemas and other data warehousing techniques. Strong knowledge of and experience with data processing languages and approaches (e.g. TypeScript, Python, SQL, Spark, DBT). Experience with setting up and maintaining reporting packages (e.g. Tableau, Looker).

You will need to be a self-starter, commercially minded, with the ability to spot opportunity for adding value to customers and partners through data products, services, and analysis projects. Ultimately, this is a fantastic opportunity for an intellectually curious, bright, ambitious Data Analyst, keen to be part of this challenger brand and a growing data team.

POSITION -                 BI / Data Engineer – Fintech / Insurance Start-Up

LOCATION -                100% Full Remote

SALARY -                    £60,000 to £75,000 plus benefits

EXPERIENCE REQUIRED/RESPONSIBILITES

  • Educated to at least degree level in a numerate subject
  • Strong knowledge and experience of data processing languages and approaches (Typescript, Python, SQL, Spark, DBT)
  • Experience of working within the AWS (Amazon Web Services) ecosystem, including Redshift, RDS, Lambda, EC2)
  • Excellent communication skills in order to present findings to non-technical audiences
  • Act as the ‘expert in the room’ for all things analysis for this small yet growing firm
  • An ability to develop, implement and maintain data processing systems, data collection systems, data analytics and other elements of data strategy
  • Develop and support ongoing reporting

TO APPLY

For further information or to apply please contact:

Connor Perry

Consultant – Blue Pelican Data & Analytics

For more vacancies which may suit your needs, please visit us at www.bluepelican.com

• Work with modern Big Data and Cloud technologies.

As a result, you'll collaborate with other data engineers and data teams to ensure that the data is integrated and accessible. 

This role requires a range of data engineering activities including; prototyping, pipelining, warehousing, automation and more.

What you'll get in return for your experience

Base salary of up to £80k plus bonus and benefits. The position is fully remote for now with the expectation of 1-day in the office p/week post-COVID measures. 

What's next?

They use a proven delivery model that operates globally in partnership with a l...
fullDescription:
Job Title: Data Engineers - Multiple Positions Available

Location: Nationwide

Salary: Competitive

Job Type: Full Time, Contract

The Company:

This independent company delivers Telecommunications services across Mobile, Fixed and Optical Networks. They use a proven delivery model that operates globally in partnership with a leading telecoms company.

Their expertise lies in the implementation of E2E delivery services in all sectors of the telecommunications industry, specialising in mobile, fixed and optical networks. Drawing on extensive experience and knowledge in large scale multivendor environments to deliver high quality projects and solutions that satisfy their customers and importantly their end user.

Job Purpose:

The Data Engineer is responsible for the installation, testing and certification of both AC and DC electrical installations on customer premises within the Telecoms sector.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Fibre handling adept use of OPM and fault finding
  • Copper and co-axial terminating, testing and fault finding
  • Minor Infrastructure survey & build
  • Rack/Sub rack Installation
  • Installation of telecoms equipment, including minor DC power work, in equipment rooms or out on site in accordance with the design documentation provided
  • Assisting other engineers where and when appropriate, ensuring compliance and adherence with policies and procedures
  • To take full responsibility for the complete installation and test to customer standards.
  • Reporting progress and issues affecting the work
  • Responsibility for ensuring all equipment issued is kept in good working order maintaining calibration and test date
  • A willingness to travel is essential
  • Perform all duties safely and to industry best practice
  • Receive and check issued paperwork from the office
  • Report all issues with equipment in a timely manner

Key Requirements:

  • NPPV3 Clearance
  • Emergency First Aid at Work (005-HS-APP)
  • RF/EMF Awareness (005-HS-RFA)
  • Roof Top Safety (005-HS-RTS) (desirable)
  • Experience in a data Centre environment essential
  • Siena Training would be desirable

Please click the APPLY button to send your CV and Covering Letter for this role.

Candidates with experience of; Service Technician, Electrical Engineer, Engineer, Engineer, Field Service Engineer, Technician, Service Engineer, Field Based Engineer, Telecom Engineer, Electrical Maintenance Engineer, Installation Engineer, Repairs Engineer, Maintenance Engineer, Multi Skilled Engineer, Maintenance Technician, Multiskilled Engineer, Field Service Technician, Site Maintenance Engineer may also be considered for this role.

jobDescription: Junior Data Engineer, Uxbridge, £40-50K + 10% bonus + bens. Either a recent Graduate or someone with commercial experience, both  will be considered. Reporting into the Data Engineering Technical Lead, the role involves creating data solutions to process data at scale, both in batch and real-time...
fullDescription:
Junior Data Engineer, Uxbridge, £40-50K + 10% bonus + bens. You must be a Graduate with a strong understanding of Data Engineering, Machine Learning and ideally a good knowledge of Java. Either a recent Graduate or someone with commercial experience, both will be considered.

Reporting into the Data Engineering Technical Lead, the role involves creating data solutions to process data at scale, both in batch and real-time pipelines, to support a wide range of data-driven projects and support our transformation into an AI-ready organisation.

The key responsibilities of the Data Engineer are:
*Implement workflows to ingest data into a Snowflake data warehouse for a variety of data sources
*Implement data transformation pipelines in real-time and batch environments
*Support all product teams in adopting our data engineering tech stack to generate new data streams
*Collaborate with Data Science and Business Intelligence teams to identify requirements and develop the necessary data workflows to deliver against those requirements

Key Experience:

*University degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering or related subjects
*Knowledge / experience of Java. Python desirable.
*Relational and non-relational databases. Experience with Snowflake a plus.
*Batch processing frameworks, such as DBT, Flink, Apache Airflow, etc.
*Message brokers / stream processing technologies (Kinesis, Kafka, Storm, Spark Streaming, Flink, etc.)
*Familiarity AWS, Docker, Kubernetes, Amazon EKS
*Continuous Integration with Jenkins
*Test-Driven Development and XP

This role involves close collaboration with data scientists, data analysts and product engineers.

This Junior Data Engineer position is based in Uxbridge but can be remote working and is paying c£40-50K + 10% bonus + Bens, depending on relevant experience.

jobDescription: The NHS are looking for an apprentice to join the team to deliver high quality analytical outputs, using relevant technical skills in data management and manipulation, business intelligence and analytics.  A typical day  You will work as part of a dynamic team in delivering an effective service.Work in an agile manner with daily stand upsCleanse and manage data (including processing)</li...
fullDescription:
The NHS are looking for an apprentice to join the team to deliver high quality analytical outputs, using relevant technical skills in data management and manipulation, business intelligence and analytics.

A typical day

  • You will work as part of a dynamic team in delivering an effective service.
  • Work in an agile manner with daily stand ups
  • Cleanse and manage data (including processing)
  • Quality assure data and analytical outputs following best practice guidelines
  • Integrate data feeds from disparate sources
  • Respond to incoming requests for information in a timely and efficient manner
  • Develop data processing packages
  • Plan, design, manage, execute and report on tests, using appropriate tools and techniques
  • Be highly numerate and use a variety of techniques to develop, process and engineer data relating to key priorities
  • Be adaptable when finding engineering solutions to challenges
  • Able to present findings to a diverse audience
  • Log, analyse and manage problems in order to identify and implement the appropriate solution, ensuring that the problem is fixed.

You must have

  • Five GCSE grades C - A* (4-9) or equivalent, including English and Maths
  • Level 3 qualification (A level, BTEC or equivalent)

Skills needed

  • Attention to detail
  • Able to work to tight deadlines
  • Good time management
  • Ability to communicate technical points to a non-technical audience
  • Problem solving skills
  • Ability to prioritise work and switch focus if needed

Perks and benefits

  • WhiteHat community
  • Pension

Training provided:

  1. Training on the 18 month Standard Level 4 Data Analytics (DA4) apprenticeship.
  2. Being a WhiteHat apprentice means access to awesome social events, sports teams, insight/career days with other apprentices to grow your network, as well as your own personal Coach who will guide you through the qualification to help you achieve your full potential.
  3. As part of your WhiteHat Apprenticeship, you will have access to our Future Leaders Foundation modules to develop 6 key competencies, underpinned by well-being, self-awareness, motivation, conscientiousness, effectiveness and grit.

Future prospects

After your Data Analysis Apprenticeship, you can progress into any Junior Data Analyst, Data Scientist and Data engineer role. You'll have the skills to run insight analytical projects from beginning to end and work within a Data Analytics team.

fullDescription:
SENIOR DATA ENGINEER
INSURANCE
LONDON
£60,000-£85,000 + BENEFITS

A globally renowned insurance brand are looking for a new senior data engineering to join the head of data science and another senior engineer within their corporate team dealing with their business to business offering.

THE COMPANY

The company are a household name in insurance and work across 33 countries globally. They have thousands of people working for them and until recently enough data. Wasn't hugely central to what they do which has all changed. They are now building a team around some successful POC work

THE ROLE

If you were to be successful in your application for this Senior Data Engineer your responsibilities would include:

  • Sit alongside the other Senior Data Engineer and digging into lots of messy databases and building an enterprise wide data warehouse so the rest of the business can access this.
  • Eventually take this to the next level and be able to automate and retrain some of the processes put in place
  • Work closely with 2 predictive modellers to platform data for them.

SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE

In order for your application for the Junior BI Analyst to be successful you will need;

  • A strong background within insurance and experience on projects relating to pricing or modelling
  • Excellent SQL experience for the building of databases and manipulation of data
  • Ideally a scripting language like Python for automating processes or building data pipelines
  • Experience with pricing or actuarial data would be useful for one of their roles

HOW TO APPLY

If you are interested in this Senior Data Engineer role please apply via this site.

KEYWORDS

SQL,Python, Data Warehousing, Insurance,

fullDescription:
Data Engineer

Surrey

Up to £70,000 + Competitive Bonus and benefits

The Company

Join one of the largest healthcare providers to date, using their wealth of data to create a best-in-class customer journey across all of their healthcare products! This data team has recently undergone huge investment, looking at new technology and AI as well as working on transformations for not just physical, but also mental health.

The role

You will be part of their growing data team and will be enabled to hit the ground running with the autonomy that you are given. You will be responsible for the creation and maintenance of a logical data model that enables the provision of data from various sources to analysts that can then gain actionable insights from this. You will:

  • Integrate data from multiple sources into a centralised data warehouse with a logical data model using T-SQL and dimensional data modelling
  • Build and maintain data artefacts - data models, data dictionaries and business glossaries using SQL and Python
  • Contribute to the design, development, testing and performance in production of the data-centric software.

Key Skills and Requirements

  • Strong development skills using T-SQL and Python
  • Experience in data modelling/dimensional data modelling
  • Experience in Cloud services and architecture - ideally Azure

jobTitle: Snowflake Data Engineer / Data Warehouse Engineer - City of London
jobDescription: Snowflake Data Engineer / Data Warehouse Engineer - City of London We are looking for a Data Warehouse Engineer with extensive experience of Snowflake Cloud based data platforms to join a leading insurance MGA in the City of London. The primary focus of this role will be the development of a Snowflake data warehouse environment  and will include using Matillion ETL tools and Tableau for data visualisations. As the ideal candidate you ...
fullDescription:
Snowflake Data Engineer / Data Warehouse Engineer - City of London

We are looking for a Data Warehouse Engineer with extensive experience of Snowflake Cloud based data platforms to join a leading insurance MGA in the City of London. The primary focus of this role will be the development of a Snowflake data warehouse environment and will include using Matillion ETL tools and Tableau for data visualisations. As the ideal candidate you will be adept at working with large data sets to develop advanced, scalable Data Warehouse solutions from end-to-end.

They are still at the early stages of building their Cloud based Data Warehouse based on MS Azure. The basic architecture has been established and various system components talk to each other but there is still a lot to do and this will be a huge opportunity for the right person to take ownership of the Data Platform and take it to the next level. You will be a hands-on Data Engineer who thrives on working in a varied and challenging environment and will use your technical knowledge to advise on how they are ingesting data, what they are ingesting and how they are using insights to drive key business decision. You must have strong experience using a variety of data architecture/data modelling techniques. You must also have a proven ability to design, develop and implement advanced data warehousing solutions and be comfortable working with a wide range of stakeholders and functional teams to understand business needs.

Experience Required

  • Snowflake expert (based on MS Azure)
  • Data architecture and modelling experience (eg. facts and dimensions, materialized views etc)
  • Performance tuning - a deep understanding of query and table performance and how to resolve non performing model/query issues in Snowflake
  • Data Warehouse Design - a demonstrable and broad understanding of best practices, common issues and how to solve them.
  • An ability to tell a great story from a range of data sources
  • Advanced Caching
  • Advanced skills in SQL
  • Ability to present findings in a structured, clear manner with actionable insights
  • Excellent oral and written communication skills for translating data insights into concise executive summaries and presentations.
  • Matillion ETL tools - how to build data pipelines and advanced data ingestion techniques
  • Tableau for advanced data visualisations

APPLY NOW FOR IMMEDIATE CONSIDERATION AND INTERVIEW IN THE NEXT WEEK.

Location: City of London - For the foreseeable future this will be a home-based role with the opportunity to work remotely 2-3 days a week after the pandemic.

Salary: Competitive + benefits

Data Engineer - Central Belt

Fancy taking ownership of a Data Engineering function in the next year? If you want to work within one of Scotland's most innovative teams and have autonomy to shape the company's future data capabilities then this is for you! The company are rapidly scaling their FinTech platform and are looking for best in their class individuals to take the journey with them. You will have the opportunity to work with cutting edge technology and make a key contribution to an innovative product.

The Role

You will be the company's go to person when it comes to matters relating to their data platform. The development phase of the work is very much in its infancy so you will have a truly Greenfield project to run at! The company have an expectation that they will be further growing the Data team over the next year and see this an opportunity for you to come in and take ownership of the function moving forward.

You will have industry experience with the following technologies

- Java, Python

- AWS

- Working with Speech Data/NLP

- Regulated Data Environments

The Company

This client have significant funding and already established with products and services in the market, and customers lined up to consume their services. They provide a start-up opportunity, with the chance to be involved at the beginning, to bring influence to the future product, to establish rapid career and personal development and with options to share in the company's success.

Package

Offering a package of up to £60k for the right person as well as benefits including Work from Home post lock down, a good bonus scheme and company shares.

Please get in touch with Greg at FPSG, . Or apply for more information.

Equal Opportunities

FPSG is committed to equal opportunities regardless of gender, race, disability, sexual orientation, religion or belief and age.

SECURITY SYSTEMS & DATA ENGINEER - STARTING HOURLY RATE UP TO £15.00 PER HOUR DOE

TEMP TO PERM POSITION!

Our client is a well-established company 3 offices across the UK. One of these offices in the North of the UK are looking to expand. They provide high-end security systems to a range of commercial clients and due to a big work load they are seeking a Security Systems & Data Engineer who is confident working on a range of systems within Access Control, CCTV, Data & Intruder Alarms to join their team on a temp to perm basis.

Starting hourly rate of up to £15.00 per hour. (12 week temporary role - moving into a permanent role at the end of 12 weeks whereby you will be paid an annual salary of up to £32,000 + Overtime and Call Outs on top).

Fully stocked company van, mobile phone, uniform & PPE.

Working hours are Monday - Friday 40 hours a week minimum.

Area of work: North of the UK.

Role & Responsibilities:

  • Installation, servicing & commissioning of Access Control & CCTV (70%) and Data systems (30%) as well as Integrated Security Systems such as Intruder alarms, Gates/Barriers and Intercoms.
  • Taking part in a call out rota. Paid for call outs and a standby rate.
  • Working as part of a small team within a larger organisation ensuring work is completed to a high standard and being a team player.

The Ideal Person:

  • You will have at least 3 years experience as a Security Engineer working with Access Control and CCTV systems. Intruder Alarm experience is preferable but not essential for this role. If you have previously worked with Data that would be highly desirable - specifically Fibre splicing.
  • You will be based within Derbyshire, Nottinghamshire, South Yorkshire area.
  • You will have knowledge of a range of equipment and be willing to learn new systems. Training can and will be provided for you on their high-end security products.
  • You will hold a Full UK driving Licence.

This is a truly great opportunity and the successful candidate will receive a very competitive salary package & additional benefits.

DON'T MISS OUT ON THIS GREAT OPPORTUNITY - APPLY NOW

Get Staff acts as an employment agency for permanent recruitment and employment business for the supply of temporary workers.

Please note that if you have not been contacted within 7 days, your application for this position has been unsuccessful.

jobDescription: DATA ENGINEERFINTECH AND PRIVATE EQUITY REMOTE- UK£40,000-50,000 Great opportunity for a Data Engineer with strong ETL to join this London based team and work remotely  THE COMPANY The company specialises in investing in startups and also company's in the gaming space and also incubates numerous seed pr...
fullDescription:
DATA ENGINEER
FINTECH AND PRIVATE EQUITY
REMOTE- UK
£40,000-50,000

Great opportunity for a Data Engineer with strong ETL to join this London based team and work remotely

THE COMPANY

The company specialises in investing in startups and also company's in the gaming space and also incubates numerous seed projects with the ambition of launching them as their own companies.

THE ROLE

As a Data Engineer you would be responsible for :

  • Lead Data integration projects on the Azure Cloud platform including building streaming data pipelines for real time data
  • Designing and developing databases using different tools and tech (relational, dimensional, NoSQL, Python data pipelines
  • A good understanding of data warehousing so you can contribute to this (Star schemas slow changing dimensions, BI tools)
  • Focusing more heavily on the data pipelining and ETL work from various source systems/API's and varying data types but can also get involved in building schemas, designing DWH's and also getting involved in the BI work if they have that experience.

SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE

A successful BI Developer will have:

  • A number of years of experience as a BI Developer and strong data ingestion/ETL experience
  • Excellent MS Stack experience and T- SQL coding, SSIS particular.
  • Ideally cloud experience specifically with Azure and data factory
  • Some Python coding ability is also Ideal or something like Scala or another programming language.

HOW TO APPLY

Please register your interest by sending your CV to Eoin Pierce or clicking on the link

KEYWORDS

SQL, SSIS, SSAS, Power BI, BI Developer, BI Analyst, Python, Azure, Data Factory

I am seeking an experienced Data Engineer to join a leading Digital Transformation consultancy based in Manchester or Leeds.

You will be joining a wider team of Engineers, working heavily across industries such as: Financial Services & Insurance, Energy & Commercial and Public Sector.

This is an excellent opportunity for a seasoned Engineer to join an exciting team known and recognised for being pioneers in their field.

To be considered, you must have the following:


Role & Responsibilities

  • Work on machine learning algorithms
  • Help support and operating production systems
  • Work on open-source stream-processing software platform (Kafka)
  • Build and maintain databases: SQL Server / PosteSQL / MySQL


Skills & Qualifications

  • Experience working with AWS cloud providers
  • Experience with data reporting and visualisation tools (PowerBI, Tableau, Qlik)
  • Experience of Hadoop big data platforms (either Cloudera / Hortonworks or cloud native equivalents)
  • Experience with Infrastructure as Code (e.g. Terraform, Cloudformation)
  • Demonstrable experience in automating operations tasks with one or more scripting languages

fullDescription:
Senior Data Engineer (ODI)

Data Warehouse | Data Architecture | ETL | ODI | Oracle Data Integrator

A boutique analytics solutions provider who had a successful 2020 and have secured new projects starting in 2021 are now growing and looking to find a superb Data Engineer that's happy to work across multiple platform in Oracle and SQL Server and Cloud.

You'll be focused on understanding their clients requirements and challenge and deliver data warehouse solutions. Due to their vendor neutral offering, experience in multiple platforms would be beneficial.

Essential

  • Oracle Data Integrator (ODI) - would be amazing
    • Alternatively (Data Factory, SSIS, Data Stage)
  • Data Warehouse track record (ETL, Cubes, OLAP, Star Schema, Kimball or Inmon)
  • Exposure to cloud would be ideal

Remote working until restrictions are lifted. Limited travel to the office.

This vacancy will be closing application on January 30th 2020. If you have any questions or fancy a chat about the opportunity feel free to give George Bone a call on or apply for the advert and George will be in contact.

Business Intelligence | BI | Data | Engineer | Developer | Data Warehouse | Architecture | ETL | SSIS | ODI | Oracle Data Integrator | Data Factory | Redshift | SQL | Oracle | DB2 | Cognos | Tableau | Power BI | Qlikview | Azure | AWS | GCP | £55,000 - £70,000

fullDescription:
Are you a Data Engineer/ Data Scientist looking for a new role? If so, I have a role based in Cambridgeshire with a company that is growing steadily in one of the most secure sectors.


You will support software developers, database architects, data analysts and data scientists on data initiatives and will ensure optimal data delivery architecture is consistent throughout ongoing projects. A real chance to enhance and broaden your skills.
Technical needs!

  • Advanced working SQL knowledge and experience working with relational databases, query authoring (SQL) as well as working familiarity with a variety of databases.
  • Experience building and optimizing 'big data' data pipelines, architectures and data sets.
  • Experience performing root cause analysis on internal and external data and processes to answer specific business questions and identify opportunities for improvement.
  • Hadoop, Spark, Kafka, etc.
  • SQL and NoSQL databases,
  • Data pipeline and workflow management tools
  • Stream-processing systems: Storm, Spark-Streaming, etc.
  • Relational Databases and Data Warehousing
  • Microsoft Azure DevOps
  • Python
  • CI/CD

fullDescription:
Senior Data Engineer (AWS Kinesis kafka AWS) *Remote Interview WFH*. Are you an experienced Data Engineer seeking a role where you can take ownership and progress your career working on complex and interesting systems?

You could be joining a Global FinTech Unicorn that is helping to revolutionise the payments industry Globally via their suite of cloud based SaaS Products.

As a Senior Data Engineer you will focus on working with stream processing technologies and platforms that ensure that Data is an asset that can benefit to this businesses clients. You'll work in a small but high performing agile team to build a platform that processes data in batch and real time. Day to day you will work on a variety of business critical projects - where you will have the opportunity to shape what technologies are used. You will also design and implement infrastructure to build a platform to train, deploy and Monitor Machine Learning models.

Requirements:

  • Strong Engineering Background with an interest in data and machine learning.
  • Experience working with Stream Processing Technologies like Kinesis, Kafka, KSQL.
  • Experience working with AWS (kinesis Lambda EMR)
  • SQL Databases
  • Experience with Docker and Terraform.
  • Extensive Experience with SQL Databases

Don’t worry if you don’t meet all of these requirements please still apply if you cover most bases and think you can pick these missing skills up quickly.

For this role you can expect to earn upto £90,000 with Bonus, Health insurance and many other benefits on top.

Apply now or call to find out more about this Data Engineer opportunity.
