jobDescription: About the role:Working as part of the Data Factory team, the purpose of this role is to lead the data engineers to collaborate with data architects and data product teams to contribute to the acquisition of corporate data requirements, documenting them according to the required  standards utilising the prescribed methods and Azure data tools, in order to build our company centralised data platform.The role will...
fullDescription:
About the role:
Working as part of the Data Factory team, the purpose of this role is to lead the data engineers to collaborate with data architects and data product teams to contribute to the acquisition of corporate data requirements, documenting them according to the required standards utilising the prescribed methods and Azure data tools, in order to build our company centralised data platform.

The role will manage the roadmap to develop, construct, test and maintain architectures such as data pipelines and large-scale data processing systems. Leveraging industry best practice while delivering changes, such as agile backlogs, code repositories, automated builds, testing and releases. Ensure data scientists can pull relevant data sets for their analyses. Implement data pipelines to connect operational systems, data for analytics and BI systems.  Re-engineer manual data flows to enable scaling and repeatable use.

Develop data set processes for data modelling, mining and production. Work closely with data architects (to determine what data management systems are appropriate) and data scientists (to determine which data are needed for analysis). Provide clean, usable data to the business through the data platform in accordance with governance. Leading the data engineer team in the best way to do this

Analyses, designs, plans, executes and evaluates data requirements to support business activities and projects.

To be successful you will have the following skills and experience:
  • Training or certifications in Azure
  • Training or certifications in key industry data product technologies (i.e. ETL Tools, flexible languages like python)
  • Efficient in building ETL processes for enterprise solutions
  • Strong Software delivery methods and knowledge
  • Ability to work in an agile framework and collaboratively with others
  • Managing other team members
  • Strong technical process understanding regardless of technology
  • Core cloud (azure) based technical knowledge
  • Wide range of strong technical skills (i.e. Azure DevOps, Azure Data Factory, Data Bricks, SQL, API creation, PowerShell, Python) based technical knowledge
What’s in it for you:
Our competitive salary and package include a competitive bonus, car allowance, private healthcare, an excellent contributory pension, 26 days holiday. There is also a wider benefits scheme which includes an annual pay review, season ticket loans and loyalty awards for continuous service plus discounts at a wide range of retailers via Benefits on Taps.  We also have a referral scheme, where you can receive £750 for helping someone get a permanent position within the company. 

We’re proud to be here for our local community, offering everyone two days paid volunteer leave a year, as well as proudly supporting a lot of local events and charities. 

About us:
Thames Water is the UK’s largest water and wastewater company. We make a daily difference to millions of customers by supplying 2.7 billion litres of world-class water to around 10 million homes.  

As our world changes, the need to take care of our most precious resource is greater than ever, both locally and globally. That’s why, at Thames Water, every one of our actions, big and small, matters every day. Water is essential to daily life, and that means our business is always open. We’re passionate about providing world-class tap water, now and for the future.

We’re also turning waste into power, self-generating 20% of the energy we use and, in turn, doing our bit for the planet. We’re reducing plastic waste by celebrating our tap water and rolling out an ambitious water fountain project. We’re using our voice to lobby for change and partnering with WaterAid to provide clean water to the world’s poorest communities.

Together, we’re building a better future for our customers, our region and our planet.
Thames Water is a unique, rewarding and diverse place to work. If you join our team, you’ll enjoy fast-tracked career opportunities, flexible working arrangements and unparalleled benefits. We’re also proud to be an equal opportunity employer, Stonewall Diversity Champion and Disability Confident Leader, welcoming individuals from all walks of life and leading the way with award-winning mental health and well-being strategy.

jobDescription: Global Manufacturer require a Data Engineer to work with developers, database architects / data scientists on strategic data initiatives. You will be responsible for expanding and optimizing data and pipeline architecture, as well as data flow/collection  for cross functional teams. You will be an experienced data pipeline builder and data wrangler who enjoys optimizing data systems and building them from the ground up. Client...
fullDescription:
Global Manufacturer require a Data Engineer to work with developers, database architects / data scientists on strategic data initiatives. You will be responsible for expanding and optimizing data and pipeline architecture, as well as data flow/collection for cross functional teams. You will be an experienced data pipeline builder and data wrangler who enjoys optimizing data systems and building them from the ground up.

Client Details

Global Manufacturer / Distributor

Description

Global Manufacturer are looking for a Data Engineer to work with software developers, database architects, data analysts and data scientists on strategic data initiatives. The Data Engineer will be responsible for expanding and optimizing data and data pipeline architecture, as well as optimizing data flow and collection for cross functional teams. The ideal candidate is an experienced data pipeline builder and data wrangler who enjoys optimizing data systems and building them from the ground up.

As Data Engineer you will be responsible for:

  • Create and maintain optimal data pipeline architecture,
  • Assemble large, complex data sets that meet functional / non-functional business requirements.
  • Identify, design, and implement internal process improvements: automating manual processes, optimizing data delivery, re-designing infrastructure for greater scalability, etc.
  • Build the infrastructure required for optimal extraction, transformation, and loading of data from a wide variety of data sources using SQL/Non-SQL and Azure 'big data' technologies
  • Build analytics tools that utilize the data pipeline to provide actionable insights into customer acquisition
  • operational efficiency and other key business performance metrics
  • Work with stakeholders including the Executive, Product, Data and Design teams to assist with data-related technical issues and support their data infrastructure needs
  • Keep our data separated and secure across national boundaries through multiple data centres and Azure regions
  • Create data tools for analytics and data scientist team members that assist them in building and optimizing our product into an innovative industry leader.
  • Work with data and analytics experts to strive for greater functionality in our data systems.
  • For developing, constructing, maintenance and testing of data architectures, such as databases and large-scale processing systems
  • Clean, aggregate, and organize data from disparate sources and transfer it to data storage for analysis. Making sure the companies data technology is operating at its peak results in massive improvements to performance, cost, or both
  • Owning the stability of new products designed, including the on-going robustness, resilience and stability of these products
  • Building and maintaining custom ingestion pipelines

Experienced using the following software/tools:

  • Big data tools: Hadoop, Spark, Kafka, etc.
  • Relational SQL and NoSQL databases, including Postgres and Cassandra
  • Data pipeline and workflow management tools: Azkaban, Luigi, Airflow, etc
  • AWS cloud services: EC2, EMR, RDS, Redshift
  • Stream-processing systems: Storm, Spark-Streaming
  • Object-oriented/object function scripting languages: Python, Java, C++, Scala
  • Data Integration / Archiving / Relational Databases and Data Warehousing
  • MS SQL, Logic Apps, Function Apps, SSIS, SSRS
  • Microsoft Azure DevOps
  • Data Visualisation

Profile

  • Graduate degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Informatics, Information Systems or another quantitative field.
  • Advanced working SQL knowledge and experience working with relational databases, query authoring (SQL) as well as working familiarity with a variety of databases.
  • Experience building and optimizing 'big data' data pipelines, architectures and data sets.
  • Experience performing root cause analysis on internal and external data and processes to answer specific business questions and identify opportunities for improvement.
  • Strong analytic skills related to working with unstructured datasets.
  • Build processes supporting data transformation, data structures, metadata, dependency and workload management.
  • A successful history of manipulating, processing and extracting value from large disconnected datasets.
  • Working knowledge of message queuing, stream processing, and highly scalable 'big data' data stores.
  • Strong project management and organizational skills.

Experienced using the following software/tools:

  • Big data tools: Hadoop, Spark, Kafka
  • Relational SQL and NoSQL databases, including Postgres and Cassandra
  • Data pipeline and workflow management tools: Azkaban, Luigi, Airflow
  • AWS cloud services: EC2, EMR, RDS, Redshift
  • Stream-processing systems: Storm, Spark-Streaming
  • Object-oriented/object function scripting languages: Python, Java, C++, Scala
  • Data Integration / Archiving / Relational Databases and Data Warehousing
  • MS SQL, Logic Apps, Function Apps, SSIS, SSRS
  • Microsoft Azure DevOps
  • Data Visualisation

Job Offer

Opportunity to join a rapidly expanding team

Opportunity to work in an advanced analytics function

jobDescription: A London based Financial Consultancy Firm are looking for a Data Engineer to join their team. The Company This is an exciting opportunity for a Mid-Level Data Engineer to join the global firm who work within the financial space, including within the Banking and Insurance industries. The Role In your role as a Data Engineer, you will be focused on the delivery of a variety of proje...
fullDescription:
A London based Financial Consultancy Firm are looking for a Data Engineer to join their team.

The Company

This is an exciting opportunity for a Mid-Level Data Engineer to join the global firm who work within the financial space, including within the Banking and Insurance industries.

The Role

In your role as a Data Engineer, you will be focused on the delivery of a variety of projects which are central to the wider success of the data engineering team. These include but are not limited to; designing robust ETL and data pipelines which are capable of moving vast amounts of information around the business, constructing and maintaining continuous integration pipelines.

You will also be required to communicate the results to the client/team. 

Data Engineer Requirements

The requirements for the role are:

  • A degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics or a similar discipline
  • Experience architecting and developing data pipelines
  • Advanced knowledge of SQL
  • Strong cloud provider’s experience on at least one of AWS, Azure or GCP
  • Experience in Hadoop Ecosystem (Spark and Kafka)

In return, you will receive a salary of between £50,000 and £70,000 based on experience.

The company has moved to a virtual hiring and onboarding process for the foreseeable to ensure candidate and employee safety. Interviews for the role are already underway, so if you this sounds like the role for you then please apply now.

jobTitle: Lead Data Engineer (Relocation Opportunity in Manchester)
jobDescription: NB this role is based in Manchester City Centre Lead Data Engineer - £90,000- Banking - Manchester  Join a well-established player in the Banking industry who for ten consecutive years have held a four-star Fair banking mark and a 4 star rating on Trustpilot to recognise that we help customers manage money well. They’ve undergone a huge digital transformation in the past few years. ...
fullDescription:
NB this role is based in Manchester City Centre

Lead Data Engineer - £90,000- Banking - Manchester

Join a well-established player in the Banking industry who for ten consecutive years have held a four-star Fair banking mark and a 4 star rating on Trustpilot to recognise that we help customers manage money well.

They’ve undergone a huge digital transformation in the past few years. For example, they’ve revolutionised their mobile banking app so that it now has 3x the function it had when they started, and have really exciting plans in the pipeline. Their aim is to have the group be one of the leading digital businesses in Manchester and they are well on their way to achieving this vision.

It’s been incredible to watch them grow and develop over the past few years into a business that on one hand is slick, efficient and commercial, but also fosters a culture of putting people first - whether this by ensuring staff are happy, fulfilled and healthy, or the vast amount of volunteering and fundraising they do for good causes each year.

They are now looking for a Lead Data Engineer to join a diverse and friendly team, building dataflows into a data lake and data warehouse from a wide range of sources.

The wider Data Team is currently moving from a SQL Server based stack to a cloud-native solution in AWS. You will steer the development of a cloud native data platform that will enable sophisticated analysis and data science.

In this role you will:

  • Plan with analysts and data scientists on a regular basis to translate requirements into solutions and ensure delivery of successful business outcomes.
  • Architect the data warehouse and data lake for the cloud.
  • Ensure environments are stable and available.
  • Lead a team using Agile Kanban workflows to safely code, review, test and deploy solutions, using source control to manage changes.
  • Manage the DevOps processes for Data, and any tooling that guides the processes.
  • Design and build with the on-premise Microsoft BI stack, including SSIS, SQL Server and Power BI.
  • Design and build with an AWS-based BI stack, including Lambda, Redshift and Matillion.
  • Design and build connections to APIs, flat files, databases and data streams to our data lake (ELT).
  • Shape data from our data lake and form into a Kimball data warehouse (ETL).

About you:

  • Be experienced leading, mentoring and training a team of data engineers.
  • Be experienced with ETL tools like SQL, SSIS, AWS, Lambda and Python.
  • Be experienced with data warehouse concepts, including Kimball methodology.
  • Be experienced with SQL Server and Redshift management.
  • Have enthusiasm for deduction and problem solving, with a logical and curious mind.
  • Have a positive, enthusiastic and methodical attitude to development, business intelligence and data science.

Why work here?

As well as having the opportunity to work with, and learn from, one of the most commercially focused and results driven businesses in the North West, you’ll find lots of great extras too! These include:

  • Hapi benefits program, including discounts at leading supermarkets, cinemas and other leading retailers
  • On-site gym with free personal training
  • Personal lockers and showers
  • Basic 23 days holiday, plus public holidays. You’ll get an extra days’ holiday for every year served (up to 28 days)
  • An extra day of annual leave (taking the starting total to 24) on your birthday
  • Ability to buy and sell holiday entitlements
  • Paid Charity volunteer day, where the company give one working day a year to every employee to help out a charity
  • On-site training centre and self-learning facilities

Please note due to high volumes of applications unfortunately we are not always able to respond to all unsuccessful applicants. However we wish everyone who applies the very best with their job search.

As well as having the opportunity to work with, and learn from, one of the most commercially focused and results driven businesses in the North West, you’ll find lots of great extras too! These include:

  • Hapi benefits program, including discounts at leading supermarkets, cinemas and other leading retailers
  • On-site gym with free personal training
  • Personal lockers and showers
  • Basic 23 days holiday, plus public holidays. You’ll get an extra days’ holiday for every year served (up to 28 days)
  • An extra day of annual leave (taking the starting total to 24) on your birthday
  • Ability to buy and sell holiday entitlements
  • Paid Charity volunteer day, where the company give one working day a year to every employee to help out a charity
  • On-site training centre and self-learning facilities

fullDescription:
Global Manufacturer require a Data Engineer to work with developers, database architects / data scientists on strategic data initiatives. You will be responsible for expanding and optimizing data and pipeline architecture, as well as data flow/collection for cross functional teams. You will be an experienced data pipeline builder and data wrangler who enjoys optimizing data systems and building them from the ground up.

Client Details

Global Manufacturer / Distributor

Description

Global Manufacturer are looking for a Data Engineer to work with software developers, database architects, data analysts and data scientists on strategic data initiatives. The Data Engineer will be responsible for expanding and optimizing data and data pipeline architecture, as well as optimizing data flow and collection for cross functional teams. The ideal candidate is an experienced data pipeline builder and data wrangler who enjoys optimizing data systems and building them from the ground up.

As Data Engineer you will be responsible for:

  • Create and maintain optimal data pipeline architecture,
  • Assemble large, complex data sets that meet functional / non-functional business requirements.
  • Identify, design, and implement internal process improvements: automating manual processes, optimizing data delivery, re-designing infrastructure for greater scalability, etc.
  • Build the infrastructure required for optimal extraction, transformation, and loading of data from a wide variety of data sources using SQL/Non-SQL and Azure 'big data' technologies
  • Build analytics tools that utilize the data pipeline to provide actionable insights into customer acquisition
  • operational efficiency and other key business performance metrics
  • Work with stakeholders including the Executive, Product, Data and Design teams to assist with data-related technical issues and support their data infrastructure needs
  • Keep our data separated and secure across national boundaries through multiple data centres and Azure regions
  • Create data tools for analytics and data scientist team members that assist them in building and optimizing our product into an innovative industry leader.
  • Work with data and analytics experts to strive for greater functionality in our data systems.
  • For developing, constructing, maintenance and testing of data architectures, such as databases and large-scale processing systems
  • Clean, aggregate, and organize data from disparate sources and transfer it to data storage for analysis. Making sure the companies data technology is operating at its peak results in massive improvements to performance, cost, or both
  • Owning the stability of new products designed, including the on-going robustness, resilience and stability of these products
  • Building and maintaining custom ingestion pipelines

Experienced using the following software/tools:

  • Big data tools: Hadoop, Spark, Kafka, etc.
  • Relational SQL and NoSQL databases, including Postgres and Cassandra
  • Data pipeline and workflow management tools: Azkaban, Luigi, Airflow, etc
  • AWS cloud services: EC2, EMR, RDS, Redshift
  • Stream-processing systems: Storm, Spark-Streaming
  • Object-oriented/object function scripting languages: Python, Java, C++, Scala
  • Data Integration / Archiving / Relational Databases and Data Warehousing
  • MS SQL, Logic Apps, Function Apps, SSIS, SSRS
  • Microsoft Azure DevOps
  • Data Visualisation

Profile

  • Graduate degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Informatics, Information Systems or another quantitative field.
  • Advanced working SQL knowledge and experience working with relational databases, query authoring (SQL) as well as working familiarity with a variety of databases.
  • Experience building and optimizing 'big data' data pipelines, architectures and data sets.
  • Experience performing root cause analysis on internal and external data and processes to answer specific business questions and identify opportunities for improvement.
  • Strong analytic skills related to working with unstructured datasets.
  • Build processes supporting data transformation, data structures, metadata, dependency and workload management.
  • A successful history of manipulating, processing and extracting value from large disconnected datasets.
  • Working knowledge of message queuing, stream processing, and highly scalable 'big data' data stores.
  • Strong project management and organizational skills.

Experienced using the following software/tools:

  • Big data tools: Hadoop, Spark, Kafka
  • Relational SQL and NoSQL databases, including Postgres and Cassandra
  • Data pipeline and workflow management tools: Azkaban, Luigi, Airflow
  • AWS cloud services: EC2, EMR, RDS, Redshift
  • Stream-processing systems: Storm, Spark-Streaming
  • Object-oriented/object function scripting languages: Python, Java, C++, Scala
  • Data Integration / Archiving / Relational Databases and Data Warehousing
  • MS SQL, Logic Apps, Function Apps, SSIS, SSRS
  • Microsoft Azure DevOps
  • Data Visualisation

Job Offer

Opportunity to join a rapidly expanding team

Opportunity to work in an advanced analytics function

fullDescription:
Data Engineer

Bath

Salary: £35,000 - £45,000 + excellent benefits

Rapidly expanding Bath based business have an excellent opportunity for a Data Engineer to join their Digital Team. The company are leaders in their field and due to their global footprint have a varied and growing amount of data to work with. The Data Engineer would have the chance to make this position their own with the view of moving to a senior / lead role long term.

You will be responsible for expanding and optimising data and data pipeline architecture, as well as optimizing data flow and collection for cross functional teams. The ideal candidate is an experienced data pipeline builder and data wrangler, must be self-directed and comfortable supporting the data needs of multiple teams, systems and products.

Role:

  • Create and maintain optimal data pipeline architecture,
  • Assemble large, complex data sets that meet functional / non-functional business requirements.
  • Identify, design, and implement internal process improvements: automating manual processes,
  • optimizing data delivery, re-designing infrastructure for greater scalability, etc.
  • Build the infrastructure required for optimal extraction, transformation, and loading of data from a wide variety of data sources using SQL and BigQuery.
  • Work with stakeholders including the Executive, Product and Data teams to assist with data-related technical issues and support their data infrastructure needs.

Skills / experience:

  • Advanced working SQL knowledge and experience working with relational and no relational
  • databases
  • Some software development skills / coding knowledge in any language
  • Using tools to extract data from a wide variety of disparate sources
  • Experience building and optimizing 'big data' data pipelines, architectures and data sets beneficial
  • Any experience using Google Cloud Platform environments (BigQuery, Pub/sub, Cloud Functions, etc), BigQuery and No-SQL databases and Managing data from social media platforms would be useful but not essential

Contact David Southwood - Sanderson Recruitment

This position reports into the Lead Data Engineer and is responsible for providing technical  support in an MS based environment. Due to the ...
fullDescription:
Job Description

Data Engineer

£45k-£60k

London

Company Overview

I am currently working with a forward-thinking international insurer who is looking to hire a Data Engineer sitting in their Actuarial and Analytics department. This position reports into the Lead Data Engineer and is responsible for providing technical support in an MS based environment. Due to the close working relationship with Actuaries, this role would suit someone highly numerate ideally with a computer science, mathematics or similar background.

Your Responsibilities

  • Developing or redeveloping new or existing solutions that support analytics capabilities, database usage and dashboards using new or existing technologies
  • Developing and maintaining new and existing data warehouses, structures and loads
  • Understanding and analysing new datasets/warehouses as and when required.
  • Being involved in key data projects to help the company meet its strategic objectives.
  • Automating business processes using SQL, Python, SSIS or other relevant technologies.
  • Developing and maintaining C# applications used to automate business processes
  • Extracting, transforming and loading data to the right places in the right format
  • Liaising with other business units to help them identify and build the right solutions they require.

Required Experience

  • Highly numerate - expecting a good (2.1 or above) degree in mathematics/computer science or related disciplines with a minimum of 120 new (300 old) UCAS points.
  • Knowledge of at least one object orientated programming language is desirable e.g. C#, Python, R, MATLAB
  • Good knowledge of SQL is highly desirable
  • Knowledge of ETL techniques to support the transformation of data from a variety of sources, especially SSIS, would be an advantage
  • Scripting skills e.g. VBA (use with Excel)
  • Advanced knowledge of Microsoft Excel.

Please apply now if you are interested in being considered for this position.

fullDescription:
A leading and well known Scottish organisation require a Data Lead for a 12 month fixed term contract. This organisation are undertaking a number of exciting projects and require a Data Engineer with strong experience of Azure Data Factory and SSIS to support the team.

This client are maintaining working from home after the pandemic, and would only expect the successful candidate to attend meetings approx once per month in their Scottish office.

Morgan Hunt are looking for a Lead Data Engineer to be the technical lead on a new Azure data platform. The platform is one of the outputs of a new programme of work resulting from a recent investment to modernise existing technology and invest in state of the art data and analytical capabilities

- Provide the technical expertise on activities that consume data from a selection of source systems and move through Azure pipelines into Power BI dashboards and analytical products.

- Be a hands-on data engineer across the full stack as well a team leader who will be able to train and mentor others joining and developing into the team.

- Lead on Azure data technologies and data engineering, establishing best practices and creating new agile processes with the highest standards for coding and development.

- Be accountable to Technical Design authority, Data Panel, the Product Owner and ultimately the analytical community who rely heavily on this data to be managed appropriately to inform risk-based decision making.

-stay up to date on evolving technologies in this field and ensure the data platform and the team running it remain current and in adherence to data governance and compliance regulations.

Essential and desirable criteria

- Proven hands-on Data Engineering experience and Business Intelligence development.

- Experience in SQL programming skills.

- Strong Experience in Datamodelling, data warehouse design and data lake concepts and practices.

- Comfortable with Power BI management and integration with other analytical tools.

- Responsible to manage and train junior engineers/analysts.

- Experience working within data governance and compliance frameworks.

- Previous experience of building, maintaining and influencing relationships with a range of stakeholders.

- Previous experience of developing pragmatic, data led solutions to solve critical business challenges.

Morgan Hunt is a multi-award-winning recruitment business for interim, contract and temporary recruitment and acts as an Employment Agency in relation to permanent vacancies. Morgan Hunt is an equal opportunities employer. Job suitability is assessed on merit in accordance with the individual's skills, qualifications and abilities to perform the relevant duties required in a particular role.

About the Team The team is a diverse group of machine learning, AI, NLP and other data science experts. They work closely with the core businesses to conceive and produce innovati...
fullDescription:
We are looking for an experienced Data Engineer to join the development and modelling team of a global media agency.

The role supports and delivers on operations and research in a growing range of machine learning applications.

About the Team

The team is a diverse group of machine learning, AI, NLP and other data science experts. They work closely with the core businesses to conceive and produce innovative data applications, creating value and potentially disrupting current processes and business models.

They work directly with various business units across the entire group and work with stakeholders to identify and understand problems, propose solutions, and then deliver those solutions to a production standard within mission critical environments.

About the Role

As a data engineer you will be part of a team responsible for the development and overall delivery of their new big data analytics platform. In particular, you will be designing, building, and maintaining big data infrastructures. You should have a keen eye for details and an analytical mind.

The role offers an excellent opportunity for growth and to work on a wide variety of technologies including programming, relational and un-structured databases, cloud infrastructures, and visualization tools. You will develop deep domain expertise and generate key insights that influence business decisions and technological solutions.

Responsibilities

  • Working with product owners, analysts and data scientists to develop, build and improve ETL and data insight pipelines
  • Leading rapid and smooth transition of algorithms and processes developed by other parts of the organisation to production
  • Initiating, managing, and conducting research projects, working independently, but in close collaboration with junior and senior team members
  • Working with new and emerging languages and technologies ?
  • Supporting internal and external clients
  • Defining data retention policies

Requirements

  • Masters, or equivalent experience in a STEM (science, technology, engineering, mathematics) science
  • Proven track record of programming experience in python/R
  • Knowledge of data analysis, visualization techniques, and frameworks
  • Experience with development best practices such as source control, continuous integration, unit testing, design patterns, and agile development methodologies
  • Documented experience of designing efficient and robust ETL workflows
  • Documented experience of cloud-based technologies such as Windows Azure, AWS and/or GCP
  • To be able to assist in documenting requirements as well as resolve conflicts or ambiguities
  • Experience with relational and non-relational databases
  • Proficient understanding of distributed computing principles
  • Working Knowledge of visualization platforms
  • Provide secure public-facing access to modelling solutions via REST APIs
  • Experience of marketing and advertisement is not required, but you are expected to learn and understand the business logic behind the numbers, aiding developers and analysts to produce insights for clients
  • Understanding of web analytics, UI, and UX ?
  • Good knowledge of big data querying tools

This is a superb opportunity to join a team innoivating and disrupting in an established global business so be sure to apply now!

  • 5 years experience as a software engineer / developer in the past
  • 2 years experience developing data pipelines

fullDescription:
Salary: £60,000 - £65,000 per annum

Location: Bromley / remote for the time being
Benefits:

  • 9% pension contribution
  • Annual bonus
  • 25 days holiday
  • 50% off home, pet and motor insurance

Here at Jefferson Frank,we're dedicated to AWS recruitment-it's all we do.

We're the only global recruitment agency dedicated solely to AWS. Since June 2018, we've more than 1,600 AWS professionals across the world with great jobs working with AWS partners, ISVs and end users. No matter where you are in your career, or where you are in the country, we're in your corner making sure you land the right job with the right terms.

At Jefferson Frank we have an incredible opportunity to join one of the Sunday Times best big companies to work for on an exciting greenfield opportunity to seriously make your mark and have an strong and long lasting impact.

You'll have a start-up mentality within this well established business (as they do to!) and embrace the true scaled agile development processes. You will be working as part of a Scrum team aimed at delivering fast results in an Agile environment.

This is a career defining opportunity and a chance to be involved in the rescue industry, changing programme of work. You will be part of a wider technical team where you will work with some of the best in the business. You will have the opportunity to learn and grow whilst helping us deliver a companywide technology transformation project.

My client are looking for a Data Engineer able to help deliver their new AWS platform, using your strategic understanding of platforms and creating a scalable environment that can grow as they do.

They will need you to lead on the creation of processes for data deployment and integration to give their data analysts and data scientists the information they need when they need it to deliver the best service for their customers.

As a result of this, you will challenge conventions, continuously improve & innovate to deliver business values with the business.

What you'll be doing:

  • Using Python3 and your strong data modelling experience you will create production ready code, always striving to find the easiest and most direct solutions to connect and query their data.
  • Use your good understanding of data architecture to and deliver logical data structures at enterprise or programme level.
  • Bring your experience developing and analysing both SQL and NoSQL databases.
  • Foster and cultivate an Agile culture so that it will enable the smooth and rapid transitioning of prototype data products into robust product assets.
  • Using commercial awareness, influence and communicate across multiple business areas and partners to promote new opportunities for data to be used effectively.

What they'll give you:

When you join the team, you'll find yourself in the middle of one of the most on-the-go teams in the business, with autonomy and exposure to industry leaders on huge household brand names. They are always encouraging internal development and you'll have access to loads of learning opportunities, events and conferences to build your industry knowledge.

To find out more, don't hesitate and reach out now to Elliott Collins by email - or by phone on . We can run through the role in detail and discuss your ideals further.

If however this is not exactly what you're looking for, feel free to get in touch and we can talk about how we'll find the perfect opportunity for you.

This role will support the delivery of appropriate analytics tools for insight leads in teams across the organisation to be able to build reports and dashboards.

*Expert SQL Data Warehouse Developer with experience delivering enterprise data models, data warehousing and operational data stores, and developing data interfaces for reporting tools such as Power BI.
*Designing extract, transform and load (ETL) processes in a range of technologies e.g. Microsoft Azure Data Factory. Deploying data transformations, including data standardisation.

jobDescription: SQL Data Engineer Purpose and Background Are you a capable sql data engineer who is passionate about the power of data to solve environmental issues? Our client is looking for an sql data engineer to shape delivery by collaborating with data architects and modellers to contribute to the acquisition  of corporate data requirements, documenting them according to the required standards utilising t...
fullDescription:
SQL Data Engineer

Purpose and Background

Are you a capable sql data engineer who is passionate about the power of data to solve environmental issues? Our client is looking for an sql data engineer to shape delivery by collaborating with data architects and modellers to contribute to the acquisition of corporate data requirements, documenting them according to the required standards utilising the prescribed methods and Azure data tools, in order to build our centralised data platform.

This is a permanent role, with responsibility for developing, constructing, testing and maintaining architectures such as data pipelines and large-scale data processing warehouses. They will leverage industry best practice while delivering changes, such as agile backlogs, code repositories, automated builds, testing and releases. They will be responsible for ensuring data scientists can pull relevant data sets for their analyses, and implement data pipelines to connect operational systems, data for analytics and BI systems. They will re-engineer manual data flows to enable automation, scaling and repeatable use and develop data set processes for data modelling, mining and production.

The post holder will work closely with data architects (to determine what data management systems are appropriate) and data scientists (to determine which data are needed for analysis). They will provide clean, usable data to the business through the data platform in accordance with governance, and analyse, design, plan, execute and evaluate data requirements to support business activities and projects. The post holder will be central in ensuring the delivery of world-class digital products and changing the delivery culture in the company.

The Data Engineering Team’s primary remit is to improve the usability of the climate change, water, forests and cities data disclosed through robust and transparent methods. The team will create sustainable data pipelines for data quality monitoring, data cleaning, reporting and data science modelling. Harmonised data collected from external sources will enrich the data assets’ value and enhance accessibility for stakeholders. The team will produce value-adding insight delivering it through data products that help internal and external stakeholders to better understand the quantitative and qualitative results of their actions. This in turn helps stakeholders to make data-led decisions and optimise for all constraints. Through every stage the data assets are governed by the industry practice standards in a robust and transparent manner.

Key responsibilities include:

  • Managing the investigation of corporate data requirements, documenting them according to the required standards utilising the prescribed methods and tools
  • Implementing data flows to connect operational systems, data for analytics and BI systems. Re-engineer manual data flows to enable scaling and repeatable use
  • Working closely with data architects (to determine what data management systems are appropriate) and data scientists (to determine what data is needed for analysis).
  • Tackling problems associated with database integration and unstructured data sets
  • Ensuring that those using the data structures and associated components have a good understanding and that any queries are dealt with promptly and efficiently
  • In liaison with the information management or IT management functions, contributing to the development and maintenance of corporate data standards.
  • Ability to create efficient DW or DL structures to minimise cost of orchestration / processing and ingestion of data

Required skills and experience:

  • Strong technical process understanding regardless of technology
  • Wide range of strong technical skills (i.e. Azure Devops, Azure Data Factory, Data Bricks, SQL, python)
  • Core SQL Competencies - SSMS, SSIS, T-SQL, Stored Procedures
  • ADF Pipelines to build and populate SQL databases
  • Background in migrating traditional MS products to Azure
  • Very high attention to detail
  • Strong communication skills
  • Efficient in building ETL and ELT processes for enterprise solutions
  • Strong software delivery methods and knowledge
  • Strong performance-tuning skills

Desired skills and experience

  • Digital delivery - has a track record of working on DevOps delivery
  • Exposure in Climate Change data legislation, practices and stakeholders
  • Experience in Environmental related industries ie Water, Energy, Forestry related
  • Presentation skills
  • Understanding of architecting solutions taking into account wider considerations
  • Structured problem-solving techniques

This is a permanent full-time role, reporting to the Head of Data Engineering, which will be delivered remotely to start with. The post holder will be required to travel to the London office from time to time when it reopens.

Salary and benefits: Between £45,000 - £48,500 per annum dependent on experience, 30 days holiday excluding bank holidays, flexible working opportunities and others benefits.

Interested applicants must be eligible to work legally in the United Kingdom.

As a Senior Data Engineer you'll build and maintain ETL pipelines in Python and ensure performance and operations of the data infrastructure, data products and data APIs as well as designing and implementing new solutions for the data team and wider business. You'll provide subject matter expertise and keep up to date with emerging tools and technologies, pro-actively seeking improvements.

There's perks such as the latest MacBook Pro, licenses to any software you want to use, training and personal improvement budget, fresh fruit daily, breakfast, snacks, in-house bar open on Fridays and an annual company retreat.

The company is currently able to offer a remote interview and onboarding process as well as fulltime work from home; following social distancing measures you'll join colleagues in the Canary Wharf office with some continued flexibility going forward.

Requirements:
*Strong data engineering experience using Python
*Good knowledge of ETL and Data APIs
*Experience with Cloud technologies, GCP preferred but AWS also considered
*Good knowledge of relational and non-relational databases e.g. SQL, PostgreSQL, MySQL
*Understanding of how to best organise and model data for storage, retrieval and analysis
*Experience of working with software development teams
*Excellent communication and collaboration skills

As a Senior Data Engineer / Team Lead you will earn a competitive salary (to £85k) plus benefits including an annual bonus, generous holiday allowance, private medical insurance and subsidised gym membership.

Apply now or call to find out more about this Senior Data Engineer / Team Lead opportunity.

Initially you will be working remotely  but you will immerse your...
fullDescription:
Senior Data Engineer

A Senior Data Engineer is required to join an established IT Consultancy based in Edinburgh City Centre.

You will be joining a very well-established Data team where you'll be working on a plethora of different projects from start to finish working for various UK based clients, with the aim of delivering unrivalled services. Initially you will be working remotely but you will immerse yourself in the businesses culture of learning from day one - they are huge on professional certifications and will encourage you to get accredited across multiple courses (and being financially rewarded for doing so).

Culture is key for this organization and surrounding yourself with like-minded people, you'll be given constant opportunities to learn and develop your skill set and work on projects many can only dream about right from the get-go.

You

They are willing to consider varying experience levels however having at least some commercial experience will be required as you will be needed to hit the ground running on a variety of projects the team have already undertaken. Given the nature of the business you will be exposed to different stakeholders from all walks of life who may or may not be technical therefore good communication skills will be essential to your success.

You'll be technically gifted, have a real drive to learn and succeed and be a natural born problem solver.

Key Responsibilities

** Build and work on Data Warehouses and complex Data Pipelines

** Develop complex ETL processes

** Support all Data Infrastructure needs

** Extract data requirements from technical objectives

** Strong interpersonal and communication skills

Skill set

** Prior experience of ETL across multiple projects is required

** Any prior experience with Azure Data Factory would be beneficial but not essential

** Must be experienced in managing end to end projects whilst managing multiple stakeholders

** Experience managing database performance

** Experience with data architecture

If your wanting to be a part of an award-winning business who will give you exposure to projects with both smaller organisations and blue-chip companies, then this is the one for you. You'll be given every opportunity to be successful in this role with constant training being provided from day one and a culture centered around self-development.

If this position sounds of interest, please call Tom Edmondson at Cathcart Associates for more details.

jobTitle: Lead Data Engineer (Relocation Opportunity in Manchester)
jobDescription: NB this role is based in Manchester City Centre Lead Data Engineer - £90,000- Banking - Manchester  Join a well-established player in the Banking industry who for ten consecutive years have held a four-star Fair banking mark and a 4 star rating on Trustpilot to recognise that we help customers manage money well. They’ve undergone a huge digital transformation in the past few years. ...
fullDescription:
NB this role is based in Manchester City Centre

Lead Data Engineer - £90,000- Banking - Manchester

Join a well-established player in the Banking industry who for ten consecutive years have held a four-star Fair banking mark and a 4 star rating on Trustpilot to recognise that we help customers manage money well.

They’ve undergone a huge digital transformation in the past few years. For example, they’ve revolutionised their mobile banking app so that it now has 3x the function it had when they started, and have really exciting plans in the pipeline. Their aim is to have the group be one of the leading digital businesses in Manchester and they are well on their way to achieving this vision.

It’s been incredible to watch them grow and develop over the past few years into a business that on one hand is slick, efficient and commercial, but also fosters a culture of putting people first - whether this by ensuring staff are happy, fulfilled and healthy, or the vast amount of volunteering and fundraising they do for good causes each year.

They are now looking for a Lead Data Engineer to join a diverse and friendly team, building dataflows into a data lake and data warehouse from a wide range of sources.

The wider Data Team is currently moving from a SQL Server based stack to a cloud-native solution in AWS. You will steer the development of a cloud native data platform that will enable sophisticated analysis and data science.

In this role you will:

  • Plan with analysts and data scientists on a regular basis to translate requirements into solutions and ensure delivery of successful business outcomes.
  • Architect the data warehouse and data lake for the cloud.
  • Ensure environments are stable and available.
  • Lead a team using Agile Kanban workflows to safely code, review, test and deploy solutions, using source control to manage changes.
  • Manage the DevOps processes for Data, and any tooling that guides the processes.
  • Design and build with the on-premise Microsoft BI stack, including SSIS, SQL Server and Power BI.
  • Design and build with an AWS-based BI stack, including Lambda, Redshift and Matillion.
  • Design and build connections to APIs, flat files, databases and data streams to our data lake (ELT).
  • Shape data from our data lake and form into a Kimball data warehouse (ETL).

About you:

  • Be experienced leading, mentoring and training a team of data engineers.
  • Be experienced with ETL tools like SQL, SSIS, AWS, Lambda and Python.
  • Be experienced with data warehouse concepts, including Kimball methodology.
  • Be experienced with SQL Server and Redshift management.
  • Have enthusiasm for deduction and problem solving, with a logical and curious mind.
  • Have a positive, enthusiastic and methodical attitude to development, business intelligence and data science.

Why work here?

As well as having the opportunity to work with, and learn from, one of the most commercially focused and results driven businesses in the North West, you’ll find lots of great extras too! These include:

  • Hapi benefits program, including discounts at leading supermarkets, cinemas and other leading retailers
  • On-site gym with free personal training
  • Personal lockers and showers
  • Basic 23 days holiday, plus public holidays. You’ll get an extra days’ holiday for every year served (up to 28 days)
  • An extra day of annual leave (taking the starting total to 24) on your birthday
  • Ability to buy and sell holiday entitlements
  • Paid Charity volunteer day, where the company give one working day a year to every employee to help out a charity
  • On-site training centre and self-learning facilities

Please note due to high volumes of applications unfortunately we are not always able to respond to all unsuccessful applicants. However we wish everyone who applies the very best with their job search.

fullDescription:
Data Engineer

Coventry / Remote

Are you looking for a new opportunity to work on some seriously interesting projects ? Do you have strong commercial experience working in complex environments with prior exposure to the public sector ? A Data Engineer has the chance to join one of the United Kingdom's leading cyber security digital service provider's that were previously voted by the Sunday times as a top 10 company work for !

The Data Engineer will join an industry leading team of data experts helping to deliver innovative and exciting data projects across a range of industry sectors. You can expect to be involved in delivering innovation in Big Data, Data warehousing, Data analytics and Data migration.

In this role, you will be afforded the opportunity to work with likeminded experts in the world of Data Science and work on complex projects that directly impact the national security of the UK. It's fast paced, and at times a challenging environment, but with a highly rewarding and tangible benefits. For any Data Engineer looking to expand on their current expertise, this is a great opportunity.

Due to current Covid-19 restrictions, you will be onboarded remotely into this role but you should be flexible to travel to client site in Coventry as required.

Requirements:

  • Minimum 3 years' experience implementing multiple data / ETL projects
  • Experience working in agile environments
  • Comfortable working with cloud environments
  • Prior experience working with Big Query
  • Experience using an appropriate stack, such as Python, to migrate data
  • Ruby/ Ruby on Rails

If you're interested in working as a Data Engineer for a global leader in the cyber security and data industry, look no further, apply below for immediate consideration. Due to the high volume of applicants currently, it may not be possible to respond to all applications.

Role: Data Engineer

Location: Coventry / Remote

Agency: Anson McCade

Duration: ASAP - 31st May

Clearance: BPSS

Salary: Up to £500 p/d

Contact: Peter Vannet

Reference: *AMC*PVA/CBALDDEDF

They are looking for a Data Engineer to join the Central Insights team to help drive data throughout  the business. This is great opportunity for an experienced Data Engineer to work in a fast paced & challenging e...
fullDescription:
Data Engineer - Online Entertainment

Sphere Digital have partnered with one of the largest online gaming & sporting betting groups with over 10,000 employees and 13 offices across the world. They are looking for a Data Engineer to join the Central Insights team to help drive data throughout the business.

This is great opportunity for an experienced Data Engineer to work in a fast paced & challenging environment for a global online entertainment leader.

The Job

  • Build and automate data pipelines to support Data Science & Marketing operations
  • Manage data flows and advise data scientists on using the right data for the right task
  • Perform tests and optimise data preparation scripts for Machine Learning
  • Deploy and implement models produced by the data science team to a live production environment
  • Create automated alarming and dashboarding to monitor data integrity
  • Support on building an in-house bespoke Model manager application
  • Work with Data Warehouse team and central data team to help integrate new data sources into modelling environment
  • Collaborate with data scientists, data engineers, marketing and product Development
  • Be the go-to person for all data manipulation activities in the Google Cloud platform

You

  • Minimum 5 years in a Data Engineering role
  • Strong experience with SQL & Python is a must
  • Experience working in a cloud environment - Google cloud (GCP) or Amazon cloud
  • Experience in working with Airflow and docker technology
  • Understanding of Data Science & Machine learning functions
  • Experience in reporting tools like Tableau or similar
  • Good communication and stakeholder management skills, including presentation skills
  • Experience with continuous integration and continuous deployment pipeline implementations

What's in it for you?

  • Competitive salary - £65,000 - £75,000
  • Central London offices
  • Benefits
  • Flexible working & travel opportunities!

Apply Now

You can apply for this role now by sending us your CV or by calling us now!

Tom Gould

Senior Data Consultant

Sphere Digital Recruitment currently have a variety of job opportunities across digital so feel free to get in touch with us to find out how we can help you. You can see more of my current vacancies by looking at my profile here

Sphere Digital Recruitment are specialists in placing marketing, sales, analytics, product and creative ?talent globally.

Data Engineer Required Experience

The process will be a two stage remote process. The start date is flexible up to 1 weeks’ notice. The role is OUTSIDE IR35.

Why Should You Apply?

This is an excellent contract opportunity to join a client that are using cutting edge Science and Machine Learning to support a Global mission.

If this role isn't what you're looking for then don't worry, at X4 Technology we have excellent relationships with companies ranging from some of the most exciting start-ups to the biggest names in tech, covering a wide range of mid to senior level permanent and contract positions.

You can check out all of our roles on our website. Please apply via the link if you believe you are suited to this position or you can get in touch with me directly and I can run though all my current vacancies within the Data market. You will find me on LinkedIn @lydia-b-87084491 - X4 Technology

Any experience with AWS-based BI stack, including Lambda, Redshift, Snowflake and Matillion would  be very useful indeed!! These roles are due to their commitment to everything data-related and improving data science within the compa...
fullDescription:
Senior Data Engineer - AWS - Manchester

Senior Data Engineer x 2 with excellent AWS experience in tools such as ETL, Data Lakes, SQL, SSIS, & Python to join a leading organisation based in Manchester. Any experience with AWS-based BI stack, including Lambda, Redshift, Snowflake and Matillion would be very useful indeed!! These roles are due to their commitment to everything data-related and improving data science within the company, so plenty of new projects to get stuck into on day 1!

My client offers an excellent flexible working policy including working from home. As a Data Engineer, you will be building dataflows into a data lake & data warehouse from a wide range of sources as well as helping to steer the development of efficient data structures that will enable sophisticated analysis and data science

Experience required:

  • Work with ETL tools such as SQL, SSIS, AWS, Python etc.
  • Microsoft BI stack, including SSIS, SQL Server and Power BI
  • AWS-based BI stack, including Lambda, Redshift, Snowflake and Matillion
  • Comfortable with data warehouse concepts, including Kimball methodology
  • Experience of building dataflows into a data lake and data warehouse from a wide range of sources
  • Experience with visualisation development using tools like Cognos, SSRS, Power BI or Business Objects
  • Have a passion & enthusiastic attitude towards development, business intelligence and data science

These Data Engineer roles are varied and working with the latest technology. You will collaborate with other people in the large data team on daily basis as well as the wider business. Duties include:

- Connect APIs, flat files, databases and data streams to their data lake (ELT) as well as shaping data from their data lake and form into a Kimball data warehouse

- Build containers for data model endpoints

- Ensure that appropriate data quality, integrity and alerting is built into all solutions while building containers for data model endpoints

- Work with an AWS-based BI stack, including Lambda, Redshift, Snowflake etc as well as the Microsoft BI Stack

- Work in an Agile Kanban environment & assist with managing the DevOps processes for Data, and any tooling that guides the processes

- Contribute to the architecture of the data warehouse and data lake

My client is offering a starting salary of between £55,000 - £75,000 + Benefits including home working.

To apply, press apply now or please send your CV to matthew.leach @ circlerecruitment.com

Alternatively please connect with me in LinkedIn

The Company

The consultancy firm are leading Risk Optimization, Decision Analytics and Governance across financial institutions and have an exciting opportunity for a Data Engineer to come on board.

Data Engineer Role

This is a great opportunity for Data Engineers who have a strong academic background and at least one year commercial experience. 

The Data Engineer will be responsible for expanding and optimizing the data and data pipeline architecture on a modern cloyd native stack. 

Data Engineer Requirement

  • A Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or Engineering
  • Experience in Java, Golang, Python or C++
  • Experience using Big Data tools: Hadoop, Spark, Kafka etc.

In return, you will receive a competitive salary, based on experience.

The interview process will be conducted in two stages and the successful candidate is able to get started as soon as possible.

jobDescription: Data Engineer / ETL Developer / BI Developer - SQL, Talend, AWS, Redshift, Hadoop, Spark, Datawarehousing, Data Lakes, ETL Pipelines, Data Modelling. Insurance, London / Remote Working. (100% due to pandemic, fully flexible arrangements upon return to operational  environment.). Permanent, £70k - £75k +Bonus +Benefits ETL Developer / Data Engineer sought by multi-national Fintech company operating within the Ins...
fullDescription:
Data Engineer / ETL Developer / BI Developer - SQL, Talend, AWS, Redshift, Hadoop, Spark, Datawarehousing, Data Lakes, ETL Pipelines, Data Modelling. Insurance, London / Remote Working. (100% due to pandemic, fully flexible arrangements upon return to operational environment.). Permanent, £70k - £75k +Bonus +Benefits

ETL Developer / Data Engineer sought by multi-national Fintech company operating within the Insurance sector. You will be responsible for assisting in the productionisation of the Business Intelligence output by building out complex data transformation pipelines and processes.

This role requires a solid understanding of datamarts, datawarehouses, data lakes within the AWS cloud and multiple data sources, SQL / NoSQL databases. You will be responsible for large, complex data sets and the data pipelines feeding into business intelligence platforms and products.

Some of this work will be undertaken using Talend but no experience with this tool is necessary; you will work to re-architect the data pipelines and initiatives and recommend (and use) alternative ETL tools which work effectively in the AWS cloud environment.

The Data Engineer / ETL Developer will work closely with the BI Platform Product Manager to understand how data is best managed to ensure that reports, dashboards and automated reporting functionality can be delivered by the BI Developers and Data Scientists. The product is used by both internal and external clients and as such you will need to work with them to elicit requirements. Some aspects of data modelling will be required to manipulate, process and extract data from disparate sources.

We are searching for an ETL Developer / Data Engineer / BI Developer who possesses a solid understanding of SQL engineering / ETL engineering working with both SQL (ideally AWS Redshift, PostgreSQL, Oracle etc) and NoSQL databases. You will have worked with a number of ETL tools (such as Talend or other Java based open source tools) and have extensive experience building complex data pipelines in the AWS cloud. Experience with Hadoop for data stores and Apache Spark (or similar tools) for fault tolerant data stream processing would be advantageous. Excellent communication skills are pre-requisite. Experience working in a client facing capacity and/or within a Product focussed environment would be a distinct advantage. Insurance / Life Insurance experience an advantage but non-essential.

Exceptional opportunity to work within a stable, multi-national environment within a key role enabling the enhancement of enterprise level systems within a growing Fintech/Insurtech environment. Located in the City of London with excellent benefits and career progression prospects.

The company is onboarding staff during the pandemic with 100% work from home until normal business operation can be resumed at which point a flexible approach to a mix of office and home working will be enabled and fully supported.

This work will initially be undertaken with Talend but you will advise on the use of other tools over time.

The Data Engineer / ETL Developer will work closely with the BI Platform Product Manager to understand how data is best managed to ensure that reports, dashboards and automated reporting functionality can be delivered by the BI Developers and Data Scientists. The product is used by both internal and external clients and as such you will need to work with them to elicit requirements. Data cleansing, transformation and modelling will be required to manipulate, process and extract data from disparate sources such as .csv, JSON, XML as well as data from multiple structure environments.

We are searching for an ETL Developer / Data Engineer / BI Developer who possesses a solid understanding of SQL engineering / ETL engineering working with both SQL (ideally AWS Redshift, PostgreSQL, Oracle etc) and NoSQL databases. You will have worked with a number of ETL tools (such as Talend or other Java based open source tools) and have extensive experience building complex data pipelines in the AWS cloud. Experience with Hadoop for data stores and Apache Spark (or similar tools) for fault tolerant data stream processing would be advantageous. Excellent communication skills are pre-requisite. Experience working in a client facing capacity and/or within a Product focussed environment would be a distinct advantage. Insurance / Life Insurance experience an advantage but non-essential.

Exceptional opportunity to work within a stable, multi-national environment within a key role enabling the enhancement of enterprise level systems within a growing Fintech/Insurtech environment. Located in the City of London with excellent benefits and career progression prospects.

The company is onboarding staff during the pandemic with 100% work from home until normal business operation can be resumed at which point a flexible approach to a mix of office and home working will be enabled and fully supported.

fullDescription:
Lead Data Engineer

London

£80,000 - £100,000 + Benefits


This Data Engineer role will allow you to expand and utilise your skills in a growing team working along side one of the largest data sets in the UK.

The Company

As a global leader they generate tons of data and are constantly discovering new ways to manipulate mass data sets to understand their customers and optimise every aspect of their experience.

The Role

As a Data Engineer, you can expect to be working with a small team of like-minded individuals on an endless amount of data in an agile environment

Responsibilities Include:

  • Build and design scalable real-time and batch data pipelines in a cloud environment
  • Deploy CI/CD pipelines in AWS
  • Convert algorithms, models and features into production solutions

fullDescription:
Job title: Chinese-Mandarin speaking Data Engineer
Location: Birmingham, Halesowen (+ in-house relocation assistance available)
Salary: £45,000 - £50,000 (£neg) + benefits (inc private pension, free onsite gym, free breakfast/lunch, 26 days holiday + much more).
Keywords: Data Engineer, ETL, Hadoop, SQL, MySQL, Excel, Data Architecture, Database, Business Statistics, Chinese Mandarin, Birmingham.


Chinese-Mandarin speaking Data Engineer with expertise in Data Engineering, ETL, SQL and Hadoop is highly sought by a multiple award winning games studio based in Birmingham who are the UK’s largest privately owned mobile e-gaming studio! We currently have just over 300+ employees here at our Birmingham HQ with our services offered across multiple platforms (web, mobile, tablet) with over 5mn+ registered customers here in the UK alone!


In this position, you will work as part of our international Data Analytics team (based in UK and Taiwan) to create and maintain an optimal data pipeline architecture, using ETL of data from a wide variety of data sources and providing practical solutions to ultimately improve the way we work and bring value to the business and our customers!


You will work collaboratively with multiple departments across the business including; Finance, Marketing, Games Development and our on-site Contact Centre. As a Data Engineer, you will identify, design and implement internal process improvements, automating manual processes and optimising data delivery for greater scalability. Communicating on a daily basis with our office in Taiwan, you will be assembling large, complex datasets to meet business requirements, and assist with any data-related technical issues and support data infrastructure needs.


Data Analytics is a huge part of everything we do here at the studio from game releases, marketing campaigns, user experience and the whole customer engagement experience as we continue to grow, learn and adapt as a business.


Key skills we’re looking for…

  • Degree in Computer Science/Information Systems (or related disciplines)
  • Minimum 5 years as Data Engineer/ETL Development
  • Excellent Microsoft Excel skills.
  • Excellent SQL/MySQL skills.
  • Experience in an analytical role within a customer focused digital business.

Bonus points for…

  • Willing to learn 'Big Data’ systems such as Hadoop, Hive, Map Reduce (or similar).
  • Experience in business analysis / CRM analysis
  • Experience working on concurrent projects

Therefore, if you are an experienced Data Engineer within Business Analytics with excellent ETL and SQL skills and you would like to join a multiple award winning eGaming studio who have been accredited as one of the 'Top 1000 Companies to Inspire Britain’, been recognised by the BBC as a top technology employer and have a 1 star accreditation as a 'Top Company to Work For’ then send in your CV today for review!

• Join one of the UK's leading green technology firms.

This client is building a new team as they continue to progress their technological capabilities. They are a data-driven organisation, it guides their strategic decision-making and service/product development. What you'll be doing

This role requires a range of data engineering activities including; prototyping, ETL pipelines, architecture, process automation and more.

  • Minimum of 5 years' experience in data or software engineering
  • Solid ETL pipelining experience
  • Scala/Java/Python development experience

A base salary of up to £95,000 with excellent bonuses and benefits package including remote working.

We arrange over 15,000 new customer life insurance policies per month with leading sales conversions  and customer satisfaction metrics. The business is outbound, B2C sales from internet generated customer enquiries.  We are the 2019 BESMA S...
fullDescription:
Company

Reassured Ltd is the largest non-advised life insurance intermediary in the UK with established locations in Basingstoke, Portsmouth, Southampton & Manchester. We arrange over 15,000 new customer life insurance policies per month with leading sales conversions and customer satisfaction metrics. The business is outbound, B2C sales from internet generated customer enquiries.

We are the 2019 BESMA Sales employer of the year, 2019 BESMA Sales team over 50 people of the year & Inspire 19 employer of the year. In 2018, Reassured was awarded the Princess Royal Training Award for outstanding achievements in on boarding and developing our employees. We have also just been voted number 12 on Sunday Times' best Companies to work for in Mid Size Business category.

Job Purpose

Reassured's web based CRM system has been developed internally and has currently got a strong team of developers maintaining, expanding and creating functionalities, providing the business with the flexibility to quickly expand, adapt and/or change depending on the market and business needs.

The role of the Data Engineer is to look after all of the company maintained databases across our entire estate, the internal CRM and those connected to public facing websites. The Data Engineer will develop and implement data flows to connect the different operational systems as well as data required for analytics and business intelligence systems.

The Data Engineer will take responsibility for our data pipelines, databases, data warehouse and data lakes, working closely with the IT teams and Senior IT Managers to ensure maximum uptime, appropriate back-up and disaster recovery solutions in place as well as ensuring Information Security, Cybersecurity and GDPR policies are applied on our day to day processes.

The ideal person has to have a significant set of technically skills, including deep knowledge of (My)SQL. Likewise, an excellent communicator, the person will have the ability to question non-technical colleagues and be able to work across departments to understand what MI is important to business leaders from the different datasets.

Key Responsibilities

  • Develop and implement data flows to connect the different operational systems as well as data required for analytics and business intelligence systems.
  • Maintain and update existing databases across Reassured’s internal and external systems
  • Writing and optimising SQL statements
  • Writing and optimising ETL scripts.
  • Maintain data dictionaries and source-to-target mappings
  • Support the IT developers to write better SQL statements
  • Design, build and test data products based on feeds from multiple systems using a range of different storage technologies and/or access methods.
  • Plan resource requirements from high level specifications
  • Creating technical specifications and test plans
  • Provide regular reports on the state of the company’s databases
  • Translates data into valuable insights that inform technical and business decisions
  • Keep up to date with advances in digital analytics tools and data manipulation products
  • Carry out other responsibilities as required by management
  • Overnight maintenance and updates on an as required basis
  • Always be punctual and respectful of other employees
  • Be polite and represent the business respectfully

Knowledge, Skills & Experience

  • Proven data, analytics and engineering skills
  • Writing and optimising SQL, MySQL
  • Database Administration
  • Data Warehousing
  • Data Streaming
  • Data Integration and Analytics (Snowflake, Wherescape, Power BI, etc)
  • Managing and testing database backup and restore procedures
  • Monitoring system performance with a view to capacity planning
  • MySQL clustering and database replication
  • Familiarity with other SQL/NoSQL databases such as PostgreSQL and MongoDB
  • Replication configuration using Percona XtraBackup
  • De-facto standards and best practices in MySQL/Percona, particularly security
  • Knowledge of MySQL and Percona-specific features and functions

We do not accept unsolicited third party applications. All third party inquiries should be directed to the Recruitment Team in first instance.

Data Engineer

Are you looking for a new opportunity to work on some seriously interesting projects ? The Data Engineer will join an industry leading team of data experts helping to deliver innovative and exciting data projects across a range of industry sectors. You can expect to be involved in delivering innovation in Big Data, Data warehousing, Data analytics and Data migration.

It's fast paced, and at times a challenging environment, but with a highly rewarding and tangible benefits. For any Data Engineer looking to expand on their current expertise, this is a great opportunity.

Due to current Covid-19 restrictions, you will be onboarded remotely into this role but you should be flexible to travel to client site in London as required.

  • Experience using an appropriate stack, such as Python, to migrate data

If you're interested in working as a Data Engineer for a global leader in the cyber security and data industry, look no further, apply below for immediate consideration. Due to the high volume of applicants currently, it may not be possible to respond to all applications.

fullDescription:
A permanent opportunity has arisen for a Big Data Engineer to join an organisation as they grow their Data function. You will be joining a fairly new department that has seen excellent growth and are continuing to do so through 2021.

They’re looking for an experienced Data Engineer with a deep understanding and interest of everything data with good software engineering skills. You will be creating data solutions to scale their data on a wide range of projects to support their continued growth.

You will also work with the business to create highly scalable data solutions and pipelines, create workflows to ingest data into their Data Warehouse/Data Lake and consult the business on ways to improve how they’re using their data to improve reliability and quality.

You’ll also have the following skills and experience.

  • Data Engineering experience with AWS using Athena/Redshift
  • Knowledge of both relational and non-relational database systems and concepts
  • Strong ETL experience with AWS Glue, EMR / Spark
  • Coding experience in Python, Java, Spark-SQL or R
  • Data modelling experience to visualise data requirements to aid technical design.

The salary for this position is dependent on the individual, as is the remote working arrangements (which is discussed at offer stage). You will also receive a comprehensive benefits package which include shares, pension, life insurance, holidays and more.

Broster Buchanan are in search for a Data Engineer to join an exciting, growing SME in the heart of London. My client specialises in Consultancy within a highly niche sector and supplies exceptional services and solutions to a plethora of clients. The business is going through an exciting growth period and despite being a very young business, they have grown headcount by 50% worldwide in just the last 12 months.

The salary offering for this position is £70,000 to £80,000 plus bonus plus other great benefits and we are ready to start interviewing imminently.

* Design and implementing new solutions for the data remit
* Deploy industry related technology and building inhouse solutions
* Build / maintain ETL jobs and tasks via Python
* Support ongoing company data initiatives on a strategic level

* A minimum of 4 years experience as a Data Engineer
* Hands on management of cloud infrastructure
* Highly experienced in using Python and SQL
* Experience of GCP and AWS will prove valuable
* Ability to build and maintain API's
* Understanding of data governance and metadata
* Experience in Airflow or similar tooling programmes

* Comfortable at communicating with internal and external stakeholders including the clients of the business

This is an exciting opportunity for someone looking to further their career in the data world.
