fullDescription:
• Fast-paced, creative e-commerce business
  • Latest tech stack 
  • Exciting tech transformations 

An exciting opportunity to join a fast-paced, creative e-commerce/ marketplace company based in London. Over the last 12 months, the company has been working hard on progressing their tech platform and customer experience and are now looking to take the business to the next level. With over 12 million website visitors per month, and their current product offering doubling this year, this is a great time to join.

The company is using cutting-edge technology including React, Next JS, GraphQL, AWS ECS, Lambdas, Java and there a number of super exciting projects in the pipeline. They are a nurturing business that focuses on learning, development, agile working, and team/ individual autonomy.

What skills you’ll need

  • Full-stack software development experience
  • Extensive experience with Python
  • SQL proficiency
  • Experience using Cloud DevOps tools like AWS, GCP with CloudFormation and/or Terraform
  • A solid understanding of database systems
  • Great communication skills
What you’ll be doing

Data is at the center of this fast-paced business and using data well allows them to better understand their customer trends. This role will sit in the software engineering/ tech team. This team is accountable for ensuring that data flows and can be used effectively by the data scientists/ machine learning team.
As a Senior Data Engineer, you will design, build, and run innovative solutions using market-leading data platform technologies. This is a senior role, so you also be responsible for supporting more junior team members, upskilling, and working with your peers to make decisions.
You will be passionate, creative, and have a great interest in the latest technologies.

What you’ll get in return for your talents

A fantastic salary, great holiday allowance, up to 10-15% bonus and many other benefits and perks

What’s next?

Please apply with your up to date CV and Sophie will be in touch

Up to £45,000 + Competitive Bonus and Benefits

This is an exciting opportunity to join a disruptive challenger bank. You will work in a dedicated engineering function with the chance to learn and pick up the newest Big Data technologies that are sought after globally. They're looking for an enthusiastic learner that is looking to transition into a senior role and is willing to push the boundaries.

The Role

In this role you will be able to shape your own career and receive some of the best training to help you do so. You will focus on maintaining the data lake, debugging issues that arise. You will:

  • Monitor daily BAU data pipelines and ensure data solution is up to date
  • Enhance processes and develop on the data lake build using SQL and Scala/Python
  • Work in an agile team controlling development and CI/CD release processes

Key Skills & Requirements

  • Experience with data solution BAU processes (ETL, Table, refresh etc)
  • Strong knowledge of database SQL technologies i.e. Oracle, SQL Server
  • Experience in programming language - Scala or Python

HOW TO APPLY

fullDescription:
A Global Management Consultancy firm are on the lookout for a Data Engineer to join their Data and Analytics Team.

The Company

This is an exciting opportunity for a Mid-Level Data Engineer to join the consultancy operating in global markets.

The Data Engineering Role

In your role as Data Engineer, you will be provided with introductory training before being placed on client projects.

Your role will be focused on the delivery of a variety of projects helping customers. These could include but are not limited to; building Big Data pipelines and reliable Data Platforms.

Data Engineer Requirements

The required skills for the role are:

  • A Bachelor’s degree or higher in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics or equivalent
  • Experience with loud Platforms including AWS and Azure
  • Databases e.g. Amazon RDS, Redshift or Snowflake
  • Data Engineering toolsets such as Spark, Databricks and Hadoop
  • Excellent interpersonal and communication skills

In return you will receive a salary of between £60,000 and £80,000 per annum.

The interview process and the role will be conducted remotely for the foreseeable. When appropriate, on occasion travel may be expected.

Interviews for the role are already underway, so if you this sounds like the role for you then please apply now.

Lead Data Engineer

£70,000 - £90,000

Building the platform of tomorrow can't be built in one night, but this global leader of their field is investing in Data & Analytics to keep themselves at the top.

Your goal will be building the data pipelines and architecting the ETL processes that'll lead into their visualisation dashboards. You'll be working with unstructured and structured data supporting the data warehouse build and moving towards big data.

You'll need a proven track record of data pipelines and ETL architecting alongside your involvement with data warehousing and analytics systems whilst working with stakeholders to understand the business of today and be forward thinking to understand the business of tomorrow.

Essential

  • Track record of hands-on data pipelines and ETL architecture
  • ETL (open to technology, Talend, Stitch, SSIS)
  • Data Warehousing
  • Big Data exposure (open to technology, Snowflake, Azure, Redshift)
  • Dashboarding (open to technology, Power BI, Tableau, Qlikview)

This vacancy will be closing application on December 10th 2020. If you have any questions or fancy a chat about the opportunity feel free to give George Bone a call on or apply for the advert and George will be in contact.

Data Engineer | Data Warehouse | ETL | Architecture | Analytics | Talend | Stitch | SSIS | Snowflake | Azure | Redshift | Power BI | Tableau | Qlikview | Big Data | Cambridge | £70,000 - £90,000

This position is commutable from Cambridge, Milton Keynes, Bedford, London, Northampton, Peterborough, Luton and everywhere in-between.

Data Engineer

London - Remote for the foreseeable future

Tec Partners are looking for an enthusiastic data engineer or similar data role to work for an award-winning pharmaceutical intelligence and analytics company. Their mission is to ensure that the world will become a better place by providing consistently renewed data on the pharmaceutical market, to aid companies in their strategic decision making.

As a Data Engineer, you will be joining the new Data engineering team. As a Data Engineer you will work predominantly in Python, AWS, Redshift and Sagemaker. The Data Engineer will be involved in supporting the product team in creating predictive machine learning models, manipulating large data sets, and extracting insightful information.

Data Stack:

Python, AWS, Redshift/glue, sagemaker.

Requirements for the Data Engineer:

Experience in a Data Engineer role or similar.

Proficient experience in Python and AWS.

Preferably experience with data modelling.

Experience in working closely with other teams.

Benefits for the Data Scientist:

Competitive Salary

10% pension contribution.

Extensive Training.

25 Days Holiday.

fullDescription:
DATA ENGINEER

READING (REMOTE WORKING)

UP TO £60,000

Harnham are partnered with a global FMCG company who are looking for a data engineer to join their R&D team to help productionise their ML models.

THE COMPANY

This company are a global leader in selling consumer products. They have offices across the world that work closely with each other to produce consistent results. This company ingests huge volumes of data due to their size and require a data engineer to help build pipelines to ingest, transform and distribute data. Their UK R&D team is based in Reading and are working with Computer Vision to detect faults with products on their supply chains.

THE ROLE

  • You will sit within the R&D team, working with cutting-edge technology on Data Science specific projects.
  • You will be building data pipelines to ingest, transform and distribute data according to R&D initiatives
  • You will be deploying ML models and solutions development with data scientists.
  • You will be developing solutions and working through it in an end-to-end role: from modelling, through to implementation.

YOUR SKILLS AND EXPERIENCES

  • You will have extensive experience in Python.
  • You will have experience in cloud technologies such as AWS, GCP or Azure.
  • You will have worked with SQL and No-SQL databases.
  • You will need an Masters or a PhD in a stats based subject.

HOW TO APPLY

Please register your interest by sending you CV to Callum Castling via the apply link on this page.

fullDescription:
Role: Data Engineer

Location: Remote / Central London

Salary: £50,000 to £65,000   

Trading data is complex. So is sports data.

Can you wrangle and tame it? Make it usable?

Turn it into something more powerful?

Create the low-latency engines that drive this data into highly accurate prediction models that are critical to decision making and risk management.

Data underpins every decision made – on the pitch, the energy markets, or in business.

Join a culture of learning, collaboration and execution throughout. Join a team that knows their craft and are being recognised across the trading sector.

Based remotely at first, then between home and the London office. You can work with top clients in a powerful niche market to provide the information required to make the right decisions and build a world-class data resource.

Qualifications

  • Experience with SQL and using AWS
  • Strong Python / scripting experience
  • Capable of managing database performance
  • Architectural experience, building ETL processes
  • Client engagement and stakeholder management
  • Numerate Degree 

Call me, email me, or send a message on Linked In.

Connor Perry 

Associate Consultant - Blue Pelican Marketing 

 

You can view all our vacancies on our web site www.bluepelican.com , or call and ask for the marketing division.

fullDescription:
My client is automating the bookkeeping of small businesses using machine learning. They currently have 10,000 businesses using their new technology and are targeting 250,000 businesses within the next 2 years. They are already a market leader for accountancy software with over 1 million small businesses as clients.

This position will fit within a team of 3 data scientists and 7 developers. As the only data engineer within the team, you will be expected to be able to work autonomously.

Scope of the role :

  • Create and maintain data pipelines to extract, transform and load data from various data sources.
  • Manage prototyping environment for the data scientists.
  • Working with DevOps to automate pipeline from/to production environments
  • Support data scientists to write scalable pre-processing and training jobs.
  • Setup analytics tools to monitor models accuracy.

Expected skills & experiences :

  • Understanding of machine learning concepts (e.g. tree-based methods, logistic / linear regression, neural networks) and their practical applications.
  • A successful history of manipulating, processing and extracting value from large disconnected datasets.

Tech stack :

Required:

  • Azure Kubernetes (AKS)
  • Azure ML
  • Python / PyData stack

Nice to have:

  • Node.js
  • Azure DevOps
  • MongoDB
  • Azure Storage
  • Elasticsearch
  • SQL Server
  • Kafka
  • Spark

jobDescription: Join BMG’s Group Technology team!Your Mission at BMG. We have an exciting opportunity for a Data Engineer to join BMG's Group technology team be responsible for helping business decisions by supporting the sales analytics teams with building high-quality and automated data pipelines. Your Responsibilities.  Automate Data Quality reporting for sales data pipeline...
fullDescription:
Join BMG’s Group Technology team!

Your Mission at BMG.

We have an exciting opportunity for a Data Engineer to join BMG's Group technology team be responsible for helping business decisions by supporting the sales analytics teams with building high-quality and automated data pipelines.

Your Responsibilities.

  • Automate Data Quality reporting for sales data pipelines.
  • Overlook ETL architecture and code quality of sales data pipelines.
  • Ensure business logic is correctly translated into code and documented.
  • Enable users from multiple business units to efficiently access sales data via BI Tools, SQL interfaces and Jupyter Hub.
  • Ensure alignment of entity hierarchies across different business units.

Your Profile.

Essential Skills & Experience

  • 2 years of work experience in the field
  • Ability to communicate with both technical and business experts.
  • Pro-active and collaborative
  • High sense of accountability
  • Desire to help and support other people learning new skills
  • Advanced SQL
  • Python
  • Good understanding of cloud computing
  • Understand characteristics of different database systems
  • Know how to use Git
  • Undergraduate degree in an engineering or quantitative subject
  • Interest in Coding and Data
  • Interest in Music

Desirable (but not essential) Skills & Experience

  • Open source contributions in the field of data engineering
  • Demonstrable ability in self-directed learning
  • Scala and Java
  • ML engineering skills
  • Apache Airflow and Spark
  • Jupyter Hub
  • Google BigQuery
  • PostgreSQL
  • Google Datastudio and Tableau (optional)

Now, what's in it for you?

  • 25 days annual leave plus 3 days between Christmas & New Year
  • Subsidised gym membership
  • Private Health Insurance
  • Competitive pension scheme
  • Annual gig allowance
  • Artist showcases
  • Cycle to work scheme
  • Season Ticket Loan
  • Access to our Employee Assistance Programme
  • Give As You Earn Scheme
  • Flexible working
  • Excellent development opportunities
  • A fun and sociable office environment (Currently virtual!)

What you should know about us.
Founded in 2008, BMG is already the world’s fourth biggest music publisher and the first new global player in the recordings business in decades. BMG’s pitch is unique - a relentless focus on fairness and transparency and service to its artist and songwriter clients.

BMG’s 19 offices across 12 core music markets now represent over 3m songs and recordings, and thousands of artists and songwriters attracted by its fresh approach which now includes production music, film and books as well as music publishing and recordings.

BMG is owned by international media, services and education company Bertelsmann, whose other content businesses include the broadcaster RTL Group, the trade book publisher Penguin Random House and the magazine publisher Gruner + Jahr. With its multi-platform perspective, integrated technology platform and commitment to help artists maximize their income, BMG aims to be the best company in music to do business with.

This organisation has a global presence and supports 80 million customers.  They pride themselves on their excellent employees, high-level operating performance and financial strength.  The successful Senior Data Engineer will:  Develop inter...
fullDescription:
My client, one of the world's biggest providers on insurance, is looking for a Senior Data Engineer to joining a central team and build innovative, user-facing tools and applications. This organisation has a global presence and supports 80 million customers. They pride themselves on their excellent employees, high-level operating performance and financial strength.

The successful Senior Data Engineer will:

  • Develop interactive dashboards and reporting solutions
  • Work with IT and other Analytics stakeholders to productionise data-flows from different internal and external data systems into a centralised data lake
  • Develop new ingestion processes within the cloud-based platform
  • Become an expert and support the wider business on data processing and coding best practice

Successful candidates will likely:

  • Have significant experience with SQL and modern databases
  • Be passionate about data visualisation
  • Have command of Python (PySpark is desirable)
  • Have an interest in learning to use new, exciting technologies such as Palantir's Foundry platform

Some nice to haves:

  • Experience using JavaScript/TypeScript (highly desirable)
  • Front end languages (HTML/CSS)
  • An understanding of GIT style programming controls

Please apply now if you would like to be considered!

Keywords: Insurance, Data Engineer, Analytics, Insight, Visualisation, Python, Cloud Computing, Distributed Computing, SQL, ETL, JavaScript, Palantir

Eames Consulting is acting as an Employment Agency in relation to this vacancy.

DATA ENGINEER

£50,000 - £60,000

LONDON

This is an exciting opportunity for a mid- level Data Engineer with Python, Cloud, and SQL skills to work within a creative environment.

THE COMPANY:

This role is with a large international business within the television industry. The company are undergoing a digital transformation and with over 1 billion live members, there is a lot of data to deal with hence the need to build out the data function.

THE ROLE:

  • Pulling Data from multiple sources in different formats (JSON, databases, web services.)
  • Dealing with end to end ETL processes.
  • Data cleansing and creating models and data pipelines.
  • Identifying relevant data sets by interacting with stakeholders.
  • Working closely with Data Scientists to ensure they have the required data to build use case models.

YOUR SKILLS & EXPERIENCE:

  • Strong Python programming experience.
  • Experience with cloud tech (AWS/GCP/Azure)
  • Commercial experience with Data management systems (Hadoop, Spark, Oracle, SQL)
  • A relevant university degree (computer science/engineering/maths/stats/Physics) or relevant professional experience.

THE BENEFITS

This opportunity offers a salary of £50,000 - £60,000 plus added benefits.

HOW TO APPLY

fullDescription:
DATA ENGINEER

LONDON (REMOTE WORKING)

UP TO £75,000

Harnham are partnered with a home furnishing retailer, that has superstores placed all over the UK. They are looking for a data engineer to join their expanding and newly successful team to design and build tools for their analytics platforms.

THE COMPANY

The company are a traditional business that sell products in physical stores ranging across the requirements to furnish a home. They have been massively scaling their website in recent years and have introduced advanced analytics platforms to understand data. They broke all website sale records across COVID and are one of EU's biggest AWS Lambdas server less consumers. They require a team of data engineers to continue to expand on their customer data platform.

THE ROLE

  • You will be building and gathering data for the BI team, using Power BI as their new reporting solution
  • You will be helping to ingest data to a new Snowflake data warehouse
  • You will be working on a server-less platform, ensuring performance is enhanced therefore must have used AWS Lambdas
  • You will also contribute to their infrastructure as code set-up therefore must be familiar with terraform or cloud formation

YOUR SKILLS AND EXPERIENCES

  • Extensive experience using AWS Lambdas
  • An expert Python programmer
  • Knowledge of the complete software development life cycle (CI/CD, TDD)
  • Highly experienced in event-driven architecture such as Kinesis/Kafka

THE BENEFITS

  • Up to £75,000 per annum
  • Remote working

HOW TO APPLY

Please register your interest by sending you CV to Callum Castling via the apply link on this page.

fullDescription:
Data Engineer | Dunstable | Permanent

We have an exciting opportunity for a Data Engineer within our Support Centre in Dunstable. Can you take commercial data and turn it into actionable insights? Harness the full potential of bleeding-edge technologies, while enabling business stakeholders to understand complex data? If so, then we would love to hear from you!

Whitbread is the UK's leading hospitality company in the FTSE 100 including brands such as Premier Inn and Beefeater. By the end of 2020, our goal is to increase the number of Premier Inn UK rooms to an incredible 85,000. All while creating around 3,000 UK jobs a year and continuing to expand our presence worldwide. There has never been a more exciting time to Whitbread!

About the role:

Our data engineering team here at Whitbread are facing an exciting period of growth and there is a real opportunity to have a huge impact in delivering business-value to stakeholders.

You will deliver data projected across:

  • Premier Inn - Automated Trading Engine
  • Premier Inn and Restaurants - Customer Hub

We are proud of our tech stack, where you will have the opportunity to work with Azure Data Factory, Data Bricks, Data Synapse, CosmosDB, Python.

What you’ll be doing:

  • Delivers across the entire software delivery life cycle – concept, design, build, deploy, test, release into post implementation support.
  • Ensures work is of the highest quality and performs code/peer reviews within the team and across teams.
  • Specifies user/system interfaces and translates logical designs into physical designs taking account of target environment, performance requirements and existing systems.
  • Ensures all deliverables are well documented, re-usable, tested and conform to agreed architecture design patterns and coding standards.
  • Undertakes analytical activities required to support the development and maintenance of systems.
  • Provides support on key products should there be an incident / problem related to a product that’s now live and requires a development fix.
  • Supports the relevant project/backlog delivery events; planning / user story estimation, daily stand-ups, sprint reviews/ demos & retrospectives.
  • Supports / collaborates with the team and takes ownership of driving forward relevant stories (updating the ticket on the Kanban board & Jira).
  • Jointly responsible with the team for converting the Product backlog into ‘Done’ potentially releasable increments.

What you’ll need:

  • Azure Data Services (Data Factory, Databricks, Synapse Analytics)
  • Microsoft BI experience (SSAS, SSIS, SSRS, Power Platform)
  • Solid experience of T-SQL (stored procedures, functions)
  • Integration and ETL experience
  • Experience of Tableau or Power BI
  • Experience with relational and multi-dimensional databases and data modelling
  • Experience with NoSQL databases (Cosmos preferred)
  • Able to conduct requirements gathering and train business users

fullDescription:
Data Engineer Preston - up to £55,000

This role will be a fixed term contract till the end of 2021 with a good opportunity to extend due to the project work load and it can offer working from home with some travel in to the head offed which is in Preston depending on the project needs.

There is a need for an Data Engineer to lead the development of specific projects supporting the programme as part of this team. The Role will be focused on ensuring the portfolio of data and data science projects that are required by the Developments and Construction division are fulfilled. This involves the engagement, collation, development and visualisation of specific content and concepts back to stakeholders.

Not only will the post holder be working with the latest technology skill set and exposure across the Organisation, but you will also be allowed to develop your own capabilities and ideas. The successful candidate will have a modern outlook to technology and solutions, as well as the ability to leverage the best from legacy approaches

Required technical skills
* Strong experience in working with large, heterogeneous datasets in building and optimising data pipelines and integrating datasets using traditional and modern data integration technologies.
* Knowledge of on prem databases (Oracle, SQL Server), Salesforce, reporting building and data engineering standards. Advanced SQL development.
* Strong and advanced SQL skills across a variety of platforms, Oracle PL/SQL, SQL Server T-SQL. BigQuery knowledge a bonus
* Modern and traditional data ingestion approach and technologies, eg, SSIS, APIs.
* Adept in agile methodologies and capable of applying DevOps and increasingly DataOps
principles to data pipelines

Interviews can be arrange as soon as suitable applications are received so please send me your CV if this position is of interest.

Data Engineer Preston - up to £55,000

fullDescription:
A London based Fintech are on the lookout for a Data Engineer to join their team.

The Company

This is a great opportunity to join the Fintech Company based within the Investment Management space at an early and exciting stage of their journey.

The Role

In your role as a Data Engineer, you will be focused on the delivery of a variety of projects which are central to the wider success of the team. These include but are not limited to; designing and implementing data models and building ETL pipelines to ingest new sources of data.

Data Engineer Requirements

The required skills for the role are:

  • 3+ years' experience in Python programming
  • Strong experience Using SQL
  • Experience with Data Warehousing systems like Redshift, Snowflake etc.
  • Experience orchestrating data processing pipelines on AWS

In return you will receive a salary of £50,000 - £60,000 D.O.E + Equity, private health insurance, an annual education and training budget, pension scheme etc.

The company is keen to get the ideal candidate on board as soon as possible with interviews taking place next week. The interview process and role will be based remotely for the foreseeable.

If this Data Engineering role sounds like the role for you, please apply now.

fullDescription:
Big Data Engineer / Developer (SQL Kafka Hadoop AWS) *Remote Interview WFH*. Are you a data centric technologist? You could be joining a fast growing FinTech that is helping to revolutionise consumer banking through the use of advanced data centric, Cloud based technology.

As a Big Data Engineer you will design and develop new features and components on the Data platform / infrastructure, producing both detailed technical work and high level architectural design. The platform is built in Java on AWS infrastructure with AWS services and Open Source frameworks; you'll be encouraged to learn new technologies and contribute to the technical discussions.

Driven by technology the company can offer a remote interview / process and fulltime work from home likely to be until mid-2021 or beyond with 3-4 days a week WFH thereafter. When you're in the office you can enjoy a great team environment with spacious dining area, continuous supply of breakfast, snacks and drinks as well as games rooms and quiet spaces.

Requirements:
*You have a good working knowledge of Kafka, Hadoop, Spark or other Big Data streaming technologies
*You've worked in AWS hosted environments (will also consider GCP)
*You have a good knowledge of databases e.g. SQL, MySQL, PostgreSQL
*You're able to code with Java or Python
*You're familiar with DevOps environments / Containerisation (Docker, Kubernetes)
*You're collaborative and personable with good communication skills

As a Big Data Engineer you will earn a competitive salary (to £80k) plus benefits.

Apply now or call to find out more about this Big Data Engineer / Developer (Java Spring Kafka AWS Data) opportunity.

jobDescription: THE COMPANY  Leading Fintech who are looking to improve their Data Engineering function. fullDescription:
THE COMPANY

Leading Fintech who are looking to improve their Data Engineering function. My client is looking for a data engineer to join their team of world class engineers and Data Scientists to build end-to-end applications that make use of large volumes of source data from the operational systems.

THE ROLE

On a daily basis you will be:

  • Utilise the appropriate development, data engineering (ETL & ELT, stream processing), test and release model(s) and be flexible with your approach
  • Apply the appropriate standards and principles when delivering data ingestion and data transformation into target data models
  • Convert algorithms, models and features created by data scientists, analysts and designers from prototypes/designs into production solutions
  • Deliver, cost effective, appropriate capabilities for the business.
  • Create Data Lakes & Data Pipelines

SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE

  • Strong knowledge of Spark, Scala and AWS
  • Someone who likes to roll up their sleeves and enjoys learning
  • An understanding of data modelling, access an storage
  • Self-driven and constantly striving to improve your skills
  • Advocate of agile/lean delivery methodologies

THE BENEFITS

  • Competitive pension scheme
  • Up to £75,000

HOW TO APPLY

Please register your interest by sending your CV to Daniel Moss via the Apply link on this page

fullDescription:
NRG are currently recruiting for a Data Engineer on behalf of a well-established client based in Newcastle to manage and contribute to all data development activities ensuring they meet agreed timescales. Develop, construct and maintain solutions and processes to connect operational and distribution systems.

The role:

  • Oversee solution design ensuring they are aligned with relevant standards and principles.
  • Manage and deliver all key aspects of data engineering development activities.

  • Improve data engineering, automation and scaling capabilities.
  • Excellent understanding of data engineering techniques and concepts - data ingestion, processing and storage.
  • Knowledge and previous use of programming and query languages such as SQL and Java.
  • Experience managing project progress against delivery plans.

fullDescription:
DATA ENGINEER

£80,000

LONDON

A new and exciting opportunity to work within a well-known global media company has come available. They are currently rapidly expanding and looking for their next Data Engineer to join their tech team. They are currently working on numerous projects including their video streaming subscription service.

THE ROLE

The successful Data Engineer will be involved in building a new data platform using cutting edge technologies including Scala, Airflow and AWS. Specifically, you can expect to be involved in:

  • Building data pipelines using Scala
  • Implementing complex AWS based big data projects
  • Responsible for development using Scala , Python and Big Data Frameworks. ( e.g Spark, AWS, Kafka)

THE CANDIDATE

The successful Data Engineer will likely have the following skills and experience:

  • Previous experience with Scala programming
  • An in-depth knowledge and commercial experience of Spark
  • Prior experience using cloud technologies (preferably AWS)
  • Previous commercial experience with Airflow

SALARY AND BENEFITS

The successful Data Engineer will receive, depending on experience, a salary of £80,000 plus benefits.

HOW TO APPLY

Please register your interest by sending your CV to Georgina Garraway via the Apply link on this page.

jobDescription: Excellent opportunity to join a team of talented Data Engineers, contributing to the continual development of innovative data solutions in line with data strategy, architectural vision, and roadmap. You will join an incredible bunch of people in a creative, energetic and solutions driven environment. No two days, but typically here are some of the things you will be doing:* Showcase and apply data engineering skills (codi...
fullDescription:
Excellent opportunity to join a team of talented Data Engineers, contributing to the continual development of innovative data solutions in line with data strategy, architectural vision, and roadmap.

You will join an incredible bunch of people in a creative, energetic and solutions driven environment. No two days, but typically here are some of the things you will be doing:

* Showcase and apply data engineering skills (coding / modelling / data interrogation etc.), adapting to the demands of each project.
* Be a thought leader for all things Data Engineering within the business: leading workshops, team meetings and knowledge share seminars.
* Ownership of data engineering solutions ensuring quality standards are met.
* Ensuring internal data engineers buy-into the data strategy and data engineering standards.
* Work cross-functionally with a team of talented people (consultants, developers, data analysts) as part of an agile delivery team following Scrum Principles.
* Ensuring team members buy-into the data strategy and data engineering solutions.
* Pro-actively advise about new technologies and approaches to data

The ideal candidate will be a technically proficient SQL developer that has evolved into a wider data engineering role. You need to be comfortable leading by example in coding best practices and standards and be passionate about the Big Data. Proven experience in the following areas is expected;

* Well versed in ETL Process Development
* Highly proficient in Data Modelling
* Highly proficient in Data Warehousing dimensional modelling techniques.
* Strong knowledge of data engineering technologies, such as SQL Server, Azure data lakes, Delta Lake, Azure data factory, Azure Databricks, Apache Spark, SSIS or other data platform/integration tool
* Experience with other Programming applications: Python, R or Scala
* Excellent understanding of data governance concepts such as data ownership, data stewardship etc
* Collaborates well in a team environment.
* Passionate about continuous improvement / best practice
* Passionate about Business Intelligence
* Project driven
* Confidence to articulate analytics findings in front of stakeholders at all levels, and produce useful and concise documentation as necessary
* A desire to learn new techniques and trends and apply them within our business context
* Demonstrate leadership, communication and influencing skills

The position represents an outstanding opportunity for an ambitious and talented Data Engineer to make a significant, long-lasting contribution within a data led consultancy. For the right person there is a competitive salary and fantastic company benefits.

jobDescription: Your new role As a Principal Data Engineer you will bring passion and creativity to help Highways England better understand, leverage and 'demystify’ data, to make it more meaningful to non-technical staff, and to build data capability across our organisation. In this  role you will work with a wide range of people across the organisation on an array of projects and be responsible for ensuring that all data captured, ...
fullDescription:
Your new role

As a Principal Data Engineer you will bring passion and creativity to help Highways England better understand, leverage and 'demystify’ data, to make it more meaningful to non-technical staff, and to build data capability across our organisation. In this role you will work with a wide range of people across the organisation on an array of projects and be responsible for ensuring that all data captured, generated, stored, retained and distributed is modelled and managed appropriately. You will help to lead the specification, design and implementation of the next generation of data solutions within Highways England to support the development of the next Road Investment Strategy (RIS). You will help us to better understand what data we own, manage, and use. You will extract insight from data to understand how we can better connect the country. You will discover opportunities for data acquisition and be in control of innovative new data products in order to help us engage the supply chain and our stakeholders. As Principal Data Engineer will also own key parts of our 'Data-as-a-Service’ platform, including our Azure cloud architecture for data analysis and reporting.

This is a newly created position and a great opportunity for you to come into an organisation and growing team that is heavily investing in an IT transformation that will allow you to professionally develop and use your experience to improve data efficiency and reliability driving the toward automated, reliable and secure services.

We are happy to accommodate flexible working arrangements, and welcome discussion around how we can make working for Highways England work for you.

What you’ll be leading on

  • Responsible for the design and implementation of numerous complex data flows to connect operational systems, data for analytics and BI systems.
  • Define and lead verification and validation activities to provide assurance that data flows are designed, upgraded, managed, de-commissioned and archived in compliance with data policy across the full data life cycle
  • Responsible for the whole life management data flow models
  • Responsible for recognising and sharing opportunities to re-use existing data flows
  • Responsible for the design and build of data pipelines and data streaming systems
  • Coordinate teams and set data engineering best practice best practice and standards, and champion data engineering across the business, industry & government.

To be successful

  • Experience of communicating between technical and non-technical staff and suppliers.
  • Data profiling and conforming to data models in the public cloud.
  • Understanding and experience of enterprise-scale data integration in the public cloud.
  • Previous experience of lifecycle management of cloud platforms including infrastructure-as-code, CI/CD, DevOps, and testing.
  • Exceptional communication skills to convey complex information with enthusiasm to a wide audience.
  • Ability and proven experience in making effective decisions using data.
  • Ability to see the big picture, meeting wider public needs, and developing long term strategies.

A bit about us

The Information and Technology Directorate is a growing and vibrant team and there has never been a better time to join us as we go through our transformation programme. We are helping to transform the way Highways England operates by delivering digital, data and technology services from frontline to back office, in a modern and efficient way. Our vision is to develop integrated information and technology that empowers our colleagues and provides real time information to our customers, integration with intelligent vehicle and transport systems as they develop, to improve journey safety and reliability.

Interviews are planned to take place February 2021.

Why you should join us

At Highways England we believe in a connected country. We are passionate about creating a culture where colleagues feel connected, included and enjoy greater wellbeing to achieve this. We’re proud that as an organisation we are continually striving to do better and actively encourage and support our colleagues to do the same with their careers.

So, if you put safety first, take ownership of your work, show passion for what you do, work effectively in a team, and demonstrate integrity in how you do it - then you’ll be a great fit for our organisation.

And finally

We reserve the right to close before the advertised closing date, so we recommend completing your application as soon as possible.

jobDescription: Data Engineer - AzureLondon / Remote working£75,000 - £80,000 paAre you an experienced Data Engineer who has worked across the Azure platform? Do you have a good knowledge of Machine Learning concepts (e.g. tree-based methods, logistic / linear regression, neural networks) and their practical applications?Do you want to work for a multi-national company who with real career pr...
fullDescription:
Data Engineer - Azure

London / Remote working

£75,000 - £80,000 pa

Are you an experienced Data Engineer who has worked across the Azure platform?

Do you have a good knowledge of Machine Learning concepts (e.g. tree-based methods, logistic / linear regression, neural networks) and their practical applications?

Do you want to work for a multi-national company who with real career progression opportunities?

The company

The company was founded in San Francisco in 2012 to develop a Framework, based on HTML5, ExtJS / Angular / React, Node.js, C (addon Node.js) and mongoDB technologies. This unique Web framework allows them to generate a new breed of multi-tenant, collaborative Web applications.
The framework is used by other development teams in the group to build accounting, tax and payroll softwares of over 100 000 companies worldwide. They are a true market leader in the field and very well respected.

The role

As the Data Engineer, you will integrate into a scrum team, based in London (of 11 people at the moment as they are growing fast!) (7 developers, 3 data scientists & 1 QA).

They are automating bookkeeping of small businesses using machine learning. They then process the documents in order to generate their accounting and then accountants only have to review and validate. They have about 10,000 small businesses using this robot and they provide softwares for the accounting of more than 1 million small businesses.
Scope of the role :

* Create and maintain data pipelines to extract, transform and load data from various data sources.
* Manage prototyping environment for the data-scientists.
* Working with DevOps to automate pipeline from/to production environments
* Support data scientist to write scalable pre-processing and training jobs.
* Setup analytics tools to monitor models accuracy.

What skills will you need

* Understanding of machine learning concepts
* A successful history of manipulating, processing and extracting value from large disconnected datasets.
* AKS (Kubernetes on Azure)
* Azure Client
* Python / PyData stack
* Node.js. This is a rare opportunity to join a true market leader where you your skills will be highly valued.

They are not offering sponsorship currently so please only apply if you are eligible to live and work in the UK.

Interviews to take place ASAP so dont delay if you are interested in this one!

Azure Data Engineer - London - £60-70k

Please note - this role requires you to work from the Central London office when safe to do so. You must have the unrestricted right to work in the UK to be eligible for this role - this organisation is not able to offer sponsorship.

I'm looking for a Data Engineer to work on developing products and solutions in Azure. You will have the opportunity to work on projects for some of the largest clients in the sports industry.

If you have experience with SQL, Azure and Python (Synapse and Databricks would be great) and other aspects of the BI stack and looking to work on large scale data projects then this could be for you.

Although main responsibilities are internally facing, you will be involved in some elements of working with clients.

Role & Responsibilities

  • Design and Architecture of Azure Data solutions
  • Be the technical expert with the latest technologies. Make recommendations to the wider business as to how to keep up to date with the best data solutions.
  • Working with and modelling data warehouses.


Skills & Qualifications

  • Strong technical expertise using SQL Server.
  • Experience delivering a data warehouse solution from scratch.
  • A strong understanding of SQL Azure principals (Azure Data Factory, Azure Databricks).
  • Understanding of Agile methodologies including use of Git
  • Experience with Python/PySpark

Benefits

  • £60,000 - £70,000
  • Bi-annual salary reviews and bonuses
  • Company away day

To apply for this role please submit your CV or contact David Airey on or at .

Nigel Frank International are the go-to recruiter for Power BI and Azure Data Platform roles in the UK offering more opportunities across the country than any other recruitment agency. fullDescription:
• Help tackle world hunger!
  • Software Engineer with expertise in back-end development and building data architectures needed

KEY EXPERIENCE / SKILLS REQUIRED:

  • Demonstrable experience in Software Engineering (this role would likely suit somebody who considers themselves to be at a mid or senior level).
  • Ability to work across the full-stack in a Linux and Open Source Environment using the likes of Python and JavaScript, but with a particular leaning towards back-end and data engineering.
  • Expertise in developing and delivering data architectures and platforms; in particular, knowledge of modern 'Big Data' tools such as Hadoop, Spark, etc, would be beneficial (although not essential).

ROLE OVERVIEW:

If you're an accomplished Software Engineer with particular expertise in Data Engineering, this could be a rare opportunity to demonstrate your skills in ways that will contribute to improving lives and the planet we live on.

A leading light in the UK AgriTech scene, this software & data analytics company is on a mission to devise and develop solutions for the AgriFood sector that will lead to greater food productivity, environmental sustainability and more.

Working within a team of Full-Stack Software Engineers, your remit will be to become one of the main authorities in the team when it comes to developing and building data architectures. Therefore, you could be a 'mid level' Developer looking to take this step up, or a more experienced Developer who is already able to take on a 'senior' role.

You will be part of a small and flexible team that is happy to 'muck in' on various tasks when required; therefore, whilst specialising in Data Engineering, you must also be versatile and happy to get stuck into more general Software Engineering and programming tasks as and when needed.

fullDescription:
DATA ENGINEER

An award-winning management consultancy is looking for a Data Engineer to join their growing Analytics team in London.

The ideal candidate will have some experience in web scraping, data pipeline building and data manipulation. You will also develop new skills in this area using Python and SQL in an AWS environment.

YOUR RESPONSIBILITIES WILL INCLUDE:

- Monitoring progress on data collection on AWS throughout the day
- Identifying issues, investigating causes, and making fixes
- Rapidly updating scripts when websites make changes which impact data collection
- Conducting routine checks to ensure data processing running as expected
- Providing reports to account managers for distribution
- Application of new database rules identified by analysis team
- Managing core consumer panel database, maintaining strict adherence to GDPR regulations
- Reviewing end-to-end process for efficiency improvements
- Documenting each stage of process and identifying gaps
- Liaising with product team to confirm release requirements
- Managing development for product releases
- Conducting web-scraping activities for other relevant projects

ESSENTIAL EXPERIENCE

- Graduate degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Information Systems, Engineer or another quantitative field
- Proficiency in Microsoft Excel, advanced/expert knowledge
- Ability to simplify and solve problems
- Ability to communicate technical concepts to non-technical audiences
- Knowledge of data warehousing concepts, including data warehouse technical architectures, infrastructure components, ETL/ELT and reporting/analytic tools proficient in queries, administration and development on database server, particularly MSSQL
- Skilled in some programming languages, like Python or R
- Python development experience, preferably in web-scraping applications
- Experience of Cloud technologies (preferably AWS)
- Experience of SSIS or ETL processes
- Ability to manage multiple tasks and thrive in a fast-paced team environment

DESIRABLE EXPERIENCE

- Data visualisation tools (Tableau / Power BI)
- Web-scraping using Selenium
- Sound understating of HTML
- Working knowledge of Amazon S3 web service

jobDescription: The role of the Data Engineer is to support and grow our data science activities across internal projects and external collaborations, supporting our academic and commercial end-users in the UK drug discovery sector. This team member will be expected to  provide both hands-on and strategic expertise across our multiple and diverse projects and collaborative work. fullDescription:
The role of the Data Engineer is to support and grow our data science activities across internal projects and external collaborations, supporting our academic and commercial end-users in the UK drug discovery sector. This team member will be expected to provide both hands-on and strategic expertise across our multiple and diverse projects and collaborative work.

Client Details

We are a government funded not for profit organisation, our aim is to help with insight and innovation when it comes to drug discovery. We're able to take risks and pursue objectives that are understandably challenging for commercial for-profit companies. It's the reason we're able to focus so much of our effort on pioneering the next generation of medicine discovery techniques and technologies.

Description

Data Engineer main duties and responsibilities:

  • Develop and support our data scientists by building custom data extraction tools
  • Integrate solutions into existing data extraction pipelines / ETL
  • Working with data scientists to help package their models/algorithms into production ready software
  • Work with others to successfully deploy solutions to collaborators
  • Maintain excellent written records of work

Profile

The position will provide the Data Engineer with the opportunity to develop systems that enable the analysis and interpretation of large-scale, complex and dynamic data sets. This member of the team will need an understanding of how to develop data extraction pipelines in our privacy conscious and commercially sensitive setting. Working in the MDC also provides a unique opportunity to interact with cutting-edge health-related translational researchers and technologies.

Job Offer

Based on the Astrazeneca site at Alderley Edge, this role is easily commutable by car or public transport from, Manchester, Liverpool, Macclesfield, Northwich, Warrington, however flexible working and working from home is also available.

This role is great for data engineers who want to work with the latest technologies and Google size amounts or raw data.

Urgent role, apply now.

fullDescription:
Data Engineer
Kent
Up to £68,000

A great opportunity to join a global healthcare brand transforming and aligning their data environments.

THE COMPANY

A healthcare firm that's grown rapidly through multiple acquisitions. The brand has a strong international presence and is looking to build on that by investing in leading technology solutions. They have just undergone a large data transformation project and this role will be pivotal in enabling the business to leverage the vast amounts of data and transform their healthcare offering with AI chatbots, new products, online appointments, and more!

THE ROLE

  • Extract, Transform and Load and integrate vast amounts of data into a centralised data warehouse
  • Model data and logically review its structure and flows
  • Design, develop and test data-centric software
  • Build data marts allowing data to be accessible and usable for varying use cases
  • Build, maintain and document data models, data dictionaries, and glossaries

YOUR SKILLS & EXPERIENCE

  • Expert level with SQL
  • Experience with Logical and Physical design of Kimball
  • Strong experience with data model design (OLAP style/Star Schema)
  • Previously worked on Enterprise Data Warehouses
  • Experience with cloud environments, ideally Azure
  • Other technical capabilities: Python, Power BI, Big Data

BENEFITS

Up to £68,000
Bonus
Competitive pension contribution
Discounted healthcare and insurance products
Flexible working
Thriving industry

HOW TO APPLY

Please register your interest by sending your CV to Rosalind Madge via the Apply link on this page.

fullDescription:
Senior Data Engineer (AWS)
Cambridge, Cambridgeshire
£60,000-£80,000 per annum

TEC Partners are recruiting exclusively for a Senior Data Engineer to join a well-known tech company based in Cambridge, who are currently going through a large recruitment drive, with over 200 hires planned for this year.

You will be tasked with building a Cloud-based Data and Analytics Platform, able to receive, interpret and feed data back to consumers in real-time. Helping to improve overall customer experience, along with delivering valuable data insights and dashboards. This data is critical to the product teams, so that they can understand what the customers want and where both their enjoyment and pain points are.

You will be working in an exciting and vibrant environment, where you will be engaged in architectural designs, cutting edge technologies, testing and profiling, evaluating software solutions and programming.

How you can contribute:
* Provide technical leadership to drive data products and insight strategy, advocating the effective use of data technologies
* Set the vision for the team and lead the execution of projects, aligning with studio priorities to meet deadlines with clear deliverables
* Ensure reliability and security, liaising with the security team to implement policies through code
* Mentor, lead and manage members of the Data Engineering team; set a quality bar, inspire innovation & creativity and make the vision a reality
* Work with external development teams (2nd, 3rd or contractual) to successfully launch new technical products that provide advanced data science and analytical capabilities
* Build and maintain data pipelines to process diverse data sets at scale and with low latency
* Design, develop, test, launch and manage software packages to support use of data and advanced analytics
* Maintain and extend data and analytics environments to provide additional tools and capabilities
* Develop near real-time and batch-based data processing frameworks
* Push evolution in how we think about analytics, data science and business intelligence that will make them a leader in this space
* Ensure platform availability expectations are met, manage capacity planning and team SLAs
* Participate in all aspects of agile software development and software lifecycle, including high level design, architecture definition, implementation, testing, deployment
* Create software and tooling necessary for build and deployment pipeline automation
* Mentor and couch the other team members

What we need:
* Strong knowledge and experience in AWS Services
* Expert knowledge and experience with big data ecosystems and infrastructure (i.e. Hadoop, Mapreduce, Vertica, Snowflake, etc.)
* Proven history of adopting production related processes, deployment pipelines and reviews
* Expert in Agile, proven experience working with Product Owners to expand user stories into engineering tasks, ensuring development is focused and impactful
* Significant experience in launching new data products that were successful not least due to contributions from Analytics, Data Science and Data Engineering teams, with measurable return
* Experience deploying applications on Kubernetes Clusters
* Deep understanding of design patterns and good code practices
* History of working with senior management on long-term strategic planning and budgetary processes
* Understanding of current & future business needs relative to the gaming and technology industry
* Thorough knowledge of analytics, technology, trends and competitors
* Experience in building strong relationships within a company and empowering your team to do the same
* Proven capabilities as a vision-holder for engineering

Company Benefits:
- Flexible Working
- Bonus Scheme
- Private Health Care
- Gym Membership
- Generous Pension Contributions
- Life Insurance
- Free Cycle Repair
- Income Protection
- Dental Plan
- Free Fruit and Drinks
- Subsidised Canteen

If this sounds like you, then please contact Harry Calvert at TEC Partners and apply below now!

jobDescription: Data EngineerData Engineer required for a fast growing and forward-thinking Consultancy as they continue to win new and interesting data projects.  Your new role … You'll be joining a really talented team of Data Engineers, Scientists, Architects and a wider team of Product Mangers, Software Engineers and Consultants. No need to be worried about this being another Data En...
fullDescription:
Data Engineer

Data Engineer required for a fast growing and forward-thinking Consultancy as they continue to win new and interesting data projects.


Your new role …
You'll be joining a really talented team of Data Engineers, Scientists, Architects and a wider team of Product Mangers, Software Engineers and Consultants.
No need to be worried about this being another Data Engineering role with no interesting projects, or even worse no data! The team have plenty of work to be getting on with and as they are a Consultancy and trusted partner across a variety of industries, you will have the chance to be involved in an array of work.


You …
You'll be well versed as a Data Engineer, ideally having worked in a customer or business facing role before. A huge part of this role will be talking to a selection of stakeholders from super technical to complete non-techies. You need to be able to explain your solutions to both seamlessly.
I won't patronise you here by saying you'll need experience of Python or SQL- you're a data engineer after all …
An appreciation of various cloud providers would be pretty beneficial though as they work in various environments depending on the customer with a recent push in GCP projects, but as you'd expect plenty of Azure and AWS work as well. A certification in one or more of these would be a bit of a cherry on top.


The company …
A boutique data consultancy within a larger organisation, delivering some impressive and complex projects in various sectors.
You will have the opportunity to progress your career with well defined bandings and regular feedback.
The Senior Management are still very hands on and not in a micro-management, can't let go sort of way, they are still very passionate about the success of the business.


The Small Print … (AKA salary & benefits)
You will be working remotely initially - obviously, but in the future, there is an expectation to be on client site up to 4 times a week, which can be UK wide. This is a Consulting gig, so you'll need to be comfortable with that.
In reality, they will try spread the work as locally as possible and there is a good chance a lot of customers will be happy with remote work going forward.
But you need to be prepared to travel as part of the role.

Salary wise, there is a wide range on offer as they have multiple roles, but to help you drum down a bit, somewhere between £45-80k + benefits.

Please do hit apply and contact Tom Edmondson at Cathcart Associates for a more detailed chat on the role, the company and what you are looking for.

jobDescription: The data engineer will be responsible for the successful delivery of a variety of software and technology solutions projects. The pace of innovation within RSM is increasing all the time and this has created the need for additional skills within the firm  in relation to analytics and data-centric development. The core of the role will be to utilise business data, working with a variety of stakeholders to support deep analysis and delivering ...
fullDescription:
The data engineer will be responsible for the successful delivery of a variety of software and technology solutions projects. The pace of innovation within RSM is increasing all the time and this has created the need for additional skills within the firm in relation to analytics and data-centric development. The core of the role will be to utilise business data, working with a variety of stakeholders to support deep analysis and delivering innovative data focused solutions. An additional focus will be the continued optimisation and on-going maintenance of those solutions.


The data engineer will be expected to:

  • Collaborate on the design and development of high-quality software;
  • Understand how to optimize data retrieval and how to develop dashboards, reports and other visualizations for stakeholders;
  • Work across departments to understand what business leaders want to gain from RSM’s large datasets;
  • Where required, identify and define solutions and support their development;
  • Report accurately and succinctly on project delivery progress to senior management;
  • Work closely with data analysts to identify and communicate data trends;
  • Develop, construct, test and maintain architectures aligned with business requirements;
  • Develop pipeline-centric processes to support business processes;
  • Identify ways to improve data reliability, efficiency and quality;
  • Ongoing maintenance of published solutions and provide regular helpdesk support.
  • The preferred candidate will bring the ability to focus on getting the job done, maintaining a view of the business benefits, and proving resilient in the face of obstacles.


This role is in an agile team, collaborating with colleagues and stakeholders so excellent communication skills are essential. The right candidate will be experienced in the development of varied, large complex data-centric projects. They should bring demonstratable experience of delivering against agreed requirements and specifications as well as the technical delivery, as well as the ability to iteratively improve solutions based on evolving business requirements.

Essential skills and experience

  • Excellent problem solver - demonstrable experience of developing solutions to resolve business challenges
  • Demonstrate successful interactions with business and technical stakeholders
  • Experience of SQL server and development of ad-hoc queries, views, functions and stored procedures
  • Demonstrable experience of data integration and pipeline-centric development
  • Experience of developing information and decision-making systems (Power Platform, Reporting services, excel)
  • High standard of written and verbal communication skills
  • Excellent facilitation, collaboration, negotiation, and presentation skills
  • Focused and versatile team player who is comfortable under pressure, ambiguity, frequent change, or unpredictability
  • Experience in delivering projects under different process frameworks of lifecycles (i.e. Agile, SCRUM, Waterfall)
  • In depth understanding of project management concepts

Desirable skills

  • Experience of working within an Agile methodology
  • Azure deployments
  • Data quality and management experience
  • Experience of working with analytical languages (Python/R)

fullDescription:
Data Engineer / Reporting Analyst (Python BI Monday.com). Are you a business focussed Data Engineer with Python coding skills seeking a challenging role where you can work with a great deal of autonomy? You could be joining a global games software house and progressing your career in a diverse team environment.

As a Data Engineer you will take ownership of internal data analysis; you'll partner with stakeholders to define their requirements and then build the tools to extract the data required and present it a digestible format. You'll create predictive models around estimations, valuations and other performance criteria, working with data coming from the Amazon Redshift Data Warehouse to analyse and report on inter-dependencies between agile delivery projects. You will create dashboards and alerts to identify bottlenecks and software to automate the presentation of delivery performance data via tools such as SharePoint, Intranet and Monday.com.

In this Data Engineer role you'll be collaborating with senior stakeholders and proactively analysing data to answer the queries, developing statistical models to gain insights into trends and patterns.

Driven by technology this company can offer a remote interview / onboarding process and work from home during the current social distancing measures with a gradual return planned in the new year; thereafter you'll be based in awesome offices in Central London with a wide range of facilities and some flexibility to work from home for part of the week.

Requirements:
*Strong data engineering / analysis experience
*Strong Python coding ability
*Good knowledge of SQL and BI tools such as Tableau
*Experience of building big data models, scenario analysis and sensitivity analysis
*Strong analysis and problem solving skills with meticulous attention to detail
*Excellent written and verbal communication skills, collaborative

As a Data Engineer / Reporting Analyst you will earn a competitive salary (to £65k) plus bonus and benefits.

Apply now or call to find out more about this Data Engineer / Reporting Analyst opportunity.

fullDescription:
Data Engineer (Python ETL API Google Cloud). Are you a technologist Data Engineer looking to progress your career working on a modern tech stack with daily challenges and learning opportunities?

You could be joining a tech driven real-time market data and research provider for the Energy markets as part of a small collaborative team of software and finance professionals you'll be able to take ownership and see the effects of your work quickly.

As a Data Engineer you'll build and maintain ETL pipelines in Python and ensure performance and operations of the data infrastructure, data products and data APIs as well as designing and implementing new solutions for the data team and wider business. You'll provide subject matter expertise and keep up to date with emerging tools and technologies, pro-actively seeking improvements.

The company is currently able to offer a remote interview and onboarding process as well as fulltime work from home; following social distancing measures you'll join colleagues in the Canary Wharf office with some continued flexibility going forward.

There's perks such as the latest MacBook Pro, licenses to any software you want to use, training and personal improvement budget and when you are in the office, fresh fruit daily, breakfast, snacks, in-house bar open on Fridays and an annual company retreat.

Requirements:
*Strong data engineering experience using Python
*Good knowledge of ETL and Data APIs
*Experience with Cloud technologies, Google Cloud Platform GCP preferred but AWS also considered
*Good knowledge of relational and non-relational databases e.g. SQL, PostgreSQL, MySQL
*Understanding of how to best organise and model data for storage, retrieval and analysis
*Experience of working with software development teams
*Excellent communication and collaboration skills

As a Data Engineer you will earn a competitive salary (to £85k) plus benefits including an annual bonus, generous holiday allowance, private medical insurance and subsidised gym membership.

Apply now or call to find out more about this Senior Data Engineer / Team Lead opportunity.

fullDescription:
SENIOR DATA ENGINEER

SALARY £60,000 - £80,000

LONDON

Are you an enduring learner who wants the opportunity to get hands on in an innovative company, whilst being able to influence business decisions and solution delivery?

THE COMPANY:

This role is with a maturing global and diverse company which sits in the ever-evolving media industry and thus functions at a fast pace in order to strive and out do their competitors. They are looking to develop their data implementation in order to enable deeper analysis, reporting and business decisions.

THE ROLE:

The Senior Data Engineer will sit within the Technology department and report into the Head of Data Insights & Engineering.

In particular, this role will involve:

  • Working with stakeholders to develop production data bases and deliver data solutions.
  • Implement architectural decisions surrounding data platforms and systems.
  • Design, develop and maintain data pipelines, the data lake and data warehouse using Python.
  • Outline best practice for data storage, access and security.

YOUR SKILLS & EXPERIENCE:

  • Strong understanding of machine learning principles.
  • Educated to a degree level with computer science, Math or an analytical and web analytics tools (Adobe Analytics). background.
  • Commercial experience with AWS data tools (Redshift & Spectrum)
  • Exposure to workflow management tools (Airflow, Luigi, Pinball etc).
  • Knowledge of BI tools (ideally Looker).
  • Capable of writing SQL queries.

THE BENEFITS:

The selected candidate will receive a competitive salary between £60,000 - £80,000 depending on their experience and requirements. On top of this salary, there are some excellent benefits on offer including a fantastic open culture.

HOW TO APPLY:

Please register your interest by sending your CV to Holly Neeves via the Apply link on this page.

As Data Engineer you will create, maintain, and manage software components, data stores, and pipelines that will support  adva...
fullDescription:
Data Engineer x 4 – Manchester – £50- £65K

"Our Client will be interviewing and onboarding remotely during COVID-19"

Adria Solutions has a fantastic opportunity for four talented Data Engineers to join our well-established client based in Manchester. As Data Engineer you will create, maintain, and manage software components, data stores, and pipelines that will support advanced data analytics for better use and wider consumption of our client’s data.

The duties of the Data Engineer will include:

  • Design, write and test code modules that add value to data for reporting and other uses
  • Integrate applications with other BI solutions to improve functionality
  • Develop solutions that connect to a variety of on and off-premises data sources, ensuring data is cleansed, mapped, transformed, and otherwise optimized for storage and to meet requirements for business and technical use cases.
  • Apply business and logic rules to derive new variables, encode data and create aggravated values
  • Generate and schedule data enrichment processes
  • Develop effective, scalable solutions that can be efficiently maintained, updated, tested, deployed and managed.
  • Ensure solutions support the architectural direction of our client’s technology and use approved technical components

The ideal candidate will have:

  • Proven work experience in Data Engineering using Python or SQL or other mainstream languages in a data analysis environment
  • Experience of working with large data sets in an enterprise environment
  • Experience in Azure data components is highly desirable such as Azure Data Lake, Azure Analytical Services, Azure Warehouse, Azure Data Factory, Databricks or similar Spark environment
  • Strong analytical skills, with the ability to adopt a logical approach to solving problems
  • Data exploration, cleansing, and preparation
  • Expert Python or SQL coding skills and the ability to apply these to data engineering and analytics

This is a fantastic opportunity for four Data Engineers to join an award-winning company, where you will work in an innovative and dynamic environment and play a vital part in the company’s transformational journey. For your hard work you will be rewarded with a generous benefits package:

  • Competitive Salary
  • Flexible working hours with the opportunity for some home working
  • An additional day off for your birthday!
  • Company pension scheme and group life assurance

Data Engineer x 4 – Manchester – £50- £65K

Interested? Click APPLY!

fullDescription:
DATA ENGINEER

A leading UK listed group within the FMCG space with an acclaimed technology function is now looking to hire a data engineer to join their team. Full time remote working is available & their head office is near Dunstable, should working within the office be more desirable. You will be working within one of the teams that is lead by their inspirational CTO.

Working within their technology team, the incoming data engineer will work to improve upon the existing infrastructural landscape used by their data science team. You will work with enormous volumes of data that are employed for user-facing applications. The projects you will focus on among others will include their data pipeline projects. In this capacity you will regularly liaise with diverse teams across the business to ensure collaborative working and the implementation of best-in-class and fit-for-purpose strategies. Your involvement and input as a data engineer will be to create a pipepline that will allow the business to make critical efficiency and process improvements using real-world data across a number of acreas Working with other technology team members you will turn theoretical data into actionable plans and play a leading role within this process.

You should have strong experience in the following areas:

  • Be an accomplished programmer in python
  • Have several years experience of having worked in software development
  • You should have experience in having working with PostreSQL
  • Able to develop and familiar with distributed systems
  • Ability work independently and autonomouslty - can-do attitude is paramount to be succesful
  • Be familiar with such tools as GIT/Puppet or relevant alternatives.
  • Strong programming/technology background with experience that would be beneficial to you coming in to this role
  • Willingness to collaborate, engage with wider teams across the business
  • Any experience having used open-source tools could be useful, but is not a deal breaker.

The business has a flexible working culture and is very much geared to helping employees thrive in a fast moving and cutting-edge technological environment.

fullDescription:
As a data engineer you should have experience developing ETL links to a Azure data lake and be able to communicate confidently with both technical and non-technical stakeholders.

Client Details

My client, is a large and expanding Pharmaceutical consultant company that is expanding due to the growth in the industry and their clients that specialise in a wide range of areas from drug manufacturing to specialised logistical support.

Description

As a Data Engineer you should have experience working on the Azure cloud Platform, utilising your skill set to develop complex data pipelines (ETLs) to move information from on-site data sources to the cloud. In this aim you should be able to work with users and stakeholders to provide technical expertise to support their move to the cloud while remaining hands on in its development. This would require an individual like you to have a great knowledge of on premise solutions to guide their technical development of the cloud solution.

Profile

Essential Skills

- Experience working developing ETL links to Azure.

- Great Communication skills and be able to work with senior stakeholders.

- Knowledge of Data Pipelines & data factories.

Desired Skills

- Experience working on the early phases of rolling out a cloud platform.

- Experience of the pharma industry.

Job Offer

My client are offering a generous compensation package of up to £75,000 in addition to working in a distinguished institution.

jobDescription: A skilled Data Engineer is required by a leading organisation in London. This position is ideal for a Data Engineer that enjoys working with bespoke, purpose-built, hand-coded data environments, and is competent in delivering strong business intelligence to other areas of the business. This role will involve working with Data Scientists, BI Developers, and Digital teams. You will be responsible for reviewing da...
fullDescription:
A skilled Data Engineer is required by a leading organisation in London.

This position is ideal for a Data Engineer that enjoys working with bespoke, purpose-built, hand-coded data environments, and is competent in delivering strong business intelligence to other areas of the business.

This role will involve working with Data Scientists, BI Developers, and Digital teams. You will be responsible for reviewing data sources, checking code, understanding the desired outcomes, and redesigning to ensure the data can be used in the most effective and efficient way.

Responsibilities:

  • Implement trusted rich data that supports efficient algorithms and predictive models
  • Deploy and maintain machine learning models
  • Develop and manage a variety of scripting languages and tools
  • Facilitate processes and data modelling, data mining and production
  • Work with Data Scientists, Data Architects, BI Developers, and Digital teams to improve the quality, reliability and efficiency of data and the development of scalable data management systems
  • Ensure data is cleansed and usable across the business

Requirements:

  • Must have extensive experience in a Data Engineer capacity
  • Must have strong written coding skills (the company hand codes every API's so a strong understanding is essential)
  • The most critical technical skills and experience include:
    • Windows and Linux
    • Docker / machine learning
    • PostgreSQL / SQL Server databases or similar
    • SSIS
    • ETL
    • Apache / Spark / Kafka / Nifi
    • Springboot / Java / Python would be advantageous
    • Hadoop or similar
  • Competent in communicating and interfacing with other teams, and must be able to work in an Agile environment
  • Degree in an information technology, computer or data related subject, science, or mathematics (or equivalent experience)

Salary:

The salary is competitive depending experience, plus a bonus that will increase your salary substantially. Benefits include up to 30 days holiday plus all bank holidays, competitive pension scheme, life insurance, private medical insurance, free gym membership, discounted parking, and much more.

Covid-19 & Remote Working

The business is currently operating a remote working policy. This may continue for the foreseeable future with non-office-essential individuals working full time from home. However, some office visits will be required from time to time, particularly when restrictions are lifted.

How to Apply:

Please submit your CV for the Data Engineer vacancy. For further information, contact Michelle Turner on the IT recruitment team at Bond Williams in Bournemouth -

Keywords: Data Engineer, Business Intelligence, BI, Data Scientist, Data Management, Big Data, Data Warehouse, Data Mining, Data Science, Machine Learning, Systems Analyst, Data Architect, Docker, SQL, SSIS, ETL, Apache

Bond Williams Professional Recruitment are an equal opportunity employer and operate as an Employment Business and Recruitment Agency

fullDescription:
DATA ENGINEER

LONDON (REMOTE WORKING)

UP TO £70,000

Harnham are partnered with an international insurance company that has won awards for its tech teams across the business. They require a data engineer to further advance their data platform.

This company are a large company with a turnover of over £1bn per year. They are pioneers within the insurance space and were one of the first to focus on their data. They are looking for a data engineer to help build out this platform and work in cross-functional teams to deliver on projects.

- You will be working on serverless AWS

- You will be working in an agile framework - working in squads and cross-functional teams

YOUR SKILLS AND EXPERIENCES

- Experience with AWS

HOW TO APPLY
