fullDescription:
Data Engineer

This cutting edge intelligence arm delivers solutions which help to protect and enhance the connected world. Their solutions combine large scale data exploitation, 'intelligence grade' security and complex services and solutions integration. They operate in four key domains of expertise: Cyber Security, Financial Crime, Communications Intelligence and Digital Transformation.

Their people apply intelligence to protect and enhance national and organisational assets so that they can grow and prosper - from improving the health and efficiency of leading corporations to protecting critical infrastructures, safeguarding vulnerable people and catching criminals.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Work with the client to design and implement a data pipeline to get user data from a public-facing service and store it in a centralised Big Query data warehouse. This involves migrating schemas into Big Query.
  • Help advise and guide the service team's developers in iterating a data pipeline architecture that will scale across multiple teams and live services.

Requirments

  • Minimum 3 years' experience implementing multiple data / ETL projects
  • Experience working in agile environments
  • Comfortable working with cloud environments
  • Prior experience working with Big Query
  • Experience using an appropriate stack, such as Python, to migrate data
  • Ruby/ Ruby on Rails

The Package

  • Day Rate of up to £500pd (Self Assessed)
  • Fully Remote
  • Initial contract till the end of May (Likely to extend)

jobDescription: Senior Data Engineer Berlin Salary - up to €70,000 doe + benefits A brilliant AI start up are looking for their first Data Engineer to be the pivotal person in helping them create the next generation products for enterprise businesses. You'll be reporting directly to the CTO, this collaborative team encourage learning  and development, run a bottom-up management styl...
fullDescription:
Senior Data Engineer

Berlin

Salary - up to €70,000 doe + benefits

A brilliant AI start up are looking for their first Data Engineer to be the pivotal person in helping them create the next generation products for enterprise businesses. You'll be reporting directly to the CTO, this collaborative team encourage learning and development, run a bottom-up management style, and are tech agnostic - using the best tools for the job.

This Senior Data Engineer role is crucial within the business and will see you collaborate with all stakeholders from C-Suite to Developers, in a data-driven approach. The team structure will allow you to learn and progress within the role whilst leading projects and team members!

This is a fantastic opportunity to join a forward-thinking successful company in an interesting position where you can progress your career.

As a Senior Data Engineer, what you'll need?

  • Expert Python and cloud computing skills, ideally AWS - will consider GCP
  • Excellent stakeholder management, communication, and leadership skills
  • Understanding of end-to-end toolset on Data Engineering projects
  • Experience and desire to lead, mentor, upskill and develop team members

This is a phenomenal opportunity for a Senior Data Engineer to lead a team of talented and enthusiastic data professionals within a business that reaches millions of users across the globe.

jobDescription: Data Engineer (Python AWS ETL) *Remote / WfH*. Would you like to progress your career working on complex systems, taking ownership and influencing technology choices on a modern tech stack? You could be joining a scale-up technology company.As a Data Engineer you'll help to establish the Data Engineering team, partnering with Data Scientists to design, build and ship new data centric features from scratch across a wide ra...
fullDescription:
Data Engineer (Python AWS ETL) *Remote / WfH*. Would you like to progress your career working on complex systems, taking ownership and influencing technology choices on a modern tech stack?

You could be joining a scale-up technology company.

As a Data Engineer you'll help to establish the Data Engineering team, partnering with Data Scientists to design, build and ship new data centric features from scratch across a wide range of platforms and languages; as well as building ETL pipelines in AWS. You'll collaborate to solve problems and make technology choices, using the right tool for the job and gain exposure to streaming technologies such as Kafka and Prometheus in a software focussed environment.

The company is well funded, enjoying great success and growing as a result - in time you could progress to a Data Architect or leadership position.

The company can currently offer a remote interview and onboarding process as well as work from home; in time you'll join your team in London, City based offices with continued flexibility to work remotely for part of the week or fulltime as desired.

Requirements:
*You have strong Data Engineering experience
*You can code with Python and / or Java and Scala
*You have a good knowledge / experience with AWS
*You're experienced of building ETL pipelines
*You're collaborative with good communication skills, you enjoy problem solving and tech discussions
*You're keen to take ownership and progress your career in a tech drive company

As a Data Engineer you will earn a competitive salary (to £65k) plus benefits.

Apply now or call to find out more about this Data Engineer (Python AWS ETL) opportunity.

jobTitle: Senior Data Engineer  Python  SQL  AWS  E-Commerce

Despite the retail industry experiencing a lot of uncertainy over the last few months, this organisation recorded their best ever trading year in 2020 and even paid their bonuses company-wide 6 months earlier than planned. fullDescription:
Senior Data Engineer | Python| E-Commerce | SQL | AWS

One of the most well recognised e-commerce brands in the UK are looking to hire a senior data engineer into their data team.

Despite the retail industry experiencing a lot of uncertainy over the last few months, this organisation recorded their best ever trading year in 2020 and even paid their bonuses company-wide 6 months earlier than planned.

For 2021 a new leadership team is busy transforming the way the business operates, and will be putting tech at the forefront. Tech teams are already breaking down a monolith into microservice architecture, built out new iOS and Android appplications and are relying on their data function to continute to provide key business insights.

This senior data engineer will be involved with expanding the data capabilities of the business, and working cross functionally to empower data analysts and data scientists to uncover true value for stakeholders.

Key requirements include:

  • Expert level Python skills
  • Great knowledge of SQL
  • Great knowledge of AWS or GCP
  • Exposure to microservice architectures
  • Solid understanding of machine learning technologies
  • Ability to work within an Agile environment
  • Passion for mentoring junior team members

Get in touch with Aoibheann Doherty on LinkedIn for more details about this client.

Senior Data Engineer | Python | SQL | AWS | E-Commerce

jobDescription: An exciting opportunity to join an International Financial Services / Forex Company based in Limassol, Cyprus EU.  As a BI Data Engineer with a focus on data visualizations, you will join the client's Business Intelligence team dedicated to empowering making data driven decisions. You will work across various business units (Risk, Sales, Operations, Product etc..) to  create BI reports, dashboards, and improve existin...
fullDescription:
An exciting opportunity to join an International Financial Services / Forex Company based in Limassol, Cyprus EU.

As a BI Data Engineer with a focus on data visualizations, you will join the client's Business Intelligence team dedicated to empowering making data driven decisions. You will work across various business units (Risk, Sales, Operations, Product etc..) to create BI reports, dashboards, and improve existing reporting processes. Experience in ETL development, data architecture and data warehousing is crucial. Solid communication skills and building interdepartmental relationships are critical to success in this role.

Your role will be required to have:

  • B.Sc. /M.Sc in Computer Science, Data Science or related field;
  • Passion for using data visualization tools to turn complex data sets into actionable insights;
  • Strong SQL skills and experience with large data sets required;
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills;
  • Ability to translate complex source data into a consumable format and structure;
  • Ability in liaising with product management and content owners to produce impactful visualizations;
  • Expertise in data visualization, including dashboard development and design principles using Power BI or Tableau or other reporting tools;
  • Design and implement complex, multi-step ETLs;
  • Perform data profiling, data mapping, and data quality validation;
  • Knowledge of data warehouse design concepts such as star and snowflake schema design, and slowly changing dimensions;
  • Excellent knowledge of the English Language both written and oral, is a Must.

The following will be considered an advantage:

  • Interest in data modelling and statistical analysis with Python or R;
  • Familiarity with cloud services and source control systems;
  • Experience in financial markets;
  • Written and verbal communication skills and the ability to influence others;
  • Experience with Agile/Scrum Methodology.

Greek language not essential for this international Company.

jobDescription: A leading Insurance Company are currently recruiting for a Scala Data Engineer to join their dynamic and growing business.They are looking to hire a cross functional, highly tenacious and bright Scala Data Engineer with a passion for functional programming. The ideal candidate is someone with Scala Dev Ops experience who is passionate about the use of modern technology, principles and patterns and can back this up with si...
fullDescription:
A leading Insurance Company are currently recruiting for a Scala Data Engineer to join their dynamic and growing business.

They are looking to hire a cross functional, highly tenacious and bright Scala Data Engineer with a passion for functional programming.

The ideal candidate is someone with Scala Dev Ops experience who is passionate about the use of modern technology, principles and patterns and can back this up with significant experience and skill.

Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:
. Scala experience is a must have
* Strong mathematical background (ideally maths degree, pure maths)
* Strong engineering skills - self starter
* Linux/Bash - familiarity with Scala & Java
* Agile & Extreme Programming practices (TDD, KISS, YAGNI etc) (Hihgly Desirable)
* NLP & Document processing (Highly Desirable)
* AWS (Desirable)
* Strong analytical and time management skills
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills
* Self-motivated and able to handle tasks with minimal supervision

jobDescription: A highly dynamic and trailblazing Insurance company are currently recruiting for a Snowflake - Data Engineering specialist to join their growing business.We are looking for a cross functional highly tenacious bright engineer with passion for dataWe believe our greatest assets are people and we are looking for the individuals who are technically proficient, enjoy challenges and are willing to learn from them. We have a cul...
fullDescription:
A highly dynamic and trailblazing Insurance company are currently recruiting for a Snowflake - Data Engineering specialist to join their growing business.

We are looking for a cross functional highly tenacious bright engineer with passion for data
We believe our greatest assets are people and we are looking for the individuals who are technically proficient, enjoy challenges and are willing to learn from them.
We have a culture of shared success and transparency which is what we expect you to embrace. We're always looking for individuals who share our passion for growth and customer centricity.

Key Responsibilities
* Designing, developing and supporting data platform with focus on Snowflake
* Ensuring all code in managed and delivered in line with expected standards, leveraging development practices like DevSecOps
* Employing the latest agile techniques to build fast, scalable, highly available and secure systems
* Delivering data assets in a manner which can be easily leveraged by the consumers
* Learn new technologies as the technology stack evolves, set-up monitoring alerts for applications and environments
* Ensure the environment and data is managed securely in line with the security and privacy policies
* Using technology to solve business problems with creativity & innovation, take Data driven decisions
* Delivering code of highest quality supported by sufficient testing and documentation to improve the code base and remove technical debt
* Partnering with the Data Architecture and Data Culture team to define the best technology solution to the business problem
* Collaborate, update with your peers, wider teams to enhance best practice

Skills, Knowledge & Expertise
* Strong engineering skills - Tenacious self-starter - expert Googler!
* Demonstrated ability of design, build and implementation of software solutions in Snowflake with an unwavering focus on quality
* Experience in implementation of data marts and understanding data models
* Agile & Extreme Programming practices (TDD, KISS, YAGNI etc) (Highly Desirable)
* Experience of working using CI / CD and DevSecOps approach
* SQL
* Terraform
* dbt or similar tools (Highly Desirable)
* Ability to work in an agile environment, partnering with team members and peers to find solutions to challenging problems with transparency
* Demonstrated ability in working with Data platforms supporting Reporting, Analytics and Data Science use cases

jobDescription: Duration: Permanent Salary: £40,000-60,000 A Data Engineer is required to join a market leading organisation that are at the forefront of using Data Analytics. You will be joining the company's well-established Data team who are using cutting-edge technologies to make advancements within the Healthcare  industry. Your position as a Big Data Engineer will consist of building custom tools to aid the Data Scientists, b...
fullDescription:
Duration: Permanent

Salary: £40,000-60,000

A Data Engineer is required to join a market leading organisation that are at the forefront of using Data Analytics. You will be joining the company's well-established Data team who are using cutting-edge technologies to make advancements within the Healthcare industry.

Your position as a Big Data Engineer will consist of building custom tools to aid the Data Scientists, building ETL pipelines and creating a data lake. In this role, it is crucial that you have experience of handling data flows between algorithms. Below is not a list of requirements but technologies that you will have exposure to in this position:

  • Strong experience with Python and applying it to data manipulation.
  • Building data pipelines.
  • SQL
  • NoSQL databases e.g. MongoDB
  • Able to work independently and as part of a team.
  • RabbitMQ (desirable)

Due to covid, interviews will be conducted remotely. Initially, the position will be home-based and when normality returns you will be required to go to the office twice a week.

If this role is of interest, please send your CV to , or call Adam on for more information.

jobDescription: Data EngineerHamburg €50,000 to €70,000 + PackageExcellent opportunity for a Data Engineer to join an expanding Green Energy company who are changing the cities we live in. This is a highly varied, interesting, and challenging position that is offering long term progression opportunities.Through this period a lot of companies have struggled due to COVI...
fullDescription:
Data Engineer
Hamburg
€50,000 to €70,000 + Package

Excellent opportunity for a Data Engineer to join an expanding Green Energy company who are changing the cities we live in. This is a highly varied, interesting, and challenging position that is offering long term progression opportunities.

Through this period a lot of companies have struggled due to COVID-19, however through working with a range of key clients this organization are strong, stable and continue to grow. Through an increase in workload, they are looking for a Data Engineer to join their bust development team.

In this role you will provide solid ETL pipeline builds to the internal operations teams while helping to deliver successful business outcomes utilizing the MS SQL-Server, MS Azure, Power BI, Snowflake and Kafka, this is an advantage.

The ideal candidate will be a Data Engineer with experience working on data warehouses, experience using SSIS and experience using T-SQL.

This is a fantastic opportunity to join a forward-thinking successful company in an interesting position where you can progress your career.

The role:

  • Up to €65,000 starting salary
  • Opportunities to progress to team leader and management roles
  • Build on the already strong Data Engineering function, enhancing the Data Lakes / Data Warehouse on the cloud, you'll have either GCP, Azure, AWS
  • Working in Agile with 2 week sprints
  • You'll be used to working in Product teams
  • You'll want to learn a DevOps culture and grow the knowledge of yourself and others around you

jobDescription: Real-time streaming & ML deployment.Multi-Cloud environment.Collaborate with Software Engineers and Data Scientists. An exciting opportunity to join a fast-paced, creative e-commerce company based in London. Over the last 12 months, the company has been working hard on progressing their tech platform and customer experience and are now looking...
fullDescription:
• Real-time streaming & ML deployment.
  • Multi-Cloud environment.
  • Collaborate with Software Engineers and Data Scientists.

An exciting opportunity to join a fast-paced, creative e-commerce company based in London. Over the last 12 months, the company has been working hard on progressing their tech platform and customer experience and are now looking to take the business to the next level. With over 12 million website visitors per month, and their current product offering doubling this year, this is a great time to join. 

What you’ll be doing 

This role will sit in the software engineering/tech team and will be accountable for ensuring that data and can be used effectively by the data scientists/ML team and to support the wider business. 

As such, you will design, build and manage the platform, underpinning real-time streaming and ML. This is a senior role, so you also be responsible for supporting more junior team members, upskilling and working with your peers to make decisions.  

What skills you’ll need to apply
  • 5 years' experience as a Data/Software Engineer
  • Python  
  • Solid ETL
  • DevOps experience
  • SDLC
  • ML Deployment desirable
What you’ll get in return for your talents

A base salary of up to £85,000plus up to 15% bonus and many other benefits and perks 

What’s next? 

Please apply with your up-to-date CV today, don't hesitate to call/email to discuss the finer details.

jobDescription: SENIOR DATA ENGINEERLONDON BASED£500-£600 per day4-6 MONTHS A chance to work as part of an agile team of Data Engineers building an AWS Data Platform from scratch using Scala/Spark! THE COMPANY: As a Senior Data Engineer you will be working for a leading client in the insurance industry. You will be part of a ...
fullDescription:
SENIOR DATA ENGINEER
LONDON BASED
£500-£600 per day
4-6 MONTHS

A chance to work as part of an agile team of Data Engineers building an AWS Data Platform from scratch using Scala/Spark!

THE COMPANY:

As a Senior Data Engineer you will be working for a leading client in the insurance industry. You will be part of a team of around 16 Data Engineers and 16 Data Scientists, BI Developers and DevOps Engineers in helping to set up a sophisticated Data platform from scratch.

THE ROLE:

As a Senior Data Engineer you will be heavily involved in building ETL pipelines using Scala/Spark so must be very proficient with this technology. You will be working in an AWS environment so familiarity with many of its key services is extremely useful. As a Senior Data Engineer you may also be helping to introduce streaming technologies such as Kafka or Kinesis for building a clients architecture so any experience with either of these technologies is valuable. As a Senior Data Engineer you will also be using Databricks and tools such as Airflow for scheduling so commercial use of these would also be helpful.

YOUR SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE:

  • Extensive experience with Scala, specifically Scala in Spark
  • Good working knowledge of AWS and services such as S3, Lambdas, Glue
  • Worked with streaming technologies such as Kafka/ Kinesis
  • Good experience with technologies such as Databricks/Airflow
  • Experience of technologies such as Kubernetes/ Docker

HOW TO APPLY:
Please register your interest by sending your CV to Anna Greenhill via the Apply link on this page.

jobDescription: SENIOR DATA ENGINEER (PYTHON) £80,000-£90,000 + BENEFITS REMOTE WORKING/CENTRAL LONDON Are you a senior data engineer wanting to move into the e-commerce industry? Do you want to work on a Python and big data engineering team? This Data Engineer position offers the opportunity to work on cutting edge data solutions projects using AWS, Redshift  and Python, ...
fullDescription:
SENIOR DATA ENGINEER (PYTHON)

£80,000-£90,000 + BENEFITS

REMOTE WORKING/CENTRAL LONDON

Are you a senior data engineer wanting to move into the e-commerce industry? Do you want to work on a Python and big data engineering team? This Data Engineer position offers the opportunity to work on cutting edge data solutions projects using AWS, Redshift and Python, with the opportunity to work remotely once a week.

THE COMPANY

An opportunity to work in a growing team within an iconic and rapidly expanding tech focused e-commerce business. They have a mission to provide data solutions to improve efficiency across all areas of the business. Culture is a big priority for the organisation and they give their staff opportunities to work in a supportive and enjoyable culture. With small collaborative, tech focused teams using technologies such as AWS, Spark, Kafka, and Python, it's an exciting opportunity to work on solving complex issues in an environment which facilitates both personal and professional progression.

THE ROLE

As a Senior Data Engineer, you will have theopportunity to put your mark onto a brand new data platform using cutting edge technologies such as Redshift and AWS.

In this role you could also expect to:

  • Build data pipelines using python
  • Apply your knowledge of big data tools such as Spark, Kafka and Databricks on a day to day basis
  • Work on creating complex big data solutions surrounding both customer data and business data, using technologies such as Airflow and AWS

THE CANDIDATE

The successful Senior Data Engineer will likely have the following skills and experience:

  • Educated to a degree level or above within a numerical discipline
  • Python programming experience
  • An in-depth knowledge and commercial experience of Redshift
  • Experience using cloud technologies, ideally AWS
  • A drive to build a next generation data platform using Python
  • An understanding of data streaming technologies such as Kafka
  • Experience in Airflow or Spark is preferred but not essential

BENEFITS

Benefits include £80,000-£90,000 PA dependent on experience. You will also receive a range of incredible benefits, including competitive holiday allowance, work from home, a dress down culture and many more.

HOW TO APPLY

Please register your interest by sending your CV to Kyle Fenton via the Apply link on this page.

jobDescription: ANALYTICS DATA ENGINEER Curious about a position with MHR? You've come to the right place. MHR has been changing the industry for years, and now you can too. MHR offers HR, Payroll and Analytical expertise to help our customers work smarter. Our strength is in the development of our own technology based upon the market and future trends to ensure our customers have solutions that fit their needs today and grow ...
fullDescription:
ANALYTICS DATA ENGINEER

Curious about a position with MHR? You've come to the right place. MHR has been changing the industry for years, and now you can too.

MHR offers HR, Payroll and Analytical expertise to help our customers work smarter. Our strength is in the development of our own technology based upon the market and future trends to ensure our customers have solutions that fit their needs today and grow with them in the future.

Today we're powered by a world-class team of over 700 people working with us across four products, a multitude of services and three continents. We’re driven by organic growth, a significant achievement in our industry. We pride ourselves on being a financially independent family-owned company on a journey to completely transform the world of work for organisations of all shapes and sizes. We have over 1,000 customers, serving organisations across the public, private and non-profit sectors.

Our mission is to constantly strive to understand and improve the world of work, technology and people, enabling us to create market-leading platforms and services and we'll need creative individuals like you to help continue this success.

Our philosophy for the last 35 years and moving forward remains resolute - one vision, one strategy - one MHR.

Want to be part of something incredible? #OneMHR

Role Responsibilities

Due to continued growth, MHR Analytics are recruiting for an Analytics Data Engineer, who is experienced in data modelling principles; to plan, develop, implement and maintain Analytics solutions and services across the MHR customer base.

Core Skillset should be able to demonstrate:

  • Depth in data modelling and database design
  • Conversed in established and emerging data technologies

Core areas of BI development will consist of the following technology stack and disciplines;

  • Breadth in Enterprise Data warehousing and working with Data lakes in current technologies
  • Fully conversed in software project management approaches, requirements, design and test techniques
  • SQL Development, database administration
  • Columnar and NoSQL database expertise
  • Working with Structured/Unstructured big data sets
  • Experience in predictive modelling and AI technologies (e.g. SAP Predictive analytics/ Cognos Watson Analytics/ SAAS/ Azure ML/ R)
  • Experience in platform development and services (SAP Cloud Platform, Microsoft Azure)
  • Knowledge of SAP/ Microsoft BI and visualization technologies (SAP Business Objects, PowerBI)
  • Meta Data and Multi-Dimensional Design
  • SAP Business Objects Enterprise/Edge/Suite, including Crystal Reports, Dashboards (Xcelcius), Design Studio
  • Microsoft BI stack, including PowerBI, SSIS, SSAS
  • Experience in Apache Airflow and other modern pipeline/Orchestration tools advantageous
  • Experience in working with MS Azure Beneficial
  • Multiple Sector Experience (Particularly HR/Payroll)

Key Skills

  • Database Architecture
  • SQL
  • SSIS
  • SAP Data Services
  • SAP Business Objects
  • Open Source ETL (e.g. Airflow)
  • Data Warehousing Methodology
  • Microsoft Azure
  • Python
  • Microsoft Analytics (PowerBI, SAAS)
  • Capturing and defining business requirements
  • Stakeholder management
  • Change management & version control
  • Take design concepts to Commercial propositions
  • Internal and External customer presentations

Our Rewards

  • We contribute to a full company pension scheme to help you plan for your future.
  • We offer life assurance (x4 salary, with option to increase up to x8 salary).
  • An employee assistance programme is included.
  • Our sites all come with a subsidised restaurant and cafe on-site, with delicious new meals on offer from our chefs each day.
  • We offer Vodafone discounts, making it cheaper and easier to catch up with your favourite people.
  • Personal development plays a big part in helping our people to reach their potential, this is why we offer over 60 internal training courses and support our people with external qualifications.

Why us?

  • What makes MHR a great place to work, isn’t novelties or gimmicky job titles, it’s our down to earth approach working with people who want to do a job they’re proud of.
  • We invest for the long term, providing fantastic careers for our people and the best software and services to meet the needs of our customers now and in the future.
  • With over 35 years’ experience in the industry, our ethos has been to keep investing and moving forward with the changing world of work, and we can only do that by supporting our people. We’ve invested £20 million in a huge building expansion project to provide the best environment for our people, to give them the space they need to excel and grow. And by investing 20% of our turnover into our own research and development, our people shape the future of our products and services to support changing requirements on both a local and global scale.
  • We’re flexible, we embrace change and as we’re still owned by the original founders. We’re incredibly proud of what we we’ve built, evolving from a small business into one of the biggest and best in the industry.

Today we're powered by a world-class team of over 700 people working with us across four products, a multitude of services and three continents. We’re driven by organic growth, a significant achievement in our industry. We pride ourselves on being a financially independent family-owned company on a journey to completely transform the world of work for organisations of all shapes and sizes. We have over 1,000 customers, serving organisations across the public, private and non-profit sectors.

Our mission is to constantly strive to understand and improve the world of work, technology and people, enabling us to create market-leading platforms and services and we'll need creative individuals like you to help continue this success.

Our philosophy for the last 35 years and moving forward remains resolute - one vision, one strategy - one MHR.

Want to be part of something incredible? #OneMHR

Role Responsibilities

Due to continued growth, MHR Analytics are recruiting for an Analytics Data Engineer, who is experienced in data modelling principles; to plan, develop, implement and maintain Analytics solutions and services across the MHR customer base.

Core Skillset should be able to demonstrate:

  • Depth in data modelling and database design
  • Conversed in established and emerging data technologies

Core areas of BI development will consist of the following technology stack and disciplines;

  • Breadth in Enterprise Data warehousing and working with Data lakes in current technologies
  • Fully conversed in software project management approaches, requirements, design and test techniques
  • SQL Development, database administration
  • Columnar and NoSQL database expertise
  • Working with Structured/Unstructured big data sets
  • Experience in predictive modelling and AI technologies (e.g. SAP Predictive analytics/ Cognos Watson Analytics/ SAAS/ Azure ML/ R)
  • Experience in platform development and services (SAP Cloud Platform, Microsoft Azure)
  • Knowledge of SAP/ Microsoft BI and visualization technologies (SAP Business Objects, PowerBI)
  • Meta Data and Multi-Dimensional Design
  • SAP Business Objects Enterprise/Edge/Suite, including Crystal Reports, Dashboards (Xcelcius), Design Studio
  • Microsoft BI stack, including PowerBI, SSIS, SSAS
  • Experience in Apache Airflow and other modern pipeline/Orchestration tools advantageous
  • Experience in working with MS Azure Beneficial
  • Multiple Sector Experience (Particularly HR/Payroll)

Key Skills

  • Database Architecture
  • SQL
  • SSIS
  • SAP Data Services
  • SAP Business Objects
  • Open Source ETL (e.g. Airflow)
  • Data Warehousing Methodology
  • Microsoft Azure
  • Python
  • Microsoft Analytics (PowerBI, SAAS)
  • Capturing and defining business requirements
  • Stakeholder management
  • Change management & version control
  • Take design concepts to Commercial propositions
  • Internal and External customer presentations

Our Rewards

  • We contribute to a full company pension scheme to help you plan for your future.
  • We offer life assurance (x4 salary, with option to increase up to x8 salary).
  • An employee assistance programme is included.
  • Our sites all come with a subsidised restaurant and cafe on-site, with delicious new meals on offer from our chefs each day.
  • We offer Vodafone discounts, making it cheaper and easier to catch up with your favourite people.
  • Personal development plays a big part in helping our people to reach their potential, this is why we offer over 60 internal training courses and support our people with external qualifications.

Why us?

  • What makes MHR a great place to work, isn’t novelties or gimmicky job titles, it’s our down to earth approach working with people who want to do a job they’re proud of.
  • We invest for the long term, providing fantastic careers for our people and the best software and services to meet the needs of our customers now and in the future.
  • With over 35 years’ experience in the industry, our ethos has been to keep investing and moving forward with the changing world of work, and we can only do that by supporting our people. We’ve invested £20 million in a huge building expansion project to provide the best environment for our people, to give them the space they need to excel and grow. And by investing 20% of our turnover into our own research and development, our people shape the future of our products and services to support changing requirements on both a local and global scale.
  • We’re flexible, we embrace change and as we’re still owned by the original founders. We’re incredibly proud of what we we’ve built, evolving from a small business into one of the biggest and best in the industry.

jobTitle: Data Engineer Azure, SQL  Nottingham  Circa £60k
jobDescription: Data Engineer (Azure) | Nottingham | Software Company | £65k My clients demand for Data is relentless. As an innovator and major disruptor within their industry, it is absolutely key that their solutions are well engineered, robust and highly secure. I am therefore on the lookout for a cracking Data Engineer to join  them within their Data Engineering effort; ultimately ensuring that the right data is delivered t...
fullDescription:
Data Engineer (Azure) | Nottingham | Software Company | £65k

My clients demand for Data is relentless. As an innovator and major disruptor within their industry, it is absolutely key that their solutions are well engineered, robust and highly secure. I am therefore on the lookout for a cracking Data Engineer to join them within their Data Engineering effort; ultimately ensuring that the right data is delivered to the right people at the right time.

They are without a doubt one of the most exciting, highly data-driven tech firms in the Midlands right now and an enviable company to work for. They have built an established team full of some of the most talented developers, testers and data scientists in the local market and offer an intellectually challenging, technically stimulating and fun environment to work in. You'll need to have working experience as a Data Engineer so that you can hit the ground running with current projects.

I am looking for a SQL Server guru who has a good handle on most aspects of modern BI (particularly SSIS) with the ability to write well-engineered solutions that will develop the data platform, whilst improving future data technology. You will be confident working with different teams throughout the business and comfortable dealing with a variety of stakeholders. You'll be comfortable with Azure Data Bricks/Factory and data warehousing.

You will be passionate about new data trends and upcoming innovations in cloud, storage and data engineering. I want to see an Engineer who isn't phased by new challenges, but instead thrives from devising smart solutions to novel problems. I want somebody who isn't thinking traditionally and is obsessed with the latest going ons in the Data industry!

As a business, my client have cross-functional teams with very little hierarchy and you will find yourself working in a highly motivated, technically forward team, with a bunch of like-minded and extremely capable and likeable colleagues. The team are very close-knit and know how to have laugh.. whilst getting the job done. Everyone shares a real passion for developing industry leading software!

Salary is flexible up to £65k depending on your experience and you'll also receive a bonus, Pension scheme, generous holiday allowance, non-corporate environment, travel loans and many more. They're a company which is growing at the moment and are looking for the right people with the right attitudes.

If you're interested in the position then please get in touch for more information.

Modis International Ltd acts as an employment agency for permanent recruitment and an employment business for the supply of temporary workers in the UK. Modis Europe Ltd provide a variety of international solutions that connect clients to the best talent in the world. For all positions based in Switzerland, Modis Europe Ltd works with its licensed Swiss partner Accurity GmbH to ensure that candidate applications are handled in accordance with Swiss law.

Both Modis International Ltd and Modis Europe Ltd are Equal Opportunities Employers.

By applying for this role your details will be submitted to Modis International Ltd and/ or Modis Europe Ltd. Our Candidate Privacy Information Statement which explains how we will use your information is available on the Modis website.

jobDescription: DATA ENGINEER - OUTSIDE IR35£400-£500 PER DAY3 MONTH CONTRACT FULLY REMOTE As a Data Engineer you will have the chance to work for ecommerce company using PySpark to deploy ML models in AWS.  THE COMPANY: As a Data Engineer, you will be working for a leading e-commerce company. You will be working alongside other Data Engineers and Data Scientists in a fast pa...
fullDescription:
DATA ENGINEER - OUTSIDE IR35
£400-£500 PER DAY
3 MONTH CONTRACT
FULLY REMOTE

As a Data Engineer you will have the chance to work for ecommerce company using PySpark to deploy ML models in AWS.

THE COMPANY:

As a Data Engineer, you will be working for a leading e-commerce company. You will be working alongside other Data Engineers and Data Scientists in a fast paced environment.

THE ROLE:

As a Data Engineer, you will you will be heavily involved in productionsing ML models using PySpark. Therefore as a Data Engineer you must be extremely skilled in Spark, notably PySpark or Scala. As a Data Engineer experience in AWS is also preferable.

YOUR SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE:

The successful Data Engineer will have the following skills and experience:

  • Extensive experience with Python/ PySpark or Spark in Scala
  • Good knowledge of AWS
  • Previously worked alongside Data Scientists

THE BENEFITS:

  • A chance to work on important projects

HOW TO APPLY:

Please register your interest by sending your CV to Anna Greenhill via the Apply link on this page.

jobTitle: Quantitative Analyst Imbedded Data Engineer - VC Backed Busine
jobDescription: Title: Quantitative Analyst (Imbedded Data Engineer) - VC Backed Business Location: Manchester Salary: £75k + Significant Bonus + Benefits As a result of a surge of new investment opportunities, this VC backed business is looking for a commercially savvy Machine learning Engineer to join their award winning team of Analytics experts to support the investment team and Data Scientists on package devel...
fullDescription:
Title: Quantitative Analyst (Imbedded Data Engineer) - VC Backed Business
Location: Manchester
Salary: £75k + Significant Bonus + Benefits

As a result of a surge of new investment opportunities, this VC backed business is looking for a commercially savvy Machine learning Engineer to join their award winning team of Analytics experts to
support the investment team and Data Scientists on package development ensuring optimal data delivery architecture is consistent through ongoing projects.

Reporting into Specific responsibilities will cover:

- Increasing the efficient of investment analysis via Build, develop and productionise toolsets and models to be used in pricing, acquisition and revaluation
- Creation of ad hoc models for valuation of varying asset types
- Development and implementation of the pricing and framework
- Technical input into and knowledge sharing during all Decision Science projects;
- Collaborating with data scientists and architects on several projects

The ideal candidate will be an experienced data package builder and data wrangler who is excited by the prospect of solving business problems using their technical skills (be it from optimising models or building from scratch)

Applicants should possess;

- Strong coding ability (Sql, Python, Pyspark or some other programming language) with a passion to solve business problems through coding
- Experience of cloud based analytics packages (Scala, Databricks)
- Understanding of Machine Learning methodologies (Markov chain Monte Carlo, Decision Tree, Random Forest etc)
- Technical expertise with data models, python package development, deployment of predictive models to cloud solutions, data mining, and segmentation techniques.
- Highly educated in a quantitative subject (Mathematics, Physics, Economics, Computer Science etc)

This represents a unique encompassing both data Analytics and Engineering in one of the most desirable companies and ambitious companies in the North of England.

jobTitle: SC Cleared Microsoft Data Engineer - Remote
jobDescription: Location: London/Remote Salary: £55,000 - £70,000 Clearance: Must have active SC Clearance   The Company: This organisation proves that IT can make a real difference to their customers’ businesses. As a recent finalist for the 2019 Microsoft Partner of the Year Data Estate Modernisation Award, they are more than just another IT services ...
fullDescription:
Location: London/Remote

Salary: £55,000 - £70,000

Clearance: Must have active SC Clearance

The Company:

This organisation proves that IT can make a real difference to their customers’ businesses. As a recent finalist for the 2019 Microsoft Partner of the Year Data Estate Modernisation Award, they are more than just another IT services company - they are leaders in implementing and supporting Microsoft, Oracle and AWS technologies. With over 20 years’ experience, they are trusted by global brands to deliver IT solutions that drive customer success.

Benefits:

Profit share, pension, private medical, flexible working policy and more. They offer incentives for accreditations and educational assistance for course relevant to your role. They offer employee recognition in the form of Excellence Awards which is awarded by your peers. Engagement is incredibly important with local engagement teams driving our engagement events, summer party and Christmas parties!

Job Description:

Our client is recruiting for a Data Engineer with experience of developing large data warehousing solutions. You will have a history of implementing data ingestion and transformation pipelines for large organisations. You will have strong experience in building solutions using a variety of Microsoft technologies, and a proven track record in delivering high-quality work to tight deadlines and working within an Agile delivery / DevOps methodology.

Essential Skills:

  • SSRS and SSIS Experience.
  • Experience in the design & development of SQL Server Analysis Services (SSAS) Tabular Models including row-level security, partitioning, and perspectives.
  • Experience developing reports and visualisations in Power BI / Power BI Reporting Services.
  • Experience in the design & development ETL data management processes using SQL Server Integration Services & Microsoft T-SQL.
  • Knowledge of the Kimball Dimensional Modelling approach to database design and experience building dimensional data warehouses.
  • Knowledge of approaches & technologies used for Metadata management, including data models, data catalogs, data dictionaries, and data lineage.
  • Excellent understanding of data management best practices including demonstrated experience with data profiling, sourcing, and cleansing routines utilizing typical data quality functions involving standardization, transformation and rationalization.
  • Agile development methodologies and use Continuous Integration / Continuous Deployment (CI/CD) tools in a data warehousing environment.

Desirable Skills:

  • Experience with related technologies such as Azure SQL Database, Azure Data Factory and Azure Synapse .

To apply for this SC Cleared Microsoft Data Engineer permanent job, please click the button below and submit your latest CV.

Curo Services endeavours to respond to all applications, however this may not always be possible during periods of high volume. Thank you for your patience.

Curo Services is a trading name of Curo Resourcing Ltd and acts as an Employment Business for contract and temporary recruitment as well as an Employment Agency in relation to permanent vacancies.

jobDescription: Principal Analyst Developer Global Distribution Technology, Distribution Analytics Who we're looking for We are looking for a Principal Developer with the experience and desire to help design and deliver the Distribution analytics solutions. We want a knowledgeable developer who is both creative and analytical, an individual who is able to understand and articulate business challenges and ideas, explore them a...
fullDescription:
Principal Analyst Developer
Global Distribution Technology, Distribution Analytics

Who we're looking for
We are looking for a Principal Developer with the experience and desire to help design and deliver the Distribution analytics solutions.

We want a knowledgeable developer who is both creative and analytical, an individual who is able to understand and articulate business challenges and ideas, explore them and implement the functionality safely into the production environment.

You'll be busy, working closely with the business teams from data scientists and analytics professionals to Sales and Client Servicing. Distribution analytics is a changing landscape at Schroders with an emphasis on innovation.

About Schroders
We're a global investment manager. We help institutions, intermediaries and individuals around the world invest money to meet their goals, fulfil their ambitions, and prepare for the future.

We have around 4,000 people on six continents. And we've been around for over 200 years, but keep adapting as society and technology changes. What doesn't change is our commitment to helping our clients, and society, prosper.

The base
We moved into our new HQ in the City of London in 2018. We're close to our clients, in the heart of the UK's financial centre. We offer flexible working appropriate for a client solutions focussed role.

The team
Distribution and Marketing Technology creates and supports the applications used by our Sales and Client Servicing teams. Our technology footprint includes applications and systems, split between vendor and in-house developed, all designed with the common objective of being digitally and data driven. Not only do we rapidly respond to the demands of the external environment and those of our Sales and Client Service teams, the team is strategically positioned to deliver innovative solutions.

We also recognise that successfully balancing personal and professional commitments brings out the best in our teams and therefore all roles in Global Technology are reviewed for suitability for flexible working arrangements, with this specific opportunity available to applicants from 3 to 5 days per week. We passionately believe that individual performance is enhanced by embracing the whole individual and structuring a working environment that supports them.

What you'll do
• Responsible for leading development and build tasks which contribute to the delivery of working software required by the Product Owner and Distribution Analytics Business Teams
• Responsible for the capture and analysis of requirements which can be quickly delivered using the Agile delivery processes and tooling
• Explore and take ownership of ways to improve technology processes to progress the Distribution Analytics function, across a broad range of areas such as cost savings, security, ease of use, & reliability
• Develop automated processes to prevent, identify, and fix problems that impact service availability
• Discover and playback innovative functionality and potential new ways to realise additional business benefits
• You will contribute to peer code reviews and the preparation of releases for the entire Agile Team
• Drive interactions with our community of technologists to describe & own the work produced by team
• You will work closely with the Systems Architect to ensure that standards are adhered to and any necessary architectural or technical debt is recorded with a realistic plan to remediate
• Play a key role in familiarising Data Scientists, and wider team, with software development tools and best practice.
• Support the Data Scientists, and wider team, by developing specialized software in Python, Bash, R and C/C++.
• Maintain an understanding of industry trends and how new technologies can be leveraged to meet business objectives
• Engage actively in Agile planning including story refinement, demos and retrospectives
• Continually look for ways to improve your own skills and experience
• Support other team members to improve their own software development skills
• Assist us with the role of Scrum Master if required to do so

The knowledge, experience and qualifications you need
• Experience in data engineering using Cloud based platforms, ideally Azure (ADF, CosmosDB, Blob storage) and/or AWS
• Experience in developing and data engineering with Python, Spark/Hive/Hadoop
• Experience in Bash scripting and a good knowledge of the Linux environment
• Understands the principles and needs of Data Scientists and how data requirements differ from regular reporting
• Experience of SQL Server; data modelling, warehousing and SSIS
• Knowledge and experience of data visualisation tooling, preferably Tableau Server and Tableau Desktop
• Understands the principles and best practices of data modelling, interface design, code development, and testing, and you can apply these principles in real-world dev environments.
• Extensive knowledge of GIT and DevOps
• An ability to design and implement sharing models using declarative and programmatic methods.
• Knowledge in unit testing framework (NUnit, Jest, Enzyme, Jasmine, Karma) and mocking frameworks.
• Experience with automated build and deployment tools (VSTS, Octopus Deploy or other)
• Knowledge and experience of contributing to the development of technology solutions, both in house developed bespoke applications and commercially available off the shelf solutions, especially for analytical work.
• Familiarity with Agile delivery methodologies, (SAFe is preferred)
• High level of organisational skills to sustain momentum in multiple work-streams

The knowledge, experience and qualifications that will help
• Knowledge of NoSQL data stores like Cassandra, Redis, couchDB, Elasticsearch
• Experience with click-stream data like web traffic
• Experience with CRM systems like Salesforce

What you'll be like
• Self-motivated and enthusiastic
• Find satisfaction in solving complex technical and theoretical challenges.
• Flexible, highly curious and willing to learn
• A critical thinker who's able to look at things from different angles
• Great at unpicking a problem, from start to end, own and deliver the solution
• Able to work under pressure, on several priorities at once, and with tight deadlines
• Great at working with other people, sharing and communicating decisions
• Keen to improve what we do for our clients and how we do it

We're looking for the best, whoever they are
Schroders is an equal opportunities employer. You're welcome here whatever your sex, marital status, ethnic origin, sexual orientation, religious belief or age.

Note to Agencies:
Schroders

jobDescription: INCLUDE:  Managing a small technical team of 3 to deliver insight through data collection, processing, and reportingDeveloping change management processes to accommodate planned releases alongside product fixesTaking a technical project management role to ensure actions are prioritised correctly and delivered in the most effective waySpending time to understand the dynamics of the industries we operate in...
fullDescription:
INCLUDE:
  • Managing a small technical team of 3 to deliver insight through data collection, processing, and reporting
  • Developing change management processes to accommodate planned releases alongside product fixes
  • Taking a technical project management role to ensure actions are prioritised correctly and delivered in the most effective way
  • Spending time to understand the dynamics of the industries we operate in, and how our clients will extract value from the data and reporting being delivered
  • Being able to identify potential solutions to challenges and communicate them with decision makers.
  • Developing the most appropriate data architecture to capture, integrate, and organise data
  • Managing several competing priorities and stakeholders with the ultimate objective of delivering quality to clients

ESSENTIAL EXPERIENCE
  • Extensive experience in web-scraping, data pipeline building and data manipulation in a fast-moving environment
  • Leading development change management within fast-paced growth environment
  • Advance SQL knowledge and experience working with relational databases (+10GB)
  • Experience building and optimizing data pipelines, architecture, and data sets
  • Database administration of MySQL and experience of SSIS or ETL processes
  • Experience working with managed databases in the cloud (AWS preferably)
  • Strong project management and organisational skills
  • Python development experience (preferably in web-scraping applications)
  • Ability to manage multiple tasks and thrive in a fast-paced team environment

DESIRABLE EXPERIENCE
  • Manipulating, processing, and extracting value from large, disconnected datasets is a plus
  • Experience with BI tools (Tableau, Power BI etc.)
  • Proficiency in Microsoft Excel, advanced/expert knowledge
  • Experience with statistical packages

jobTitle: Lead Data Engineer (Relocation Opportunity in Manchester)
jobDescription: NB this role is based in Manchester City Centre Lead Data Engineer - £90,000- Banking - Manchester  Join a well-established player in the Banking industry who for ten consecutive years have held a four-star Fair banking mark and a 4 star rating on Trustpilot to recognise that we help customers manage money well. They’ve undergone a huge digital transformation in the past few years. ...
fullDescription:
NB this role is based in Manchester City Centre

Lead Data Engineer - £90,000- Banking - Manchester

Join a well-established player in the Banking industry who for ten consecutive years have held a four-star Fair banking mark and a 4 star rating on Trustpilot to recognise that we help customers manage money well.

They’ve undergone a huge digital transformation in the past few years. For example, they’ve revolutionised their mobile banking app so that it now has 3x the function it had when they started, and have really exciting plans in the pipeline. Their aim is to have the group be one of the leading digital businesses in Manchester and they are well on their way to achieving this vision.

It’s been incredible to watch them grow and develop over the past few years into a business that on one hand is slick, efficient and commercial, but also fosters a culture of putting people first - whether this by ensuring staff are happy, fulfilled and healthy, or the vast amount of volunteering and fundraising they do for good causes each year.

They are now looking for a Lead Data Engineer to join a diverse and friendly team, building dataflows into a data lake and data warehouse from a wide range of sources.

The wider Data Team is currently moving from a SQL Server based stack to a cloud-native solution in AWS. You will steer the development of a cloud native data platform that will enable sophisticated analysis and data science.

In this role you will:

  • Plan with analysts and data scientists on a regular basis to translate requirements into solutions and ensure delivery of successful business outcomes.
  • Architect the data warehouse and data lake for the cloud.
  • Ensure environments are stable and available.
  • Lead a team using Agile Kanban workflows to safely code, review, test and deploy solutions, using source control to manage changes.
  • Manage the DevOps processes for Data, and any tooling that guides the processes.
  • Design and build with the on-premise Microsoft BI stack, including SSIS, SQL Server and Power BI.
  • Design and build with an AWS-based BI stack, including Lambda, Redshift and Matillion.
  • Design and build connections to APIs, flat files, databases and data streams to our data lake (ELT).
  • Shape data from our data lake and form into a Kimball data warehouse (ETL).

About you:

  • Be experienced leading, mentoring and training a team of data engineers.
  • Be experienced with ETL tools like SQL, SSIS, AWS, Lambda and Python.
  • Be experienced with data warehouse concepts, including Kimball methodology.
  • Be experienced with SQL Server and Redshift management.
  • Have enthusiasm for deduction and problem solving, with a logical and curious mind.
  • Have a positive, enthusiastic and methodical attitude to development, business intelligence and data science.

Why work here?

As well as having the opportunity to work with, and learn from, one of the most commercially focused and results driven businesses in the North West, you’ll find lots of great extras too! These include:

  • Hapi benefits program, including discounts at leading supermarkets, cinemas and other leading retailers
  • On-site gym with free personal training
  • Personal lockers and showers
  • Basic 23 days holiday, plus public holidays. You’ll get an extra days’ holiday for every year served (up to 28 days)
  • An extra day of annual leave (taking the starting total to 24) on your birthday
  • Ability to buy and sell holiday entitlements
  • Paid Charity volunteer day, where the company give one working day a year to every employee to help out a charity
  • On-site training centre and self-learning facilities

Please note due to high volumes of applications unfortunately we are not always able to respond to all unsuccessful applicants. However we wish everyone who applies the very best with their job search.

  • On-site gym with free personal training
  • Personal lockers and showers
  • Basic 23 days holiday, plus public holidays. You’ll get an extra days’ holiday for every year served (up to 28 days)
  • An extra day of annual leave (taking the starting total to 24) on your birthday
  • Ability to buy and sell holiday entitlements
  • Paid Charity volunteer day, where the company give one working day a year to every employee to help out a charity
  • On-site training centre and self-learning facilities

jobDescription: Lead Data Engineer - £90,000- Banking - Manchester  Join a well-established player in the Banking industry who for ten consecutive years have held a four-star Fair banking mark and a 4 star rating on Trustpilot to recognise that we help customers manage money well. They’ve undergone a huge digital transformation in the past few years. For example, they’ve revolutionised their mobile banking app so that it ...
fullDescription:
Lead Data Engineer - £90,000- Banking - Manchester

Join a well-established player in the Banking industry who for ten consecutive years have held a four-star Fair banking mark and a 4 star rating on Trustpilot to recognise that we help customers manage money well.

They’ve undergone a huge digital transformation in the past few years. For example, they’ve revolutionised their mobile banking app so that it now has 3x the function it had when they started, and have really exciting plans in the pipeline. Their aim is to have the group be one of the leading digital businesses in Manchester and they are well on their way to achieving this vision.

It’s been incredible to watch them grow and develop over the past few years into a business that on one hand is slick, efficient and commercial, but also fosters a culture of putting people first - whether this by ensuring staff are happy, fulfilled and healthy, or the vast amount of volunteering and fundraising they do for good causes each year.

They are now looking for a Lead Data Engineer to join a diverse and friendly team, building dataflows into a data lake and data warehouse from a wide range of sources.

The wider Data Team is currently moving from a SQL Server based stack to a cloud-native solution in AWS. You will steer the development of a cloud native data platform that will enable sophisticated analysis and data science.

In this role you will:

  • Plan with analysts and data scientists on a regular basis to translate requirements into solutions and ensure delivery of successful business outcomes.
  • Architect the data warehouse and data lake for the cloud.
  • Ensure environments are stable and available.
  • Lead a team using Agile Kanban workflows to safely code, review, test and deploy solutions, using source control to manage changes.
  • Manage the DevOps processes for Data, and any tooling that guides the processes.
  • Design and build with the on-premise Microsoft BI stack, including SSIS, SQL Server and Power BI.
  • Design and build with an AWS-based BI stack, including Lambda, Redshift and Matillion.
  • Design and build connections to APIs, flat files, databases and data streams to our data lake (ELT).
  • Shape data from our data lake and form into a Kimball data warehouse (ETL).

About you:

  • Be experienced leading, mentoring and training a team of data engineers.
  • Be experienced with ETL tools like SQL, SSIS, AWS, Lambda and Python.
  • Be experienced with data warehouse concepts, including Kimball methodology.
  • Be experienced with SQL Server and Redshift management.
  • Have enthusiasm for deduction and problem solving, with a logical and curious mind.
  • Have a positive, enthusiastic and methodical attitude to development, business intelligence and data science.

Why work here?

As well as having the opportunity to work with, and learn from, one of the most commercially focused and results driven businesses in the North West, you’ll find lots of great extras too! These include:

  • Hapi benefits program, including discounts at leading supermarkets, cinemas and other leading retailers
  • On-site gym with free personal training
  • Personal lockers and showers
  • Basic 23 days holiday, plus public holidays. You’ll get an extra days’ holiday for every year served (up to 28 days)
  • An extra day of annual leave (taking the starting total to 24) on your birthday
  • Ability to buy and sell holiday entitlements
  • Paid Charity volunteer day, where the company give one working day a year to every employee to help out a charity
  • On-site training centre and self-learning facilities

jobTitle: Senior Data Engineer 100 Home Working, Fully Remote
jobDescription: Senior BI / Data Engineer ** Fin-tech / Insurance Start-Up ** THE COMPANY  This business offers personalised insurance through their App, working to disrupt the insurance market and make it digitally native. Their product will make people start caring more about their insurance.  Along with their household-name clients in the automotive industry, they have recentl...
fullDescription:
Senior BI / Data Engineer

** Fin-tech / Insurance Start-Up **

THE COMPANY 

This business offers personalised insurance through their App, working to disrupt the insurance market and make it digitally native. Their product will make people start caring more about their insurance. 

Along with their household-name clients in the automotive industry, they have recently partnered with one client to launch an innovative service in pay-as-you-drive insurance and have secured an exclusive agreement with an automotive giant to white label their direct insurance offering. 

The role reports directly into the CTO and is the first of its kind within this rapidly growing fin-tech start-up (currently 30 strong).

A comprehensive background in BI / Data Engineering is required, with solid skills working in the AWS ecosystem and using AWS data services (Redshift, RDS, Lambda, EC2). Significant experience designing and implementing automated data processing systems, ideally using Extract, Load and Transform (ELT) strategies. Experience designing data models for analytical querying, with familiarity with star schemas and other data warehousing techniques. Strong knowledge of and experience with data processing languages and approaches (e.g. TypeScript, Python, SQL, Spark, DBT). Experience with setting up and maintaining reporting packages (e.g. Tableau, Looker).

You will need to be a self-starter, commercially minded, with the ability to spot opportunity for adding value to customers and partners through data products, services, and analysis projects. Ultimately, this is a fantastic opportunity for an intellectually curious, bright, ambitious Data Analyst, keen to be part of this challenger brand and a growing data team.

POSITION -                 BI / Data Engineer – Fintech / Insurance Start-Up

LOCATION -                100% Full Remote

SALARY -                    £60,000 to £75,000 plus benefits

EXPERIENCE REQUIRED/RESPONSIBILITES

  • Educated to at least degree level in a numerate subject
  • Strong knowledge and experience of data processing languages and approaches (Typescript, Python, SQL, Spark, DBT)
  • Experience of working within the AWS (Amazon Web Services) ecosystem, including Redshift, RDS, Lambda, EC2)
  • Excellent communication skills in order to present findings to non-technical audiences
  • Act as the ‘expert in the room’ for all things analysis for this small yet growing firm
  • An ability to develop, implement and maintain data processing systems, data collection systems, data analytics and other elements of data strategy
  • Develop and support ongoing reporting

TO APPLY

For further information or to apply please contact:

Connor Perry

Consultant – Blue Pelican Data & Analytics

For more vacancies which may suit your needs, please visit us at www.bluepelican.com

  • A supportive, challenging work environment focused on learning and development
  • Opportunity for progression and growth in seniority as the organisation expands

READING, UK

SENIOR DATA ENGINEER

£70,000 - £85,000 + 10% BONUS

LONDON

This is a world-renowned insurance business with a range of departments. They've recently been through a transformation to use data more in the business and are looking to bring on a Data Engineer to focus on either the predictive modelling or pricing side.

THE ROLE:

As a Data Engineer, your responsibilities will include:

  • Sit alongside the other data engineers in the team and digging into lots of messy databases and building an enterprise wide data warehouse for the rest of the business to access
  • Work with a range of data sources, transforming from a manual to automated system using SQL
  • Working with PySpark
  • Developing tools for the pricing and actuarial teams to use

YOUR SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE:

The successful Senior Data Engineer will have the following skills and experience:

  • A strong background within insurance and experience on projects relating to pricing or modelling
  • Excellent SQL experience for the building of databases and manipulation of data
  • Ideally Python scripting experience for automating processes or building data pipelines
  • Experience with pricing or actuarial data would be useful
  • Excellent communication skills

jobDescription: A skilled Data Engineer is required by a leading organisation in London. This position is ideal for a Data Engineer that enjoys working with bespoke, purpose-built, hand-coded data environments, and is competent in delivering strong business intelligence to other areas of the business. This role will involve working with Data Scientists, BI Developers, and Digital teams. You will be responsible for reviewing da...
fullDescription:
A skilled Data Engineer is required by a leading organisation in London.

This position is ideal for a Data Engineer that enjoys working with bespoke, purpose-built, hand-coded data environments, and is competent in delivering strong business intelligence to other areas of the business.

This role will involve working with Data Scientists, BI Developers, and Digital teams. You will be responsible for reviewing data sources, checking code, understanding the desired outcomes, and redesigning to ensure the data can be used in the most effective and efficient way.

Responsibilities:

  • Implement trusted rich data that supports efficient algorithms and predictive models
  • Deploy and maintain machine learning models
  • Develop and manage a variety of scripting languages and tools
  • Facilitate processes and data modelling, data mining and production
  • Work with Data Scientists, Data Architects, BI Developers, and Digital teams to improve the quality, reliability and efficiency of data and the development of scalable data management systems
  • Ensure data is cleansed and usable across the business

Requirements:

  • Must have extensive experience in a Data Engineer capacity
  • Must have strong written coding skills (the company hand codes every API's so a strong understanding is essential)
  • The most critical technical skills and experience include:
    • Windows and Linux
    • Docker / machine learning
    • PostgreSQL / SQL Server databases or similar
    • SSIS
    • ETL
    • Apache / Spark / Kafka / Nifi
    • Springboot / Java / Python would be advantageous
    • Hadoop or similar
  • Competent in communicating and interfacing with other teams, and must be able to work in an Agile environment
  • Degree in an information technology, computer or data related subject, science, or mathematics (or equivalent experience)

Salary:

The salary is competitive depending experience, plus a bonus that will increase your salary substantially. Benefits include up to 30 days holiday plus all bank holidays, competitive pension scheme, life insurance, private medical insurance, free gym membership, discounted parking, and much more.

Covid-19 & Remote Working

The business is currently operating a remote working policy. This may continue for the foreseeable future with non-office-essential individuals working full time from home. However, some office visits will be required from time to time, particularly when restrictions are lifted.

How to Apply:

Please submit your CV for the Data Engineer vacancy. For further information, contact Michelle Turner on the IT recruitment team at Bond Williams in Bournemouth -

Keywords: Data Engineer, Business Intelligence, BI, Data Scientist, Data Management, Big Data, Data Warehouse, Data Mining, Data Science, Machine Learning, Systems Analyst, Data Architect, Docker, SQL, SSIS, ETL, Apache

Bond Williams Professional Recruitment are an equal opportunity employer and operate as an Employment Business and Recruitment Agency

fullDescription:
Senior Business Intelligence Engineer - London - £50k-£70k

Our client is a prestigious not for profit organisation, providing support to thousands of members across the UK. They are seeking a talented and ambitious BI Data Engineer who has a strong technical background, however, also possesses excellent communication skills to work across the breadth of the organisation.

This successful candidate will:

  • Collaborate with business stakeholders and product owners to architect, create, design, test, and implement integrated data solutions into the corporate business intelligence platform.
  • Be working with a high degree of autonomy to investigate, understand and propose solutions for complex data models and data architectures.
  • Work closely with BI analyst and developers to turn data into critical information that can be used to make sound business decisions.
  • Build and maintain batch and real-time ETL data pipelines to power our data warehouse and analytical reports and dashboards.
  • Responsible for the maintenance, improvement, cleaning, and manipulation of data in the analytics databases.

Our client is a big user of the Microsoft technology stack, thus we are seeking the following skills:

  • High experience in Microsoft data cloud services ecosystems
  • MS- SQL
  • Data analytical platform/tools
  • Data warehousing solutions
  • ETL processes,
  • API and general data pipelines such as SSIS, Data factory,
  • Azure Services,
  • Azure DB,
  • Azure data lake

In return you will be working with a talented and highly motivated team of Data Engineers supporting a highly progressive organisation looking to build for the future. Finally we have a highly competitive salary and compensation package to offer.

BI/BusinessIntelligence/SQL/Datawarehousing/Analytics/Cloud/Azure/ETL/API/SSIS/Azure/Data Lake/Azure Devops/Azure Cloud Services

jobDescription: The NHS are looking for an apprentice to join the team to deliver high quality analytical outputs, using relevant technical skills in data management and manipulation, business intelligence and analytics.  A typical day  You will work as part of a dynamic team in delivering an effective service.Work in an agile manner with daily stand upsCleanse and manage data (including processing)</li...
fullDescription:
The NHS are looking for an apprentice to join the team to deliver high quality analytical outputs, using relevant technical skills in data management and manipulation, business intelligence and analytics.

A typical day

  • You will work as part of a dynamic team in delivering an effective service.
  • Work in an agile manner with daily stand ups
  • Cleanse and manage data (including processing)
  • Quality assure data and analytical outputs following best practice guidelines
  • Integrate data feeds from disparate sources
  • Respond to incoming requests for information in a timely and efficient manner
  • Develop data processing packages
  • Plan, design, manage, execute and report on tests, using appropriate tools and techniques
  • Be highly numerate and use a variety of techniques to develop, process and engineer data relating to key priorities
  • Be adaptable when finding engineering solutions to challenges
  • Able to present findings to a diverse audience
  • Log, analyse and manage problems in order to identify and implement the appropriate solution, ensuring that the problem is fixed.

You must have

  • Five GCSE grades C - A* (4-9) or equivalent, including English and Maths
  • Level 3 qualification (A level, BTEC or equivalent)

Skills needed

  • Attention to detail
  • Able to work to tight deadlines
  • Good time management
  • Ability to communicate technical points to a non-technical audience
  • Problem solving skills
  • Ability to prioritise work and switch focus if needed

Perks and benefits

  • WhiteHat community
  • Pension

Training provided:

  1. Training on the 18 month Standard Level 4 Data Analytics (DA4) apprenticeship.
  2. Being a WhiteHat apprentice means access to awesome social events, sports teams, insight/career days with other apprentices to grow your network, as well as your own personal Coach who will guide you through the qualification to help you achieve your full potential.
  3. As part of your WhiteHat Apprenticeship, you will have access to our Future Leaders Foundation modules to develop 6 key competencies, underpinned by well-being, self-awareness, motivation, conscientiousness, effectiveness and grit.

Future prospects

After your Data Analysis Apprenticeship, you can progress into any Junior Data Analyst, Data Scientist and Data engineer role. You'll have the skills to run insight analytical projects from beginning to end and work within a Data Analytics team.

jobDescription: SENIOR DATA ENGINEERINSURANCE LONDON £60,000-£85,000 + BENEFITS  A globally renowned insurance brand are looking for a new senior data engineering to join the head of data science and another senior engineer within their corporate team dealing with their business to business offering. fullDescription:
SENIOR DATA ENGINEER
INSURANCE
LONDON
£60,000-£85,000 + BENEFITS

A globally renowned insurance brand are looking for a new senior data engineering to join the head of data science and another senior engineer within their corporate team dealing with their business to business offering.

THE COMPANY

The company are a household name in insurance and work across 33 countries globally. They have thousands of people working for them and until recently enough data. Wasn't hugely central to what they do which has all changed. They are now building a team around some successful POC work

THE ROLE

If you were to be successful in your application for this Senior Data Engineer your responsibilities would include:

  • Sit alongside the other Senior Data Engineer and digging into lots of messy databases and building an enterprise wide data warehouse so the rest of the business can access this.
  • Eventually take this to the next level and be able to automate and retrain some of the processes put in place
  • Work closely with 2 predictive modellers to platform data for them.

SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE

In order for your application for the Junior BI Analyst to be successful you will need;

  • A strong background within insurance and experience on projects relating to pricing or modelling
  • Excellent SQL experience for the building of databases and manipulation of data
  • Ideally a scripting language like Python for automating processes or building data pipelines
  • Experience with pricing or actuarial data would be useful for one of their roles

HOW TO APPLY

If you are interested in this Senior Data Engineer role please apply via this site.

KEYWORDS

SQL,Python, Data Warehousing, Insurance,
