fullDescription:
Data Engineer - Central Belt

Fancy taking ownership of a Data Engineering function in the next year? If you want to work within one of Scotland's most innovative teams and have autonomy to shape the company's future data capabilities then this is for you! The company are rapidly scaling their FinTech platform and are looking for best in their class individuals to take the journey with them. You will have the opportunity to work with cutting edge technology and make a key contribution to an innovative product.

The Role

You will be the company's go to person when it comes to matters relating to their data platform. The development phase of the work is very much in its infancy so you will have a truly Greenfield project to run at! The company have an expectation that they will be further growing the Data team over the next year and see this an opportunity for you to come in and take ownership of the function moving forward.

You will have industry experience with the following technologies

- Java, Python

- AWS

- Working with Speech Data/NLP

- Regulated Data Environments

The Company

This client have significant funding and already established with products and services in the market, and customers lined up to consume their services. They provide a start-up opportunity, with the chance to be involved at the beginning, to bring influence to the future product, to establish rapid career and personal development and with options to share in the company's success.

Package

Offering a package of up to £60k for the right person as well as benefits including Work from Home post lock down, a good bonus scheme and company shares.

Please get in touch with Greg at FPSG, . Or apply for more information.

Equal Opportunities

FPSG is committed to equal opportunities regardless of gender, race, disability, sexual orientation, religion or belief and age.

We are Disability Confident and neurodiverse aware. If you have a disability, please tell us if there are any reasonable adjustments we can make to assist you in your application or with your recruitment process

jobDescription: A highly dynamic and trailblazing Insurance company are currently recruiting for a Snowflake - Data Engineering specialist to join their growing business.We are looking for a cross functional highly tenacious bright engineer with passion for dataWe believe our greatest assets are people and we are looking for the individuals who are technically proficient, enjoy challenges and are willing to learn from them. We have a cul...
fullDescription:
A highly dynamic and trailblazing Insurance company are currently recruiting for a Snowflake - Data Engineering specialist to join their growing business.

We are looking for a cross functional highly tenacious bright engineer with passion for data
We believe our greatest assets are people and we are looking for the individuals who are technically proficient, enjoy challenges and are willing to learn from them.
We have a culture of shared success and transparency which is what we expect you to embrace. We're always looking for individuals who share our passion for growth and customer centricity.

Key Responsibilities
* Designing, developing and supporting data platform with focus on Snowflake
* Ensuring all code in managed and delivered in line with expected standards, leveraging development practices like DevSecOps
* Employing the latest agile techniques to build fast, scalable, highly available and secure systems
* Delivering data assets in a manner which can be easily leveraged by the consumers
* Learn new technologies as the technology stack evolves, set-up monitoring alerts for applications and environments
* Ensure the environment and data is managed securely in line with the security and privacy policies
* Using technology to solve business problems with creativity & innovation, take Data driven decisions
* Delivering code of highest quality supported by sufficient testing and documentation to improve the code base and remove technical debt
* Partnering with the Data Architecture and Data Culture team to define the best technology solution to the business problem
* Collaborate, update with your peers, wider teams to enhance best practice

Skills, Knowledge & Expertise
* Strong engineering skills - Tenacious self-starter - expert Googler!
* Demonstrated ability of design, build and implementation of software solutions in Snowflake with an unwavering focus on quality
* Experience in implementation of data marts and understanding data models
* Agile & Extreme Programming practices (TDD, KISS, YAGNI etc) (Highly Desirable)
* Experience of working using CI / CD and DevSecOps approach
* SQL
* Terraform
* dbt or similar tools (Highly Desirable)
* Ability to work in an agile environment, partnering with team members and peers to find solutions to challenging problems with transparency
* Demonstrated ability in working with Data platforms supporting Reporting, Analytics and Data Science use cases

jobTitle: Machine Learning Engineer - VC Backed Business
jobDescription: Title: Machine Learning Engineer - VC Backed Business Location: Manchester Salary: £68,000k to £75,000k + Significant Bonus + Benefits As a result of a surge of new investment opportunities, this VC backed business is looking for a commercially savvy Machine learning Engineer to join their award winning team of Analytics experts to support the investment team and Data Scientists on package deve...
fullDescription:
Title: Machine Learning Engineer - VC Backed Business
Location: Manchester
Salary: £68,000k to £75,000k + Significant Bonus + Benefits

As a result of a surge of new investment opportunities, this VC backed business is looking for a commercially savvy Machine learning Engineer to join their award winning team of Analytics experts to
support the investment team and Data Scientists on package development ensuring optimal data delivery architecture is consistent through ongoing projects.

Reporting into Specific responsibilities will cover:

- Increasing the efficient of investment analysis via Build, develop and productionise toolsets and models to be used in pricing, acquisition and revaluation
- Creation of ad hoc models for valuation of varying asset types
- Development and implementation of the pricing and framework
- Technical input into and knowledge sharing during all Decision Science projects;
- Collaborating with data scientists and architects on several projects

The ideal candidate will be an experienced data package builder and data wrangler who is excited by the prospect of solving business problems using their technical skills (be it from optimising models or building from scratch)

Applicants should possess;

- Strong coding ability (Sql, Python, Pyspark or some other programming language) with a passion to solve business problems through coding
- Experience of cloud based analytics packages (Scala, Databricks)
- Understanding of Machine Learning methodologies (Markov chain Monte Carlo, Decision Tree, Random Forest etc)
- Technical expertise with data models, python package development, deployment of predictive models to cloud solutions, data mining, and segmentation techniques.
- Highly educated in a quantitative subject (Mathematics, Physics, Economics, Computer Science etc)

This represents a unique encompassing both data Analytics and Engineering in one of the most desirable companies and ambitious companies in the North of England.

jobTitle: Senior Data Engineer / Azure Lead - Fixed Term
jobDescription: Senior Data Engineer - Nationwide charity: 9 month FTC. As the technical Data / BI SME on a business-critical data strategy (embracing MS Azure stack, SQL BI, Cloud tech, Big Data, Data Science), you will be working closely with key stakeholders driving  forwards adoption of better data integration and modelling through effective data warehousing to support analytics across the organisation.You will engage a team of developers to del...
fullDescription:
Senior Data Engineer - Nationwide charity: 9 month FTC. As the technical Data / BI SME on a business-critical data strategy (embracing MS Azure stack, SQL BI, Cloud tech, Big Data, Data Science), you will be working closely with key stakeholders driving forwards adoption of better data integration and modelling through effective data warehousing to support analytics across the organisation.

You will engage a team of developers to deliver an organisation-wide ETL, data import, and master data management approach. This will be done while fostering an entrepreneurial and creative work ethic, and willingness to learn and adapt to emerging or different technologies. This role will support the delivery of appropriate analytics tools for insight leads in teams across the organisation to be able to build reports and dashboards.

Expected technical experience:

*Leading fast-paced deployment of data solutions in a range of settings
*Expert SQL Data Warehouse Developer with experience delivering enterprise data models, data warehousing and operational data stores, and developing data interfaces for reporting tools such as Power BI.
*Designing extract, transform and load (ETL) processes in a range of technologies e.g. Microsoft Azure Data Factory. Deploying data transformations, including data standardisation.
*Exploring other Microsoft products (Synapse, Data Lake, Power BI, Data Catalog, Knowledge Transfer and other Azure tools)
*Experience of object orientated programming, to enable bulk data manipulation and import procedures (e.g. using Python, R etc).
*Application of Machine Learning in a data integration, cleansing and / or analysis context

  • Leverage vast data sets in the company
  • Evaluate and deploy new models
  • Improve existing models
  • Develop a platform that will operate worldwide
  • Problem solve on a daily basis
  • Analyse large data sets
  • Lead projects within the ML
  • Deploy fully functional models using ML models

  • Several work experience in ML
  • MSc preferred
  • Hands on Machine Learning experience
  • Python, Scala, Java, SQL, Random forest
  • Understand supervised and unsupervised machine learning
  • Experience boosting algorithms

  • Earning potential up to £65,000

fullDescription:
DATA ENGINEER

£80,000

LONDON

A new and exciting opportunity to work within a well-known global media company has come available. They are currently rapidly expanding and looking for their next Data Engineer to join their tech team. They are currently working on numerous projects including their video streaming subscription service.

THE ROLE

The successful Data Engineer will be involved in building a new data platform using cutting edge technologies including Scala, Airflow and AWS. Specifically, you can expect to be involved in:

  • Building data pipelines using Scala
  • Implementing complex AWS based big data projects
  • Responsible for development using Scala , Python and Big Data Frameworks. ( e.g Spark, AWS, Kafka)

THE CANDIDATE

The successful Data Engineer will likely have the following skills and experience:

  • Previous experience with Scala programming
  • An in-depth knowledge and commercial experience of Spark
  • Prior experience using cloud technologies (preferably AWS)
  • Previous commercial experience with Airflow

SALARY AND BENEFITS

The successful Data Engineer will receive, depending on experience, a salary of £80,000 plus benefits.

HOW TO APPLY

Please register your interest by sending your CV to Georgina Garraway via the Apply link on this page.

jobDescription: Excellent opportunity to join a team of talented Data Engineers, contributing to the continual development of innovative data solutions in line with data strategy, architectural vision, and roadmap. You will join an incredible bunch of people in a creative, energetic and solutions driven environment. No two days, but typically here are some of the things you will be doing:* Showcase and apply data engineering skills (codi...
fullDescription:
Excellent opportunity to join a team of talented Data Engineers, contributing to the continual development of innovative data solutions in line with data strategy, architectural vision, and roadmap.

You will join an incredible bunch of people in a creative, energetic and solutions driven environment. No two days, but typically here are some of the things you will be doing:

* Showcase and apply data engineering skills (coding / modelling / data interrogation etc.), adapting to the demands of each project.
* Be a thought leader for all things Data Engineering within the business: leading workshops, team meetings and knowledge share seminars.
* Ownership of data engineering solutions ensuring quality standards are met.
* Ensuring internal data engineers buy-into the data strategy and data engineering standards.
* Work cross-functionally with a team of talented people (consultants, developers, data analysts) as part of an agile delivery team following Scrum Principles.
* Ensuring team members buy-into the data strategy and data engineering solutions.
* Pro-actively advise about new technologies and approaches to data

The ideal candidate will be a technically proficient SQL developer that has evolved into a wider data engineering role. You need to be comfortable leading by example in coding best practices and standards and be passionate about the Big Data. Proven experience in the following areas is expected;

* Well versed in ETL Process Development
* Highly proficient in Data Modelling
* Highly proficient in Data Warehousing dimensional modelling techniques.
* Strong knowledge of data engineering technologies, such as SQL Server, Azure data lakes, Delta Lake, Azure data factory, Azure Databricks, Apache Spark, SSIS or other data platform/integration tool
* Experience with other Programming applications: Python, R or Scala
* Excellent understanding of data governance concepts such as data ownership, data stewardship etc
* Collaborates well in a team environment.
* Passionate about continuous improvement / best practice
* Passionate about Business Intelligence
* Project driven
* Confidence to articulate analytics findings in front of stakeholders at all levels, and produce useful and concise documentation as necessary
* A desire to learn new techniques and trends and apply them within our business context
* Demonstrate leadership, communication and influencing skills

The position represents an outstanding opportunity for an ambitious and talented Data Engineer to make a significant, long-lasting contribution within a data led consultancy. For the right person there is a competitive salary and fantastic company benefits.

jobDescription: DATA ENGINEERAn award-winning management consultancy is looking for a Data Engineer to join their growing Analytics team in London.The ideal candidate will have some experience in web scraping, data pipeline building and data manipulation. You will also develop new skills in this area using Python and SQL in an AWS environment.YOUR RESPONSIBILITIES WILL INCLUDE:- Monitoring progress on data collect...
fullDescription:
DATA ENGINEER

An award-winning management consultancy is looking for a Data Engineer to join their growing Analytics team in London.

The ideal candidate will have some experience in web scraping, data pipeline building and data manipulation. You will also develop new skills in this area using Python and SQL in an AWS environment.

YOUR RESPONSIBILITIES WILL INCLUDE:

- Monitoring progress on data collection on AWS throughout the day
- Identifying issues, investigating causes, and making fixes
- Rapidly updating scripts when websites make changes which impact data collection
- Conducting routine checks to ensure data processing running as expected
- Providing reports to account managers for distribution
- Application of new database rules identified by analysis team
- Managing core consumer panel database, maintaining strict adherence to GDPR regulations
- Reviewing end-to-end process for efficiency improvements
- Documenting each stage of process and identifying gaps
- Liaising with product team to confirm release requirements
- Managing development for product releases
- Conducting web-scraping activities for other relevant projects

ESSENTIAL EXPERIENCE

- Graduate degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Information Systems, Engineer or another quantitative field
- Proficiency in Microsoft Excel, advanced/expert knowledge
- Ability to simplify and solve problems
- Ability to communicate technical concepts to non-technical audiences
- Knowledge of data warehousing concepts, including data warehouse technical architectures, infrastructure components, ETL/ELT and reporting/analytic tools proficient in queries, administration and development on database server, particularly MSSQL
- Skilled in some programming languages, like Python or R
- Python development experience, preferably in web-scraping applications
- Experience of Cloud technologies (preferably AWS)
- Experience of SSIS or ETL processes
- Ability to manage multiple tasks and thrive in a fast-paced team environment

DESIRABLE EXPERIENCE

- Data visualisation tools (Tableau / Power BI)
- Web-scraping using Selenium
- Sound understating of HTML
- Working knowledge of Amazon S3 web service

DATA ENGINEER
FINTECH AND PRIVATE EQUITY
REMOTE- UK
£40,000-50,000

Great opportunity for a Data Engineer with strong ETL to join this London based team and work remotely

THE COMPANY

The company specialises in investing in startups and also company's in the gaming space and also incubates numerous seed projects with the ambition of launching them as their own companies.

THE ROLE

SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE

A successful BI Developer will have:

  • A number of years of experience as a BI Developer and strong data ingestion/ETL experience
  • Excellent MS Stack experience and T- SQL coding, SSIS particular.
  • Ideally cloud experience specifically with Azure and data factory

Please register your interest by sending your CV to Eoin Pierce or clicking on the link

SQL, SSIS, SSAS, Power BI, BI Developer, BI Analyst, Python, Azure, Data Factory

fullDescription:
Data Engineer / Reporting Analyst (Python BI Monday.com). Are you a business focussed Data Engineer with Python coding skills seeking a challenging role where you can work with a great deal of autonomy? You could be joining a global games software house and progressing your career in a diverse team environment.

As a Data Engineer you will take ownership of internal data analysis; you'll partner with stakeholders to define their requirements and then build the tools to extract the data required and present it a digestible format. You'll create predictive models around estimations, valuations and other performance criteria, working with data coming from the Amazon Redshift Data Warehouse to analyse and report on inter-dependencies between agile delivery projects. You will create dashboards and alerts to identify bottlenecks and software to automate the presentation of delivery performance data via tools such as SharePoint, Intranet and Monday.com.

In this Data Engineer role you'll be collaborating with senior stakeholders and proactively analysing data to answer the queries, developing statistical models to gain insights into trends and patterns.

Driven by technology this company can offer a remote interview / onboarding process and work from home during the current social distancing measures with a gradual return planned in the new year; thereafter you'll be based in awesome offices in Central London with a wide range of facilities and some flexibility to work from home for part of the week.

Requirements:
*Strong data engineering / analysis experience
*Strong Python coding ability
*Good knowledge of SQL and BI tools such as Tableau
*Experience of building big data models, scenario analysis and sensitivity analysis
*Strong analysis and problem solving skills with meticulous attention to detail
*Excellent written and verbal communication skills, collaborative

As a Data Engineer / Reporting Analyst you will earn a competitive salary (to £65k) plus bonus and benefits.

Apply now or call to find out more about this Data Engineer / Reporting Analyst opportunity.

jobDescription: ITP Media Group reaches an audience of more than 50.3 million people across the Middle East and beyond through its leading websites, portals, social media platforms, events, conferences, award ceremonies, magazines, books and social media influencers agency.We are looking for hardworking and experienced data engineers to join our Digital team in Dubai.The role is responsible for overseeing the maintenance and growth of th...
fullDescription:
ITP Media Group reaches an audience of more than 50.3 million people across the Middle East and beyond through its leading websites, portals, social media platforms, events, conferences, award ceremonies, magazines, books and social media influencers agency.

We are looking for hardworking and experienced data engineers to join our Digital team in Dubai.

The role is responsible for overseeing the maintenance and growth of the data warehouse and its evolution into an SCV. The role will help implement the future architecture design of integrating multiple data sources to a single store (AWS Redshift). The successful candidate will have a good knowledge of data sets, single person matching and architecture/design of data and analytical layers. The candidate will be working with support to a current design plan and have resource support to help on certain tasks. The role will be responsible for the ongoing evolution of the warehouse and ensure its stability and consistency through owning the ETL processes.

Requirements

Essentials


  • Proficient in SQL and Python Programming languages
  • Experience in design and build of data warehouses
  • Experience leading data engineering projects
  • Ability to match and reconcile data sets back to a single customer view
  • Proficient in the principles of data architecture and ETL systems
  • Knowledge of business processes and how data requests can be brought to life
  • Knowledge of BI processes and outputs
  • Ability to communicate complex problems simply
  • Proficient with cloud based solutions
  • Familiar with AWS/Redshift
  • Knowledge of media/publishing industries
  • Knowledge of real-time capabilities
  • Knowledge of AWS analytics functions


Benefits

Being an ITP employee is an opportunity to be part of the largest content creation house in the region and provides the luxury of working with global brands and experienced industry leaders. To ensure we invest in the development of our team, employees are given access to a variety of learning resources and exciting career development opportunities.

We believe in recognizing the passionate efforts of our team members. Our employees are rewarded by competitive tax-free remuneration, attractive bonus structure, medical insurance and a generous leave entitlement scheme that sees annual holiday entitlement grow as tenure with the company increases. ITP employees also enjoy a variety of staff offers at many local restaurants, salons, hotels and service providers.

fullDescription:
Recession-proof, shining star in the Manchester FinTech arena - with leading-edge tech, ethics, meritocracy, and real growth. Data and Analytics is at the very heart of everything they do. A growth Business. We saw a >10% increase in staff here during Q3 and Q4 so far this year and this will increase. Benefits include Bonus, Pension, Courses and self-development, food, cerebral colleagues and your chance to genuinely make an impact with cutting edge tech in the biggest projects in the Business. They’re currently working 2 days in office though this is Pandemic dependent.

This role is all about being the Engineering Lead for the Data Science and Modelling team - Building a range of toolsets and helping models to increase the profitability of the organisation, utilising a best in class tech stack. You’ll:

  • Build, develop and productionise toolsets and models to be used in Pricing and valuations
  • Create ad-hoc Models for varying asset types and georgraphies
  • Be Technical SME for Data & Decision Science Projects
  • Work with Data Engineers and Architects on Projects

And you?:

  • You’ll be Educated to beyond Degree Level in a Quant subject
  • Advanced Coding proficiency in Python - ideally with PySpark, Numpy etc
  • Experience of Python Package Development and Data Models
  • An experience of Cloud Based Analytics Packages - preferably Azure / AWS
  • A passion to solve problems using Coding and Modelling

This is a key role in a firm who are currently undergoing exponential growth - it’s an exciting time to join and for the right person could be a real career-maker.

Our client also offers a strong bonus, excellent benefits and an amazing city centre location to work in.

Feel free to call any of the team at PeopleGenius for more info.

fullDescription:
Title: Quantitative Analyst (Imbedded Data Engineer) - VC Backed Business
Location: Manchester
Salary: £75k + Significant Bonus + Benefits

As a result of a surge of new investment opportunities, this VC backed business is looking for a commercially savvy Machine learning Engineer to join their award winning team of Analytics experts to
support the investment team and Data Scientists on package development ensuring optimal data delivery architecture is consistent through ongoing projects.

Reporting into Specific responsibilities will cover:

- Increasing the efficient of investment analysis via Build, develop and productionise toolsets and models to be used in pricing, acquisition and revaluation
- Creation of ad hoc models for valuation of varying asset types
- Development and implementation of the pricing and framework
- Technical input into and knowledge sharing during all Decision Science projects;
- Collaborating with data scientists and architects on several projects

The ideal candidate will be an experienced data package builder and data wrangler who is excited by the prospect of solving business problems using their technical skills (be it from optimising models or building from scratch)

Applicants should possess;

- Strong coding ability (Sql, Python, Pyspark or some other programming language) with a passion to solve business problems through coding
- Experience of cloud based analytics packages (Scala, Databricks)
- Understanding of Machine Learning methodologies (Markov chain Monte Carlo, Decision Tree, Random Forest etc)
- Technical expertise with data models, python package development, deployment of predictive models to cloud solutions, data mining, and segmentation techniques.
- Highly educated in a quantitative subject (Mathematics, Physics, Economics, Computer Science etc)

This represents a unique encompassing both data Analytics and Engineering in one of the most desirable companies and ambitious companies in the North of England.

fullDescription:
Machine Learning Engineer
London - Paddington
£80,000 + benefits

Harnham are working exclusively with the R&D unit of a leading telco's Big Data & AI Lab in Europe to build out their machine learning team in London (Paddington).

They have 300+ people across analytics, with a number of Data Scientists, Data Engineers and Machine Learning Engineers. Everything this team does involves how the use of machine learning and sophisticated algorithms can be used to benefit the business.

Vital for this role is to be able apply complex machine learning knowledge to real-world challenges faced by the business.

This is the perfect opportunity for someone who iskeen to work at the intersection between cutting-edge data science and scalable machine learning production.


The Role - Machine Learning Engineer

You will be:

  • Building end-to-end machine learning systems for the business
  • Experimenting with deep learning algorithms
  • Translating business challenges and converting them into clear and concise projects
  • Deploying models to production and working closely with Data Scientists to build state of the art systems


Experience - Machine Learning Engineer

You will have:

  • M.Sc. or Ph.D. in: Statistics, Applied Mathematics, Computer Science, Engineering, etc.
  • Experience using Python is a must (tools like AWS and Spark are beneficial)
  • A strong knowledge of statistical/machine learning models applied to real-world problems
  • A keen interest in problem solving and using scalable machine learning to solve the biggest data-related problems
  • Experience in core software engineering principles


BENEFITS

£80,000
Competitive bonus and pension
Budgets for training and conferences
The ability to attend and present at conferences
Working from home / flexible working
The opportunity to join a world-class and growing team


HOW TO APPLY

Please register your interest by sending your CV via the Apply link on this page. For further details or to enquire about other roles, please contact Nick Mandella at Harnham.


KEYWORDS

Python, SQL, Tensorflow, Spark, AWS, Kafka, machine learning, deep learning, analytics, insight, Data Science, Data Scientist, telco, Big Data, Artificial Intelligence.

fullDescription:
Machine Learning Engineer
Surrey
£60,000 - £75,000

This is an exciting new opportunity for a Machine Learning Engineer to join a growing team of Data Science experts for an established Insurance company.

THE COMPANY

This well-established Insurance company have their HeadQuarters in Surrey and they are building an entire Data Science function having heavily invested in this area. You'll be working in the Pricing team for the business, working with cutting edge technology and driving the new approach for Machine Learning there. It's a great opportunity to join a stable business but have an immediate impact in a new team.

THE ROLE

As a Data Scientist for the business you will:

  • Use your analytics experience to increase the sophistication for pricing including data acquisition from both internal and external data
  • Working with the other Data Scientists in the team to drive the new Machine Learning approach across various areas of the business from building the ML models to productionisation of the models
  • Be involved in deploying automation across the business

SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE

  • Bachelors/Masters in a numerical or relevant field is essential
  • An excellent understanding of Data Science techniques including modelling and machine learning - end to end ML including productionisation
  • Proven commercial experience of deploying automation
  • Tech: Python, Pyspark, Spark, Git, Databricks, Jenkins

SALARY AND BENEFITS

  • Basic salary £60,000 - £75,000
  • Benefits
  • Flexible working

HOW TO APPLY

Please register your interest for this role by sending your CV to Rosie O'Callaghan via the apply link on this page

Please note that our client is currently running a fully remote interview process and able to on-board and hire remotely as well. This role is intended to be home working for the duration of the pandemic.

fullDescription:
GCP
£500-£550 PER DAY

3 MONTHS

Are you looking for an opportunity to work for a hugely successful media company design the architecture and using technologies such as Big Query, PySpark and Kafka?

THE COMPANY:

This is an exciting opportunity to work for a leading creative media agency who specialise in providing their clients with award winning ad campaigns. As a GCP Data Engineer you will be working closely alongside stakeholders and therefore it is essential you have stakeholder management experience as this will be an important aspect of your job.   • Setting up data pipelines in PySpark
  • Working with Google Big Query
  • Using technologies such as Kafka

  • Commercial experience using PySpark
  • Previous experience working in GCP using Big Query
  • Experience with Kafka
  • Stakeholder management

  • The chance to work in a highly dynamic team environment

jobTitle: AWS Data Engineer - SC Cleared / SC Eligible

fullDescription:
Job Description - We are currently looking for an outstanding Data Engineer to join our growing analytics and data science team. The ideal candidate is a Data Engineer with strong SQL and Python skills and previous experience working with APIs as well as designing and maintaining ETL pipelines that gather and transform data from different sources. This is a team-based role, where the project work is varied and shared amongst other engineers so you will not just be focused on one part of the process, so being able to see the big picture and work collaboratively is critical. The role will have a 100% focused on client projects.


Role & Responsibilities

  • Working with a team of analysts, data scientists and data engineers amongst other stakeholders to identify and implement best solutions for the analytical needs of a project
  • Contributing to architectural designs, engaging in technical discussions and presenting solutions to product challenges
  • Work with our technical partners and suppliers to ensure their technology is implemented for our internal requirements and for our client projects
  • Work with our internal operations team to ensure a robust business intelligence architecture is in place across all sections of the business
  • Heavily involved in the building and development of the architecture and engineering process of projects including building API's as well as other scripts to set up and automate engineering pipelines and solutions
  • Create and maintain optimal data pipeline architecture
  • Assemble large, complex data sets that meet functional / non-functional business requirements
  • Identify, design, and implement internal process improvements: automating manual processes, optimising data delivery, re-designing infrastructure for greater scalability, etc.
  • Work with stakeholders including the Executive, Product, Data and Design teams to assist with data-related technical issues and support their data infrastructure needs
  • Create data tools for analytics and data scientist team members that assist them in building and optimising our products and services into an innovative industry leader.
  • Someone who can complement the commercial and sales teams, supporting client meetings, pitches and add value to client proposals, new business strategy and company case studies.


Skills & Qualifications

  • Advanced SQL knowledge
  • PostgreSQL dialect is most important
  • Advanced Python programming
  • Familiarity with Docker
  • Strong problem-solving skills, willingness to take ownership and risks, and enthusiasm in the face of technical challenges
  • Excellent interpersonal skills and the ability to work in a team environment
  • Strong communication skills, with the ability to support client meetings
  • Valid SC clearance would be very useful.

jobDescription: The NHS are looking for an apprentice to join the team to deliver high quality analytical outputs, using relevant technical skills in data management and manipulation, business intelligence and analytics.  A typical day  You will work as part of a dynamic team in delivering an effective service.Work in an agile manner with daily stand upsCleanse and manage data (including processing)</li...
fullDescription:
The NHS are looking for an apprentice to join the team to deliver high quality analytical outputs, using relevant technical skills in data management and manipulation, business intelligence and analytics.

A typical day

  • You will work as part of a dynamic team in delivering an effective service.
  • Work in an agile manner with daily stand ups
  • Cleanse and manage data (including processing)
  • Quality assure data and analytical outputs following best practice guidelines
  • Integrate data feeds from disparate sources
  • Respond to incoming requests for information in a timely and efficient manner
  • Develop data processing packages
  • Plan, design, manage, execute and report on tests, using appropriate tools and techniques
  • Be highly numerate and use a variety of techniques to develop, process and engineer data relating to key priorities
  • Be adaptable when finding engineering solutions to challenges
  • Able to present findings to a diverse audience
  • Log, analyse and manage problems in order to identify and implement the appropriate solution, ensuring that the problem is fixed.

You must have

  • Five GCSE grades C - A* (4-9) or equivalent, including English and Maths
  • Level 3 qualification (A level, BTEC or equivalent)

Skills needed

  • Attention to detail
  • Able to work to tight deadlines
  • Good time management
  • Ability to communicate technical points to a non-technical audience
  • Problem solving skills
  • Ability to prioritise work and switch focus if needed

Perks and benefits

  • WhiteHat community
  • Pension

Training provided:

  1. Training on the 18 month Standard Level 4 Data Analytics (DA4) apprenticeship.
  2. Being a WhiteHat apprentice means access to awesome social events, sports teams, insight/career days with other apprentices to grow your network, as well as your own personal Coach who will guide you through the qualification to help you achieve your full potential.
  3. As part of your WhiteHat Apprenticeship, you will have access to our Future Leaders Foundation modules to develop 6 key competencies, underpinned by well-being, self-awareness, motivation, conscientiousness, effectiveness and grit.

Future prospects

After your Data Analysis Apprenticeship, you can progress into any Junior Data Analyst, Data Scientist and Data engineer role. You'll have the skills to run insight analytical projects from beginning to end and work within a Data Analytics team.

jobDescription: Do you have a background in Machine Learning and are seeking new opportunities to have a significant impact on the accessibility of treatments in healthcare? Zest Scientific recruitment is partnered with an exciting HealthTech start-up which has developed  an AI- driven platform to drastically improve patient pathways. We are seeking a Machine Learning Engineer to join a small but innovative engineering team where you will play a pivotal rol...
fullDescription:
Do you have a background in Machine Learning and are seeking new opportunities to have a significant impact on the accessibility of treatments in healthcare? Zest Scientific recruitment is partnered with an exciting HealthTech start-up which has developed an AI- driven platform to drastically improve patient pathways. We are seeking a Machine Learning Engineer to join a small but innovative engineering team where you will play a pivotal role in the design and development of their technology. You will design and implement algorithms and liaise closely with the AI team to ultimately improve patient experience and ensure accessible and affordable healthcare.

The Candidate:

  • A proven commercial background in software development, preferably Machine Learning with experience using Python.
  • BSc degree in Computer Science, Mathematics or related field with an understanding of Probability and Statistics.
  • An enterprising and creative professional with the ability to design and implement key elements to the platform.
  • Passionate about making a change and playing a significant role in improving the way patient conditions are diagnosed and treated.
  • Demonstrates a willingness to collaborate - working closely with the AI and Data Science team to help with project delivery.

The Role:

  • Apply Machine Learning to deliver reliable and state-of-the-art technology to ensure the development of the software platform.
  • Develop high-quality design and implementation of algorithms in conjunction with the AI and Data Scientist team.
  • Providing software engineering expertise in the design and implementation of AI and Machine Learning prototypes and platforms with the ability to comply with project plans.
  • Apply computer science fundamentals and data modelling to implement and design key AI elements to the platform.
  • Plan and implement full lifecycle software development ensuring this is in line with project plans and industry standards.

The Opportunity:

  • One of the UK's fastest growing HealthTech start-ups which is revolutionizing patient pathways in healthcare.
  • Join an exciting and innovative team of industry leading experts in the mission to provide the highest level of clinical care.

Remuneration:
Highly competitive salary, commensurate with experience plus benefits. Zest Scientific is working to a strict deadline so in order to be considered for this opportunity please apply now and your application will be reviewed immediately.

jobDescription: Data Engineer - AzureLondon / Remote working£75,000 - £80,000 paAre you an experienced Data Engineer who has worked across the Azure platform? Do you have a good knowledge of Machine Learning concepts (e.g. tree-based methods, logistic / linear regression, neural networks) and their practical applications?Do you want to work for a multi-national company who with real career pr...
fullDescription:
Data Engineer - Azure

London / Remote working

£75,000 - £80,000 pa

Are you an experienced Data Engineer who has worked across the Azure platform?

Do you have a good knowledge of Machine Learning concepts (e.g. tree-based methods, logistic / linear regression, neural networks) and their practical applications?

Do you want to work for a multi-national company who with real career progression opportunities?

The company

The company was founded in San Francisco in 2012 to develop a Framework, based on HTML5, ExtJS / Angular / React, Node.js, C (addon Node.js) and mongoDB technologies. This unique Web framework allows them to generate a new breed of multi-tenant, collaborative Web applications.
The framework is used by other development teams in the group to build accounting, tax and payroll softwares of over 100 000 companies worldwide. They are a true market leader in the field and very well respected.

The role

As the Data Engineer, you will integrate into a scrum team, based in London (of 11 people at the moment as they are growing fast!) (7 developers, 3 data scientists & 1 QA).

They are automating bookkeeping of small businesses using machine learning. They then process the documents in order to generate their accounting and then accountants only have to review and validate. They have about 10,000 small businesses using this robot and they provide softwares for the accounting of more than 1 million small businesses.
Scope of the role :

* Create and maintain data pipelines to extract, transform and load data from various data sources.
* Manage prototyping environment for the data-scientists.
* Working with DevOps to automate pipeline from/to production environments
* Support data scientist to write scalable pre-processing and training jobs.
* Setup analytics tools to monitor models accuracy.

What skills will you need

* Understanding of machine learning concepts
* A successful history of manipulating, processing and extracting value from large disconnected datasets.
* AKS (Kubernetes on Azure)
* Azure Client
* Python / PyData stack
* Node.js. This is a rare opportunity to join a true market leader where you your skills will be highly valued.

They are not offering sponsorship currently so please only apply if you are eligible to live and work in the UK.

Interviews to take place ASAP so dont delay if you are interested in this one!

jobDescription: A skilled Data Engineer is required by a leading organisation in London. This position is ideal for a Data Engineer that enjoys working with bespoke, purpose-built, hand-coded data environments, and is competent in delivering strong business intelligence to other areas of the business. This role will involve working with Data Scientists, BI Developers, and Digital teams. You will be responsible for reviewing da...
fullDescription:
A skilled Data Engineer is required by a leading organisation in London.

This position is ideal for a Data Engineer that enjoys working with bespoke, purpose-built, hand-coded data environments, and is competent in delivering strong business intelligence to other areas of the business.

This role will involve working with Data Scientists, BI Developers, and Digital teams. You will be responsible for reviewing data sources, checking code, understanding the desired outcomes, and redesigning to ensure the data can be used in the most effective and efficient way.

Responsibilities:

  • Implement trusted rich data that supports efficient algorithms and predictive models
  • Deploy and maintain machine learning models
  • Develop and manage a variety of scripting languages and tools
  • Facilitate processes and data modelling, data mining and production
  • Work with Data Scientists, Data Architects, BI Developers, and Digital teams to improve the quality, reliability and efficiency of data and the development of scalable data management systems
  • Ensure data is cleansed and usable across the business

Requirements:

  • Must have extensive experience in a Data Engineer capacity
  • Must have strong written coding skills (the company hand codes every API's so a strong understanding is essential)
  • The most critical technical skills and experience include:
    • Windows and Linux
    • Docker / machine learning
    • PostgreSQL / SQL Server databases or similar
    • SSIS
    • ETL
    • Apache / Spark / Kafka / Nifi
    • Springboot / Java / Python would be advantageous
    • Hadoop or similar
  • Competent in communicating and interfacing with other teams, and must be able to work in an Agile environment
  • Degree in an information technology, computer or data related subject, science, or mathematics (or equivalent experience)

Salary:

The salary is competitive depending experience, plus a bonus that will increase your salary substantially. Benefits include up to 30 days holiday plus all bank holidays, competitive pension scheme, life insurance, private medical insurance, free gym membership, discounted parking, and much more.

Covid-19 & Remote Working

The business is currently operating a remote working policy. This may continue for the foreseeable future with non-office-essential individuals working full time from home. However, some office visits will be required from time to time, particularly when restrictions are lifted.

How to Apply:

Please submit your CV for the Data Engineer vacancy. For further information, contact Michelle Turner on the IT recruitment team at Bond Williams in Bournemouth -

Keywords: Data Engineer, Business Intelligence, BI, Data Scientist, Data Management, Big Data, Data Warehouse, Data Mining, Data Science, Machine Learning, Systems Analyst, Data Architect, Docker, SQL, SSIS, ETL, Apache

Bond Williams Professional Recruitment are an equal opportunity employer and operate as an Employment Business and Recruitment Agency

jobDescription: Machine Learning Engineer | £70,000 - £90,000 (Remote) Deep Learning | Machine Learning | Video | Python | Signal Processing Want to get involved with a Deep Learning specialist? This deep learning video disrupter in central London are looking for a self-starting independent Machine Learning Engineer to improve upon the DL architecture, research and implement methods for maximu...
fullDescription:
Machine Learning Engineer | £70,000 - £90,000 (Remote)

Deep Learning | Machine Learning | Video | Python | Signal Processing

Want to get involved with a Deep Learning specialist?

This deep learning video disrupter in central London are looking for a self-starting independent Machine Learning Engineer to improve upon the DL architecture, research and implement methods for maximum impact on the product.

You:

  • Have published papers with Deep Learning in Computer Vision or signal processing or IEEE transaction journals such as ICCV, CVPR, ECCV, NeurIPS, ICASSP or ICIP.
  • Completed a research degree (PhD or MPhil) in video signal processing or deep learning video etc.
  • Self-starter, able to operate independently
  • Python

Desirable:

  • Filed patents or can showcase you've not used off-the-shelf components and built something using first principles of deep learning

Benefits:

  • Up to £85,000 per annum
  • Fully remote, even after restrictions are lifted
  • Bonus

This vacancy will be closing applications on 12th January 2021. If you have any questions or fancy a chat about the opportunity feel free to give George Bone a call on or apply for the advert and George will be in contact.

Deep Learning | Machine Learning | Engineer | Video | Signal Processing | Computer Vision | Data Scientist | Data Science | Researcher | PhD | Python | Tensorflow | PyTorch | AI | Artificial Intelligence | CPU | GPU | AWS | GCP | London | £70,000 - £90,000

jobDescription: Global Manufacturer require a Data Engineer to work with developers, database architects / data scientists on strategic data initiatives. You will be responsible for expanding and optimizing data and pipeline architecture, as well as data flow/collection  for cross functional teams. You will be an experienced data pipeline builder and data wrangler who enjoys optimizing data systems and building them from the ground up. Client...
fullDescription:
Global Manufacturer require a Data Engineer to work with developers, database architects / data scientists on strategic data initiatives. You will be responsible for expanding and optimizing data and pipeline architecture, as well as data flow/collection for cross functional teams. You will be an experienced data pipeline builder and data wrangler who enjoys optimizing data systems and building them from the ground up.

Client Details

Global Manufacturer / Distributor

Description

Global Manufacturer are looking for a Data Engineer to work with software developers, database architects, data analysts and data scientists on strategic data initiatives. The Data Engineer will be responsible for expanding and optimizing data and data pipeline architecture, as well as optimizing data flow and collection for cross functional teams. The ideal candidate is an experienced data pipeline builder and data wrangler who enjoys optimizing data systems and building them from the ground up.

As Data Engineer you will be responsible for:

  • Create and maintain optimal data pipeline architecture,
  • Assemble large, complex data sets that meet functional / non-functional business requirements.
  • Identify, design, and implement internal process improvements: automating manual processes, optimizing data delivery, re-designing infrastructure for greater scalability, etc.
  • Build the infrastructure required for optimal extraction, transformation, and loading of data from a wide variety of data sources using SQL/Non-SQL and Azure 'big data' technologies
  • Build analytics tools that utilize the data pipeline to provide actionable insights into customer acquisition
  • operational efficiency and other key business performance metrics
  • Work with stakeholders including the Executive, Product, Data and Design teams to assist with data-related technical issues and support their data infrastructure needs
  • Keep our data separated and secure across national boundaries through multiple data centres and Azure regions
  • Create data tools for analytics and data scientist team members that assist them in building and optimizing our product into an innovative industry leader.
  • Work with data and analytics experts to strive for greater functionality in our data systems.
  • For developing, constructing, maintenance and testing of data architectures, such as databases and large-scale processing systems
  • Clean, aggregate, and organize data from disparate sources and transfer it to data storage for analysis. Making sure the companies data technology is operating at its peak results in massive improvements to performance, cost, or both
  • Owning the stability of new products designed, including the on-going robustness, resilience and stability of these products
  • Building and maintaining custom ingestion pipelines

Experienced using the following software/tools:

  • Big data tools: Hadoop, Spark, Kafka, etc.
  • Relational SQL and NoSQL databases, including Postgres and Cassandra
  • Data pipeline and workflow management tools: Azkaban, Luigi, Airflow, etc
  • AWS cloud services: EC2, EMR, RDS, Redshift
  • Stream-processing systems: Storm, Spark-Streaming
  • Object-oriented/object function scripting languages: Python, Java, C++, Scala
  • Data Integration / Archiving / Relational Databases and Data Warehousing
  • MS SQL, Logic Apps, Function Apps, SSIS, SSRS
  • Microsoft Azure DevOps
  • Data Visualisation

Profile

  • Graduate degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Informatics, Information Systems or another quantitative field.
  • Advanced working SQL knowledge and experience working with relational databases, query authoring (SQL) as well as working familiarity with a variety of databases.
  • Experience building and optimizing 'big data' data pipelines, architectures and data sets.
  • Experience performing root cause analysis on internal and external data and processes to answer specific business questions and identify opportunities for improvement.
  • Strong analytic skills related to working with unstructured datasets.
  • Build processes supporting data transformation, data structures, metadata, dependency and workload management.
  • A successful history of manipulating, processing and extracting value from large disconnected datasets.
  • Working knowledge of message queuing, stream processing, and highly scalable 'big data' data stores.
  • Strong project management and organizational skills.

Experienced using the following software/tools:

  • Big data tools: Hadoop, Spark, Kafka
  • Relational SQL and NoSQL databases, including Postgres and Cassandra
  • Data pipeline and workflow management tools: Azkaban, Luigi, Airflow
  • AWS cloud services: EC2, EMR, RDS, Redshift
  • Stream-processing systems: Storm, Spark-Streaming
  • Object-oriented/object function scripting languages: Python, Java, C++, Scala
  • Data Integration / Archiving / Relational Databases and Data Warehousing
  • MS SQL, Logic Apps, Function Apps, SSIS, SSRS
  • Microsoft Azure DevOps
  • Data Visualisation

Job Offer

Opportunity to join a rapidly expanding team

Opportunity to work in an advanced analytics function

employerName: Anson McCade Ltd - IT and Finance Recruitment
jobDescription: Machine Learning Engineer (HealthTech, MediTech, Start-up, Regulatory,) UK wide - remote Quick Summary:  Become a part of our revolutionary HealthTech start-up building a product that is positively impacting lives globally - currently we have circa 10 million users!We are dedicated to transforming the way traditional healthcare is viewed and championing the...
fullDescription:
Machine Learning Engineer (HealthTech, MediTech, Start-up, Regulatory,)

UK wide - remote

Quick Summary:

  • Become a part of our revolutionary HealthTech start-up building a product that is positively impacting lives globally - currently we have circa 10 million users!
  • We are dedicated to transforming the way traditional healthcare is viewed and championing the use of AI and machine learning.
  • You'll be working alongside a small but passionate group of talented engineers, researchers, designers and analysts
  • You'll get 25 days holidays, a pension and stock options in the near future.
  • Please note - this is not a Data Scientist position

More about us:

  • We are one of the fastest-growing, bleeding-edge HealthTech start-ups in the UK, consistently being nominated and winning awards for our innovation in the industry, and are now scaling our client base rapidly -with over 9.2 million users!
  • Our goal is to provide solutions for our customers that are affordable, accessible and easy to use.
  • Our debut product is revolutionising a key area of the healthcare industry, using AI to mould the product to every user and their needs in a way that they can handle their recovery.
  • Thanks to some significant early business successes, we are seeking to expand our dynamic, proactive workforce with a similarly-minded mission-driven Machine Learning Engineer who is keen to change the world and make a difference
  • We like to provide an open and transparent working environment to our colleagues, that encourages ingenuity and collaboration
  • You will be paid a competitive salary, 25 days holiday allowance, stock options in the near future and pension
  • This position is likely to remain fully remote until mid-next year but even then you can be based anywhere UK-WIDE and travel (expensed by us) to occasional team meet-ups.
  • In joining us, we want you to love your job and have the environment to thrive, you'll be working with some of the most innovative and experienced professionals from the healthcare industry, allowing you to learn new skills and develop your career

The Machine Learning Engineer (HealthTech, MediTech, Regulatory, Start-up)Role:

  • As the Machine Learning Engineer (HealthTech, MediTech, Regulatory, Start-up) you will be playing a pivotal mission-critical role, liaising with AI and Data Scientists in creating data models as well as designing, specing and implementing algorithms based on models either defined by or in conjunction with the AI and Data Science team.
  • You'll write testable, complete and efficient code
  • Plan and execute SDLC
  • Design, spec and implement AI/ML prototypes (including very early ones), microservices and systems/platforms in a similar way
  • Document and maintain system functionality

A bit about you:

  • You must have demonstrable experience as a Software Engineer, preferably with an emphasis on Machine Learning
  • Experience with Python
  • Experience with web technologies and developing for the web browser
  • Desired but not essential- proven ability to write front-end code using libraries like React, Angular, Vue, Backbone.js, Ember.Js, Qt etc

You'll be coming in as the first Machine Learning Engineer with a huge amount of opportunity to make a big impact from day one in a highly visible environment. The Head of ML is a recognised and respected name in this space who you will work alongside.

If you want to be a part of something revolutionary - on your road to a very successful interesting career, please get in touch with me (Emily) on: or click to apply.

Reference: AMC*EWA*ML/EQ01

Location: London

Duration: Permanent

Salary: up to £80,000 (there may be some movement for the right candidate) + package including Stock options in the near future

Agency: Anson McCade

Contact: Emily Watkins

  • As the Machine Learning Engineer (HealthTech, MediTech, Regulatory, Start-up) you will be playing a pivotal mission-critical role, liaising with AI and Data Scientists in creating data models as well as designing, specing and implementing algorithms based on models either defined by or in conjunction with the AI and Data Science team.
  • You'll write testable, complete and efficient code
  • Plan and execute SDLC
  • Design, spec and implement AI/ML prototypes (including very early ones), microservices and systems/platforms in a similar way
  • Document and maintain system functionality

A bit about you:

  • You must have demonstrable experience as a Software Engineer, preferably with an emphasis on Machine Learning
  • Experience with Python
  • Experience with web technologies and developing for the web browser
  • Desired but not essential- proven ability to write front-end code using libraries like React, Angular, Vue, Backbone.js, Ember.Js, Qt etc

You'll be coming in as the first Machine Learning Engineer with a huge amount of opportunity to make a big impact from day one in a highly visible environment. The Head of ML is a recognised and respected name in this space who you will work alongside.

If you want to be a part of something revolutionary - on your road to a very successful interesting career, please get in touch with me (Emily) on: or click to apply.

Reference: AMC*EWA*ML/EQ01

Location: London

Duration: Permanent

Salary: up to £80,000 (there may be some movement for the right candidate) + package including Stock options in the near future

Agency: Anson McCade

Contact: Emily Watkins

jobTitle: Data Scientist / Machine Learning Engineer - Martech Start Up
jobDescription: Data Scientist / Machine Learning Engineer ** Martech Start Up ** SALARY -            £50k - £65k & equity LOCATION -        Remote to begin with, then Central London Following steady growth over the last 5 years, this martech start up...
fullDescription:
Data Scientist / Machine Learning Engineer

** Martech Start Up **

SALARY -            £50k - £65k & equity

LOCATION -        Remote to begin with, then Central London

Following steady growth over the last 5 years, this martech start up are looking to expand their growing Tech Team.

Their digital advertising optimisation product, sees them partnering with large organisations, tech providers and other agencies to deliver AI and machine learning optimised advertising performance and engagement; looking in detail at customer behaviour, engagement and conversion.

We are looking for a bit of a hybrid, someone who can easily go between the data science and software engineering team, with skills in both camps. This is essentially an R&D role, where you can flex your creative side in solving real world product problems and adding value through actionable insights and recommendations. You will take the lead on greenfield research projects employing a range of techniques including NLP (Natural language Processing) and Computer Vision (especially video analysis), as well as deploying production ready machine learning pipelines.

You will be joining a cross functional tech team of Data Scientists, Engineers and Software Developers, which they plan to expand over next year, so there is plenty of room for growth and development.

Working closely with the CTO, you will deliver data science solutions and services for their digital advertising optimisation product. They use every bit of available relevant data from their clients to help predict which ads will or won’t do well to enable commercially valuable forecasting and audience insight.

Experience across specialisms such as NLP, sentiment analysis, text mining and AI is required as well as very strong coding and programming skills in machine learning (using Python). Their USP is their creative use of AI to improve each advert for their clients so the variety of projects and work you will gain exposure to is broad, meaning your learning curve could be steep – and joining at middleweight level, you could soon be operating at senior level within a year or two.

Culture is something that is the lifeblood of this agency and something their CEO takes very seriously. They love people from non-traditional backgrounds, and are a very diverse bunch, working hard to ensure they embrace all ethnicities, genders, age groups and disabilities.

Skills and experience required:

  • Educated to at least degree level in a numerate subject; Mathematics, Statistics, Engineering, Physics, Chemistry, Economics, Machine Learning, Computer Science etc.
  • A strong background in data science techniques as well as coding using Python
  • Experience using a wide range of machine learning techniques, but definitely including NLP and Computer Vision.
  • Ideally industry experience in marketing or advertising
  • A problem solving approach, ability to apply AI and ML techniques to real world business challenges
  • A curious nature, and inquisitive nature plus an ability to build strong relationships with co-workers, peers and senior level stakeholders

fullDescription:
Machine Learning Engineer
London - Paddington
£80,000 + benefits

Harnham are working exclusively with the R&D unit of a leading telco's Big Data & AI Lab in Europe to build out their machine learning team in London (Paddington).

They have 300+ people across analytics, with a number of Data Scientists, Data Engineers and Machine Learning Engineers. Everything this team does involves how the use of machine learning and sophisticated algorithms can be used to benefit the business.

Vital for this role is to be able apply complex machine learning knowledge to real-world challenges faced by the business.

This is the perfect opportunity for someone who iskeen to work at the intersection between cutting-edge data science and scalable machine learning production.


The Role - Machine Learning Engineer

You will be:

  • Building end-to-end machine learning systems for the business
  • Experimenting with deep learning algorithms
  • Translating business challenges and converting them into clear and concise projects
  • Deploying models to production and working closely with Data Scientists to build state of the art systems


Experience - Machine Learning Engineer

You will have:

  • M.Sc. or Ph.D. in: Statistics, Applied Mathematics, Computer Science, Engineering, etc.
  • Experience using Python is a must (tools like AWS and Spark are beneficial)
  • A strong knowledge of statistical/machine learning models applied to real-world problems
  • A keen interest in problem solving and using scalable machine learning to solve the biggest data-related problems
  • Experience in core software engineering principles


BENEFITS

£80,000
Competitive bonus and pension
Budgets for training and conferences
The ability to attend and present at conferences
Working from home / flexible working
The opportunity to join a world-class and growing team


HOW TO APPLY

Please register your interest by sending your CV via the Apply link on this page. For further details or to enquire about other roles, please contact Nick Mandella at Harnham.


KEYWORDS

Python, SQL, Tensorflow, Spark, AWS, Kafka, machine learning, deep learning, analytics, insight, Data Science, Data Scientist, telco, Big Data, Artificial Intelligence.

Surrey

This is an exciting new opportunity for a Machine Learning Engineer to join a growing team of Data Science experts for an established Insurance company.

This well-established Insurance company have their HeadQuarters in Surrey and they are building an entire Data Science function having heavily invested in this area. You'll be working in the Pricing team for the business, working with cutting edge technology and driving the new approach for Machine Learning there. It's a great opportunity to join a stable business but have an immediate impact in a new team.

As a Data Scientist for the business you will:

  • Working with the other Data Scientists in the team to drive the new Machine Learning approach across various areas of the business from building the ML models to productionisation of the models
  • Be involved in deploying automation across the business

SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE

  • An excellent understanding of Data Science techniques including modelling and machine learning - end to end ML including productionisation
  • Proven commercial experience of deploying automation

SALARY AND BENEFITS

  • Basic salary £60,000 - £75,000
  • Benefits
  • Flexible working

HOW TO APPLY

Please register your interest for this role by sending your CV to Rosie O'Callaghan via the apply link on this page

Please note that our client is currently running a fully remote interview process and able to on-board and hire remotely as well. This role is intended to be home working for the duration of the pandemic.

GCP

Are you looking for an opportunity to work for a hugely successful media company design the architecture and using technologies such as Big Query, PySpark and Kafka?

THE COMPANY:

This is an exciting opportunity to work for a leading creative media agency who specialise in providing their clients with award winning ad campaigns. Through data driven social media campaigns they help provide their clients with key insights into how best target consumers. The project you will be working on is a for a financial client where you will be situated in a dynamic team of engineers, scientist and analysts.

THE ROLE:

As a GCP Data Engineer you will be helping to set up data pipelines working alongside Data Engineers using PySpark. You must have excellent experience with Python and an understanding of GCP as this is the platform you will be working on. You must have specific experience with Google Big Query as you will be helping to implement data strategies. As a GCP Data Engineer you will be working closely alongside stakeholders and therefore it is essential you have stakeholder management experience as this will be an important aspect of your job. Any expereince with streaming technologies such as Kafka is valuable or GCP services such as Pub/Sub. In specific, you can expect to be involved in the following:

  • Setting up data pipelines in PySpark
  • Working with Google Big Query
  • Using technologies such as Kafka

YOUR SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE:

The successful Data Engineer will have the following skills and experience:

  • Commercial experience using PySpark
  • Previous experience working in GCP using Big Query
  • Experience with Kafka
  • Stakeholder management

THE BENEFITS:

  • The chance to work in a highly dynamic team environment

jobTitle: AWS Data Engineer - SC Cleared / SC Eligible
jobDescription: Job Description - We are currently looking for an outstanding Data Engineer to join our growing analytics and data science team. The ideal candidate is a Data Engineer with strong SQL and Python skills and previous experience working with APIs as well as  designing and maintaining ETL pipelines that gather and transform data from different sources. This is a team-based role, where the project work is varied and shared amongst other engineers...
fullDescription:
Job Description - We are currently looking for an outstanding Data Engineer to join our growing analytics and data science team. The ideal candidate is a Data Engineer with strong SQL and Python skills and previous experience working with APIs as well as designing and maintaining ETL pipelines that gather and transform data from different sources. This is a team-based role, where the project work is varied and shared amongst other engineers so you will not just be focused on one part of the process, so being able to see the big picture and work collaboratively is critical. The role will have a 100% focused on client projects.


Role & Responsibilities

  • Working with a team of analysts, data scientists and data engineers amongst other stakeholders to identify and implement best solutions for the analytical needs of a project
  • Contributing to architectural designs, engaging in technical discussions and presenting solutions to product challenges
  • Work with our technical partners and suppliers to ensure their technology is implemented for our internal requirements and for our client projects
  • Work with our internal operations team to ensure a robust business intelligence architecture is in place across all sections of the business
  • Heavily involved in the building and development of the architecture and engineering process of projects including building API's as well as other scripts to set up and automate engineering pipelines and solutions
  • Create and maintain optimal data pipeline architecture
  • Assemble large, complex data sets that meet functional / non-functional business requirements
  • Identify, design, and implement internal process improvements: automating manual processes, optimising data delivery, re-designing infrastructure for greater scalability, etc.
  • Work with stakeholders including the Executive, Product, Data and Design teams to assist with data-related technical issues and support their data infrastructure needs
  • Create data tools for analytics and data scientist team members that assist them in building and optimising our products and services into an innovative industry leader.
  • Someone who can complement the commercial and sales teams, supporting client meetings, pitches and add value to client proposals, new business strategy and company case studies.


Skills & Qualifications

  • Advanced SQL knowledge
  • PostgreSQL dialect is most important
  • Advanced Python programming
  • Familiarity with Docker
  • Strong problem-solving skills, willingness to take ownership and risks, and enthusiasm in the face of technical challenges
  • Excellent interpersonal skills and the ability to work in a team environment
  • Strong communication skills, with the ability to support client meetings
  • Valid SC clearance would be very useful.

jobDescription: The NHS are looking for an apprentice to join the team to deliver high quality analytical outputs, using relevant technical skills in data management and manipulation, business intelligence and analytics.  A typical day  You will work as part of a dynamic team in delivering an effective service.Work in an agile manner with daily stand upsCleanse and manage data (including processing)</li...
fullDescription:
The NHS are looking for an apprentice to join the team to deliver high quality analytical outputs, using relevant technical skills in data management and manipulation, business intelligence and analytics.

A typical day

  • You will work as part of a dynamic team in delivering an effective service.
  • Work in an agile manner with daily stand ups
  • Cleanse and manage data (including processing)
  • Quality assure data and analytical outputs following best practice guidelines
  • Integrate data feeds from disparate sources
  • Respond to incoming requests for information in a timely and efficient manner
  • Develop data processing packages
  • Plan, design, manage, execute and report on tests, using appropriate tools and techniques
  • Be highly numerate and use a variety of techniques to develop, process and engineer data relating to key priorities
  • Be adaptable when finding engineering solutions to challenges
  • Able to present findings to a diverse audience
  • Log, analyse and manage problems in order to identify and implement the appropriate solution, ensuring that the problem is fixed.

You must have

  • Five GCSE grades C - A* (4-9) or equivalent, including English and Maths
  • Level 3 qualification (A level, BTEC or equivalent)

Skills needed

  • Attention to detail
  • Able to work to tight deadlines
  • Good time management
  • Ability to communicate technical points to a non-technical audience
  • Problem solving skills
  • Ability to prioritise work and switch focus if needed

Perks and benefits

  • WhiteHat community
  • Pension

Training provided:

  1. Training on the 18 month Standard Level 4 Data Analytics (DA4) apprenticeship.
  2. Being a WhiteHat apprentice means access to awesome social events, sports teams, insight/career days with other apprentices to grow your network, as well as your own personal Coach who will guide you through the qualification to help you achieve your full potential.
  3. As part of your WhiteHat Apprenticeship, you will have access to our Future Leaders Foundation modules to develop 6 key competencies, underpinned by well-being, self-awareness, motivation, conscientiousness, effectiveness and grit.

Future prospects

After your Data Analysis Apprenticeship, you can progress into any Junior Data Analyst, Data Scientist and Data engineer role. You'll have the skills to run insight analytical projects from beginning to end and work within a Data Analytics team.

fullDescription:
Do you have a background in Machine Learning and are seeking new opportunities to have a significant impact on the accessibility of treatments in healthcare? Zest Scientific recruitment is partnered with an exciting HealthTech start-up which has developed an AI- driven platform to drastically improve patient pathways. We are seeking a Machine Learning Engineer to join a small but innovative engineering team where you will play a pivotal role in the design and development of their technology. You will design and implement algorithms and liaise closely with the AI team to ultimately improve patient experience and ensure accessible and affordable healthcare.

The Candidate:

  • A proven commercial background in software development, preferably Machine Learning with experience using Python.
  • BSc degree in Computer Science, Mathematics or related field with an understanding of Probability and Statistics.
  • An enterprising and creative professional with the ability to design and implement key elements to the platform.
  • Passionate about making a change and playing a significant role in improving the way patient conditions are diagnosed and treated.
  • Demonstrates a willingness to collaborate - working closely with the AI and Data Science team to help with project delivery.

The Role:

  • Apply Machine Learning to deliver reliable and state-of-the-art technology to ensure the development of the software platform.
  • Develop high-quality design and implementation of algorithms in conjunction with the AI and Data Scientist team.
  • Providing software engineering expertise in the design and implementation of AI and Machine Learning prototypes and platforms with the ability to comply with project plans.
  • Apply computer science fundamentals and data modelling to implement and design key AI elements to the platform.
  • Plan and implement full lifecycle software development ensuring this is in line with project plans and industry standards.

The Opportunity:

  • One of the UK's fastest growing HealthTech start-ups which is revolutionizing patient pathways in healthcare.
  • Join an exciting and innovative team of industry leading experts in the mission to provide the highest level of clinical care.

Remuneration:
Highly competitive salary, commensurate with experience plus benefits. Zest Scientific is working to a strict deadline so in order to be considered for this opportunity please apply now and your application will be reviewed immediately.
